reviews.name: Genny A.
reviews.review: Kristen was the only girl at the counter when we arrived. We were the only ones in line. She did not greet us. Just looked at us blankly and finally asked "you ready?"She seemed very frustrated as we placed our order. My sister asked did ask for a cheese switch and her condiments on side but you would have thought she asked for the moon. We explained it had been a while since we lost the BYBs on our area but she never acknowledged and had we known where another was we would have left this one based on her attitude.The issue at the front aside our food arrived fast and hot and perfect! We were so happy to have been able to grab a bite here in our way out of town today! Great fast food meal to end our Nashville vaca! A little more expensive than normal fast food but I am already trying to find another one for the ride home! They would have had 5 stars if staff had been friendly!

reviews.name: Jill B.
reviews.review: Very dirty... Greasy every thing I think the mopped the floor with grease. Gave it 2 stars because the burger was good. I would take mine to go next time I'm in town, I wonder if the kitchen is greasy?

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: Good burger and delicious fries. I felt like my meal took longer to make even though the restaurant was pretty sparse. My meal seemed a bit overpriced as well. I wished that I had more fries. I'd try this place again though.

reviews.name: Libby B.
reviews.review: Nashville has so many great, original burger joints that I don't often stop by chains when I'm feeling like a burger, but this is close to home and satisfies my meat craving when I need to stay out of the beer garden anyhow. I usually order the Black and Bleu, and was surprised and delighted to learn on my last visit that I could substitute a turkey patty for the regular beef one. It was actually pretty good. They currently have a red velvet milkshake that did look awesome, but I passed because it would have undermined my turkey patty decision. They also have waffle fries, although I found them overly greasy.They always bring my food out in a pretty timely manner, and the place is clean and well lit. I've never really seen this particular location all that crowded, but I probably stop in at off-peak times (which is probably why I never wait too long for my food).So, for a burger on a budget that's a bit fancier than your average drive through meal, definitely A-OK.

reviews.name: Joelle P.
reviews.review: No. Just no. They take forever.

reviews.name: Scott P.
reviews.review: Meh indeed.Stationed somewhere between a Mcd's and a smash burger BYB inhabits some sort of ambiguous middle ground of higher prices and alleged higher quality. Key word- alleged. I got my burger turned into a wrap after a local told me the buns were disgusting, the other two people in my group got buns and it turned out that was pretty good advice. Not that the wrap was anything to write home about, but it didn't fall apart while I was eating it. I also got a "baked" potato... I hate to go on a bit of a rant here but the word baked- it turns out that actually means baked. Like, in an oven. Putting something in a plastic bin and microwaving it does not make it baked. The potato was by far the worst potato I have ever had. I know I know- you are at a burger place, why did you get a baked potato instead of fries? I freely admit this was my own blunder and that I am less of a man for not getting fries (if that's possible). That being said it wasn't "baked".

reviews.name: Kevin W.
reviews.review: I came to this place because I had a coupon to buy one get one free. It was still a little expensive with the BOGO coupon but it was good. Better than your typical fast food burger. I do not see myself going out of my way to visit this place again but it was decent food. Pretty good service, nice taste, and better than usual variety. Quality of food is not that great.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Got a daily coupon for this place.Very nice staff and the manager was really nice.Place was clean, service was quick.The thing is....... it reminded me of an expensive Burger King burger....It was nearly identical, but more expensive.No... I would not return.

reviews.name: Victoria S.
reviews.review: First visit yesterday as of 10/10/14 Empty due to the time I came in, 3:30 pm. The cashier was a nice little blonde long haired man who said to take our time as it was our first visit. I had a coupon and  he was not surprised at allas most people nowadays are not very knowledgeable about coupons. I joked about how this restaurant works and the cashier responded "it's basically a fast food burger place but w/fine dining experience" and we exchanged laughs! I ended up ordering the Black Jack chicken combo w/waffles fries and my little cousin ordered the Hawaiian Chicken w/sweet potato fries. The tables were dirty, so I didn't like that so much. Food was hot! Sweet potato fries are the most delicious sweet potato fries I have eaten! Because they batter them up ahaha! Overall my experience and the food I would say it's food you would somewhat order at a restaurant, the chicken sandwich was very good and much better than most places I have eaten. I will go here when I have a craving for "fast fast but w/fine dining experience" Ha!

reviews.name: L C.
reviews.review: They operate like they are new to the fast food business. I was not impressed. I had the veggie burger, which is basically a black bean burger. It was okay, but needed more seasoning. I ordered it without bacon. After all, I did order the veggie burger. Right? After double-checking my order three times, guess what? Yes, big slices of bacon imbedded in my burger! It seems that someone back there would question why a veggie burger would have bacon on it? (Helloooo! Does anybody work here?) Sometimes fast food is just too fast!The waffle fries were hot and pretty tasty, but needed salt. The lemonade? Meh! Mainly sugar-water without much flavoring.Personally, I think its a little pricey for the service and a basic burger. A little quality control is definitely needed here, folks!

reviews.name: Kris H.
reviews.review: Worst one I have been to. Got two incomplete kids meals, and the wrong shake. When I took the completely melted shake back they simply took off the lid, added the Oreo, and remixed it. Even after I told them they gave it to me melted, wrong, and I had tasted it. How many other shakes have they remixed on the same machine after people drank out of them??? Nasty!

reviews.name: Missy K.
reviews.review: Here on business and staying at an airport hotel and do not have a car, so walking distance is where I eat! I found this on my walk and decided to give it a try.  Never heard of it before... From walking in the place looked clean and there were plenty of people here which told me that it must be ok.  Better than McDonalds at least... ?! However, I almost walked out after observing how the patrons ahead of me were treated by the girl working the register.  Blonde girl with the worst attitude in the history of food service.  "I hate my JOB and my life and all things in this WORLD" was written across her face the entire time i was in this place.  I decided to stay and ordered my food.  Told the EMO girl to have a fantastic day with the best smile I could seriously give her after watching her act like the World has screwed her over.  And well maybe it has.... Hopefully her day is better today than yesterday. Anyway, i'm off track.  The burger was great, the fries were even better!  It really is good food.  I'm glad I stuck around.  However, the price was a bit higher than I would have liked to have paid for fast food.  The menu states that my meal comes with Waffle fries, and unless i'm crazy, my yummy french fries that were just like fries from Mc Donalds didn't look like Waffle Fries--- maybe this is Tennessee's version of Waffle Fries!?!? loL!!  Oh well- they were good! Great seasoning. 3 stars- it wasn't a great customer service atmosphere but the food was good.  I prob will never eat at a Back Yard Burgers again, but only because they dont have them in Arizona.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: This place was hood fabulous, it took me forever to get my food and when I got it, it was cold... I will not be going there:-(

reviews.name: Peter P.
reviews.review: A step up from McDonalds and Burger King, but not amazing by any means. I appreciate the diversity they offer with turkey burgers, chili cheese dogs, and smoked sausages and the service has always been fast even when it was really busy.

reviews.name: Aubrey D.
reviews.review: I stopped in today for a Blackened Chicken Sandwich only to find that...they sort of don't have it anymore. They have revamped their entire menu. Now it's all "Build Your Own Burger" for $3.89 and pay 3 more bucks to make it a combo! I had to go through each confusing little category to try and replicate my fave sandwich there. The cashier was helpful but this is not my idea of fun. Fortunately, I came armed with a coupon. Otherwise, there was no way I was paying 7 bucks for a fast food combo. This could have been a glorious opportunity for BYB to bring back their beloved waffle fries. No such luck.In spite of the fact that it was bustling, my food came right out. It was pretty good and almost like the blackened chicken sandwich of my memories but not quite. They've started getting a little too big for their britches here! They've lost their identity and are now just serving over-priced fast food.

reviews.name: Jeff L.
reviews.review: This place was just ok. Tables were not kept clean. I ordered a burger and a shake. The burger came out quickly. The shake on the other hand took 30 minutes. Not impressed.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Everything is good, but this is the place where everything is supposed to be better than good.  The burgers are good, but they aren't any better than any other fast food place in Donelson, and they're more expensive.The hot dogs are good, which is why I'm reviewing it, and it's almost certainly the best dog in Donelson, but it's still nothing special.  I wouldn't rate them anywhere near the quality of the dedicated hot dog place sprinkled throughout Nashville.The place is clean, well-organized, and the staff is friendly enough, but is that really enough for the hype Back Yard Burger gets?  I don't think so.

reviews.name: TeDarrius X.
reviews.review: BYB is easily my favorite hamburger spot. I'm very upset that they took away the waffle fries. I'm starting a petition on facebook to bring those back. Other then them taking my favorite fries away, I love it. They have the best burgers and the best service. If you haven't been you should go and give it a try.

reviews.name: Dave B.
reviews.review: Chain atmosphere. OK. Clean. Nothing exciting, but an ok basic burger.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: This Tennessee based chain has better than average fast food burgers. They are real burgers, big and juicy, like restaurant ones, although you can't order them medium, which is a shame. I mourn for the waffle fries though. I think they stopped serving them a couple of years ago. Bad decision on their part! I occasionally get a craving for their veggie burger, which is flame grilled and tastes great, nothing like a real burger, but good in its own right. I wish there were more of them around, because I usually only get to eat there when I'm in Donelson or Cool Springs

reviews.name: Wade H.
reviews.review: Good service clean best burger I have had in a long time

reviews.name: Bristol D.
reviews.review: uptight prudes stay away, this is a safe haven for politicallynincorrect humor.the drinks were prompt and not watered down like so many of the district hotspots.the souvinier mugs are great reminders of why youre broke the next week.i'd do it again, but i'm a glutton for punishment.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: This was the first time I had been to dicks. I had no idea what I was in for. A friend told me we had to go to dicks so I just said ok. When we got in the host goes "how the hell are you doing tonight,how was your swim in the river beach boy. I had a tee shirt and boardshorts that's where the beach boy came from. I said are you f***ing kidding be bro. My friend said they make fun of you at dicks. I had no idea I thought the host was just having a bad day. Now that I knew the back story at dicks. I was excited. The waiter we had was awesome. Being from NY I'm used to having quick comebacks when people joke. This waiter kept messing with me calling me names because i wasn't showing Him a reaction and had good come backs. I'm not gay but At one point he told me to stop getting excited and put my boner away. I replied thanks for telling the whole table I have a decent sized dick. I guess I turn you on because I can see your non existent excuse for a boner. The waiter had nothing to say back he went umm beach boy is funny I'll be back with your re fills. The waiter came back and brought a bag and wrote BONER BOY on the bag. So for the rest of the night my nickname was boner boy. As I was going past one of the girls at the bar said hey boner boy. I busted out laughing. This was the closest experience to being in college. I ended up just having a appetizer. They have happy hour here with $5 drink specials. They had some interesting things on the menu like gator bites. I do recommend coming here. It's a great time and when you have a few drinks in you, it gets better. It's more of a show than a place to eat. I have no complaints about the food. PROS:- great time if your with a group- waiter was awesome - be prepaid to have come backsCONS:- they put a bag on my head that said BONER BOY lol

reviews.name: C M.
reviews.review: I see a lot of negative reviews on this joint, let me just clarify....going to Dicks is NOT about the food, it's about the experience.  And my rating is not on the food, just the overall experience.If you're thin skinned, and just want to fade into the wallpaper, this is NOT the place for you. Otherwise, it was hilarious. We were set to do the Hick Chick tour bus (another hilarious experience) which meets up at Dick's for pick up, so that's how we wound up here--I have never heard of nor been to a Dick's before.There are plenty of warnings outside the place that they are paid to be rude/insulting, and will definitely make fun of you, so we weren't shocked when they immediately shouted out that Snooki and the Situation had arrived when they asked for our id's, lol. Being from Jersey, we are used to rudeness so we were equipped with quick come backs, but that just encourages the servers to take it up a notch. I have to add that if you engage them in 'normal' conversation, you'll find they're actually a lovely bunch.The food (I had a burger) was good, not great, but it's a BAR, and the drinks were good as well. A little on the pricey side, but again, it's a tourist spot.Restrooms were clean (surprisingly for the atmosphere) and they have a little 'gift' shop on the way out. Lots of drinks with take home cups (overpriced but great 'souvenirs').

reviews.name: Desiree W.
reviews.review: This was our first stop when getting to Nashville for dinner. We started with the nachos. Not that good at all, the chicken was bland as if it was boiled. No taste to it at all. Next, for our dinner I had the buffalo chicky salad, the chicken was horrible. It was hard to chew and just nasty. My friend had the "dolly," he literally couldn't eat it. My other friend had the fish and chips, which was also for the birds, blandest crap I've ever tasted. You come here, you're really coming for the ambiance of the place, which is sarcastic service and hats.

reviews.name: Charlotte D.
reviews.review: Dirty dirty dicks....ahhh what to say. At least I got to keep the glass from my 16 oz $9.75 bluemoon. Such a tourist trap but it is one of those places you have to visit at some point in your life just to say you did. This is my third, I have been to San Diego and Baltimore in the past. I only went to this one because my friend had never been. Let me warn you: there are no limits to how much of an asshole the servers can be. I mean my friend and I got asked if we had STDS, I got called weavy-wonder, you name it. I'm just gonna say third time is a charm, I have no desire to go back here.

reviews.name: mark e.
reviews.review: It's not about the food or the drinks, it's about the entertainment and if you are easily offended or don't enjoy a good put down at your expense, there are a lot of good places to go instead. But for the laughs and group laughing...5/5 stars easy.

reviews.name: Melissa I.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed this place. Yes, they are rude but that's their thing. You can't go here without an open mind. Plus you will have to wear hats that they make for you with rude sayings on it. If that doesn't sound like a good idea to you, then you probably shouldn't come here. The food was pretty typical but the fried pickles were absolutely delicious! I would definitely check this place out again!

reviews.name: Nick M.
reviews.review: Well the decor and atmosphere was some what amusing. But as far as the food it was just ordinary and not that flavorful. Also kind of over priced! Paid about $30 bucks for one drink and a Philly cheesesteak. Overall kind of disappointed. **susan- you obviously didn't read the part where we said it was disappointing. We will not be back.

reviews.name: Jackie B.
reviews.review: Giving 3 stars because it's an awesome time, so much fun! Trust me when I say you're paying for the rude, hilarious service and NOT the food. Myself and 3 of my girls came and ordered nachos to split. Gross! Fake cheese sauce and barely any toppings. Nothing tasted fresh. I will be back because it's a great time but will probably just order drinks next time.

reviews.name: Crystle C.
reviews.review: The food was mediocre, typical chain restaurant quality and the service was, oddly enough, too nice. I would have overlooked the quality of the food (do NOT order the ribs... Just plain awful) and the overpriced drinks if the service had lived up to the reputation of the restaurant and provided some source of entertainment but it did not.  Our server just wasn't into the dick thing... I feel so odd complaining about a nice server but if I go into a restaurant and over pay for pretty basic food just so I can be treated like sh*t, I expect to be treated like sh*t!!!Anyway, if you find yourself hungry and in the area, I'd skip this place and go to Rippys. Service there is fast, prices are right and the food is delicious.

reviews.name: Jennifer B.
reviews.review: We went there specifically to see the atmosphere and knew what to expect when it came to rudeness and sarcasm.  It would've been nice to get a waiter who pretended to be rude.  We got the dudliest waiter ever.  I even told him it was my daughter's 17th birthday and we had gifts on the table and he did absolutely nothing.  We were jealous of the other tables, because they had such awesome waiters.  They were hilarious and here we sat with a dud and then the food was terrible just to top it off:-(  If our waiter was obnoxious, we really could've handled the food, but it was a complete waste of time and money:-(

reviews.name: Kaitlyn M.
reviews.review: Brenda was .... How do you say it nicely... I can't come up with the words to describe her.  Came with a big group and had a great time!

reviews.name: Diana M.
reviews.review: We had a really good time here. IF YOU COME HERE, you should know that the whole point is the experience. You are not looking for fine dining. The point of this chain is that they will be sarcastic, funny, and somewhat rude. If you cant handle that, dont come here. Our waiter, known as handsome, was great. He was very funny, and made fun of us in a very appropriate manner. My friend and i shared the XX margarita made for 2. That was really good. We also had the fried pickled app which was sooooo good. I want more. We both had the chicken fried chicken and it was good. Again, not the greatest, but good enough. Our waiter took pics with us, chatted with us the whole time, and made us enjoy our experience. I guess your experience depends on the server you get, and we truly enjoyed it!

reviews.name: Stacy B.
reviews.review: Yummy food, fun environment... Order the gator bites and buffalo chicken sandwich! Drinks are awesome too! Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Wm H.
reviews.review: Sorry, whomever in Marketing thought humiliation was proper entertainment for a tourist restaurant should be fired.My idea of having a meal is being treated nicely, not going to some joint to deal with staff that are obnoxious and rude.  I really don't like things thrown at me, like the straws, the bill or my food slammed down on the table.Some Bozo thought this is the way to bring crowds in.  Me, nope won't go back. I felt bad for the little old lady's out for lunch, who also got suckered in to eat here.FYI, their catch is service with an attitude, a bad one.  so this is not a fluke.  This is how they do it.  Not for me.

reviews.name: Kelly S.
reviews.review: This is a a tourist attraction. You go here to have a good laugh, not get the most amazing food in the world. Although the food wasn't half bad. And I definitely enjoyed our waiter and the service. Everyone in my group had a good laugh. Disregard any of the 1 star ratings. Giving this place 1 star because the servers were rude, knowing you would get that service when you walked in, is ridiculous. It's a fun place and if you go in with thick skin and a good attitude you'll have a lot of fun.

reviews.name: Emily E.
reviews.review: This is truly a unique one of a kind place. The atmosphere would be the only reason to come here. The waitress' took our orders but wouldn't bring us the drinks we asked for instead she brought use "angry balls" which were more expensive then the bottleneck beers we ordered. The food was alright, definitely nothing I would want to pay for again. I got a little crab for $20+.The atmosphere is what truly makes this place. It's loud and funny. They make you wear these paper hats they make with crude sayings on them, it was hysterical. If they came down off the price I would have given them a better rating, however they do offer a military discount which was nice.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: First time I went to this concept restaurant was 20 years ago in San Diego - I admittedly had a great time, staff were all funny, and a good time was had by all - the food was OK.Fast forward 20 years to the 2nd time.  I noticed the restaurant in Nashville and decided to go.The food is probably the worst food I'd had in 10 years.  Had 1/2 chicken and ribs - the chicken was so dry that it sucked all the moisture out of my system and there was no flavor or sauce.  The ribs were not only cold, they were still frozen when served to me.  I asked for another serving, and next thing I had a piping hot freshly microwaved dry flavorless 1/2 rack of ribs with no sauce.  The buffalo wings were not that good.  The best 'tasting' item which was still pretty bad was the salmon.  The food is an embarrassment to the microwave and serve industry.The "theme" is very tiresome and best suited to very wealthy teenagers, perhaps.  They create a hat for you with lame sayings or they make up something.  They act rude or don't care.The one from 20 years ago was fun.  The workers were like circus performers or comedians or soon to be entertainers/actors - really livened things up and folks had a great time, I remember 100's of bra's on the bar.  Now, it's a bunch of lame attempts of fun, really bad food and extremely expensive.

reviews.name: Gabe F.
reviews.review: Know what you're getting yourself into before you go. Don't expect great food, friendly service or reasonable prices. This is a novelty attraction for TOURISTS. It's specifically designed for the experience of trying something completely outside of the realm of normalcy. It's a fun place to go with a bunch of friends and make fun of each other and the hats that are specially designed to make fun of you. This place is not good for kids or people who are sensitive about their physical appearance. They have 40oz bottles of a few popular beers.

reviews.name: Laura M.
reviews.review: In town for the Country Music Marathon, had no idea what I walked in to....We had an enjoyable time,but the food was nothing to get excited about and they are pushy about add ons. Make sure if you order a beer, you pay attention, or you may have purchased yourself a couple of $9 beer glasses. Funny concept, but probably wont go back.

reviews.name: Allie R.
reviews.review: What a tourist trap this is.... I'm from Nashville but I came here with some friends who were visiting.  Before we sat down at our table we got some drinks at the bar... $9 beers!!??  I'm sorry, but if you are a bar with beer prices in line with sports arenas something is seriously wrong.  The atmosphere was fine, typical downtown party bar, the bar itself was huge so there was room to wander around it and get a drink.  Of course the food was way overpriced as well.  $15 for some fries and a couple cuts of fried catfish.  My husband and I were so disgusted with the prices we ended up splitting everything.  I will say the catfish was good, crispy outside juicy inside, it's just the price that was a bummer.  The service was frustrating.... the whole schtick is that your server is rude to you, I've been to places like this, I think they are funny and I get it.  Our server barely said anything, seemed annoyed and was very slow.  He wasn't a bad server in a funny way he was a bad server in a very generic bad server way.Anyway, I am glad I went and saw what all the fuss was about with this place, now that I know I won't return.  My friend who picked it out and made the reservations felt bad.  Said she had a blast in the one they went to in FL and I believe her, I felt bad the Nashville location was such a let down.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: Not a fan. This place is a tourist hellhole. The music is too loud to talk, but it's not a music focused place either. The food and drinks are overpriced and the selection is sort of nasty (unless you like everything deep fried). And like a few other reviewers, how this ridiculous concept got to be a chain, I have no idea. If I want to eat a meal where everyone is rude to me, curt, and nasty, I'd rather just wait for an awkward family holiday and save myself the dime. What I really want to know is how this place got to be on OpenTable. I thought they had some kind of standard for the restauarants they include, so I mistakenly thought it must be a decent chain, as chains go. Nope.

reviews.name: Lauren R.
reviews.review: We came here as a group on NYE while in Nashville.  I'd been to this chain before and knew what to expect.  We had a great waitress who stayed in character, but could subtly tell us she was also trying to serve our table in a way we would not be horribly offended.  We didn't order much, as we were just here for the drinks and music.  There was alligator and some other "non-standard" appetizers to choose from.  Music wasn't that bad and we definitely had enough to drink.  I wouldn't pick this place out if I was trying to just hang out with some friends, but this was definitely a good place to stop for NYE with a large group of people.

reviews.name: Charlie G.
reviews.review: We were doing one of those Nashville comedy bus tours and had thirty minutes before the bus picked us up from Dick's to get a bite to eat. We headed to the bar. I had enough time to visit the lady's room, come back to the bar and chat with some tourists from Texas before the bartender took our order. I will say that once he did take our order, our drinks in food were out in a split second. Seriously, those appetizers came up so quickly, I am not even sure how they had time to cook them. Maybe I was just distracted by good conversation with the nice tourists. My crab dip was decent. I give it a solid C. It was a weird nacho cheese combination with tiny pieces of crab scattered amongst the cheese product. If I wasn't so hungry, the crab dip may have received a C- or even a D, but you know, hunger makes anything taste good. Besides, It's Dicks. It's like Fuddruckers, Hard Rock, or any of those themed restaurants. Going there expecting fine cuisine would be like watching Keeping Up with the Kardashians and expecting there to be good acting. Since we sat at the bar, we didn't get the full experience of the waiters acting like jerks, Dick's trademark experience. The bartender played the role a little bit, but he was more concerned with actually doing his job and getting orders out correctly and quickly, than playing the role. I was grateful for this. Synopsis: speedy service,  average price, below average food quality.

reviews.name: Liesel H.
reviews.review: Good times and good food at Dick's. Enjoyed the wasabi salmon. Brenda was the bestest server ever.

reviews.name: Troy H.
reviews.review: Worst food that I have ever had! Stay away! Ribs were horrible and chicken fried chicken was like a rubber bouncey ball

reviews.name: Glaiza B.
reviews.review: I hated this place. The first and last time my husband and I came here was New Year's Eve. We had heard that this place was fun to grab a couple of drinks, but we didn't expect that it would be crazy. The floor of the whole place was covered in napkins and pieces of paper, everyone was wearing paper hats with inappropriate sayings, the servers were rude, and the place was too loud. Don't take your kids here. This place is definitely not family friendly. Never again.

reviews.name: Al S.
reviews.review: This was a total waste of time and money. We had 2 adults and 2 children and our bill was $125. Margaritas are $21 and they are terrible. Not to forget about the food, it was aweful. We thought it would be fun to try something different, and we were extremely disappointed.

reviews.name: Brandi H.
reviews.review: My cousin and I were well aware of the schtick and have been talking about trying this place for months but you know how hard it is to get locals to trek downtown. We showed up after the Gay Pride Parade to finally try it, excited to see the "service with sarcasm bit"....Imagine my surprise when I looked at the menu and NOTHING looked appetizing. I was starving, but a) nothing on the menu sounded good, and b) I ain't paying $8-10 for a chicken tenders and fry basket.So my cousin and I decided to order dessert. The server was funny, we giggled and laughed a lot. The hats were a hoot! The ladies beside us cackled like it was the funniest moment of their lives.... not quite AS funny for us. Maybe we needed alcohol in our systems?The dessert tasted like it was made several states away and shipped and store in a freezer for weeks on end. Meh.All in all, we agreed we were glad we tried it because the server was funny, and it was an interesting show. But we probably won't be back.

reviews.name: Kenneth M.
reviews.review: You go to the place for the experience not the food.  The food is edible, but not anything that will knock your socks off.  The experience is great.  Its even more fun when you can take someone who doesn't know about Dick's.

reviews.name: Jesse M.
reviews.review: The waiter did what he could but they were understaffed. The food wasn't very good either.  Processed cheese in the wrap, and the rice in it was cold. Yuck.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: I first tried Dick's at the Taste of Music City and the workers at the tent were super nice and said we should give the place a go.We had the Firecracker salmon and it was so awesome! I love salmon, but this was grilled and pretty good to say the least. The crabby balls were equally good.Drinks were good and so was the food. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.name: Haley H.
reviews.review: Only went because my group wanted to go. I didn't appreciate the "sarcastic humor" because it wasn't humor, just rudeness. Please don't go here for the food because it was terrible! As was the service! Even our hats they made for us were lame! If you have to eat lunch room quality food, I at least want good entertainment!

reviews.name: Jen R.
reviews.review: If you come here with the expectation that the food is going to blow you away: you're delusional. You come here for the atmosphere and the "dick's" of course. I just laughed nonstop here. I thought the waiters and bartenders were super dicky and it was hysterical. My favorite part: one of the girls I was with had no idea that that was the theme of the restaurant... one of the waiters yelled at her for being in his way and she started yelling back at him and called him rude. Again, I just laughed. And even though I didn't have high expectations for the food...The chicky fried chicky was very juicy, crispy and tasty. Although the server was a "dick," he was very prompt when bringing our drinks and attending to us.Stop in here if you're looking for some laughs!

reviews.name: John C.
reviews.review: Very fun place. Go in with an open mind.  Burger was great.

reviews.name: Evan B.
reviews.review: Make being rude to customers a point of pride. Racist pill head waitress, poor food, weak expensive drinks. I'm either too old at twenty six or too stuck up. I doubt both.. had to come back and edit. I got a large Matthias, which didn't have a price next to it on the menu... knew I'd get housed. But it was 23.51... and light on tequila... They put these butcher paper hats on you, and I get the place is supposed to be raunchy, but mine was some homophobic nonsense about brokeback mountain, and the one they have my wife referred to swallowing cum. I am not making this up, and I'm nit writing this to be vulgar. Our check was 73 dollars for said Margarita, two mixed drinks, Some chicken tenders and fries, and nachos... does not include the generous tip my wife inexplicably left. This was without a doubt the worst dining experience I've ever had. I'm not picky and I used to wait tables, so I'm the easiest customer you'll ever have. I couldn't be more pissed.

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: We decided we had to check this restaurant out to see what it was about.  The atmosphere was fun and if you take jokes and have thick skin the staff is funny.  They insult you as they serve you.  We ordered alligator bites as our appetizer and they were good.  I ordered the ribs and wings.  The ribs were very good and the wings were OK.  I took one of my husband's crab cakes and it wasn't good.  We finished the meal with the brownie and it was fantastic.  We will definitely have to make a return visit.

reviews.name: Lisa O.
reviews.review: Sat at the bar after a titans game....wasn't that much fun. I was hoping for the experience but it was uneventful. I ordered the fruity bastard drink and felt ill after, not from the alcohol but from whatever nasty mixes they use and my friends drink was just as bad. Fried pickles were the worst I've had yet in still ate them and the cheese sticks were fine.

reviews.name: Sam T.
reviews.review: Granted this a chain who prides them self on being rude and ridiculous as part of their standards for being a "last resort" drinking establishment, it is still a fun place to go and we had a great time drinking beer, eating fries and watching football at the bar. To be perfectly honest, many of the bars in that neighborhood of Nashville have great live music and performers at all hours of the day. But I really just wanted to go someplace a little more quite where we didn't have to scream over the music and sit in clean place that I knew was safe and not covered in stale beer from the night before. The bartender, despite his "rude" persona was actually very prompt, checked on us frequently and was pretty funny. We had a great time. You probably won't get the worlds best service or the most delicious food you've ever eaten at this place, but you will get your beer filled up quickly, an easy seat at bar and a relaxed fun time.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: This place is TERRIBLE.  Yes, I understand the concept... which in and of itself is stupid.  "Yes, let's go to a place to buy expensive, shitty food and have lame ass waiters throw napkins at us and try to treat us poorly."This places fails on every level.  The ONLY reason I managed to walk in this place is the fact that my office had a portion of a team builder here.  I didn't pay for it, so I didn't mind going.  It is however about an hour of my life I will never get back.  If the employees were at least somewhat entertaining, or funny, I might think differently.  I have thick skin and can take a good ribbing... I just had to shake my head at the level of incompetence here.Seriously, I'd rather wait in line at the DMV than go and spend another 5 minutes in this place.  The waitress we had would have a tough time getting a GED.  She couldn't even spell things correctly on the paper hats she seemed so intent on creating.  Hey, I have an idea... let's focus more on getting the orders right than what half-ass comment you can write on the hat.  The other waiter we had was a coke head, hipster who you just wanted to strangle with his tight leg jeans to spare the world's gene pool the possibility of him infecting it.I forgot to mention the food.  There were about 25 of us there, and NOT A SOUL enjoyed their meal.  We got to pick from about 8 options on the group menu and while the choices were average, the portions were super small.  I actually felt bad that my company had to shell out the money for what they served us.  We got a $6 meal for $25 a head.  If you're downtown and doing the tourist thing, please go ANYWHERE but here.

reviews.name: Nick B.
reviews.review: This place is good.  Not great.  Definitely not exceptional.  But good.  Dick's is one of those places that you need to experience at least once in your life.  It's a very unique experience like none other.  The wait staff is rude, but that's the point.  They're rude in a funny way.  They'll often hurl witty insults at you, and they even make paper hats for you with crudely clever sayings on them.The food and drinks are good but severely overpriced.  The first time I came here, all I got was a beer and appetizer, so price wasn't as big of an issue.  But the second time, I was taking a friend out to eat.  We ordered an appetizer, a meal for each of us, a beer for me, and a soft drink for him.  When I got the check, it was over FIFTY DOLLARS.  Yeah, the food was good, but 50 bucks for bar food?  That's just not right.  In fact, the cheapest meal on the menu was $13.  Do you know what that meal was?  A CAESAR SALAD.  Yes, you heard me right.  Some of the bigger meals were almost $30.  As for drinks, the cheapest beer was over $5, and all the cocktails were twice as much as the beers.So to make a long story longer, the food and service here are good, but nowhere near worth the price.  If you're rich and feel like blowing fifty bucks on a decent meal that you could get for half the price at LongHorn, then have at it.  But if you're looking for good value dining, steer clear of Dick's.

reviews.name: Sarah A.
reviews.review: Food eh. Service hilarious... Fish n chips crappy but my Boyfriend loved their Chicken and Ribs. So I guess maybe steer clear of the fried foods and go for the grilled items.Ha Ironic.. maybe they are trying to tell me something!

reviews.name: Maggie C.
reviews.review: If I could give less than one star, I would. I've never been to a Dick's before, so my friend and I wanted to check it out. It was about 10:45 on a Saturday night and they were mildly busy...lots of empty tables, a band playing on the stage...After waiting five minutes for a hostess to even come to the hostess stand (she had to be found by another employee), we were seated. She was rude, but we figured that's part of the whole "experience". We then waited TEN MINUTES and after not ever seeing a waitress, we left. We walked to Hard Rock Cafe, we're seated immediately, and the "experience" was leaps and bounds above this place.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: Oh, Yelp. You've taken the words right out of my mouth. 'Meh' is about right.That's fine if service with an attitude is your shtick, but there's a fine line between being annoyingly funny and being... well, this place's namesake.I've been here a grand total of 3 times: once for a post-Board Retreat dinner (we had reservations and decent service), once for an impromptu dinner with friends (horrible service), and once as a stop on the Santa Rampage agenda (strictly bar service). I've concluded the following...If you want something new and different, aren't on a diet and, and don't mind paying a little extra for booze and bar food, give it a shot. It's probably worth going once just to split a Beer Tower amongst a couple of friends and get a funny, degrading paper hat.It's actually perfect for those nights when you have out-of-towners sleeping on your couch and you want to give them a quintessential Nashville experience -- make this a stop on your tour of Broadway & 2nd!Whatever you decide, keep in mind that Dick's is NOT for the easily offended.

reviews.name: Amanda C.
reviews.review: Oh, this is when I wish I could give a 2.5 out to a place because it was almost, almost a 3.  I went in going in knowing the staff was sposed to be rude, but maybe I had too high hopes.  I have been to some other Dick's locations in the past and laughed so hard I though I was going to explode because the jokes were so funny, however, at this location, I was not just blown away.It took forever to get a drink.  The drinks on the mixed beverage menu are around $9.25 so be prepared to spend a little more.  I think I might just stick to beer like I do at the other locations.  The nachos came out cold, and they were out of crab cakes.  It was nice they offered to comp an item off our bill because of that.I might come back just to give it a chance again, because it really is a funny concept. The live music was good too.  The band was really great.   I hope to update again soon.

reviews.name: Terri F.
reviews.review: This place is awesome, keep in mind you MUST have a sense of humor to enjoy and patience!!! Food is good and worth the abuse!!!!  We went during CMA FEST 2013 and the wait was fine and the waiters were AWESOME!  Ignore any negative remarks. If you get a chance definitely go!!!!

reviews.name: Shannon K.
reviews.review: Had the opportunity to visit here in July  with my family. We were a large group of 9. When we walked at about 6pm,  in the tv's were on all over the place, music was blaring and there were no other guests-with the exception of one guy at the bar who looked like an employee. (There is clue number one-run for the exit? Or continue on ahead?) There was no one at the door to direct us to a table. We meandered in, and then a waitress and manager looking type directed us to a set of tables she hurridly squashed together. You get how this is going, right? She took our orders and was pretty nice about it. I thought this place was supposed to be rude?To cut this short, the food was pricey and not good. The plates looked really plain and the chicken that I had was rather dry and tasteless. If you want good food, I agree with the last guy that reviewed. This is NOT the place to eat. None of the food looked fabulous and no one thought their food was really great. The entire family was like, "Eh, " when the  "How is your food?" question went around the table. The food was cruddy however, the premium (priced) drinks were good. My family members did enjoy one super giant margarita and said that it was quite tasty. The iced tea was weak-which is a huge "no-no" in the South. And the whole paper hat thing, well, I suppose that was worth a few giggles. The waitress must have been new because the manager type guy had to tell her what to write on the hats, and then she seemed a little awkward putting them on guests. (Probably some really nice southern girl that just needed a job. You could tell that rudeness was just not in her nature.) If this place wants to stay open in Nashville, they had better look for a new cook. And, they should revise their menu. Next time I'm in the area, there are plenty of other places on that street that I will be selecting from. I won't be going here again.

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: I went here on a Sunday night with my wife and another couple.  We were the only customers in there for about 15 minutes, so the waiter was basically just hanging around our table throwing insults at my friend & I and hitting on my wife & his fiancé.  You have to have thick skin and a twisted sense of humor to really enjoy Dicks.  It might be different on a busy night.I ordered nachos while my wife got a Caesar salad.  Neither were worth the price.  They weren't bad, just overpriced.  Once the food was served, the waiter made hats for us.Overall, it was an experience worth having.  I probably won't be back though.  Once is enough for me.

reviews.name: D S.
reviews.review: Great place. I know it's a chain, but it is still alot of fun nonetheless. If Avery, the bartender is working, sit at the bar. The $hit talking is great and he can take just as good as he can dish it out. I told him I would Yelp him...so Avery if you are reading this, greetings from CA.

reviews.name: Karyn J.
reviews.review: So this is where our office had our Christmas luncheon...I know, a little different. But the place was and the staff was rude...okay so they're supposed to be that way and that is what makes this restaurant fun!I ordered the cheese steak with fries and the food came to us quick, fresh and hot. They serve their drinks in these super huge cups which no of us really expected but was great. (Usually you get the regular size cups elsewhere)Even though the staff plays it 'rude' it's very funny. They made those who had difficulty ordering (asking too many questions, not sure of what they really wanted, etc...) wear these homemade hats with funny sayings. For example, my co-worker wore one that said, "Ask me about my rash." They also have great shirts and panties, yes panties that read 'I Love Dick" on the back of them for sale. All in all it was a good office break, the food was good and I'd go again.

reviews.name: Lauren B.
reviews.review: If you're up for having your teenage daughters be called "whores," "easy," "loose" or "lesbians" (because they play a team sport), then this is the place for you!I went here with by niece's basketball team and the waiter made hats for them to wear and wrote the above adjectives to describe these 16 year old girls who traveled from the other side of the country for their tournament in Nashville and were excited to eat at this restaurant. Additionally, he had four of the girls stand up and had the rest of the girls applaud and then said, "Congratulations, you just met the team whores."I know this restaurant's shtick is supposed to be sardonic, caustic and callous which therefore makes it funny, but clearly this waiter who was hired and  whose behavior has been deemed approved and appropriate by management needs to take a cue from any kid joke book that you check out from the library, because making fun of teenage girl's sexuality IS NOT FUNNY!!!!!!Don't believe me? That's okay. I made sure to take pictures of the hats that I will be sharing with others and will make sure to never visit this establishment ever again.

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: Pretty funny place.  Basically you pay to get treated like crap while you drink or eat a meal.  The food is good.  Loud music.  Nice atmosphere.  Tourist attraction for those visiting Nashville.  Dick's is kid friendly.  I had a good time. The food was decent.  Nice portions.  A little pricey.  But you are paying for the entertainment.  Service is funny.  They threw straws and mayonaise packs at me. Ignored me.  Mess with the kids wrap them to a chair. It's a cool place.  Or just hit the bar and get drunk.

reviews.name: Randi T.
reviews.review: I don't particularly like having to sit with a big group of strangers, especially when we are all ordering at different times and the person next to me is getting their food way before I am. The food was a lot better than I had expected! The crab cakes and fried shrimp are exceptional! My boyfriend ordered the steak and it was not that great, but I didn't expect it to be!! The atmosphere is really different as the waitresses and waiters are very sarcastic which I think is great, BUT we were hardly waited on...... never got asked if we needed anything and there were times that we did need something. I also ordered a Mango Rita (for two) and drank the whole thing almost immediately. It was delicious, but there couldn't have been any more than one shot of alcohol in the whole thing. Definitely not worth the 18.00 for a drink. Overall, it was an OK experience. The food would be the ONLY thing I would consider going back for.

reviews.name: JOE S.
reviews.review: . DICK'S LAST RESORT & THE JOE SAVAGE EXPERIENCE Dick's Last Resort is a unique club/restaurant on 2nd Ave in Downtown Nashville. The Joe Savage Experience will be Fri & Sat, July 20 & 21; the band is absolutely smokin and I have added many new high energy party songs. If you need a break and want to have some fun, make this a happening and tell all your friends. Remember you Enter at Your Own Risk......lol

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: Dicks, much like Hard Rock Cafe, is the type of place that you go to for the experience and not the food. The premise is that your waiter, and the rest of the staff, gives you bad service and says cruel things on purpose. If you have a sense of humor and thick skin, it is a good time. I would definitely suggest going with a group of friends. They usually make "hats" out of butcher paper and write lewd, but funny, comments on them and it's always a good time when everybody is poking fun at each other while you eat. Don't be surprised if the food doesn't blow you away or if your bill is high. A few fried shrimp and some fries for $16? A bottle of beer for $6? It's not hard for two people to rack up a $50 meal for just average food. But, again, that isn't the point of Dick's and I would encourage anyone to go at least once just to see what it's all about. If you do end up there and want an appetizer, my suggestion is to get the gator bites.

reviews.name: Cathi C.
reviews.review: Visited Dick's in Nashville (we are locals) with a large group of 16, raging from ages 10 to 80. Everyone had a blast! From the smart-alec waiter to the band it was nonstop enjoyment.  Our hats featured "hope the viagra works better than the rogaine" (for my balding husband), "Hung like a tic-tac" (for a teen)  to "Titanic Survivor" (for the 80 year old grandma) .  The teens in our group had fun, dancing to the live music,  rolling our table with toilet paper and starting a balloon game with the surrounding tables. As you may gather - not a quiet, romantic experience but perfect for a boisterous, fun-loving group. And the food? DELICIOUS. I had crabcakes (yummy), hubby had a ribeye (yummy) and my picky youngest had the kids ribs (yummy). The prices are a little high, but we had coupons from the entertainment book and some for kids meals saving us over $100 for our group as a total.  Highly recommended for a fun night where "quiet" is not a requirement.

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: I really don't understand how this place doesn't have a better rating. I laughed from the time that I sat down until I left. I came with a party of five and all of us had a blast. Yes the food is expensive but not much more than any of the other places off Broadway. Plus the portions are very large. Also remember you are paying for a show from the employees as well. Great food, great atmosphere. I will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Kory V.
reviews.review: Ok I like to give crap and am always looking for a challenge but this place was lame. Me and buddy came in there and I actually felt bad for the waitress because she couldn't even come up with giving us crap. The food was ok but when you have a pbr buzz even a  roasted cat tongue would taste good. Next time I will go to a waffle house where I can listen to Flo talk better crap than these people.

reviews.name: Phil H.
reviews.review: I've never been to a Dick's Last Resort before, but got a good dose of their style as I passed the downtown Nashville location today. It seems they extend their rude behavior beyond their doors- staff at the door harrassed my elderly Aunt as we walked down the sidewalk. Even when I asked the manager to limit offensive behavior to his customers, I was met with more of the same discourtious behavior.

reviews.name: Rachel F.
reviews.review: I was hoping for fun. Ed Debevic's in Chicago is amazing. I was hoping for that. What we got was some old pervy waiter with bad jokes and terrible timing. He wasn't just rude. He was disgusting. Apparently, Dick's doesn't train them to be funny or hire servers with any experience for that matter. He forgot several things we asked for and seemed overwhelmed waiting on 2 tables. I do not recommend this place if you've ever been to a good "rude" restaurant. You'll be disappointed.

reviews.name: Ryan S.
reviews.review: La Esquina is another authentic gem of a restaurant in Nashville on Antioch Pike. If you haven't had it, Salvadorian cuisine is fantastic and La Esquina does it well! Their Pupusas are the main reason to go, but their Tamales are excellent too. Bring your appetite and brush up on your espanol, this place doesn't disappoint!

reviews.name: Chito G.
reviews.review: Don't come and eat here!!!!!!! Their food sucks.. It's greasy and the place had flies inside that's so unprofessional and unsanitary.. The owner was very rude when it came down to my order that wasn't correct she didn't even offer to refund me $10 dollars, she rather lose a customer than keeping them happy.. I'm never going back again!!!!!!! Save your money and go elsewhere..

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: Another fantastic local restaurant to enjoy authentic Mexican and Salvadoran food.  Tiny place with 8 tables and you have to look to find it.  Once you have located the place be ready to be amazed at how good the food is.  Great papusa's with a huge selection to choose from.   The slaw served with the papusa was crunchy as it should be with a nice vinegar flavor.  The sauces both red and green were very good but I prefer the green.  If you're really hungry and want a challenge get the papusa loco.  It has all of their normal ingredients and is about the size of a medium pizza. Now lets talk tamales.  I've tried them all over and these are without a doubt the best I've ever eaten.  Most places that serve tamales are long on masa and short on filling.  And usually the masa is dry and will darn near choke you.  Not the case at La Esquina.  Heck, I'd eat their masa with nothing else.  But the fillings were tasty as well as the masa so it's doubly good.  Along with the food the drinks (Tamarind, Jamaica and Horchata) are all made in house.  I had the Jamaica and it is the best I've had in town.  My friend had the Horchata and said it was really good with a little extra oomph from cinnamon.  Try this place, you will like it!

reviews.name: Brock G.
reviews.review: Wow. Love it. Totally surprised!!!  Never have eaten pupusa until today but I was blown away. Going back next week

reviews.name: Enrique L.
reviews.review: La Esquina is epic. This place was pretty small and I wasn't sure what to expect when my friend brought me here. English is not happening here and my Spanish isn't the greatest but the waiting staff was still patient with me. I ordered and was very pleased with the meal. Great hot sauces are here. Many fun. If you aren't a wuss about where you dine I would recommend you come try this is some real central American food.

reviews.name: Aaron D.
reviews.review: My Spanish is awful. Don't let a lack of language skills keep you from going here. The food is solid. And affordable.The pupusas are gigantic - and filling. I thought I could handle 3 of them, but in reality I would have been smarter just ordering 1 or 2.  The salsa that accompanies them is fantastic.We did get a side of fried plantains, which I thought were delicious.Both the horchata and the tamarind juice drink are indeed tasty.Decor is spartan, although a TV in the corner lets you catch up on melodramatic telenovelas.

reviews.name: cliff m.
reviews.review: Provencal food at it's best!  like the previous reivew... $2 pupusas!  made fresh on the spot.  you can't beat it.   Jalapeno y Queso is amazing.   All I've had are the tamales (delicious and quite a variety in the masa) and the pupusas b/c they're so good I can't make myself order anything else.  Also, their drinks are great.  Thick horchata and the Tamarindo is spectacular!  If you've never had tamarind it's an excellent introduction.  Like a fruit tea with a zing! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED    They don't speak great english but are a very sweet family that runs the shop.

reviews.name: Brian C.
reviews.review: Down-home Salvadorian food!  This business is owned by a middle-aged El Salvadorian couple. They had their business ruined by the "great Nashville flood" and had to move. Pupusas for $2 each, you can't beat that for homemade food! Wonderful, wonderful! They only except cash, but I didn't have enough and they made an I.O.U for me (which I repaid the same night). They have pupusas queso (cheese), chicharrón (pork), frijoles (beans), loroco (green vegetable) and mixtas (all together) amongst pan con pollo (bread and chicken) and carne asada. Very traditional, very authentic, very reasonable. Please help them grow their business. You won't regret it!

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: My flight back from Nashville was cancelled due to the blizzard and it was already about 8pm. I wanted some decent food before I hit the highway for an only-stop-for-gas 12 hour drive in fair weather and who knows how long as I was heading towards the teeth of the storm. I tried 2 BBQ joints--both closed. I drove down West End Av. Every crappy fast food I don't eat seemed to be representing--KFC, McD's, BK, Wendy's, Jack In The Box, Taco Bell, Checkers.  One hideous logo after another representing everything wrong with America. Ugh--I resigned myself to grabbing a bag of jerky and some nuts at a rest stop.Then I saw the red and white checkerboard and all was well.

reviews.name: Jared K.
reviews.review: Five Guys has a pretty basic setup. No specialty burgers or any of that. I snagged a bacon cheeseburger, plus a regular-sized drink and a small order of fries. Shockingly, this ran me nearly $15! Just the fries and drink alone were over $5. Wow, those are clearly Vanderbilt prices. Everything comes in paper bags. I wish they had trays for dine-in customers. I liked the hand-cut style fries. I'm not sure whether they gave me twice as many as I ordered, or whether the "little" size is double the amount that the fry cup holds. Either way, I had enough for a full cup and the entire bottom of my bag.The burger was exceptionally thick, probably because the cheese was stuffed between two patties. The plain old sesame seed bun was nothing special. Most of the flavor here came from the bacon, so I was glad to have it. My burger was decent, but still only stood near the top end of the fast food spectrum.Five Guys was certainly a filling and decently-satisfying meal, but at these prices I doubt I'll be back.

reviews.name: Correy S.
reviews.review: Gluten free friendly! Little burger Ina salad style dish. French fries cooked in a dedicated fryer. PTL!

reviews.name: Jack N.
reviews.review: Checked in to my hotel and walked down for a quick lunch. They offer burgers with many options to serve all taste. The burgers are juicy and moist. There is a self serve drink dispenser.

reviews.name: Lynna K.
reviews.review: In Nashville for a few days and we were hungry upon arrival. Didn't want to walk far and this was close to our hotel. First time to this chain...it was nice to choose whatever toppings you want on your burger. The little burger is one patty, the regular is two. I went with one and shared a little fries with my husband. There were tons of fries for both of us. I really enjoyed them...hot and delicious. Super quick if you're in a hurry or close to "hangry" as we were! Also had hot dogs on the menu...something I don't see often at a burger place.

reviews.name: Lizzy Z.
reviews.review: Two words: Cajun fries. This is the chipotle of burgers. A little more expensive than fast food, but just as convenient. They're always pretty busy, so go on an off peak time if you want to sit in and eat! If you are taking to go, any time is fine as they are very time efficient!

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: First time here, I'll have to say their burgers were Fat, Fresh and Messy.   There are Peanuts offered to snack on as your burgers are prepared.  The French Fries are simply Fresh Cut Potatoes fried up, not frozen and compressed with who knows what ingredients added, what a concept, serve Fresh Fried Potatoes.   I like it.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: The South's answer to a lack of In-n-Out, Five Guys excels in its simplicity.  It sells burgers, with toppings of your choice, cooked to order when you order, and cooked fast.  No, its not In-n-Out, for those who have experiences it, but they aren't bad burgers at all, and are inexpensive and taste so much better than anything at other fast food restaurants.  You can find them sprinkled all over town, and they offer the same fast and friendly service.  You can decide what you want or don't want on your burger and BOOM its done.  Have it your way but a whole lot less gross.  A clean, almost clinical eating space but this isn't the kind of place where you linger.  However, if you want a fast burger, I would recommend this over a McDonalds or Wendy's anyday.

reviews.name: Randi N.
reviews.review: Y'all I love Five Guys. The burgers are what burgers should be plump and juicy and they have so many options of how to outfit the burger. This is one of my favorite crazy cheat meals. The fries are fried in Peanut oil so watch out if you have an allergy.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: Best burgers ever! Five Guys burgers are amazing. They have that really good old fashioned taste to them. The fries are awesome too. Service is fast and friendly.

reviews.name: Da Deacon H.
reviews.review: GOOD A** BURGERS!!!I ventured to this location with a classmate who has been here several times but it was my first. Ordered a jr. burger and small fry....THE JR. BURGER LOOKS LIKE A REGULAR SIZE BURGER!! and Mann was it good! Fries were hot and customer service was outstanding..Cons: Didn't care for the parking that's behind the restaurant its kind of a inconvenience but due to its location they really don't have a choice!WILL DEFIANTLY RETURN!

reviews.name: Jason T.
reviews.review: My wife and I stopped in yesterday afternoon to grab a quick snack before seeing a movie. We were able to find free parking behind the building. Even though we did not have trouble parking, I could imagine at busier times this would be a problem. The restaurant was about 50% full, but all the empty tables were clean and ready for use. There was no one in line and our order was taken quickly and our food arrived quickly, to be made to order. Since we were just having a snack, we were advised by the order taker to try the regular size fries and drinks. We shared (1) order of  regular fries with drinks and it was more than enough for us to share. There were free peanuts along with mustard, ketchup, and malt readily available for the fries.The fries were all little too salty for my taste, but overall the experience was pleasant and met my expectations.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: 3 stars for consistency. I've been to this particular one 2 or 3 times now, and I have yet to have a bad experience. I have yet to figure out why you would need two pieces of meat AND two pieces of cheese on a cheeseburger, so I always get the Little Cheeseburger. They have always been delicious. We've always gotten excellent service, too. My ONLY complaint is the fries. They are too salty, and they are always a little too soggy. The parking is actually not a pain in the ass, which is kind of odd for this city. If you're lucky, you can snag a street spot. If you're even luckier, it is after 6pm and you won't have to pay the meters. However, there is plenty of parking in the back and under the building, and it is free to park there for the first 2 hours. You can definitely be in and out in under two hours. Now if they would just do something about their fries...

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Burgers are good, with plenty of choices for toppings, and the prices are very good for the food. The fries are also really good and fresh, very substantial. A "regular" order is a good couple of potatoes worth of fries and fills a cup and almost half a bag. Even if the burgers are on the thin side, they still taste good.They also have pretty good hot dogs. And one thing I really like are the tons of peanuts they have. When I'm just hanging out with a few friends and waiting for food, the peanuts are perfect to snack on (and they're healthy!) and pass the time with.

reviews.name: Emily M.
reviews.review: The fries at this location are always soggy and the burgers are sometimes dry and overcooked.  Not sure why this location is not as good as the others...

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: So shoot me.I love a good burger and fries from time to time.Some people like a good chili dog, some people like pizza, some people like fried chicken...Give me a burger and fries and call it a day!This place has never let me down.I don't care how thin the burger is, I don't care that they don't make it medium rare.I love the taste of the burger, sans the bun, wrapped in oodles of lettuce, and I eat it with a fork and knife.I do!and they over compensate the burger with a mountain of good tasty fries.I know, I know, this is not Gabby's.But hey..... when you're jonesing for a burger and fries, and you don't feel like cooking, and it's Sunday, Five Guys is open!!!!!!And you know those nights you were out partying and you forgot to eat dinner?This place is open til 10, EVERY day!oh, oh, oh, and you can order online.So you just got out of the movies, it's 9pm, you're hungry, you don't want to spend a lot of money, you just want to eat something salty, crunchy, and you want to go home and dive into bed...  This is the place.Score!

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: Can I dare to go against the flow and say that I don't like Five Guys at all? I am honestly agog at all the fuss about this place. It seems to show up in posh locations touting good burgers and swanky clean-looking black and white minimalist decor, but besides the window dressing, I don't see much else going on.The burgers are thin, overcooked, and completely tasteless (unless you really like salt, but more on this in a minute). There's other stuff to fill up the space voided by the super thin burger and the wide in circumference, but inadequate to house even a skinny burger, bun, like lettuce and mushrooms and onions and the like, but it doesn't make up for the lack of actual burger in a place that supposedly specializes in burgers. Thin, tasteless, and over-salted. That's all I got from it. It's a glorified Sonic burger - actually, I think Sonic's is better. I'll move on to the fries. They are hand-cut. I'll give them that, but the two times I have been dragged to this place by people I felt I couldn't be completely honest with about my preference for places that serve good burgers, I have felt like the fries could have been so much more with so much less.....salt. The first time I went, the fries were totally inedible. They had so much salt they made me cough, and the second time, they were better, but not by much. I see some chains, and I can see why they spread, but I am baffled by the Emperor's New Clothes effect of Five Guys.

reviews.name: Tracy K.
reviews.review: Best burger I have had in a long time. Look for the song on YouTube. It was hilarious, and TRUE.. DAMN good burger and fries..DAYUM  DAYUM DAYUM!!!!

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: I don't normally review chain restaurants, but I wanted to give my two cents on this one!  First of all, I am mostly vegetarian, but sometimes I get these intense cravings for steak or burgers and say "screw it" to eating healthy.  This past Sunday was one of those times and I decided to sate my desire for juicy meat at Five Guys since I'd heard such glowing reviews about it.Since I rarely eat meat, I suppose I don't have much to compare to Five Guys burgers, but I was let down.  Don't get me wrong... it was good and I felt satisfied, but I expected it to be mind-blowing and it definitely wasn't.  Just a regular ol' cheeseburger that was only a few rungs above a McDonald's burger.  The fries were pretty darn good, although the regular size order was massive and my partner and I weren't able to finish it between the two of us!  I will probably be back, however, because it's pretty cheap and still better than something from a fast food joint.

reviews.name: Sean J.
reviews.review: This Five Guys always has great service. The food is just a touch pricy for burgers and fries, but we don't come here all that often so it seems just fine from a value point of view.

reviews.name: Molly K.
reviews.review: I am still on the quest for a good burger in Nashville--this place has the potential for being good but they don't listen.1st time I went, I ordered a cheeseburger my first time (w/o my husband) and the cheese was not melted--it's a burger with cheese and the cheese should be melted--all part of the cheese burger experience.2nd time I went back with my husband and this time I asked if they would melt my cheese. (UNREAL) I get my burger with a cold slice of american cheese. I don't get it. At this point I should have sent it back--I sat there and took one for the team--at the hamburger with a cold slice of cheese. Is this how all 5 Guys are? Really am I the first to complain about the cheese? Well until I get confirmation that the cheese will be melted on my burger the next time I certainly won't be going back and won't recommend to anyone else. The fries are fine (personalizing where the potatoes came from) but the burger...why wasn't the cheese melted? I wonder was that their intention, do they like cold cheese on a burger, is this a Nashville thing and most importantly will they even read this review?

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: I would have to take my time and think if I were to make a list of the top burger places in town, but I know Five Guys would be in the running. Oh yeah, and FREE PEANUTS!

reviews.name: Hoa T.
reviews.review: I have always been a fan of 5 guys and this location is no different. Gotta love the variety of toppings that you can put on the burgers. Cajun fries are the way to go.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Five Guys might need a few more Guys at this location for lunchtime. It is busy! Drawbacks include shared parking with the nearby businesses, but there is a lot under the building which has a good chance of having at least one spot open for you. Otherwise, you might have a difficult time finding a spot on the street, or having to pay to park. Overall, they deliver to expectation on the burgers and fries.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: Yet another franchise I've only ever tried for the first time while in Nashville. Yet another burger.a.) I love how for a "regular" order of fries, there were at least 2 large Russet-style potatoes' worth of it. I could barely eat an eighth of it. You could see the skins on these.b.) On the other hand, the Cajun-style seasoning didn't knock my socks off. c.) Clean and plenty of seats.d.) Friendly cashier who patiently explained the items since it was my first time there.e.) You can tell the burgers were hand-made -- the burgers weren't entirely round. They looked like I formed them, myself.f.) A tad on the expensive side.  $10+ for fries, a small cheeseburger, and a drink?!? The ingredients were fresh but the jury is still out if the price was worth it.g.) For a place which advertises itself as a staunch supporter of not advertising itself, it advertises itself rather blatantly, with all of the glowing restaurant reviews decorating the walls.i.) Options are limited. Burgers. Hot dogs. Fries. But lots of choices in terms of condiments for your burger.j.) Free peanuts. But if you have a severe peanut allergy, I wouldn't recommend stepping in here.k.) Interesting how they store their boxes of peanuts and peanut oil and potatoes in plain view in the dining area.Overall, I thought the burgers weren't any worse or any better than other places. I would give this place a higher rating if they also offered onion rings.

reviews.name: Jess Y.
reviews.review: 3.5 starsSo my friends and I were starving on a late Friday night and we were trying to decide where to go to feed the hunger. We wanted something unhealthy, potentially greasy, and something that would satisfy this emptiness in our stomach. And all at once, we agreed, "FIVE GUYS".I ordered a Little Cheeseburger. But, don't be deceived by the title, the Little Burgers would be more than enough to fill you up--the difference between the Regular and the Little is just an extra meat patty. And I enjoy a little more balanced meat to vegetable ratio in my burger anyway. After ordering, they give you a number and you can wait until your number is called.  In the mean time, while my stomach was about to implode upon itself, we helped ourselves to the complimentary peanuts. Yes, peanuts. Huge tubs of peanuts and bags of peanuts line the restaurant and you are welcome to take as many peanuts as you like. We each quickly devoured a basket of peanuts.After a few minutes, they called my number and my lovely cheeseburger came out. The patties are always juicy (slightly greasy) but yummy. What I love about Five Guys though are the plethora of topping options and the detail to which you can customize them. For someone as picky as me, I really appreciate being able to customize every topping that is placed on the burger without getting weird judgmental looks from the guy behind the register as I describe that I want a cheeseburger with "only onions" meaning no ketchup, no mustard, no mayo.  And I love being able to pile on grilled mushrooms and green peppers. Overall, great flavors, my only complaint was the sogginess of the burger.  By the time I opened my burger (in the restaurant, no less), my hamburger buns seemed limp and lifeless, barely holding together the burger itself. I really wish they toasted their buns or somehow solved this problem so that they would really stand up to all of the toppings they cram inside.Their fries are pretty good too. They remind me a lot of Boardwalk Fries. You can get them cajun style or normal style.  The cajun style kind has a cool paprika-filled seasoning sprinkled over the fries that reminds me of Old Bay seasoning. Also, like with the Little Burgers, a "Regular Fries" will more than fill you and your dining partner up. Use caution if you want to order a "Large Fries" because it really is a heck of a lot of fries.  Even after coming in so hungry, we couldn't finish off the Large Fries we ordered. Again, my only complaint with the fries, if I had to make one, is that they seemed a little limp and soggy. Or some of them did.Suffice it to say, we left Five Guys plenty full and I would definitely return again when the craving for a cheeseburger becomes unbearable.Another word of warning: greasy floors. One of my pet peeves.  Wear shoes with traction, lest you slip and fall. Also, free 2-hour restaurant parking behind the building. Although, you unfortunately cannot enter the restaurant from the back entrance for "security reasons". Which, by the way, we found out the hard way as one of my friends let in someone who wanted to come in from the back and was then publicly admonished over the loud speaker that the back door is locked for security purposes. When one of the workers left the door cracked open as he took the garbage out, we almost considered closing it--"for security reasons".

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: Five Guys has good burgers.Selection is quite sparse and simple: there is the default burger, a cheese burger, a small burger, and some grilled cheese sandwiches and other things that no one ever orders here, because their specialty is burgers. The default burgers come with two beef patties and tomatoes, lettuce for below $6.  Other toppings are possible and free, including my favorite combination, mushrooms, bell peppers, jalapenos and hot sauce. The burgers are fried in oil made from peanuts, which fills boxes all around the store and are free snacks while waiting for your meal.  The burgers come freshly made, piping hot in aluminum foil. They are greasy as heck. Consume quickly, or the bun will soon get soggy.The fries are also fried in peanut oil and are freshly made, crisp and delicious. The Cajun have a great additional spice kick, but at $3.50 are one of the most expensive order of fries I have ever seen.Together, a meal costs around $10.  It is a nice place to visit on that rare occasion where you say, "oh bugger to my arteries", and need to consume something to knock a few months off your life expectancy.

reviews.name: Jan L.
reviews.review: Can I rate this a very enthusiastic, "A-OK!" with a big smile?You know, I don't really know why 5 Guys posts all the reviews they've ever received in every newspaper or magazine on their walls. The reviews are great and all (I mean, who am I to say I don't like reviews!), but the food can speak for itself.Let's just put it out there that 5 Guys is a go-to greasy burger joint, which is great when you're craving it. And yes, I was craving it. Oh, it's so simple--a streamlined menu of little burgers, regular burgers, and "other stuff" along with your choice of toppings make the decision process a breeze. There are peanuts to gorge yourself with as you wait for your food that is cooked literally behind the cashier. Personally, I've always gone for the little burger/cheeseburger, but not because I don't have appetite--these burgers are BIG(ish). The regular ones aren't much bigger, but they do have another meat patty.In terms of burger joints, 5 Guys is great. I almost always inhale the food, so I'm pretty sure that I enjoy my experience every time...I like that I can still taste the potato part of the fries (both cajun and regular). When you order these thick-cut fries, they give it to you in a paper bag and they're so generous with their fries, you could feed two with the regular size fries and four with the larger size. Side note: They also have a cup in the bag of fries, which I imagine in reality they use to scoop up the fries, but I like believe it's their way of saying, "Hey a normal portion would fit in this dinky cup, but because I like you I just put it all in the bag." I like that I can have all the toppings I want on my burger, which for me is all of them. And, the food is quite fresh. The only problem is their bun, which really can't quite contain the explosion of goodness going on in between.
