Next time, I'll remember to eat it Chipotle-style and rip off the foil wrapping little by little instead of unwrapping the burger in all its glory.All in all, I'd say don't let the walls tell you how great the food is--you might be underwhelmed. But I still go back from time to time when I want a greasy burger, so maybe they're better than I think...

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: Not a fan of this place.  The burgers are good but not great, and the fries are pretty decent.  I wouldn't dislike it so much except for two things.  First, these are the messiest burgers I've ever eaten.  I'm not a fan of a burger that I have to eat with a knife and fork.  And the second thing is, this is the most expensive burger joint I've ever seen.  When I get a burger, fries, and drink, my total is in the $13 range.  That's ridiculous.  For $5 less, I might eat here more often, but I'm not paying an arm and a leg for a soggy, falling apart burger.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Every time I've been to this location it has been a pleasant and delicious experience. In fact, now that I think about it, the location in Atlanta and the one in Cool Springs were also populated with super-friendly employees. I don't know if it's because I'm a chick or because I'm obviously pregnant or because they're just really nice.I love that the burgers are made to order. They're always all misshapen and you can tell that they were hand-pattied. The ingredients taste nice and fresh - if you get a burger with mayo and tomato, for example, the beef is hot and the condiments are fresh and cold and crisp. That's one thing that I definitely miss when I have exactly two minutes to eat and am forced into FastFoodLand for a burger - they always taste like they were made an hour or two ago. Taking ingredients away to ensure a fresh patty doesn't ever seem to do the trick either! Five Guys tastes like a delicious burger that your husband or friend (or anyone but you) just cooked on the grill outside and served up just the way you like it. Because you know food made by someone else is always better than something you had to do yourself.The only thing I really don't like about Five Guys so far is the excess. I know that we Americans are all about MORE MORE MORE and FAT FAT FAT, but seriously, no one needs a minimum of two patties on a burger. And when you order fries, they're like $3 and they fill the freaking bag to the brim with them - jumping and leaping joyously out of their little cardboard container. Seriously, could I pay half the amount and get half the fries (or less!)?? I crave Five Guys every couple of months (more during pregnancy when I'm jonesin' for red meat like a FIEND!), and when I go I always ask them to please not give me two million french fries. Because honestly, I will eat. them. all. And then I will complain all day about feeling "fat" and "ugly" like a typical woman and no one wants that.Overall, I dig Five Guys. I hear they have grilled cheese sandwiches, which is a caloriffic favorite of mine, but I can't get past the MEAT MEAT MEAT craving far enough to actually order it. Maybe I will one day.. Five Guys: A bit pricey, but worth it when you get the craving.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: I am going to go against the grain a bit here, but Five Guys is not that great.  I think that the reason that Five Guys is so popular has more to do with lowered expectations than actual quality.  Let me explain.  I think over the past few decades we have been exposed to enough terrible hamburgers and fries from fast food establishments and lousy restaurants that our expectations of a good burger have been lowered so far that a passable hamburger seems amazing in comparison.  That is exactly what Five Guys has, a passable burger.  The fries are good and of course they are fresh, but aren't fries supposed to be fresh.  I suppose this is why the "craft" burger has taken off all over the city and across the country.  When people forget that a product is supposed to be good you can get away with charging a premium for anything that is above average.  That get's me to my other point.  After all is said and done, with fries and a drink, Five Guys is a $10 meal.  There are dozens of places in Nashville that have excellent burgers for around $10.  Hell I rarely walk out of Gabby's for more than $8 and that is a far superior product in every way.  Most of the sports bar's and pubs in the area have Burgers for less than $10 so I don't really get it.  Overall, I think that Five Guys is okay, but they are not particularly special or particulary a good value.  Long live the era of low expectations.

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Yes! This is the best fast food style burger in town!  The bacon cheese burger is enormous and super juicy or greasy, whichever you prefer to call it.  What makes this place unique is that you can get whatever you want on your burger at no extra charge.  Mushrooms, green peppers, jalapeños, and A-1 steak sauce are just a few of extras that I put on my burger to make it extra delicious.  I am not such of a fan of the fries.  They are the kind that have some potato skin on, and they are just not for me.  Granted, they are not bad, just too "natural" and way too salty!Inside, the place is super clean and the bathrooms are, too.  They have plenty of seating.  It is pretty funny, but they have these boxes of shelled peanuts everywhere for snacking.  I don't really eat peanuts, but I think it's cool that they have them everywhere.

reviews.name: Gary T.
reviews.review: We came in here during  a recent business trip to Nashville and while the food was excellent, the service was shit. I'll start with the good stuff first...the food. The hamburgers in Five Guys are some of the best that I have ever had and well worth the price. You pay a little more but you get A LOT of food. We got a very generous amount of fries with our order and all of the peanuts that we could eat while we were waiting on the food. Now for the bad...I had heard that the customer service at Five Guys was always really great so we must have caught these guys on a bad night. One guy in particular stood out.....This guy named "Zachary" who acted like he was doing a favor by taking my order and spoke like he had a mouthful of marbles. I kept having to ask him to repeat himself because I couldn't understand what he was saying. He was real surly and we weren't the only ones who noticed. When we were eating he came back to where we were sitting and snapped at a table full of people that were sitting near us and told them not to use the back door to come in and then went and locked the door so other people couldn't come in. He was real hateful about it. We can't wait to go to another Five Guys here in the ATL, but we would never go back to this one.

reviews.name: Justin Y.
reviews.review: Oh, Five Guys! I fell in love with you when I lived in D.C.  I thought I was lost without you once I moved back home.  But you have followed me and called to me, Oh Temptress (Tempters?).There's a reason why they are proud of their numerous awards, especially the Cheap Eats/Best Burger in Town awards.  These suckers are so good they are bad for you!During this visit, I had the regular Bacon Burger with "Everything" on it.  I forgot to ask them to grill the bacon hard, but it was still a delicious treat.  If you order the fries, never go for the "large," because they give you more than enough with the small even if you are sharing it with two people.  The fries here are not the crispiest because they use peanut oil, instead of vegetable oil, but they are still delicious.My one complaint on this trip is that the fry guy over seasoned the Cajun fries, so it was a tad bit salty.Overall, it was a wonderful gluttonous experience.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: Dear Lord Nashville needs a good burger, but kids, don't be fooled...this is NOT it.  It may, however, be that place you go to when you are drunk beyond belief and THINK its amazing.  Sadly, having only been there sober, I can tell you its a big old greasy burger in an atmosphere reviled only by McDonalds in over the top bright lighting.  Somehow somebody convinced these folks that have bags of potatoes what cute or (God forbid) healthy looking, so they decorated with them.  If you want a REAL burger, splurge and go to Stoney River at lunch or Flemings for happy hour.  $5-$9 and so much better.  Leave the Five Guys to the college kids.

reviews.name: Merritt G.
reviews.review: This is a great option if you are looking for a decent, quick, fatty dinner option. We ate here on the way to a Predators game the other night. Likes:- All toppings are included! And they have many toppings to choose from. - If you order the burger without a bun it is gluten free. - The fries are gluten free. - They serve Coke products.Dislikes:- The burger is average tasting.Warning: The burgers come double unless you specifically ask for single.

reviews.name: D D.
reviews.review: Juicy big burger with good fries

reviews.name: Ellis V.
reviews.review: Damn you FIVE GUYS!!!You really need to change you name to "FIVE GALS"... For as often as I grab a Bacon Cheese Burger with mayo, lettuce, onions, jalapenos,  and hot sauce and a whole bag of cajun fries.... Sorry my mouth started watering again...But my love is starting to question me on why I'm always with Five Guys...The location is great... yeah the parking for cars are in the back, so what! I got a Bonneville, and I love swinging her to the front parking toll and advertise your burgers as I unfold the foil to reveal it's goodness.Really you can't beat their burgers for the price. Overall you got a welcoming cashier and crew in the back flipping burgers, wide range of tables, two ketchup dispensers (important if your a ketchup lover like myself), free peanuts, free refills (MISTA PIB!)... I really should stop....But once you get you meal you'll realize you got an extra scoop of fries!!!I'll be right back and finish this review later.... I got to run and get something.... my tummy is already growling...Hello Five Guys!

reviews.name: Mimi T.
reviews.review: My friend and I were driving around Nashville when we passed by Five Guys. She was so excited and said we have to go there for dinner. Her family ate at a Five Guys in FL, and she said it was really good. She totally hyped it up for me and I was really looking forward to dinner.We came in just right before a line had started for placing orders. The restaurant was very clean, and there's a lot of room inside. I ordered my small cheeseburger with onions. I thought it was cool that they listed where their potatoes for french fries came from that day.My cheeseburger was fine. I've definitely had waay better burgers. Cali= In-n-Out & NY= Shake Shack. I was disappointed. Seeing all the press that they have had over the years, I thought this burger would be just as good as In-n-Out and Shake Shack- but it was a dud. They definitely do give you a lot of french fries, but I wasn't in a french fry eating mood that night so no extra points there. There's also a self serving peanut station. You can grab some peanuts while you wait for your burger to be cooked. Please be courteous and don't make a mess on the floor/table because someone does have to pick it up.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: So if you come from the West Coast, you probably have heard of In-n-Out. They are basically the most amazing hamburgers. We heard that this place was pretty close to having the best burgers out there so we checked it out.Order at the counter, pretty simple menu with options of a Small Burger or Cheeseburger or a Larger version. Fries and fountain drink.I have gone a few times and get the small cheeseburger. It's plenty of food for me and can get very messy so get lots of napkins. They serve pretty good fries and they are not shy on giving you extra fries. All in all, the food is great. We will be going back there for when we are craving a burger!

reviews.name: Schon B.
reviews.review: The best service in the West End!!

reviews.name: Ryan H.
reviews.review: The bacon cheeseburger here is my favorite fast food burger in Nashville.  Also, they always have great customer service.  If you're going for the first time -- you'll probably find that the "Little" burgers are plenty for an average person, and you can easily split a regular order of fries (which are generally overflowing from the cup) with a couple people.

reviews.name: Jonathan P.
reviews.review: If you are looking for good fries, you found it. If you're looking for great burgers go down the street to Ted's. The only issue I have with the burgers is that they get extra soggy from the expo line to my bag. I don't know how they accomplish that, it's like some kind of super power. They should call it steamy burgerz, cause I don't know what the five guys is all about. There were only 3 guys when I went and you can definitely fit more than 5 people in the restaurant. Sorta pricey.

reviews.name: Matt R.
reviews.review: This place is great! Burgers are a bit greasy but they are awesome (and don't forget the fresh cut fries)!

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: First class burgers, and unbelievable fries, although the hot dogs leave something to be desired.Like above, the place is so clean, you could eat off the bathroom floors and not worry about any sanitary issues.I suppose some people would say others but this place puts Fat Mo's, a Nashville staple, to shame.The burgers are first rate, really really good.  I've had burgers in several places and there is truly nothing like them.  And their fries are cut onsite, and fried the same day.  The portion of fries is amazing.  At first you think the regular fries are going to be only a styrofoam cup's worth, but when you get your bag, it is the bottom is covered with fries, and that's not even counting the cup of fries you already saw.Now, as a hot dog man, there are hot dog place way better all over Nashville, and you can check those out in my List of the best Hot Dogs in Nashville.  If you go to Five Guys, go for the burgers.  The burgers are among the best in Nashville.

reviews.name: steven c.
reviews.review: Probably the only non-local place I will ever vote 5 stars.  They make a burger that is tremendous (as everyone knows), but the biggest difference is the fries.  Proper Five Guys procedure:  Take the burger out of the bag.  Dump all fries in the bag and remove the styrofoam cup.  Sprinkle some vinegar on the fries.  Shake the bag and repeat.  Finally, tear the bag and set in the middle of the table.  Dig in.

reviews.name: Jessica N.
reviews.review: I don't usually like burgers and fries ... But I love this place. Nice thin patty with tasty toasted bun and unlimited free toppings!  I do wish the fries were thinner and crispier ... But this would still be my fave burger/fry place in Nashville!

reviews.name: Renee M.
reviews.review: I don't understand the frenzy about this chain.  The burgers are ok, but way expensive for what they are.  One cheeseburger, small fries and a drink came to over 10 dollars.  It's fast food, it's a chain, it's not fabulous so I don't understand the price point.My order was prepared pretty quickly, despite the fact the place was packed.  My favorite was the fries....but my goodness there were way to many fries to eat, and I threw away alot!I won't go back probably, just because I thought it was way too expensive and the quality wasn't mind blowing.  Believe me, I will drop some money on a good meal, and ten bucks isn't alot, but it WAS alot for what I got.

reviews.name: Jonathan S.
reviews.review: Gotta be honest. Did not live up to the hype. AJ's Alehouse in Bellevue has far better burgers. Five Guys burger had almost no flavor.

reviews.name: Beth W.
reviews.review: Coming from CA, In-and-Out Burgers are the standard. Five Guys comes as close as I have found in Nashville, TN. I try to stay away from chains but I will come here again. The burgers are made to order and they are damn good. You can share a smail fry with a friend and I found the spicy fries just a bit too spicey. Plain one for next time.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: I've already trashed the other Green Hills location but this one I love. I've never had a bad experience with the food here. The only bad experience I've had is with the parking garage. It seems to be under control now, but when they first opened I got stuck down there for 45 minutes. With having a gated garage open onto a one-way street that immediately hits a stop light the line could get pretty backed up. This caused me, and countless others, to sit, with our vehicles running, in line for that stretch of time. If you come and the gate is down, signallying that you'll have to pay to park - remember that Five Guys does validate. Back to the food though: they've always gotten my order right at this location and their fries are always hot out of the fryer. The perfect hangover food. It can get a little crazy around lunch but that's most places.

reviews.name: Kyle S.
reviews.review: I've eaten here a lot and have been to many of the other locations all over the South and it's cosistantly good. However,  I agree with another reviewer that it is a little overrated. The burger is solid for a fast food style burger but nothing to get too excited about. The reason I keep coming back is for the Cajun fries. They are fresh and fried to order and they give you a huge sandwich bag full. Don't miss those!

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.review: Best burger in town? Maybe. Fun atmosphere. Take a pile of friends when you go.

reviews.name: Sloane M.
reviews.review: Great burgers and their Cajun fries are a must!  If you are looking for a quick burger this is where to go.

reviews.name: moore t.
reviews.review: disgusting. There burgers and fries are not worth bragging about.  Burgers taste like McDonalds; fries are greasy.  I can make a better burger at home on the grill.Skip it and go to Ted's Montana Grill instead.

reviews.name: Robert N.
reviews.review: The burgers are greasy awesomeness!!!!  You tell them what you want on it and that's what you get.  The fries are plentiful and good.  Highly recommend but don't go during peak time it gets pretty backed up.

reviews.name: Kelly P.
reviews.review: It's really good... need i say more... go eat it!!

reviews.name: Ali S.
reviews.review: Sandwiches aren't necessarily mind blowing but the service, delivery, and quickness are top notch.

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: The only reason this isn't a 5 is because of the parking situation. This Jimmy Johns is a smaller location compared to others. The workers are always friendly and "freaky fast" creating your sub. The price per sandwich can have its questions, but this is better than subway in my opinion. A great grab and go idea for Vandy students and nearby business men and women. They really get you in and out so there is never an excuses to skip lunch because you have limited time. If you don't want to travel for some delicious subs then call them. They deliver. Freaky Fast

reviews.name: Kristina L.
reviews.review: I've never actually stepped foot in this place; however, I do know that they're free, fast delivery rules.  This is a go-to for my office group because we can get a good sandwich and some chips delivered quickly - even when we have an order of 10+ sandwiches.  On average, I order from here at least once a week.  I've never had a problem, my orders have always been correct, and the delivery person has always been very kind.It's nice having this option especially on rainy days.  It is good to know that I can have lunch brought to me within a thirty minute window even during peak times.  And online ordering has made that practice even simpler since I can save my profile and just click a couple of things - then, POOF, lunch is at the door.

reviews.name: Piper P.
reviews.review: Freakishly fast is right! I work at St Thomas and pull a lot of call on the weekends.  When we are starving and in between cases, Jimmy Johns is my go to. No sooner than we hang up the phone,  they are at our door. I swear they are in the hall making my sub as I am placing my order. Good solid fast food.

reviews.name: Martí M.
reviews.review: When you're down and out due to an illness, the last thing you want to do is figure out what you want to eat - then find the energy to go and get it.This was me recently, and since this Jimmy John's delivers AND is super close to my home, it became the winner to supply dinner.I find it rather odd that Jimmy John's food tends to taste better when I'm on the road. Is it because the West End location just simply doesn't prep the food correctly? Or perhaps it is due to the usual booziness when I call upon JJ's in other cities? Hmm...On this most recent order, I tried the Gourmet Veggie Club on whole wheat bread. I requested additional avocado spread, as I believe one can never have too many avocados!The sandwich was far bigger than I had expected, but not so large on taste. The provolone cheese was beyond overwhelming, and in my attempt to remove the excess cheese, I removed much of the avocado spread with it. This especially annoyed me since I had paid extra for the additional spread.While the wheat bread was better than the boring ol' white buns JJ's typically uses, it wasn't super fantastic either.Ultimately, for almost $8.00 for the sandwich alone, it could stand some improvement.One HUGE plus is delivery time. These guys are always lightning fast, which is unheard of in delivery world. For example, on the last order, I called it in at 2024. The delivery guy was at my door at 2040. Impressive.I won't seek out this Jimmy John's for a great meal, but at least it's there in a pinch.

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: This place rocks!!! The staff is as friendly as they get. They are freaky fast!!! Great Job.

reviews.name: Maiden A.
reviews.review: #5 the Vito. Great sammich. I'd rather have an Italian dressing than the oil based house dressinf they use, but...thats personal preference and it's still not a bad dressing. Quick. Busy. Rushed. Parking available at Office Max lot. Tight. Don't expect to go Eastbound after departing. Take alley adjacent to the building and circumvent the ridiculous traffic at a very busy intersection.

reviews.name: Afkham N.
reviews.review: best cold sandwiches on the planet!two words: GAR GANTUAN! They use excellent cuts of meat, fresh veggies, fresh baked bread and don't skimp out on toppings! these sandwiches are truly gourmet and beat subway, quiznos, which with and potbelly combined!

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: I work at AT&T in the "Bat Building" downtown Nashville and every now and then we have some restaurant carry food in. Today there was about 54 of us who received our lunch FREE from "JIMMY JOHN'S" as an incentive for perfect attendance for the month of January 2013. I had never eaten anything from Jimmy John's before, but I enjoy subs so I was happy about the reward. I wasn't sure what to order and a co-worker recommended that I try the "VITO" which is their Italian Sub. We were getting a box lunch meal with the sandwich ( 6 inches), chips, Pickle and a cookie. It was really good.I had chosen my sandwich on White Bread and the Vito fully loaded with all the veggies on the sandwich. I didn't eat my pickle or my chips, I shared them with a co-worker and the Cookie I brought home for Tony. But, I ate my sandwich. It was really good. I would eat there again.It's not my favorite sub in Nashville, but it was really good. I recommend it to others and I would eat there again!

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: Here's the deal with Jimmy John's: Delicious? Meh.Fast? YES.I have never, nor do I plan to ever, order Jimmy John's for anything other than a work lunch, but it's definitely a go-to in my office.  I might just be jaded since my brain automatically associates Jimmy John's with scarfing a sandwich in front of my computer. You can literally place an order online on your way into a meeting and have lunch there before it starts. The sandwiches are good, but they're often hit or miss.  I've had wrong orders, smashed food and missing items, but you can't hold too much against them when you go from ordering to eating in 11 minutes without leaving your desk.If you don't want the slightly-too-chewy french bread subs, order your sammie on wheat. It's actual big thick good bread. Highlight: The cookies are as big as my face. And I have a big head.

reviews.name: Emily M.
reviews.review: staying in a hotel downtown and running around all day, my mother and I really wanted something delivered. I first tried ordering online and it said the restaurant was closed. Then I tried calling and asking if they delivered to our hotel. our conversation me: hi do you guys deliver? jj: yep, address? me: 4th ave.. jj: not to you (CLICK-HUNG UP). So then we ventured out and decided for fast food it was the only healthy option open still. We order and get our sandwiches, neither one had tuna salad in them but their sandwich making station was dirty and tuna salad was all over our bread of our sandwiches. needless to say we will not be returning to this location. I wouldn't even give it a 1 star if I didn't have to.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: Post-Vandy football game hunger pangs led me to Jimmy Johns. I typically only go here when I am drinking, have been drinking or feel the effects post drinking. Anyway, there is something about the combo of mayo and their delicious white bread that send my stomach into a happy dance. Not too crowded for a game day today. Major bummer was that alfalfa sprouts are no longer included on sandwiches. Way to break my heart Jimmy. You bastard. That was the only part of the sandwich that I qualified as "healthy." Now how am I going to offset all that damn mayo and cheese?! Didn't think you would have a clue. I digress. Don't expect to go there, sit down and eat because there are only four tables outside of the location. But I will say, despite the whole chain gang aspect, they make one heck of a Turkey Tom! And quickly! I felt like I ordered and I couldn't even fill my drink up before my order was called!. Turning and burning!

reviews.name: Mallory S.
reviews.review: I love Jimmy Johns but this one struggled with service. Our sandwiches weren't right, but they did fix it.I also wish it had some indoor seating. The outdoor seating on a busy/loud road wasn't ideal.Great for grab and go! But make sure they get your order right before you leave.

reviews.name: Brennan W.
reviews.review: First Jimmy John's experience was... Meh. Quick pros: Extremely fast. Nice people. Delicious bread. Quick cons: Tiny and cramped place. Mediocre sandwich. Hovering between a 3 and a 4, but I feel good today, so we'll round up.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Late night hunger pains (bit dramatic) led us to Jimmy John's post Mercy Lounge show where I ordered up a veggie sammich and a bag of their own brand of lower fat potato chips. I give it to Jimmy John's for having business hours that accommodate the cravings of the vodka induced. Serious props for that!I also give them a high-five for their tasty brand of tater chips. I thoroughly enjoyed my bag and would even say that I enjoyed the flavor and crisp over many of the major brands out there. Plus, I appreciate that the bag is packed really full of product. Can we agree that it is supper annoying to open a bag of chips only to find that there are a handful to nosh on? Bags can be utterly deceptive!Why only the 3 stars?It all comes down to the sandwich. Yes, my friends... the big letdown with JJ's is the sandwiches. Perhaps the "protein" options fair  better but this vegan was unimpressed with the vegetarian sandwich (sans cheese). It overall lacked flavor and the bread was unimpressive too. We all know that a good selection of bread can make or break a sammy. For those who argue, are there even any flavorful vegan sandwiches out there? I can assure you, YES. You just won't find them at Jimmy John's.P.S. Late night staff were friendly and fun. AKA I didn't lose buzz.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: In my best Olly (from FamilyGuy) voice:  THEY GOT SANDWICHES!!!I usually get the country club with the hot peppers.  The key is the hot peppers.  Otherwise its just a boring sandwich.Warning.  If you add cucumbers to your sandwich, you might just get have made your bread in this sub a Water Slide for your meat to use that lovely mayo and shoot out the other side like you are at frigging White Water in the A to the T to the L.  Represent pimp.

reviews.name: Sara S.
reviews.review: I'm from central Illinois, so when I saw that Nashville had Jimmy Johns I felt right at home!  The sandwiches are always awesome, the service is as you'd expect, and they are done so fast you freak!  No but seriously, they're fast!Top it off with a pickle and I'm over with.  YUM!!!

reviews.name: Alysse W.
reviews.review: Great! Fast, easy, no mistakes and no wasting time or money! Thanks for the great food and attitude.

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: Crappy day out, nothing in the fridge and sick of pizza?  Jimmy John's to the rescue!   I'm crazy addicted to the Big John (med. rare roast beef) w/ cheese and the jalapeno chips.  They usually deliver fast and the sandwich is always mega tasty!  Price isn't bad considering there is no fee for delivery.Missing a star for one of my five recent deliveries being absolutely terrible:  super long wait, forgot my drinks, missing one sandwich.  I was willing to let the drinks slide but  I had to run out to my parking lot to find him and let him know it was the wrong order.  He shrugged at me...and I asked nicely, "well, do you think you can go back and get the right order this time with our drinks?"  45 minutes later the guy returns with the right sandwiches but one (no kidding) half empty drink.  I asked where the other drink was and he said, "oh.  I guess I can go get it."  Um, no.  No more waiting.  I asked if it was the coke or the diet and he says coke.  Well, it creeped me out that it was half empty so I told him to keep the coke.  Okay, I'm rambling but it really drove me batty...especially after I gave him a 25% tip before I realized the first delivery issue.  *grumble*Thankfully that one really bad delivery experience seems to have been a fluke.  Since then I've had fast, friendly service.

reviews.name: Grayson W.
reviews.review: I love this place. It's great for delivery that isn't pizza and takes half the time. You have to get the gargantuan!

reviews.name: Benson C.
reviews.review: The subs taste alright, but they deliver which makes it perfect for those times when you don't feel like driving out.  They on average they seem to deliver pretty quickly, on average about 15-20 minutes to get your food. If you're a student in the Belmont or Vandy area, they will personally find your building and room and deliver it to you.  Which makes it an extra nice touch for a delivery service.  :D

reviews.name: Tonya O.
reviews.review: If only I had discovered Jimmy John's years ago, I wouldn't have wasted my time with Subway. I wish they had more locations, but it's probably best otherwise I'd eat there more than I should.The sandwiches are very fresh. They score extra points with me by numbering their sandwiches because who wants to announce that they want an Ultimate Porker when they can quietly request a #17?  I wish they cut the sandwiches in half without requesting, because I have been several times where I requested that the sandwich be cut in half, and they didn't. One time I can see, but numerous times shouldn't happen. In a sea of sandwich shops in Nashville, this is one of the best!

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Like most students, daily I travel down West End and pass Jimmy John's, which is nestled between Office Depot and the flower shop in the pink building.  The sub shop is small and clean inside.  They have a nice outdoor patio area, less than 10 feet off of busy West End Ave., which makes for an exciting and sometimes dangerous lunch! Jimmy John's is a national chain, but one of its signature sandwiches is so good I have to write about it.  The absolute best sandwich they have is called the Beach Club.  It comes on one of their tasty sub rolls and is stuffed with cucumber, sprouts, avocado, and turkey.  What I love is that the sprouts and the cucumber make this sandwich very uplifting and light tasting, but still leaves you full.Unfortunately, Jimmy John's subs are not low in calories like Subway.  I think the Beach Club is pretty fatty, but it makes for some seriously good comfort food.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: I don't see what all the fuss was about.  What kind of sub shop has sandwiches for $5 that aren't footlongs and don't even have cheese on them.  I got the Turkey sandwich: eight inches, turkey, tomato, lettuce, bean sprouts, and no cheese.Sure everyone was real nice, and the service was fast, but the sandwich wasn't anything special, pricier than I would have expected, and didn't even have cheese.I'll go back to Jersey Mike's.  Just as pricey, maybe, but oh so good.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Of all the sub shops in the Nashville area this is my favorite. I've tried Jersy Mikes and Lenny's but in the end its Jimmy Johns I always want to come back to.

reviews.name: Nathan M.
reviews.review: Slow. .. Jk, super fast. I freaked.

reviews.name: Nicholas M.
reviews.review: The Italian sandwich was good and the service was very fast.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I have had my ups and downs with Jimmy Johns over the years but I will talk about my ups because they have an amazing sandwich. I go with the Italian #9 on the french bread and not the sandwich bread. The bread is amazing. There is a crusty chewy quality that is hard to find. They are generous with the meat and cheese and they add an Italian dressing that is really fantastic. They dint' have the garden selection of toppings like Subway but you hardly feel slighted because the meats and bread are so plentiful. My husband is not the Jimmy Johns fan so it may be a love/hate kind of thing. There is no inside seating and sitting on the street is not all that great next to West End so I would take it to the park.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: They deliver and they're yummy, need I say more? This is my favorite chain sub joint. The ingredients are fresh and they make them the way I like 'em. For me the best part is that they have all the nutrition facts online. And, their website is the easiest to follow. They actually let you pick the sandwich you want and as you add or delete ingredients the nutrition updates automatically. Not to mention, I love their kettle chips, the BBQ and Japeleno are my favs. They're usually good at getting your order right too. They one time that they didn't they had a new sandwich to me almost instantly.

reviews.name: Helena S.
reviews.review: Love it! This stuff is fresh and the bread is really tasty. Simple but high quality. They have the sandwiches numbers to pick from so you don't stand over them and pick and choose the toppings, so if you are looking for that a better bet would be Jersey Mikes, Quiznos or Subway. Oh and try the hot peppers, they are an awesome addition to any sandwich. But serious, this is better than all of those mentioned. The downtown location is outdoor seating only. Park at a meter and walk. Open late night on Fridays, 12 MIDNIGHT BABY!!

reviews.name: Tim H.
reviews.review: If there's a better sandwich shop in Nashville, I haven't found it. Sorry Sub Stop. Amazing sandwich. A delivery team organized by Speedy Gonzalez.

reviews.name: Anne B.
reviews.review: Great sandwiches and great bread. The food comes out super fast and the staff is friendly. Wish they had one of these in California! #5 Vito is amazing.

reviews.name: Kurt T.
reviews.review: Jimmy John's ROCKS!!!  When I used to date a girl that went to Vanderbilt, when I was in town I would eat here.  My first experience with JJ's was in Lawrence, KS when visiting friends at KU.  JJ's started as a sandwich shop in college towns, but I was pleasantly surprised to see that there is a JJ's in Arlington, TX.  So I think that they are expanding their market.  They make some damn fine sandwiches in here.  The only place I think rivals this sandwich place is Mr. Goodcent's in the Kansas City area.  I love me some Jimmy John's!  I hope we'll get some out here in CA at some point.

reviews.name: Morgan R.
reviews.review: This is not a place to go out of your way for. It's purely convenient if you go to Vandy.  The guys were cool, and the subs were indeed super fast. The subs were ok but not great.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Subway sandwiches are healthier, but Jimmy John's West End Avenue sandwiches are good quality and worth the money.  The best part is they will deliver to your nearby business or medical office.

reviews.name: M B.
reviews.review: In April 2011 I was in Nashville staying at the Marriott there close to Vanderbilt Hospital. My aunt was having surgery and it was about a two week stint for me. I had heard about Jimmy John's from one of my FB friends so one evening after a hard day I thought I would give it a try. We ordered, my daughter and I, and received yummy sandwiches and chips delivered to our hotel room. It was a good meal and worth the price. A month later when I received my banking statement, I saw that the store had charged me for someone else's order too. I had two debits on my statement, two authorization numbers, and two amounts coming out of my checking account. I sent an email to the corporation and told them about the mistake - I assume it was a mistake, but maybe this is something that they do regularly with folks there in the hotels since they know we're just in for a visit and out again, probably not consistent customers don't know, anyway - but I've not heard anything back from them in any way. I'm disappointed that this happened and I won't be a customer of this chain again. I know it is a local thing with that franchise but it just rubs you the wrong way when something like this happens and you get no response from the company. The food was good but the experience was not. Be careful if you do choose to order from them and provide a credit card or check card as payment.

reviews.name: Naomi S.
reviews.review: When we arrived at Ravello's my girlfriend wanted veal parmigiana and the chef came out to our table and after she explained what she wanted he said ok. The veal came out so tender and it was one of the best she ever had. I ordered angel hair with clams and it was so spicy that Romeo our server took it back and got me something else. Romeo was outstanding and everyone there was so kind and helpful.

reviews.name: Laura P.
reviews.review: Pretty much every restaurant at this "resort" only warrants a 2-3 star rating. If there was anything better in walking distance on a Sunday night I probably would've ventured out. But it'll do after just arriving from the airport.Our server Sena was very nice and helpful with the wine choice. I had a glass of Feudi Di San Gregorio, which was nice and went well with the chicken piccata I ordered. However that dish was just so-so. The chicken was very dry and more like chicken-fried battered than the lighter flour dredge it should've had. The sauce was just ok with a very heavy caper flavor. The accompanying broccoli rabe was extremely bitter. I asked Sena to add a side of angel hair since it doesn't come with any pasta and that was fine.I ordered the lemon honey semi freddo for dessert and *that* was quite nice and very refreshing. All in all it was fine for hotel dining but stupidly overpriced, like everything else at the Gaylord.

reviews.name: Gena S.
reviews.review: We were looking forward to a nice dinner before our show, so we selected this Italian restaurant. I read the reviews and they were mixed. We started with the antipasto platter. Very good, but not very much--overpriced. The salads were great. My husband ordered the lasagna. It was inedible. Very dry, no visible cheese and HUGE!   I had the shrimp and lobster ravioli. I would rate it a C-    The pasta was very hard. Several reviews mentioned the delicious bread. I didn't think it was anything special. Wait staff exceptional. We will not go back.

reviews.name: Robert W.
reviews.review: Loved this place in the Opryland complex. The service was tremendous, the food was delicious. No reservations needed, but restaurant was full.

reviews.name: Nick B.
reviews.review: The only thing that I could eat on this menu was a 1/2 roasted chicken. It was with bone and it was very tasty, if they took the bone out this place would have been 5 star.I really think the waitress was 5 stars food came out super fast and win was very tasty as well.

reviews.name: Kell K.
reviews.review: I thought the food was very good!   The service was top notch!  The scallops were perfect!  The chicken piccata was very good! My friend enjoyed the steak.   Worth a visit!  The wine was a little pricey but otherwise great dinner!

reviews.name: Diane R.
reviews.review: Slooooooowwwwwwwwservice   Would hate to see what happens when they get busy. Waiter a little overzealous with his descriptions of the menu items. Had minestrone soup. Tomato sauce with a couple of carrot chunks and a few pieces of pasta. Caprese salad presentation was horrible. Chunks of heirloom tomatoes thrown on a plate with four very small mozzarella balls. Some type of basil oil drizzle and that was it for the salad. I had shrimp scampi appetizer as an entree. It was fine. Probably the highlight of the meal. My hubby had fettuccine carbonara, which was supposed to have mushrooms in it and a poached egg on top(?!?!). He asked to omit both items and they did. The pasta was perfectly cooked but the carbonara sauce lacked flavor. We were at this restaurant probably five or so years ago and it was delicious. The menu was completely  different this time. Very disappointing. We expected better out of the Opryland Hotel. We will bypass this next time we are looking for Italian in Nashville.

reviews.name: Paul R.
reviews.review: This place is real nice because it is in the middle of the Gaylord hotel. The food was very good and the service was excellent. I would recommend this place for a nice relaxing time.

reviews.name: Chelsea C.
reviews.review: Service and atmosphere was A+ but the food left something to be desired.  There were 2 standouts though- the homemade bread and the caprese salad.  The bread was probably the BEST bread I have ever had- we ordered 3 baskets of it!  The caprese salad isn't you're typical caprese- it's pureed mozzarella with roasted tomatoes on top but it was absolutely fantastic.  It's probably not for everyone, but both of us loved it.For our entrees we got the rabbit ravioli and the lasagna bolognese.  Neither of us really liked our dishes.  The lasagna was dry, the bolognese was not really a bolognese- just a red sauce (at least on my dish).  The ravioli wasn't bad but the rabbit just wasn't our favorite- definitely a gamey flavor.  Luckily we were filing up on bread so didn't walk away too disappointed.Service was fantastic and it's a nice atmosphere but I'd venture elsewhere within the hotel.

reviews.name: Rick R.
reviews.review: Having been trapped at the Gaylord for six days, I was looking for a different place to eat. I found Ravelllo. It's a semi- upscale Italian restaurant. The menu is decent, diverse and not typical, which is good. I found myself struggling with the menu at first- and started with the Burrata salad. I did not care for it at all. The tomatoes are oven roasted and diced, along with yellow raisins and zucchini. Not a good flavor  The Fazoletti pasta was very good. The beef filet cooked perfectly. A bit of a warning-- the Kitchen puts pepper on EVERYTHING. And I hate pepper The waitress told me the para side came with a red sauce, but actually it was a heavy ragu pork or beef sauce. Be sure to ask frpre specifics if you are a vegetarian. Not sure I would return unless trapped again , but it was fine.

reviews.name: Omar A.
reviews.review: Review is simple ...Host and hostess do not understand that making a customer wait for half an hour when there are six plus open tables in front of you is not a good way to start the dining experience Waitress.... Turned everything around and was the best waitress I have had in years, seriously she was a career waitress that really knew how to speak the truth about menu recommendations and make you feel great about your dining experience Food... Calamari was slightly above average.  Cedar Plank Sea Bass over cooked and a little dry but had a very nice seasoning.  Scallops were the true highlight made the meal rock.  Skipped deserts since she said the cannoli was not the best (honesty is the best) and banana dessert was sold out... Overall.  Good place if you are staying at the hotel.

reviews.name: Andrea P.
reviews.review: The food is amazing. The price is high, but as is everything else within the Opry land resort. I enjoyed my entire meal which included the mozarella bruschetta, pear vinaigrette salad, salmon with creamy polenta,  and a dessert of chocolate salted caramel. The polenta was by far the creamiest I have ever had and the rich chocolate dessert was amazing.It was also convenient that they accommodated our party of 30 to sit together. They also allowed for our meal to be prepayed.Overall, I had an amazing meal in an amazing resort.

reviews.name: Juls B.
reviews.review: This was a very nice place in a special place, The Gaylord Opryland Resort. Great ambiance for a romantic meal. We were greeted and seated immediately. The wait staff was friendly and efficient. Loved the sundried tomato and roasted garlic spread for the bread. I mentioned this to our waiter and he told me the chef would give me the recipe if I emailed him. He gave me the chefs number. We had meatballs for appetizers along with the house salad with creamy white balsamic salad dressing. The lasagna with suckling pig was good too basically lasagna with roasted pork. Tasty. Too full for dessert but it looked amazing.

reviews.name: Ling G.
reviews.review: The service here is good but food is not. We ordered medium rare steaks they came out well done. The seafood risotto was salty. Although I have to say the appetizer and house salad were good. For what it's worth, go out of the resort for better food.

reviews.name: Joe S.
reviews.review: Good serviceVery small portions Very overpricedAla carte $26 for a small pasta dishBetter if on work expense account

reviews.name: Dave J.
reviews.review: Our meal was average, service was good. Bread and appetizer were delicious. We had the crispy risotto app. I had beef ragu lasagna which had good flavor but was a little dry. My wife had linguini mantanara (sp) and did not like it at all. Noodles were hard and dish was a little dry. Sausage was chewy as well. We were here a year ago and it was great so we were disappointed in our return visit.

reviews.name: Shannon F.
reviews.review: This place was certainly just ok.After another long hard day of working our event held @ the opryland, our group was definitely in the mood for some fine dining and In hopes of a meal that would make up for our previous disappointing dinner at Solaro.Well I Can't really say they surpassed by far, but at least by a few.Yet another classy, deceiving, impressionist restaurant situated in the midst of the enchanting opryland forest, that again struck my anticipations of hope for a fabulous meal.Our group of five was seated at a nice table which allowed us to view the restaurant and to do some people watching in it as well.There menu for the most part, was impressive with an array of appealing options to choose from, minus a few things.We were all in a toss of what to get until, I happened to notice the 3 course and 4 course options available. One being a 3 course option with your choice of any entree, appetizer and a choice of dessert for $50.00 ( not bad) and the 4th one was the same, just included with a glass of wine for like $65.00. We all chose the 3 course fro $50.00. Most of us got the fried calamari as an appetizer except for my boyfriend who got the caprese salad. For our main course choice, most of had a dish that I cannot recall the name though, it was lobster, clams and mussels over a creamy rossoto tossed in light tomato like broth.Our server in the beginning was prompt and our appetizer arrived within a reasonable amount of time, presented mouthwatering appealing and piled high with a generous amount of calamari. It turned out to be quite good, seasoned well and cooked perfectly though, nothing spectacular. I also had a bite of my bfs caprese and it tasted extremely fresh and flavorful.Our main coursed arrived a little bit longer than anticipated though when arrived, was presented beautifully! The lobster was much smaller than expected with most of the presentation being the shell. The clams and mussels were seasoned well, though still nothing spectacular especially considering the prices, I would have to say the best part of the meal was the creamy rossoto ( I usually try to steer clear of too much pasta, but the baby disappeared fast : ) . Everyone else enjoyed the main course for the most part, except for another cohort that got a clam like dish, that was pretty disappointed with it. Through out our dinner here, we were greeted and asked how everything was, from the extremely friendly lead chef there, which impressed us much.Finally for our dessert, they had a selection of mostly fruit based desserts that did not quite appeal to the most of us. Again, the chef came out again and we decided to ask him for his opinion of what to choose...man, was he in for something Lol like a red carpet we rolled out with over a 100 questions. Finally, he mentioned something he could make that was not currently on the menu and that would please all of us and it was....just just your typical Italian conoli desserts, yes.He said that it would take a bit longer to make being he would have to defrost the dough, though looking up at him like kids waiting for ice cream and not needing to be anywhere, we decided to wait.So we waited and waited. I am a big fan of desserts and will wait for good things however, this was just too long. Finally they arrived looking outstanding and decorated to an art! After biting in to it though, my first detection was it never defrosted completely and was cooked to for too long leaving my in hopes of not cracking my tooth. The filling though, was the only thing worthwhile breaking through the sacrifice and a matter a fact, it probably could have been award wining if the shell wasn't so tooth chipping hard. I really didn't want to say anything to the poor chef being he went out of his way, though I probably would have been better getting any other dessert.Overall, definitely mediocre Italian food that's overpriced because of the location. The main positive highlights of the restaurant was the friendly service and mesmerizing atmosphere though, there is nothing good enough here to have me wanting to come back.

reviews.name: Danpril Z.
reviews.review: Nice surprise. We weren't betting on much from a "hotel restaurant"but it was really good. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

reviews.name: April S.
reviews.review: The food was good. The service was good. The atmosphere was very nice. There were 8 of us, everyone liked their food/drink. Very pricey.

reviews.name: Lisa G.
reviews.review: Beware, this place has procedures in place to sell you the moment they see you check-in with the hostess.  She'll make you wait for your escort, who will walk you by the artisan cheeses and cured meats counter to whet your appetite before seating you.  Then the water guy will approach, bottles in hand, and offer sparkling or still water before telling you who your waiter will be.  Then someone else will bring you both a dinner and wine menu.  Then you'll get to talk to your waiter, who will check on you every single time he walks by (as will the escort, water guy and menu guy... AND the manager).  I actually came in just to get soup and salad, but didn't quite feel right about just getting a salad when they told me the only soup they had was something I didn't particularly care for (forget now what it was).  So, I ordered the scallops, $32.  There were four of them stacked on a polenta cake.  Really.  For $32, I should've gotten a salad, or even just a side of something green.  I saw many a steak plate go by with nothing on them except a few mushrooms on top and a spot of arugula.  Where's my arugula?  Boy, they did not like that I didn't order wine.  Or a cocktail.  Or a dessert.  At times, I'll order all of the above, but today was not the day.  I drank about 4 glasses of water (iced tap), and in this 100+ degree heat, that's all I wanted.  I truly don't mind spending money for good food (and this was good but not the best I've ever had), but I have to feel like I got my money's worth in taste and experience.  And I don't like to feel like I HAVE to order more.I wouldn't go back, just because their practices are more along the lines of a used car sales lot than an "upscale" southern Italian restaurant.  I felt like I needed a shower after I left.

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: I've been here twice now, and have experienced multiple dishes from what I have ordered and from those I am dining with...none have disappointed.   I would have to say my top three are the lasagna, ravioli, and the cannelloni, in no particular order.Also, be sure and order up the Charcuterie board...the meat and cheese selections are numerous and you are going to find plenty to enjoy.  It also never hurts to start with the burrata and finish with the cheesecake.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Appalling food.  2 hour wait to be served cold meatballs, undercooked spaghetti, and tepid (at best) lasagna.  At least they had the decency to remove the uneaten food from the bill! I have previously eaten here (18 months previous) and then food was very good, but last night it was truly awful.  I would recommend you try elsewhere.

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: This is one of Opryland's signature restaurants.  We had dinner there on Christmas Eve.  My wife had scallops and I had braised short ribs.  I wanted the veal dish I saw on their online menu but they changed it a week ago.  The food was grossly disappointing.  You had to pick the sand out of the four scallops and they were medium sized and were over cooked and the membrane hand not been removed.  The short ribs had two pieces of meat.  One piece was charred on the grill and tough and hard to cut.  The other was ok. For a desert, an olive oil lemon pound cake was totally dry and tasted like it was several days old.  Add to this the overpriced wine and you have a terrible dining experience.  Would never recommend this place.  Stay away from this restaurant.

reviews.name: Dave V.
reviews.review: Best calamari I've had in a long time. Wife's seafood rozato was awful, though. Maybe we just don't care for seafood rozato. Service was fine, a bit pricy but what isn't at gaylord.

reviews.name: Diana M.
reviews.review: Very disappointing. We paid 28.00 for Chicken Parmesan and it was a leg and a thigh with bone in. It was not breaded, the marinara sauce would have been better if they used Ragu.  My husband had a 26.00 bowl of spaghetti that was very bland tasting with two meatballs. He said it reminded him of  spaghetti from a can.  The salads were 10.00 and very average at best.  Service was good. However, for the price of the food the quality was very disappointing.

reviews.name: Joe B.
reviews.review: Nice atmosphere but food is just okay. It was an $11 upcharge for chicken on a $10 appetizer salad. That's one heck of an upcharge. 110%. The waitress mentioned there was an upcharge, but I never thought it'd be more than $5 on a $10 salad. Anyways, even if I put the upcharge aside, I wasn't overly impressed. Barely any sauce on my spaghetti and meatballs. It was like eating dry pasta. Meatballs were pretty bland. The soup was decent though.

reviews.name: Bill P.
reviews.review: I'm staying in the hotel and ate there last night.  It was disappointing.  I had the spring pasta and added the sauteed shrimp.  The pasta was gooey and stuck together...poorly prepared.  The shrimp were tasty, but a little overcooked.  Another person at our table had the same issue with their pasta.  The veal was a bit chewy and could have used a sauce.The waiter never asked how everything was.  There were 8 of us.  After we got another bottle of white and one of red, we never saw the waiter again after he poured the initial glasses from those bottles till it was time to clear the plates.  Once the plates were cleared, it was 10 - 15 min. before he asked if we wanted dessert.  By then, we were all ready to leave.  I wouldn't go back.  Fortunately my dinner was paid for last night when one of our vendors took us there.  On the business side of things, it was a nice environment for that.

reviews.name: Donnell S.
reviews.review: The greatest rack of lamb I've ever had.  Service was top notch.  It's pricey, but if you're going here in the first place, then you're prepared for it.

reviews.name: leslie k.
reviews.review: I was visiting for a conference at the Opry Hotel so I had to eat at the restaurants in the hotel.  This is one of them.  It was surprisingly good, despite the bad reviews.  My husband and I ended up going here twice.  The service is excellent and they have a nice wine list.  I would recommend the scallops and the banana dessert.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: For dinner one night our group was taken to dinner at Ravello in the Opryland hotel.  I was a little worried that the place wouldn't be very good because of its touristy location, but they surprised me in a good way.The location of this restaurant is right in the Conservatory gardens so sitting there feels as though you are on a patio.  But a magical patio with the perfect temperature and no bugs or birds annoying you.  Also of note, the seats are very wide and cushiony - sooo comfortable!For a starter the table ordered some calamari and some meat balls.  I thought both were tasty but clearly I preferred the meaty balls.  Next I had a melon salad (seemed to be a summer special on the menu).  It was refreshingly cool and perfectly sweet.  For my entree I tried the pork tenderloin braciole.  This is pork with mozzarella, prosicutto, polenta, fried swiss chard, and tomato sauce.  GAH it was deeeelicious!  I ate the entire thing and not only because I've been cutting back on the carbs.  The polenta was so rich and delicious.  I loved everything about the dish.  Portion size was also made for a regular person which left me feeling satisfied but not too stuffed.  Then I tried a couple of bites of tiramisu.  It was tasty but really I couldn't stop thinking about those pork tenderloins.  Wine was also excellent as usual but since I wasn't buying I have no idea what it was.It may be pricey and it may be out at Opryland hotel but Ravello may be worth your time when you want to do something a little different and have a good Italian meal to boot.

reviews.name: Rick G.
reviews.review: Ate there last night while staying at the hotel. The service was slow and just average. The food was not bad but overpriced. The beauty of the hotel and convenience makes up for a good bit of my disappointment however.

reviews.name: Dina C.
reviews.review: After reading the negative reviews, I was truly concerned that I was going to get some theme park inspired Olive Garden crap.  I have to say that I was very impressed by the menu, wine list, and excellent service.  I am from the Northeast and I make my own sauces "gravies" from scratch, so I am very picky about Italian food.  I was impressed.  My botfriend enjoyed the chicken livers and lasagna.  I enjoyed the simple red sauce dish with the homemade meatballs.  Overall, a very relaxing and enjoyable experience.  I have to say that Nashville doesn't have many foodie options, so I am glad that we dined at Ravello.

reviews.name: Meredith O.
reviews.review: Came here with a company party of about 30 with a pre-determined menu.  I'm vegan and quickly realized I couldn't eat anything on our menu; fortunately the woman who organized the event realized it too.  She sent the head waiter over to me and he said, "I understand you have a vegan allergy?" After a moment's hesitation I said, "Yes, yes I do."  He explained the ingredients in the one item I thought I could eat (I couldn't) and I explained what I needed.  I also told him I'd be fine with a big salad and some bread and he said, "Oh no, we can do better than that."  And they did.  He personally brought out my no meat, no cheese salad (delicious) and provided me with a wonderful angel hair pasta with a tomato sauce and grilled vegetables.  They basically fell all over themselves to provide something for me and I'm so pleased.  It's not a place I'd have originally thought of as a vegan haven but wow, they went above and beyond to meet my needs.  I will definitely be back. The atmosphere was wonderful and the service was amazing.  I can't imagine better.

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.review: Delicious food. Yes, it is pricey but by far the best food and best service in the Opryland Hotel biosphere experiment. Our server, Ebram was a highlight. The gnocchi had tons of mushrooms, the caprese included the best fresh mozzarella I had ever had. The special was a veal porterhouse that my mom said was amazing. Definitely "the" place (and I've been to Old Hickory).

reviews.name: Andrew K.
reviews.review: This place is basically lipstick on a pig.  It looks wonderful on the outside.  Beautiful and all new contemporary surroundings.  It is a work of art considering how badly the building was damaged because of the recent floods.  Ravello has an on staff cheese expert.  A cheese expert and who knows how pair some seasonal delights with excellent cheeses.Now that I've kissed the pig and the lipstick is all over my face.  The braised lamb was dull, flavorless and a little dry.  Braised anything should literally fall of the bone.  I looked like a cave man fighting with a fresh kill.  They seated our group of business people in a room with a family that had several young kids.  We promptly asked to be moved but I fail to see when you have so many open tables why you would purposely seat anyone there.  Kids screaming makes everything taste better?  18% gratuity was included on the check but no mention of that was made anywhere on their menu or ahead of time by the server.Once you get past the lipstick on this restaurant it's still a pig.  *turns around real fast* "hey Sarah Palin, I thought I was channeling you!"

reviews.name: Jon N.
reviews.review: Easily the best dining option in Opryland.  Food is well prepared.  They have an excellent wine list and anti-pasta selection.  Service is quite good.  Setting is really nice, too.It is pricey, but since you can end up being a captive audience at Opryland, this is your best dining opportunity.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: YUM YUM YUM.I had a fantastic experience here with our group.  The cheese and specialty meat display and presentation was so delicious.  Next up was calamari, mussels, scallops, gnocchi with beef tips and mushroom sauce, pork tenderloin, tiramisu, italian doughnuts, gelato, etc.  We obviously had a family style dining experience, and that is the absolute best way to go in my opinion!  This way you can experience all of the best things that Ravello has to offer, which is a lot of AMAZING food.  The wine was also delicious.The service was great & they were very knowledgeable of the menu items, which is always a big plus for a restaurant.

reviews.name: Citizen J.
reviews.review: Pasta bolognese was pretty good but fried calamari app was one star.  Wine list is not impressive.  I ordered an italian wine by the glass that wasn't corked, it was simply bad and I had to send it back (but they did take it back without a problem and brought me a CA red zin that was decent).  Wife's burrata app served way too cold but was still very good quality. I would have given them 2.5 stars overall if I could but erred on the side of conservatism.  C-

reviews.name: Marvella C.
reviews.review: Have a lovely dinner here. Cheese expert was wonderful treat? Cocktails were very different but lovely to taste. Service was great! Josh and Christe were great! best dinner we had during out ENA convention.

reviews.name: Eddie S.
reviews.review: Had the veal with a fried egg on top.  I felt it needed a sauce.  I used the wonderful sauce that came with bread.  Nice atmosphere and professional staff.  Food came on time and hot.

reviews.name: Priya K.
reviews.review: My company hosted a dinner here. The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is quite roomy and comfortable. The taste could have been more authentic especially the ravioli.

reviews.name: Shauna H.
reviews.review: The food was surprisingly delicious for most of us, considering our usual experience with hotel/resort food.  My sons loved the spaghetti, my daughter's filet was perfectly prepared (and this is coming from someone who is ridiculously picky about her steaks), and I loved the cannelloni.  The only misses were the seafood ravioli (husband said the scallops saved the dish) and the cheese for the antipasti (expected better selection and offerings, though the charcuterie was divine!).  Our server, Sam, was truly a pleasure!  It was a bit pricey, but not unexpected for a resort restaurant - after all, you are paying for the convenience of being able to stumble back up to your room after sharing a bottle of wine.

reviews.name: Katherine T.
reviews.review: We ate here this past weekend and I can't say I was particularly impressed.  The food was alright, but very expensive for what it was and I have to agree with a previous reviewer who said they were trying to upsell.  We didn't have a huge budget, but I thought we'd do okay based on the menu prices.  Well, from the moment we sat down they were trying to up the bill.  First with pricy bottled waters (which my husband went for mostly because he was a bit too dense to realize that they weren't complementary), so $6 there.  The server pushed salads at $9 for essentially what was mixed greens and $11 for the classic tomato and mozzarella combination.  Both were fine, but nothing special.  Entrees were fairly expensive and slightly overdone (for me) or burnt (my husband).  We didn't bother to send them back because by that point it was getting so late our son was starting to get restless and we just wanted to get out.  Even without desert we came away with a $120 bill and a fairly bad taste in our mouth (especially considering the price).  We would have been better off leaving the hotel and going across the street.  Better food and probably 1/3 to 1/2 the cost.

reviews.name: Richard C.
reviews.review: If you like ordinary food at extraordinary prices this is your place. Don't get me wrong the food was ok - but after $140 for two I expect WOW !!  Service was attentive but always on the upsell - don't think we will go back.

reviews.name: David J.
reviews.review: I was pretty shocked.  This is Nashville right?While staying at the hotel I wandered downstairs to look for a good place to eat dinner.  The menu at Ravello looked good, but as a Bostonian I was highly skeptical that I would leave this place impressed.  I couldn't have been more wrong.The Burrata was the best I've ever had.  They don't slice it into smaller cubes like other places - they give you have of the ball and have the freshest tomatoes bathed in balsamic vinegar underneath.Best idea ever: serving bread with the house red sauce in a small bowl so it can be spread.The pistachio encrusted Salmon over cous cous was amazing as well.I'm not one to sit here and ramble on like a stoned Anthony Bourdain so I'll just say this is one of the best italian restaurants I have ever been to (including ones in the U.S. and Italy.)

reviews.name: Kara W.
reviews.review: As others have noted, this restaurant is pricey but the food is outstanding.

reviews.name: megan s.
reviews.review: We used to enjoy eating at this location, the previous restaurant there Volari's was much better, ever since it became Ravello it has become way overpriced with a lousy menu.  We ate there recently and could not believe the prices they were charging, there is nothing upscale about this restaurant or the food.  We got the $26 Ravioli that does not even come with a salad($10 for a basic garden salad) which was bland, overdone, and tasted worse then what you get at Carraba's for $14 that comes with a salad and side.  They did not have any Salmon dishes or a pasta with a creamy sauce, they took off a decent gnocchi I used to get, everything just had a tomato sauce, pork sauce, or meat sauce.  I was definitely not paying $40 for a steak that I heard was not worth it at all from a friend who tried it.  What a disappointment, the place used to be pretty crowded and had a decent menu/prices but the last 2 times we ate there, it was almost empty.  The meal for 3 came to over $100 and we could not believe how overpriced it was for such a bland lousy meal.  If you want to pay $25 or $26 for spaghetti or ravioli that is not even as good as Macaroni Grill then go to Ravello, we won't be eating there again.

reviews.name: Constantine M.
reviews.review: Alot of money for fancy presentation and average food.  Started with a nice glass of wine conveniently priced at $19 for one glass of house wine, followed by a salad that wouldnt be big enough to feed an infant.  Topped it off with a 32 dollar salmon that was quite average and 79 dollars later I had my first and last meal at Ravello

reviews.name: karen n.
reviews.review: Restaurant has a lovely view and very good service but the food is simply NOT good.  I had a scallop dish that literally had an entire stick of melted butter in it.  It was borderline disgusting how much butter was floating in the dish and the scallops since weren't well flavored.  My companion got a veal shank that was massive but simply wasn't flavored well and was floating in grease.  While the descriptions of the food make it sound wonderful, the actual food simply doesn't live up to the descriptions.  And the dessert was like something I would have expected at a Friday's restaurant.  The dessert was so cheap and unimaginative -- I honestly coudn't even believe that they would serve a dessert of such poor quality.  I almost choked when I got the bill for $150 (and that didn't even include the tip!!).  Definitely not worth the price.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: In addition to being a pre-hockey destination, The Platinum Club was also my wedding reception venue (it's pretty much a citizenship requirement that a Canadian get married in a hockey arena when living abroad). The staff is wonderful to work with and made the planning process as stress-free as possible! Whether it's a private event or a game day, the food has always been great! The upstairs bar is classy alternative to concession stand beer before a game if you're feeling a little fancy. For the wedding, they set up a private table for us upstairs and blocked off the stairs to give us somewhere to breathe and get an uninterrupted sip and a bite before being announced. And even though it's in a hockey arena, you'd never know if when the space is set up for an event. They are not lying when they tell you the place is soundproof. A concert ended up being scheduled at Bridgestone Arena during our wedding (was not scheduled when we booked) and we never heard anything; we never would have known there was anyone else in the building if they hadn't told us.I can't say enough great things about the staff, and especially Kelly, my contact person throughout the wedding planning process! If you don't have a wedding or other event to plan, at least go grab a buffet dinner before the next Preds game!

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: I have eaten here many times before hockey games and have never had a bad experience.This is a buffet  on a much better level than your average buffet.  They usually have 3-4 choices of meats including a seafood and fowl choice.  Most nights they offer a carved meat.They usually have 2-3 Salad choices and 3-4 starch choices that sometimes include veg.They often have a cheese table set up.  The choices are not extravagant but often interesting.The dessert table has turned into a "shot" sized sampler table.  They used to have larger servings for desserts but I am sure folks got theirs and then had one or two bites.  This is wasteful so the smart option is to serve bite size servings.  I am a fan as I don't really need to eat a full size serving and this way I can try a couple of different desserts.The staff is wonderful and always attentive without pestering you while you are trying to eat or talk.It is highly recommended to have reservations however on a slow night you might be able to get in.If you have a chance be sure to visit and eat here!

reviews.name: James R.
reviews.review: Who knew such a classy place existed within the same arena mostly known for sporting events?  Yet right in the heart of the Sommet Center in downtown Nashville lies the Suite Level Club, a cultured affair of taste.Are you going to watch your favorite pop artist perform?  Cheer on the Preds?  Catch the latest show?  Well then, make plans to come early and reserve a spot at the glorious buffet that is the Suite Level Club.Granted, it seems almost a bit crass to call this a buffet; in fact, the restaurant itself refers to it as the "chef's table".  Whatever you call it, know that there are tons of hand crafted meal options to be enjoyed until you are content.Open 1-2 hours prior to most events, the Levy Restaurant offers a multitude of hand-carved meats, main dishes, side offerings and unbelievable desserts.  Just make sure to call ahead to place your reservation.The atmosphere is classy-but-casual, where you will find diners dressed from formal even wear down to shorts and sport shirts.  And don't worry - the staff excels at giving you great service as well as getting you to your seat on time.

reviews.name: Monica H.
reviews.review: Our server a Heather was great, she cared what we talked about and made our experience and enjoyable one. We are visitng from Florida and have all the commercials but no Red Robin. The food was delcious, best burgers we've had in a while, and the alcoholic drinks were great too! Definately will be back!

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Clean place.. If you go after lunch hour, better seating, better service, attentive waitstaff.I got the bleu cheese burger with bacon and they charged me (penalized me) for the GF bun.  That's not right.. It's not my fault our food is tainted and allergies happen..  A burger, bacon, french fries, and a beer came to $25.00...  The burger alone, with added charge of bacon and GF bun was over $16.. most expensive burger in town?IPA 16oz beer was $5.49..Most expensive burger in town.Charged extra to change the bun out...Enjoyed it, but doubt I'll go back.

reviews.name: Marie B.
reviews.review: I was disappointed in this Red Robin location. The floors were slippery, bathroom was filthy, and food mediocre to say the least. Apparently since it's a franchise each location is definitely not all the same. I ate at the Red Robin in Mt. Juliet, TN. and it was a five star review. Many of the staff looked miserable and had the look on their faces like- I hate my job & ready to go home. On the other hand our server was nice and friendly but got two of the orders wrong. I don't eat hamburgers often but when I do I have to eat them with onions and fries. I ordered the sweet potato fries since I had them last week and they were perfect, not the case this time they were burnt and had that old grease taste to them. My burger was was hot but a little on the dry side. The two stars= my godchildren got their bellies full and fell asleep on the ride home. As for me this meal was not worth the extra calories!!!!! :-(.

reviews.name: Kristi R.
reviews.review: We stopped in for lunch Saturday 3/7/15.  We like to sit in the bar if possible as we are usually wanting to watch sports.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was a nice gal.  I ordered the simply grilled chicken sandwich and opted for bottomless salad w/ salsa and their rather tasty bbq sauce for my sandwich.  Yum!  The diet pop was flat... :(I like Red Robin and wish there was one closer to where I live b/c there are so many other options when dining in Nashville.  My boyfriend had some sort of deal so that's why we stopped- we probably won't revisit until I get my free bday burger next mth.

reviews.name: John T.
reviews.review: The only two reasons I didn't give this place 5s are one its a chain and two (which is petty) the waitress didn't bring me more campfire sauce with my fry refill. That being said they have good burgers with a good family atmosphere and reasonable prices. You can't beat their steak fries, which is the real reason I come here. They are one of the lower priced gourmet burger joints with loads of toppings to add and they make a good lettuce bun for the lower carb conscious people. I actually have the lettuce wrap because it tends to hold together better than most buns.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: We love burgers, we love meat. We went here out curiosity. How does this place keep people coming back? Burgers were "OK". Please remember we make the best burgers ever, so we are biased. The bottomless fries would be attractive, but for us not needed. We had a coupon come thru the email so we went. Server, can not remember her name was very good. Parking easy. Clean and fun place to visit. The price for other burgers were a bit higher, but I don't know if they were justified. Not sure I will go back to see if the price equals the increase in toppings. Burgers to us mean seasoning the meat, not the toppings. 12 -14 dollars for a burger seems a bit steep in Nashville. the 6.99 special warrants the bland meat burger. Plus the fries and the service and easy parking.

reviews.name: Kim M.
reviews.review: This location is always good, but y'all have your A game on tonight!!! Great food and speedy service like always. So happy when even the right sauces come out without asking a second time.

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: Waited 10 minutes after being seated for a waitress to acknowledge us. Wrote it off to her being overwhelmed with customers.When she finally came around, we ordered immediately, not knowing when or if she'd be back again.Food came 10 minutes later. One order completely wrong. The other order had cold fries.Sent the wrong order back. When she returned with the second attempt, it was also wrong. At this point I no longer trusted he ability to get it right, so I went with it. Not good.Also not good...No check in to refill drinks.No check in to refill fries.I don't expect much from chain restaurants like this. When you're known for burgers and fries though, I do expect you to get those things right. A basic level of competency when serving them is also nice.

reviews.name: Ernesto R.
