reviews.review: Food was mediocre, but bottomless steak fries bumped up the rating to three stars. The veggie patty had no taste, but barbecue sauce on top soon fixed that. The service was excellent. Five stars to Dewann! He was funny and quick, even in an overly crowded area.

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: Great Gourmet Burgers!This is a great restaurant to hang out with friends and enjoy a good burger and drinks.  My friend and I were having a girls day out and decided to stop here for lunch.  There are so many good things on the menu it was hard to decide.  We both change our minds a few times before we ordered.  We started with the fried mushrooms and fried zucchini sticks.  I love fried mushrooms and these were great.  I had a Guinness to go with my lunch.  There is a large selection of specialty beers.  I had trouble deciding between Stella and Guinness but Guinness won that day.I had the Guacamole Bacon Burger with fries for lunch.  It was cooked perfectly and the guacamole was very good.  Our waitress checked on us several times and made sure we had everything we needed.

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: I've visited four different locations of Red Robins in the past couple of years, and I've visited this particular location at least three times according to my yelp check ins - which I may or may not always do.This location is good, but consistently not up to par with Mt Juliet or Murfreesboro, and even Knoxville one time when we were driving through.It never feels really clean when you walk in, and the servers are never great.  Last night with a group of girlfriends were were a 4 top in the bar and our server was Heather.  Heather let drinks run out three times (cocktails, no less, where the tab would've gone up), and was just generally slow.  We ordered desserts that did not look like the photos on the menu (not huge deals, but the chocolate cake was supposed to have strawberry sauce on the bottom, and didn't... and the red velvet cake was supposed to have a drizzle of strawberry sauce on the bottom, and it was COVERED).  Being the one who got the soppy, sweet strawberry red velvet cake I wouldn't like to have discussed it (not good, by the way, ignore the photo yumminess), but by the time she came back it was a mute point.Then I ordered hubby a "to go" burger where after saying "no fries" - she convinced me to order a side salad since I'd be charged for a side anyway.  Imagine my surprise when I got home and there was no salad.  Not a huge deal... but really?I hope the slight decline in this location isn't indicative of Nashville West, because I really like this shopping center and it's so close to my office.  But if you're craving the "yummmmm" - you might consider driving a little further.

reviews.name: Amanda I.
reviews.review: Who doesn't love a good burger. For a chain this place is great. Service is fabulous. I always have a good experience here. We love it

reviews.name: Edward F.
reviews.review: Exceptional service, every time we visit.The food is always just as we order it.Hearty appetites never leave hungry.Playful decor and plenty of seating.Don't forget to get your loyalty card for a free burger after 9.Bottomless fries...

reviews.name: Cody H.
reviews.review: Service was slow and over half of the tables were empty with dirty dishes piled up on them.  The food was good though. I'm a fan of the BBQ chicken wrap and the bottomless fries.

reviews.name: Gail D.
reviews.review: I've just returned home after eating at Red Robin and having my "birthday burger". I wanted to warn folks that they now have a new computer sitting on each table. If you decide to play with said computer while waiting on your food, etc. you will be charged at the end of your meal a $2.19 ENTERTAINMENT FEE. When I asked our waitress what this fee was she said she had no idea and guessed it was for the new computer sitting on the table.  It also can take your order and you can pay your bill through the machine. As I was redeeming my reward you supposedly can do that too on the machine but it wouldn't work for me and the waitress had to do it for me.  The computer did however tell me that my tip was higher than my ENTERTAINMENT FEE. My opinion is that I should have been warned before I touched the computer that I would be charged instead of seeing a fee added onto my bill at the end.  I won't be back.  Happy Birthday.

reviews.name: Lauren L.
reviews.review: Our poor little waitress was running ragged when we were seated in her section. She barely had time between all of her tables to simply grab us water and was in a rush and out of breath the entire time, which wasn't her fault.   The food did little to make up for this, though, as it was okay, but nothing that would make me go, "Oh, I really want to go to Red Robin for lunch/dinner/etc."   This place would've gotten a solid 3 stars, except when my waitress brought me a glass of water, there was a piece of strawberry, likely a remnant of lemonades past, stuck to the inside of the glass. It was swiftly beginning to break apart, little pink tidbits swirling around in the water and making it cloudy. It really grossed me out- so 2 stars.   I might come back here if I'm in the area, as I understand this kind of thing can happen, and the food wasn't all that bad.

reviews.name: Belinda H.
reviews.review: Good food..all the fries you can hold. Nice area too. Comfy atmosphere. Only negative thing was the chips with the guacamole taste bitter? Other than that it's all good.

reviews.name: Nancy P.
reviews.review: I told the waiter before I ordered that I had a coupon for a free burger for my birthday. He said great, we would get the loyalty number from my email on my phone. Going to Red Robin to celebrate anything was a big mistake because I left angry. They did not honor my coupon for my free burger because they said I qualified for 20% off because my check was over $10.00. The server was apologetic and said customers got angry over this but there was nothing he could do.  I can use the free burger coupon the next time I come in. Unless of course Red Robin runs another coupon that negates my free burger. Times are tough for restaurants and misleading customers enrolled in your Loyalty Program is pretty darn stupid. I associate them with indigestion now so not likely to enjoy a meal there in the future.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: Decided to try it while me and my girlfriend were out the other day. From the beginning the waitress was telling us how it's the best burger she's ever eaten and how there's nothing on the menu she didn't like, but she obviously doesn't get out much. It was a pretty good burger but most definitely not the best I've ever had. I decided to try the garlic and cheese seasoned fries to go with my burger. It cost a little extra for them as opposed to their normal fries. The only difference I see in these fries and the normal ones were that they shook some kind of cheesy garlic seasoning on the fries, which doesn't really make them special and doesn't really justify the extra couple dollars, although they did taste okay. I also decided to try one of their special sauces, which cost an extra 75 cents. So they brought me out a little cup of this sauce, kind of like a barbecue bacon ketchup. It was actually pretty good, but they really don't give you enough of it. When I got my burger nothing was wrong so everything came out of the kitchen correct. It was pretty good but definitely not one of the best I have ever had like the waitress was saying. I might go back but it would have to be like a second or third choice kind of thing. Overall I think that the restaurant is a decent place to eat and the never ending fries are kind of a neat thing, but its not my first choice.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: Tony, Noelle and I went to dinner at Red Robin Gourmet Burgers on the West End..never been to this location before and I am glad we did. I enjoyed the restaurant. It is one of the largest locations in Nashville and I love the decorations.Tony had an awesome Mushroom Burger medium rare over flowing with Mushrooms..and some beer of course..I went with a Fiesta Chicken Sandwich with PIco Salsa..it was so good and I had some Iced Tea with lemon and lime. Noelle went with the HOT BURGER with a big grilled Jalapeno on top...she loves this VOLCANO HOT BURGER..she loves it...loves it...The fries are all you can eat and seasoned wonderfully. I love the Burgers at Red Robin and be sure to join the club to earn free food items..I highly recommend this restaurant for all of you to enjoy!!! I know I am going back soon!!

reviews.name: Tian C.
reviews.review: Red Robin has been here for a long time and yesterday was my first time going! The wait wasn't bad for a Saturday afternoon, we were sat immediately. I loved that considering I just lost a ton of calories coming from sky high. Anywho, I'm a burger fanatic and I couldn't wait to finally pick a burger to try. The menu was great and I ended up eating the smoke and pepper burger, $13.49. I know, a bit much for a burger, but It was worth it! The only thing I disliked about my experience was the service once I was seated. I saw my server only twice. It's hard to tip the waiter when other aides are doing the job. Will be back though!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Oh Red Robin, How you empty my wallet and fill my stomach. My most recent visit to Red Robin I found that they now have a REWARDS program "Red Royalty". If you keep coming back, they eventually give you Free Food. This Rewards program unfortunately does not come with a free membership to Weight Watchers as I suspect it should. Honestly the service *I* have had here has always been excellent. The waitress of my most recent visit Shannon seemed to go out of her way to ensure that my table was receiving all the Fries, Drinks and Burgers it possibly could. As with all restaurants I'm sure your mileage may vary but they have certainly never done anything to me to discourage me from returning. Well, except adding to my waistline. The Free Burger on your Birthday program they offer is also excellent and I've never had them give me one bit of trouble over a free 8 dollar burger.

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: Moving from Denver to my wife and I luv this place for a great burger.  The unit in Murfreesboro was so/so, this location had good food and a friendly bartender "Amanda". Just one issue the manager working the door at lunch.  We wanted to sit in the bar to get away from all the ankle bitters and there was an open 4 top in the bar.  The manager said, "NO, we have people waiting for that table.  If you want to eat in the bar you need to sit in the bar...." So we did and had a good experience with Amanda, but that table sat open our entire visit. Really, what was your issue Mr. Manager???

reviews.name: Dae R.
reviews.review: I have gone to this restaurant with several groups of people, on vastly different occasions. The food was good (mostly), however the service was crap! On just about every occasion the wait staff has been rude and uncaring about the service they are providing. For instance, when I went about a year ago with a friend/co-worker, the server was very quick to come and take our drink orders. However she rolled her eyes and huffed when we didn't immediately know what we wanted to eat...we'd only gotten seated 5min prior to her showing up. During this same dining experience, our  table order took 30min to get from the kitchen. Our seats weren't directly facing the kitchen, but I could see well enough inside the area to not the plates/baskets sitting out to be grabbed by the servers. Our order had been sitting out for at least 10-15min., so it was lukewarm by the time it got to us.My second experience occurred 8 months later, and just as bad! I went with a group of family and friends. We did have a large order, so we asked for a little more time, which was granted. 30min no one had come back to ask if we were ready, and our drink order that had been put in before hadn't arrived. After we did get out drinks and put in out food order, it took another 40min to get out order, which came back either wrong, missing parts, or both. When this was pointed out to the server, she went to the kitchen to get our things. Some stuff was brought out, and some wasn't. In fact, some of our food didn't get to us until the end of our meal, and when this fact was brought up to the wait staff, they pretty much shrugged and charged us anyway.I would definitely understand the screw-ups and long wait time during busy hours. However, there's only been at maximum 20 patrons filling the whole place each time I've gone there. To add insult, there were tables that came in after us that received food well before us.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: Before today I believe I was the only person in the universe who had never eaten at Red Robin.  I don't really see what all the fuss is about... I had a burger, which was good, but not spectacular.  The endless fry gimmick sounds neat in theory, but how many fries can the average person eat, anyway? Maybe people with kids and/or competitive-eater spouses appreciate that kind of thing a little more. The service was good - pretty quick for a busy lunch hour. I'm sure I'll be back, but I don't think I'll ever have a "OMG I'm craving Red Robin!!" moment.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Several years ago while traveling with my future wife (wife of the future) we stopped at an exit somewhere in Ohio with a restaurant I used to eat at in New York that she had never heard of.  I was concentrating on locating the restaurant as the road was being worked on, there were strip malls to the left and right, and traffic was Ohio Traffic.Suddenly she screamed, causing me to instantly do the "oh crap where's a place to aim the car for when we get hit" head jerk followed immediately by noticing we were not about to be injured by a rampaging dump truck and ask her what the hell she was screaming about.It was a place called Red Robin.  It's now a staple in our West Nashville diet and we eat there whenever we have a notion to (which is when it's not crowded and we're in the mood to walk out comatose).Their veggie burgers are good, I've never been with someone who said their meal wasn't good, the shakes I love with a passion befitting a slightly larger chub chub than I am, and the fries... well, the fries... some people don't know how to do them right, these are generally the people who think the fries are nothing special.  Get yourself some mayo, ketchup, and whatever pixie dust they give you to sprinkle on the fries - mix it up in a delicious mishmash and you should have the fry-sauce.  You will need this where you're going, which is to Downtown San-Fryliciousness.Beyond that, dunno, the place is pretty nice.  I've never had bad service there, I can't comment on the non-veggie burgers, just can say the veggie ones are done a-ok.  Never have been when it's packed as, well, I avoid popular things at popular times as I find I'm generally annoyed when everyone zerg-rushes a place I like.

reviews.name: Mike W.
reviews.review: Delicious burger and careful attention to my son's tree nut allergy. Clean and nice inside. My family had a good time.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: Good food, nice place, great service, everything you could ask you in a burger chain.:)

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: The food was good but the server was not attentive at all. I give the food 4 stars and the service 1 1/2. Will give this place another chance. Burgers are very good.

reviews.name: Terra H.
reviews.review: It's noisy, so don't try making any phone calls while waiting for your food. But I've been here over a dozen times since they opened this location and I've always left satisfied. The food is always good, and the service is friendly. Love it!

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: Red Robin was a favorite of mine growing up in So Cal, typically where we would go to gather for a Birthday or some sort of get together mainly because they offer so many different burgers! So I was excited when they expanded to Nashville, and at Nashville West to boot since I love this shopping center. I was a long time fan of the chicken burgers, have had almost every one on the menu each one is a hefty serving and delivios now that I am not a meat eater, I opt for the Gardenburger. Red Robin will put pretty much any topping on your burger you have available, so dressing it up is easy. Wait....I am forgetting the bottomless steak fries! Yes, you can have bottomless fries for your entire visit! Although a single basket is typically enough, we have on occasion ordered a basket as an appetizer and you aren't charged extra. They have their own seasoning salt at each table as well that adds a bit of kick to them and is just salty enough too. Recently they changed some items on the menu but the staples are there, and they now have wraps and salads. You can order any burger or sandwich lettuce wrapped, and have melon as a side (cantaloupe is one of my faves!). They also started offering sweet potato fries for an up-charge, I ordered them and my first batch was cold, but the waitress kindly brought me a hot fresh order. They were okay, but nothing I would order again, I will stick with the steak fries next visit. The kids meal menu is one of the best I have experienced while eating out, they actually have options and side items that include healthy salads, oranges, carrots and melon and each are reasonably priced including a drink. Overall if you are looking for a very family and pocket book friendly option for dinner, this is a great place. You not going to experience grass fed local beef, local artisan cheese and buns from the local bakery, this is a chain but its' still good eats.  I have always experienced excellent service at this location as well and will return again and again.

reviews.name: Alishah N.
reviews.review: Three words: Chicken bruschetta sandwich.

reviews.name: Kiran G.
reviews.review: Really good burgers. I like the customer service. Smoothies are great. All drinks are good. I really like sweet potato fries, sweet tea and cajun burger.

reviews.name: Liz D.
reviews.review: I love Red Robin. All Red Robins have this consistency that makes me feel at home whenever I walk into one. I've been to almost every Red Robin in the Seattle area, so when my birthday rolled around, I came to this one in Nashville to feel at home. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Burger, which is always cooked to order. They have a huge variety of burgers, and they'll customize to whatever you want. Substitute away! They also serve a great chicken tortilla soup. I love the bottomless fries and strawberry lemonade. It was my birthday, so my friends arranged for a song, balloons and ice cream sundae from the waiters and waitress there. Always fun!

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: As the birthday looms in the horizon during the month of March the only thing I look forward to is the free burger from Red Robin! As part of their loyalty/rewards program during your birthday month you get a free burger with unlimited fries. The free sundae and embarrassing song birds around your table is optional. Tonight, I redeemed my free burger and I went with the classic Red Robin burger. A straight up patty with all the fixings plus Pepper-Jack cheese. Service was fabulous and I love how generous they are with their food. I never visit an walk out craving more food for a good 5 hours. Tonight as always, our server was attentive and prompt with our order. The burgers range between $8-12 and can be customized however you'd like it. Another perk is they offer for you to take your drinks to go, everything besides alcohol which they do serve! I even saw an ad for Happy Hour specials from 3p.m.-6p.m. and 8 PM to close Monday through Friday! Apparently, happy hour is available in the bar only but specials on drinks run from $2.50+  and apps start at $3.00.

reviews.name: Terra T.
reviews.review: We had a great experience here! Our waiter was so sweet and helpful, the beer was good, it's affordable, and in case I hadn't mentioned.... They serve liquor!!!! I had the Jack Daniel's burger with onion rings and my boyfriend had the bacon cheeseburger. I'm no burger aficionado, but I thought both were delicious! They have a good selection in every area, not just burgers. Next time I'd like to try their desserts!

reviews.name: Kenzi N.
reviews.review: I have eaten at this Red Robin three times now.  The first two times- we had great service (in fact, the second time was the best service we have almost ever had anywhere).  This past weekend, it was awful.  1.  I went to have lunch with my husband because I had received a free birthday burger coupon.  I was kind of excited because the previous time we had went for my husband's birthday and they made a super big deal about it (balloons, singing, dancing- you name it).  My birthday isn't usually the biggest deal, so I was a little excited.  2.  We get there and it is packed- but we still trudge on to eat our delish burgers.  They then cram us into this tiny 2 person booth that is almost inside the kitchen.  It took our waitress almost 20 minutes to come to us, and then another 10 to take our order.  It took about 30 minutes for our food to come out (meanwhile others who ordered after us were getting their food), and while we ate, she maybe came by once to check on us.  3.  The food itself was ehhhh- my fries seemed cold and the burger itself was a little burned.  At the end when we asked for the check, she says "well- you get a free sundae for your birthday- you don't want to have us sing to you, right" and gives me a look- a look that says she will poke my eyes out if I dare ask her to sing to me.  It made me feel awkward and personally I don't think someone should have to ask to be sung to.  Either it happens, or it doesn't.  I guess I was just hoping to have a special experience.  Another 20 minutes later she brings us a sad looking (thankfully free) sundae that is about 1/2 way melted (guess it had been sitting out a while???).Overall, not my favorite experience.  Hopefully this waitress will learn some manners and will learn how to treat customers.

reviews.name: Marie E.
reviews.review: Just left Red Robin. Im on a very strict diet. I had the turkey burger for the first time. I had it bunless with lettuce wrap. It was the bestest. The closest thing to a real burger as one can get. Get it with the steamed broccoli, no mayo sub with spicy mustard for a healthy alternative

reviews.name: Marissa G.
reviews.review: Yum, Yum, Yum!  Very good service, friendly staff and awesome burgers!

reviews.name: Nick N.
reviews.review: Been here several times now and the food has always been very good...service is hit or miss though. Had good service and had not so good service. Won't call any of it bad service but just could have been a lot better. Only other drawback is the price which is steep for burgers thus you figure you are paying for the service in that case and thus only a 3 star rating in my book. Will certainly go back though as it is in a great location and does have some very good food.

reviews.name: Emilia M.
reviews.review: YUM!  It's a chain, but they have very good burgers, a full bar, a varied menu, and fantastic service.  Plus, I'm still craving another strawberry mojito a week later.  Not the very best burger I've ever had but definitely a good choice if you need a bad-for-your-heart, good-for-your-soul place to eat in the area.

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: I may be getting burned out on burgers. A friend from the Y told me about this Red Robin, and I knew they were part of a chain, but decided to give them a try anyway. I don't think The burger I had was worth the over $10 for a combo meal. The service was friendly and quick! The waitress brought out our food but confused herself and took the food back. The fries were good, and they will bring you more, but the burger I had was so-so. I will probaby go back, but this won't become a regular stop for me.

reviews.name: mumin k.
reviews.review: I really like the burger here. the fries are some of the best i ever had. i know that this is a chain but i was pleasantly surprised with the quality of junk food here. I would definitely return here and have their burger again.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: The Burger and Fries were good, the Service was Great !

reviews.name: Kathy B.
reviews.review: Normally I love Red Robin but today must have been an off day for them.  The burger was a bit dry, and the fries were cold like they had been sitting for a bit didn't seem as fresh as usual. The table had NO napkins and I had to ask for them and was only given 3 to take care of my husband, son and myself. Anyone who has eaten at Red Robin knows that napkins are needed in abundance especially with a toddler! They must have the same ration on napkins as McDonald's has on Katsup! I was never offered a drink refill, or additional fries as offered on the menu. Literally was ignored the entire meal and they were not busy! I spoke to the manager and was given a gift card that gave back what we spent on the meal. That is why I gave them 2 stars in this review. Normally I would give them 4 or more. I will update this review if I go back with the gift card and things are improved.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: Let's get this straight the food was delicious! However the lack of teamwork between severs, and poor management was a major turn off....

reviews.name: Dante' T.
reviews.review: Red Robin... Yum!!  I decided to try the Cobb Salad at Red Robin tonight and it was very yummy! I had to ding them 1 star because they did not drain the lettuce well. Bridget was our server and she was amazing! She was attentive but not annoying. I will definitely go there again.

reviews.name: Rahel K.
reviews.review: This may be your best choice of dining while shopping at Nashville West (other than Cosco's cafe, of course!). We sat at the bar and ate our bottomless fries. We giggled at first because we thought they accidental brought us an extra basket and forgot to charge us. No, we are just dorks. I ordered the salmon burger and he ordered the turkey burger. Very good and juicy and different. Don't think just beef when you come here. They have tons of chicken, too. Not a bad for a chain.

reviews.name: Deb V.
reviews.review: This was my favorite burger joint back in Chicago- I was so glad they opened up a RR here finally 2 years ago.  Real good stuff.  I'm a sucker for the teriyaki and pineapple burger.  They have so many variations.  Burgers are mighty JUICY.  Plus, I like that fried egg idea :)  It's cool they have goooood bottomless fries- they have their signature seasoning on the side of the table which I use for everything- it's del-ish.  It's a good atmosphere- every Red Robin has it's own theme.  I always get a shake- the serving is more than I can handle.  The appetizers are priced at the higher end in my opinion.  $10 for an onion ring tower- I don't think so!  It's a tad over priced for a burger and a shake.  It's worth it every once in a while.   I find myself spending about $20 on a shake, side of soup or salad, and a burger, but even more if I had dessert, too.  The service is great.

reviews.name: Andrew G.
reviews.review: Very Average.  Nothing to get excited about.  First and probably last trip here.  I was really expecting something fantastic given all the recent advertising.  I'd prefer logan's which is next door.

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: I love trying new things (chain or not) and I was pleasantly surprised by Red Robin. I had the Gardenburger and it was better than expected. But what really amazed me was the tiny wording at the bottom of the menu stating that "you can customize any burger by choosing a Boca patty". If this tiny wording is true then the vegetarian possibilities are endless. That in itself is very exciting. Oh and if you love garlic get the garlic fries instead of the regular. Yum!

reviews.name: Josh B.
reviews.review: Beer and wine sales tax ripoff:The Red Robin chain has decent, but overpriced, burgers. Their "unlimited" steak fries come-on is a ruse. You get precious few fries with your burger, and when you order more, it takes forever for the next serving of fries to be delivered to your table. So long, in fact, that I found myself having finished my burger, and ready to pay and leave.However, the biggest ripoff of all is the way they charge for and tax their beer and wine. I ordered a 20 oz mug of beer, which my check priced at 5.99. However, there was an additional "SALES TAX" charge for the beer of $1.45, listed separately from the sales tax charge for the food. $1.45 is almost 25% of the $5.99 beer, which means that the beer is almost $7.50.I've never seen separate tax for alcohol at any other pub or restaurant here in Nashville (or anywhere else in the US for that matter). I've asked several bartenders at other places about this way of charging tax for alcohol, and all say they've never heard of it being done that way.The restaurant ought to be upfront about it and mention that the cost of the 20 oz beer is actually $7.49 ($7.50), not $5.99!!!!!!DRINKER BEWARE!!!!

reviews.name: Deb P.
reviews.review: After six days of eating que, I was really missing some vegetables.The food is flavorful and healthy - good spice flavour (berbere ... mmm).  The lentils --- mmmmm ....The injera bread, softer and fluffier than I get at home here in Toronto.  One of the best ever.  This place is truly a hidden gem.  Nice owners.  I would have given them a five if only I had been served on a plate, not on styrofoam with plastic forks ...This is a restaurant I would go back to in a heartbeat.

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: I was downtown for work again. I walked through the arcade and the tempting smells of Ajora Ethiopian came out into the arcade. I went in and ordered. My overall experience was good, but it was not the best Ethiopian. Since its probably the only Ethiopian downtown though, I can't complain too much. The staff was friendly and nice. Food:Miser wot was good. As expected. The Kik was too hot temperature wise. Scalded my tongue. The Injera was not soft, and seemed old. It didn't have the spongy feel to it. The Tikel gomen was good. And the Dinich wot was good.I ate it all with no complaints. Still, Although not the best, I feel good supporting them versus a mega chain

reviews.name: Karri B.
reviews.review: What a treat to have Ethiopian food in the Arcade.  Honestly, I love their breakfast because it's really filling and fresh.  They have a wonderful scrambled egg, tomato, onion, jalapeno and buri buri spice dish that keeps me full all morning.  Of course served with ingera bread.  Check them out for breakfast or lunch if you are in the area.  The people are nice and the seating is convenient.

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: The staff is always friendly and re food is full of flavor. I love eating at the arcade, most of the places in their have good food, but this is one of the most unique lunch options. I recommend it!

reviews.name: Ken A.
reviews.review: Excellent change from the downtown lunch sandwich. Ethiopian cuisine check it out.

reviews.name: Johnny T.
reviews.review: 3.5I used to live in Chicago (8 years). I've eaten in Greektown many many times. I have no idea what a 'Chicago-Style Gyro' is.* So, on one chilly Thursday evening, I found myself speeding up & down Gallatin with burgers on my mind. Traffic frustrated my pole position ways and during my stop, I spied CSG. I'd seen it many times and thought 'tonight is as good as a time to try' than ever so... I stopped in.I walked in and there weren't many people in the dining room. This is good & bad. Good because this (usually) means that the wait time will be minimized. Bad because empty restaurants sometimes come with a reason. I committed to drinking copious amounts with booze with my food (to kill anything that might try and kill me) and kept it moving. I asked the guy behind the counter what made the gyro Chicago-style. He mentioned something about the bread that I didn't quite catch/follow and at the risk of having him explain it again, I just decided to order. I ordered a combo plate. This came with chicken, gyro meat, rice, tabouleh salad, and pita.Everything was solid, if not ground-breaking. The chicken was served with ranch dressing, which made me give a side-eye. For reals? Ranch? I mean, ranch dressing *is* deliciously addicting... but... for reals? Ranch dressing? In an ethnic establishment? The side-eye was warranted. Thankfully, the gyro came with tzatziki. The meat was a bit saltier than my usual taste but when paired with the rice & pita, more than edible. Tabouleh can be an afterthought and this tabouleh was right on par with that trend... but it wasn't bad tasting. By the time I was done eating, I was full, satisfied, not in debt, and no where closer to understanding what a Chicago-style gyro was than when I stopped in. I guess some things are meant to be mysteries.*I still don't.

reviews.name: Luke B.
reviews.review: This place wasn't good. Instead of Tzatziki, they squirt Ranch on everything. The guy had a huge grin on his face as he squirted Ranch all over my side of rice. Also, their posters and decorations haven't been updated since Duran Duran had their first chart topper.

reviews.name: Justin L.
reviews.review: This place is solid. I get the chicken pocket combo every time and I love it. I have deviated and those have also been just as tasty. The fries are so good! The staff is always friendly and they are quick with the food. It's not the prettiest, but  for a quick, cheap, and delicious gyros, you can't beat it.

reviews.name: Latricia D.
reviews.review: I eat here 3-4 times a week.  Their food is very good and healthy.  I have lost 50 pounds eating their salads and spicy chicken!  Everything I've tried is delicious and always fresh.  Taboulli, spicy salad, greek salad, spicy chicken and the cucumber sauce is my favorite!  Always great and always friendly!

reviews.name: Jay G.
reviews.review: This is the best gyro place. They are never stingy with the meat on their sandwiches and they will add American cheese to the sand which, unique addition which I like. And I pretty much rate gyros on the servings size and the taste of the cucumber sauce and thus place is A1. I don't care if they don't taste like Chicargo, New York, or New Amsterdam, the food is solid.

reviews.name: Andrew C.
reviews.review: Awesome beef/lamb gyro combo plates. I get salad instead of rice. Healthy and super tasty.

reviews.name: Anthony C.
reviews.review: Out of the plethora of Greek restaurants that line Gallatin Road, Chicago Style Gyros is the standout winner. First of all, the staff is very friendly and efficient, which is a great start when running through the drive-thru. They have the norm as far as the menu goes: gyros, kebabs, hummus, falafel, stuffed grape leaves, baklava, etc. While their menu looks like the rest of the places you might find on this stretch, the quality, presentation, consistency, and flavor are what make Chicago Style the best. I usually get the combo plate, which is a mix of gyro and chicken, taboulleh salad (they offer a side salad, but the taboulleh is fantastic), toasted pita, and dressing. The flavor and quality of the gyro is the best I've had anywhere in Nashville. They serve large slices, which is better than the dried out chippy pieces you often get at other places. The chicken is always fresh, tender and well seasoned. The only reason I gave them four stars is because of the rice. When everything is so good, the mediocre (at best) rice reminds me of the overcooked chicken flavored rice from the box, and seems like a mismatch for the other fresh, delicious flavors on the plate. Other than that small complaint, I give them five stars on all of the other criteria that you look for in a gyro place.

reviews.name: Leia A.
reviews.review: Delicious food. Good prices. HUGE portions. You really can't go wrong with this place. I got the combo plate and it could have easily fed two people. The cucumber sauce is awesome. The pita bread is nice and soft. My husband got a gyro which was really good-- it was basically like the combo plate except stuffed in the bread & no rice. I really like this place. I'll definitely come back often.

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: These guys are always quick and friendly, and the food is consistently good. I've had the chance to try several of the Greek offerings that scatter Gallatin Pike, and I'd have to say that this is among the best and most consistent. If I swing through here for lunch, I'm usually picking up a gyro combo with fries. Be sure to ask for sauce on the side, otherwise your pita will lose its structural integrity before you have a chance to finish. The gyro meat is always quite tasty and the crinkle cut fries are a good add-on. If we're hitting this place for dinner, we always go with the Greek combo platter, which consists of both gyro meat and chicken (which is always delicious, but can be a little dry at times), rice and choice of a green salad with vinaigrette or the tabbouleh salad (I'd recommend the tabbouleh).On top of the delicious eats, the prices are great and the place (at least from the outside) is always clean. Even when the drive-thru line is long, the wait usually isn't, so you can get in and out and be home with your tasty Greek eats in no time.

reviews.name: Ashley S.
reviews.review: This place is absolutely great. Perfect place to grab a good bite to eat while still budgeting! The gyro is very tender, juicy and flavorful. I'm a big fan of good Greek/Mediterranean foods. The only reason why I'm not giving this 5/5 stars, and just 4/5, is because the service could be a little better. Of course, they're only human and they make mistakes just as we do, but I'd rather not get charged for something on my bill that they didn't give me in the end.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: Best gyro in Nashville hands down. While I admit I was skeptical at first, I took 3 police cruisers there as a sure sign it would be good. Ordered the gyro combo meal and it was fresh, hot and oh so delicious. Its quite filling and is only $7 too! Do it. That "other" gyro place is not worth it. Trust me, as a fat kid I know things.

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: A business associate wanted to meet at Chicago Style for lunch and I'm not that familiar with what's available on the east side, so I was a bit leary when seeing the building. We were actually doing an "informational interview" with a guy who had heard about us from his friend. So, when we met in the parking lot to walk in I was feeling that we definitely weren't going to impress him with our lunch choice.But I was wrong. The food was fresh, hot, and very delicious. I got the chicken plate and ate every bit of it. One of the other guys also joined the "clean plate club". He had a combo plate. They guys are friendly and the price is definitely right. ave been back a 2nd time and got the chicken plate again, which was just as good as the first time. Will be back often.

reviews.name: A P.
reviews.review: The service was phenomenal, the guys were ready to serve and the food was great, best gyro iv had here in Nashville at just over 5 bucks . Can beat it!!!

reviews.name: Rhonda S.
reviews.review: After relocating to Nashville from Chicago, I had to check out "chicago style gyros"  all I can say is NOT.AT.ALL.  I'm not sure where all of these 4/5 stars are coming from, perhaps I had a bad batch, but I am not interested in returning to see if there is any improvement

reviews.name: Renee A.
reviews.review: I love all the guys who man the drive-through window at Chicago Style Gyros.  Friendliest and most efficient staff ever!  Plus the portions are incredibly generous; I always get two hearty meals out of one order.  I always get the gyro plate with tabbouleh, and I've never been disappointed.  The food is consistently tasty and fresh, and the pita bread is always as soft as a pillow.   So good!

reviews.name: Kristen F.
reviews.review: I really like this place! The chicken plate is awesome, but the portion is huge (not that that is a negative)I love that I can get drive-thru greek food, what's better than that?

reviews.name: Chris E.
reviews.review: Good gyro plates, great tabouli. I like the stuffed grape leaves as well. I've never really experienced the friendliness that some other reviewers have commented on and in fact I would say they are not friendly. I'm not very concerned with this because I'm not trying to be friends with them anyway and I always get my food to go. The inside is kind of old and I think it used to be a Long John Silver's, but in spite of needing a facelift it seems clean. I'd say 3.5 If I was allowed because the lack of ambience and the lack of good attitude puts a lot of weight on the food.

reviews.name: Damon D.
reviews.review: Gyro Sandwich, Fries, and Beverage...?  Very good!

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: I cannot believe I havent reviewed this place sooner! I am always here, its kind of sad how often I eat here because it speaks to how little time I have to cook at home.....but moving on. My love affair with Chicago Style started at the location on Harding near my work, but since moving to East Nashville, this one is my fave. We eat here quite often as noted above, and I havent had a complaint yet, out of any family member. My Daugther who is 7 often has the gyro, or the kids plate with chicken and rice and I order extra pita bread for her, which they never charge me for. The guys know us....but even before we were driving thru the drive thru or coming in for a bite 2-3 times a month, they were always friendly. I love Greek food, and this is Greek fast food at its best. I often wait a few minutes more and they bring out fresh chicken. The salad is always fresh and they are not skimpy on sauces, cheeses or the portions overall. As other Yelpers have said, this is truly two meals in one. I can never finish it. Ask for your sauce on the side, so you can heat it up later. I always order the chicken plate, but my other half has the combo plate and loves it every time. I will continue to come here way too often, although I may have to begin driving another car and wearing scarves and sunglasses.....

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: I am a Greek food junkie, and this little place is pretty satisfactory as far as a good local place to get hummus and falafel goes.  I'm relatively certain Chicago Style used to be a Captain D's or a Long John Silver's (hence the pirate-style sabers on the doors), but the authenticity remains.Chicago Style Gyros certainly isn't the classiest of joints, but the dining area is comfy and the staff is friendly and hilarious.  It's cheap, and the combos are delicious.  Frequent customers seem to get preferential treatment, so if you go enough you're likely to get exceptionally hearty portions and other freebies.  The carryout containers seem to hold larger portions, and you're certainly not missing any ambiance by hitting the drive through, so I recommend doing so.Somewhat ironically, the gyros are actually one of their poorest items.  I don't typically mind them messy, but they tend to be pretty weakly constructed.  The boys don't skimp on the sauce, however, and the falafel and combo plate are up to par.  They're open relatively late (10:00 PM I believe, but I'll check on that), so I'd recommend Chicago Style Gyros as a good joint to swing by and pick up a late dinner.  And be on the lookout for the Red Greek--that guy is awesome.

reviews.name: Laurie S.
reviews.review: I LOVE Greek food (almost as much as I love Indian food) and Chicago Style makes me love it even more!  We have never eaten inside, I usually just grab food through the drive-thru and they have never failed to serve me some amazing gyros!  At first I would get the gyro combo but now I mainly go for the plate because I get rice and a small salad and it's 2 meals worth in one box.  The guys that work there are so nice and even my 3 year old asks for the chicken rice and pitas.  Now, if only I could remember how to pronounce 'gyro'.

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: Things I like about this place:  Drive thru Greek food-how can you complain about that?  Convenient location.  Good variety, prices, and portions.  I seriously ate the rice from my last combo here for three days, there was so much of it.  Their gyros are good and filling.  Other stuff I've had here hits the spot but tastes just average in my opinion.  I LOVE hummus and theirs just doesn't do it for me and their tahini sauce has an odd almost mayo-ish flavor.  I think I need to try more of their menu based on the many great reviews this place has had.

reviews.name: Brant C.
reviews.review: Oh hello there, Nashville. You are my new friend and my new home. We must get to know one another better. On my first evening in Music City, my new roommates suggested we hit up their favorite greek joint, a tradition of sorts whenever they have Nashville newbies in town. I've enjoyed the food of the Greeks in many cities across this great country. I've got Mediterranean fare in my blood. Suffice to say, I was intrigued. I'm happy to say, I was not disappointed.This isn't a place you're going to 'wow' a first date (so, don't), but it could become a favorite place to grab a bite or carry out after the tenth. Honestly, if she still likes you by then, you're probably past the point where choosing a bad restaurant could cause catastrophic failure anyways. It does indeed look like it used to be a fast food joint, both inside and out. That's ok, most of my favorite restaurants rely on their food, not the glitz and glamour of the building. (After all, it's what's on the inside that counts, right?)I opted for the Gyro Salad. Im not a "salad guy" per se, however I had just been on the road for the past couple weeks stuffing my gut with every processed meat, cheese, and saturated fat various southeastern drive-through towns could offer up, so I wanted something a little lighter. The servings were substantial with several strips of seasoned lamb laid out across a leafy salad bed alongside their significant other, the requiste gyro flat bread. Tzatziki sauce worked its way into every bite, tying together the tasty, inexpensive experience. Good food and new friends in a new place always make for a memorable occasion. The people working the joint recognized my roommate, even making an effort to say hello and goodbye. Familiar faces get familiar smiles and that's a bonus worthy of my fourth star. I'll be back to give the falafel a go. It's close proximity to my 'hood all but ensures I'll add my face to the list of familiar regulars.

reviews.name: Dana F.
reviews.review: Easily the best chicken plate I've ever had at a gyro place, and believe me I've done my research. Fresh, flavorful and every part of the dish was great, not just the chicken. Even the salad was tasty. Definitely a place to seek out amongst all the myriad of choices on Gallatin Road.

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: I love this place.  There are 4 locations that I know of.  But this one is the best out of the 3 I've eaten at.  I love it because they load the pocket up!!!  instead of a taco style.  Its a giant pocket gyro!!  Excellent staff at this spot.  Gyros are great, falafel is excellent!!  love everything ive ever eaten here!! I will be back for more!!  Plus if your on the go.  They do have a drive thru! Prices are great!

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: This is my go to place for Greek. I can't say that it is the best I have had but for convenience and consistency, it rocks my world basically. For one thing, they have a drive through (must be an hold over from Long john silvers) which makes my lazy ass happy. In addition, the portions are plentiful, the prices great and it the food actually taste pretty darn good. I always mean to get a gyro but I end up with one of the combo plates. They like the one with the gyro meat which comes with a salad, yellow rice, and fresh pita.

reviews.name: Josh F.
reviews.review: Always consistently good food, sometimes too much food :) out of the three I've been to, this one is by far the best. There is another on Dickerson rd, , and I will not go back to that one.

reviews.name: Dante' T.
reviews.review: I LOVE this place! This is my go-to whenever I am in a hurry and do not have time to cook. I pull up to the drive-thru window and they confirm my usual order (2 Gyros plates with sauce on the side) without my prompt. I guess that I am busy and in a hurry more often than I realized... :-) If you are in a mood for inexpensive, yummy Greek food, you should give them a try.

reviews.name: Nash B.
reviews.review: one of the main dudes who works at this particular location is just not nice.  the food is fine.  but he needs to improve his attitude.  (kurdish & not nice...usually that doesn't go together.  kurds are unusually friendly)

reviews.name: B C.
reviews.review: This place was...decent!  Good!  We were pleasantly surprised when our friends turned us onto this place as it looks kind of divey from the outside but the food inside was really good!  Everything we ordered - lamb gyro plate, tabbouleh, falafel sandwich and gyro sandwich - was good.  We would definitely go back again, which is not to be said of most of the restaurants in Nashville.  Sorrrrry!

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: You probably won't confuse this place with an actual Chicago gyro place, but it is still pretty tastey.  Gyro plates are a good deal and come with salad; generous, flavorful strips of lamb; bread; and yellow rice.  You can ask for extra cucumber sauce and they will not charge you or call you a fatty.  Also good are their stuffed grape leaves and hummus.  Don't be afraid of the Gallatin location; its a favorite dining spot for cops, so no one will mess with you here.  Staff are friendly and actually Greek (I think).

reviews.name: Lex M.
reviews.review: Seriously amazing brisket! The line was extremely slow moving which was annoying but once you get to the counter, good smells delight!I got the brisket plate with Mac, buffalo grits and a corn muffin. I have an amazing southern granny who can kill corn muffins. This might give her a run for her money! Tender meat and 7 sauces to choose from. Not too bad at all for $11 with drink.

reviews.name: Jacob C.
reviews.review: Price was a little steep but portions were fair.Beef was really tender.   Baked beans were overly sugary and saucy.Corn bread was too sweet but in a way that's hard to complain about.I suggest you get there before noon, not after.  Crowd rises dramatically around noon.All in all, satisfied.   Just not sure about nearly 5 stars, so I'm throwing my review on here to lower the average a little bit. ;-)If you're going to go to the farmer's market, for the love of God, buy actual produce from the actual farmers instead of patronizing this mini-food-mall inside.

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: We stopped by on a Saturday to purchase some plants. It's been a while since I've been in the food court area. So many options now! It's great. We stopped in & looked at this place & decided on trying the BBQ. The menu is pretty straightforward. You can order a plate which includes a meat, two sides & a corn muffin. You can also just do a sandwich. Or a combo that is a sandwich, side & drink. I decided on the brisket combo with Mac & cheese & a drink. The staff were very friendly & the line didn't take long to go through. For the brisket combo it was $7.50. Not bad. They've got a station with different sauces. You're able to squirt it on there or use the little to go containers. I tried the sweet & hot, mustard based & the Louisiana. They've got a little sign that shows you the scale of heat for each of the sauces. My favorite was the Louisiana, nice and hot but not overpowering. From the looks of it, they measure out the pork on a food scale. They however pick out the brisket for the sandwiches. My brisket was a nice portion, however one piece was about 35% fat and it was the chewy fat. I removed it and was much better. I kept a little fat from the other pieces and it was good. The mac and cheese is VERY cheesy. I really enjoyed it. It tastes like it has a couple different cheeses in it. I was also able to try the corn pudding and it was good, maybe a little more sweet needed in it but I liked it.

reviews.name: Bethany S.
reviews.review: I felt compelled to try some authentic southern food while in Nashville, since this was my first real trip to the South - so when I saw an option for a "veggie plate" here, I jumped in line. The "veggie" part of the veggie plate is a bit misleading, because it's really just three of their sides. I chose the cheesy garlic grits, potato salad, and mac n cheese. They were all decent, but nothing mind blowing - my favorite was probably the mayo-heavy potato salad. The cheese grits are apparently the "best in Nashville", but I don't understand why - maybe most grits have almost no flavor, but I've had some pretty delicious cheesy grits in Louisville with much more flavor and mouth-watering creamy texture. The mac n cheese was pretty average (but I adore mac n cheese in general so I still liked it). I topped it off with some sweet tea, and discovered it's true what I've heard about how excessively sweet it is in the South! Overall, the food really wasn't bad, but I just didn't love it.

reviews.name: Joseph M.
reviews.review: I would give a lower marking if possible. The BBQ Chicken that tasted like it was doused in pepper and smoke. I cannot say it has flavor because the pepper and smoke taste overflavored everything. The Mac and cheese tasted like it was made from a box. On the plus side. The muffin was actually good. They were fast.But I don't think it was $10.00+ good. I have read the other reviews and wonder if they changed ownership or if I was being punked.

reviews.name: Debbie W.
reviews.review: B&C is a great place to eat. Their Barbeque is very moist and yummy and all their sides are homemade rather than canned or frozen.  I just watched an employee cut up a lot of Barbeque and put it in the baked beans.  Not many places would go through that expense. The employees are friendly too. There is usually a line at lunch time so it is best to go early or late.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: The BEST grits in the world, hands down. BBQ is almost always good, but this place makes different grits for every day of the week and they are all amazing.  I visited Nashville for a week and ate here THREE times after visiting on a local food tour. Some of their amazing grits include jalapeno, garlic and cheese, and bacon cheeseburger to name a few. Besides their grits their BBQ brisket and pulled pork were delicious.

reviews.name: FreewheelingFoodographer F.
reviews.review: I just moved to Nashville, after living in Wisconsin for pretty much my whole life. I've been to 45 of the 50 states. I've eaten a lot of really good food. I've also eaten a lot of mediocre food. As a food-lover and food blogger (lesleighmemmel.wordpress…), when we moved to Nashville, my husband and I set out to find "Nashville's Best BBQ."We found it.Drop what you're doing and get over to the Nashville Farmers Market. Well, first... finish reading my awesome review and then go check out my blog. ;)B & C Market BBQ, or "Bacon & Caviar," is located in the "food court" of the Nashville Farmers Market. The menu is nothing more than handwritten chalk on a blackboard. You have choices of pulled pork, brisket, and chicken in form of "plate" or "combo." They also have smoked salmon a few days of the week, as well as a few other specialty items. Standard southern side items. Fountain drinks and an array of different sauces.The pulled pork is incredible. Perfectly seasoned. Melts in your mouth. The chicken is awesome. A little spicy (which I love), and really tender. The brisket was a little fatty, but it's brisket. And it's awesome. Sides... I haven't tried them all, but everything's been really good. My favorite is the Creole slaw, which is basically just a mildly spicy cole slaw. The Mac 'n Cheese is great, but I love pretty much and kind of mac 'n cheese. Actually, I love cheese, in general. But I'm from Wisconsin, where cheese is its own food group...Go here. You will love it.Cheers!The Freewheeling Foodographerlesleighmemmel.wordpress…

reviews.name: Melanie C.
reviews.review: Pulled chicken, briskets, pulled pork - sandwich or plate - this menu is delicious! The sides are also pretty much all great. I especially love that squash casserole. yum!Only issue lately is that there is a relatively new person behind the counter, and he doesn't seem to care much. Serves much smaller portions, never smiles, barely listens to you. Nevertheless, that shouldn't take away from the food here. Great BBQ!

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: I brought home some BBQ for lunch today after a quick trip to the Farmer's Market.  I'd sampled some of the food from the Melrose location, though it was through B&C's catering business (which is also very, very good)--this was my first time eating the actual B&C BBQ.  I was very happy with my meal.  I ordered the beef brisket meal, with sides of green beans and white beans, along with a small cornbread muffin.  Everything I ate was quite good.  The meat was seasoned well, on the verge of slightly too salty, and very tender.  The sides blew me away--both the green and white beans were cooked perfectly, not greasy, and flavored perfectly.  I particularly loved the big chunks of onion and celery in the white beans.  I also tried 3 of the sauces with my meal: the Hot, the Sweet and Hot, and the Mild.  All of them were good and noticeably homemade, though the Sweet and Hot was my particular favorite.  I brought some mac and cheese home for my fiancee and, upon stealing a bite, had a little bit of food envy.  Seriously, some of the best mac and cheese I've had anywhere, especially in Nashville.  YUM.  Next time we come, I'd like to try the grits--everyone raves about them, so they'll definitely be a part of any future visits!Price-wise, I was happy with the portion and the quality of our meal.  I'd certainly return to either location of B&C for some good, affordable BBQ.

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: My favorite bbq that I have had so far in Nashville. I love their chicken plate especially with the white sauce. So delicious. Its not on the menu so you have to know to ask for it. I haven't tried their grits yet even though everyone talks about how great they are. I love their mac and cheese and green beans.  Their cornbread is also delicious. The prices are reasonable and the staff is very helpful.

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: Yummie..bbq pulled pork and zydeco sauce!  must try. Love this place and the Frankln Pike establishment. Not fancy...just good comfort food.

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: I thought bbq at the Farmers' Market was kind of a gimmick. I mean, why wouldn't it be? Tourist trap with the region's staple cuisine, yeah I think I'm going to stay away, thanks. What stopped me though was that their sign had bacon/cheddar grits Monday and garlic cheese grits everyday. I love grits and my gf loves cheese AND grits. So, that decided the lunch place for the day. I went with the pulled chicken plate and got the bacon/cheddar grits and mac and cheese while the gf got the garlic cheese grits and a corn muffin. I liked the plate and the bacon/cheddar was pretty good. I could have used a little more bacon flavor but the mac and cheese was still a treat. My gf fortunately, liked her garlic cheese grits better than mine and liked her corn muffin. A touch of sweetness and a great texture so much so that I ate the last of my girl's corn muffin to her shock and disappointment-she was saving the last bit to savor and I swooped in and ate. Their sauces are pretty amazing, a good variety of sauces and all different, vinegar, mustard, and hot were all discernible from one another and not just cookie cutter sauces with just a little bit of difference.Fortunately/unfortunately, there wasn't a lot of chicken on my plate so I went back and got more food from there. I could use some more food for my money but the food itself is quality.

reviews.name: Karen T.
reviews.review: The service was friendly and quick, but my BBQ was just OK. The prices were also reasonable, but I preferred the pizza (Bella Nashville) in the market much more. If I wanted to try local BBQ, I would probably try another place, or try here again but get something besides the pulled BBQ chicken.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: Extremely good cheap eat at the market! When I went there wasn't any extra sauce to be added as sides so it was kind of a turn off. But the sandwich was amazing.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: What can I say, I love this place.  I typically go to the Farmers Market once or twice a week for lunch and more often than not, I end up waiting in line for my BBQ at B & C.  The BBQ is moist enough that you can eat it without the sauces they carry and still enjoy your meal, and if you are lucky enough to be in line on days they carry brisket, you'll be truly happy you chose B & C.  Fill up the sample cups the first time you go to figure out which sauce you like best, and I gaurentee you'll be in "hog heaven" (pun intended).  If you're the kind of person who loves to know about secret "off the menu" items, ask for the white sauce.  I believe it has a horseradish base, but it goes great on any of the sandwhiches. Fellow yelpers have mentioned the grits, and I agree...order them if you want to try something truly special.  My personal favorites are the buffalo chicken and the taco grits.  If I order a plate instead of a sandwich (plates get two sides), I usually also order the cornbread pudding and put a bit of their spicy BBQ sauce on top to finish off my meal.One last tip if you chose to swing by, ask for pickles.  A BBQ plate just isn't complete without pickles, and for some reason, you have to ask for them to get them at B & C.

reviews.name: LM P.
reviews.review: B & C Market BBQ is one of my new favorite barbeque joints.  My husband loves this place and brought me here for lunch at the Farmer's Market.  I was a little reserved at first site considering it's ran like a cafeteria line.  I was thinking, "How good could it possibly be?"  I ordered the pulled pork plate with the Mexican grits and macaroni and cheese.  I cleaned my plate.  That is very rare, especially when it comes to eating barbeque - something I rarely eat.  I couldn't believe how good it was.  The pork was so tender, I could easily pull it apart with my plastic fork.  The Mexican grits had a nice kick to them and the mac and cheese was baked like Grandma used to make.  Very good. I will be a returning customer to B & C. Tip:  B & C BBQ is one of the only eateries in the Farmer's Market that offer free refills on beverages.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: You gotta love a place that stakes it's reputation on Grits.  The rotating selection of grits and side dishes is what really sets B&C apart from other barbecue joints in town.  Taco grits, buffalo grits, cheddar garlic grits and even chocolate grits.  They are takin the grits uptown in the downtown farmer's market.The barbecue is good, but good barbecue is not to hard to come by in this town if you know where to look.  The reason to make a trip to the farmers market is for the specialty grits, corn salad, smoked hamburgers, smoked salmon and all the other creative things that B&C does.

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: So my favorite thing here are the 'crack' grits as I call them.  They are that addictive.  They have a garlic cheese every day and then a second flavor that rotates - flavors like pizza or buffalo chicken.  I am not sure what they do but these grits are incredible and even folks that don't think they like grits like them.I always get the pulled pork and play with all their sauces which are all great.  A friend told me they tried the brisket the other day and it was about the best brisket he had ever had.  It's all good.  The sides are so good that it's hard not to just get a plate of sides - from the macaroni and cheese to the baked beans and the baked potato salad.They also do catering and not just bbq catering, and I have had that and been very impressed, especially with the bite sized desserts.

reviews.name: Joshua S.
reviews.review: One of the better BBQ options in Nashville, their pork has an awesome taste and texture. Plenty of residual collagen, so not too dry, but with an awesome bacon-smoke flavor. One of the few BBQ joints in Nashville that can stand without sauce, and indeed, I recommend going without it at least the first time. Love those corn muffins, too!I also commend them on adding a fryer after the flood renovations. I resent BBQ joints that try to avoid selling fries, because it generally suggests they are being too cheap to operate a fryer. The fries aren't a high point (really need to be thicker) but at placated my value sense. they really could stand to ditch the meat and three sides and go for something a bit more modern. Everybody does those same sides in Nashville, so it is hard to stand out, although they do experiment with the grits and egg rolls.They do tend to get a bit sluggish at lunchtime, due to popularity, and they could stand to have a bit more space or a more efficient layout. One person ordering something fried means an awkward standing customer in the narrow service area, for example. They also only have certain things on certain days, like brisket, that really confuse new customers. Service is otherwise excellent, but overall score reduced to 4/5 for efficiency and side issues. They have a customer loyalty program, which is to be commended.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: I went with the pork plate with baked potato salad and creole slaw as the sides. The pork was really good. To be honest, I've never had bad barbeque pork, so it was on par with most others.The potato salad was OK. It could have used a little more flavor.I really like the creole slaw. Sweet tea was a plus as well.

reviews.name: moore t.
reviews.review: pork egg roles were rich and different for a bbq menu.  Tasty.Mac and cheese wasn't anything special. but the cheese and garlic grits were fabulous!Customer service lacking, but overall okay.

reviews.name: Paul H.
reviews.review: B & C (or Bacon & Caviar, if you please) is a recent addition to the Farmer's Market food court.  First, I should say that I'm glad this place is finally done with the renovations.  Second, I should say that I really enjoy having B & C on the short-list for lunch options.It's fast, it's good, it's well-priced with good portions, and the staff is friendly.  What more could you ask for?I had the daily Wednesday special, which was smoked salmon with  sides of baked beans and garlic cheese grits ($7.95) and a coke ($1.25).  The fish was outstanding, it had a slight cajun rub and was perfectly smoked and steamed inside it's foil wrap.  The sides were good, perhaps lacking a little salt, but otherwise really good.  I really appreciate the three styles of sauce they had - mild/vinegar, med, and hot.  Along witht he other great options at the Farmer's market, B & C is now on my short list for lunch

reviews.name: Kevin S.
reviews.review: Food and service used to be top notch. Went there on 5/18 and the grits were stone cold and the service sub-par. Time to move on to another eatery.

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: I went to farmers market to try the indian food at swagruha. I was so dissapointed and had to eat some ribs :-).  So I went to b&C and ordered some ribs. I was surprised, it was  pretty good. I may not go to farmers market and eat here in my next visit,(tatz coz i have to try the jamaican restaurant there next) but I liked the ribs here.

reviews.name: Kenny H.
reviews.review: I have been here a few times and got close to the same thing every time. I get the pork and grits plate with mac and cheese and fried okra. The real key to the meal, as many people have noted, is the grits. I do not like grits generally, but I could eat a tub of this stuff. Barbecue has been a little dry at times, but is generally good. Especially when you add one of the sauces to it. Fried okra is done just right, crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. The mac and cheese varies quite a bit. I have had it be amazing, some of the best I have had on some visits, and rather ordinary on others. Still my favorite lunch at the Farmers' Market.

reviews.name: Laura P.
reviews.review: My coworkers and I took the free Music City Circuit from our office downtown to the Farmer's Market for lunch. The Farmer's Market is great since everyone can choose what they want. I went with B&C since last time I was there I went with Indian food while my mom got the BBQ, and I was jealous the whole time. I got the brisket with macaroni and cheese and green beans. The brisket was very moist and flavorful. I loved the hot sauce on top. The macaroni and cheese was so good! I would go back and just order mac and cheese! I did not try the grits, as I've never enjoyed grits, but reading the other reviews has convinced me I must go back and try them. The service was also excellent. I didn't know what I wanted and rather than being impatient with me, they talked me through their options and provided recommendations. When I asked for a burnt part of the mac and cheese, they gladly obliged. I will definitely be back! The only downfall was the price. I spent $11 (since I left a small tip in their cup) and normally I like to stay closer to $8 and under for lunch, but the plate fed me for lunch for two days, so I guess it paid off in the end. YUM! I wish I had some of the mac and cheese right now. :)

reviews.name: Douglas B.
reviews.review: I just tried the new B&C next to the Melrose Kroger.  Dinner was a disappointment.  The pulled chicken was dry and overseasoned (too much black pepper).  The baked beans were delicious, but the corn pudding was disgusting: gummy and cheesy.  The cornbread was sweet but acceptable.  In short, there won't be a return visit.

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: Scratch biscuits and polish sausage- oh heck yes! Went back for sausage, egg and cheese biscuit and it was awesome. Fresh cooked eggs make a huge difference too! Thank you!

reviews.name: Timothy M.
reviews.review: Tried to go get breakfast this morning. This place is closed, permanently. The kitchen is up for lease

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: Greasy comfort food slides down easy at aptly named Blue Collar Grill inside the shell station. Their eggs are hot and runny & their toast is crisp, just the way the blue collar bubbas that work in the area like it. Basic greasy spoon breakfast fare is cheap and the cheesesteaks are too. Sandwiches are the main lunch stuff with a earthy mouth watering MEatball Sandwich that is my personal fave. Its cheap and its not too bad! Pink collar meets blue collar yummo. Now it is mainly takeout or seating at the subway tables, but a Blue Collar Grill food truck may be rollin by next year.

reviews.name: Scott C.
reviews.review: I've had a great experience with the Blue Collar Grill up to today 3/21/14. I have ordered from them the last two months, I live 2 miles from them. Over an hour passes and I get a call that they can't find me, I give the person the directions again and was asked to hold, I held for 10 minutes when I was hung up on, I called back no answer. Thinking my order was finally on the way again another hour pass, I call and was told I'm sorry I got busy and couldn't call you back, also the boss says we can't deliver to your location. I ask since when? The person states new management has taken over and we don't deliver in your area now. To which I ask when was it taken over, they reply beginning of last week, I replied I placed an order last Friday and you delivered then, the person states I'm just the middle man then told me to call my credit card company to cancel the charge. Because it's a free delivery I always tip very generously because we all have bills to pay and tips are what most people live of off. I'm sorry to be losing the Blue Collar Grill.

reviews.name: Judy S.
reviews.review: Stopped here for  dinner. My husband had the chicken fried steak. I had a 6 ounce sirloin with shrimp. Our service was excellent. Our server Tracey was very considerate and thoughtful. Very attentive to our needs. you get a lot of food for the price. If we're back in Tennessee well stop here again.

reviews.name: Jan F.
reviews.review: Sat at the bar hoping to get quicker service. Ha haThe place was pretty empty. Ordered steak salad and husband ordered chicken sandwich. As we were the only people at the bar after 1/2 hr of waiting for our lunch. I asked 2 times if our lunch would be out soon. Didn't hear me. I finally said excuse me 2 x and he finally looked at us. I said is our lunch about ready it's been awhile. He well I will have go back to find out. I said sorry. His head was down and he shakes his head. Like I was bothering him. Why did I have to say sorry. About 5 min later he brought lunch. Looked good but my steak was pretty tough. Hubby sandwich was just okay. Haven't been here before but I think I'll pass Logans next time.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Went during a lunch to get out of the office. Really had wanted the steak but was going back to work. Had the salad. Sat at the bar, quick service, co worker also had a salad and the strawberry lemonade which looked amazing!!!! The bar person was amazing, the hostess was nice, the parking was easy. Cleanliness was good. Next time I go, I will update. Another chain consistent and good. No manager checked in this time, but really do you need a manager unless you are unhappy. We liked our service and food so all good!

reviews.name: Jeff K.
reviews.review: Traveling on business and went here for lunch...The PROS-seated quickly-rolls served before meal-service was friendly-plenty of parkingThe CONS-food was ehhh  -had unsweetened iced tea and refilled was sweet tea-peanuts tasted too saltyNot good, but not terrible...prob wouldn't return

reviews.name: Sabrina B.
reviews.review: We have been to many Logans in several states. It is a chain with average service and steaks. Tthe food here was actually better than many locationns. The service was actually worse than many of their locations.We were here with friends on the Saturday after Thanksgiving. It was very busy but we were seated very quickly. Then the waitress did not approach the table for almost 20 minuites. We did not get peanuts until we asked for them, they arrived about 2 min before entrees. One salaid arrived fairly soon after the order. Then the next salId about 5 min later, but with the wrong dressing. The third salad came once we finally stopped the waitress and asked for it. So, it arrived w the entrees. No drink refills or additional bar drinks were ever offered. The 3 steaks were cooked well, as was the chicken entree. The sides were acceptable, but not anything special. The waitress never checked with us after we got our food. We finally flagged her down and asked for our check. Perhaps they were overwhelmed by a busy night, but we felt very ignored...

reviews.name: Carol P.
reviews.review: Excellent steaks cooked to perfection. Had their combination appetizer with fried pickles, absolutely wonderful with crispy outsides and soft insides; chicken wings that were very crispy and tasty and were mildly  hot. The potato skins did not deliver. They were a bit over cooked. The sautéed mushrooms were perfectly seasoned. Though they are primarily a steak house, they also had a variety of other entrees. You're bound to find something to satisfy your dinner craving.

reviews.name: Cliff J.
reviews.review: Ridiculously slow service on a Sunday evening when they were not even busy yet. I feel sorry for those that dined later in the evening.

reviews.name: Djl D.
reviews.review: The service was slow.  The shrimp was burnt but the restaurant was willing to replace the shrimp. The rest of the food was too salty.

reviews.name: Eatalot F.
reviews.review: Don't go next door to Santa fe castle company and go here. Like most I've been to a million steak places and some of the high end. The ribeye was actually one of the better ones my girlfriend and I've had. No grisle , perfect amount of fat, medium rare done perfect and the bites melted in my mouth. Maybe I got lucky because I didn't expect that from here!So unlike the service next door the service was great here. Caesar and house salad were good and baked potatoe and rolls were what you would expect. Lastly I had an ice tea instead of a beer and it actually was a strong brew and not water tea.

reviews.name: Jenny G.
reviews.review: Great food even better service. Will return when I can   The manager not only checked on how everything was but took a minute to chat.

reviews.name: Danii M.
reviews.review: This place is the worst steakhouse I have ever been to. If you could give them 0 stars, I would. First, we walk in there, and the drink I wanted, a strawberry tea, was not part of refills, and it was $3.99 for a small glass. After that, we go to order prime rib, and they are out of it. So, in a snotty tone, The waitress tells me the ribeye is the same and that I should have come earlier if I wanted the prime rib. What kind of steakhouse RUNS OUT OF STEAK??!!! So, I had to settle for the ribeye. The menu says the ribeye is "extremely juicy", well... I ordered mine as medium well. It comes out very well done, and at this point, I'm already highly irritated, to the frustration point of wanting to cuss someone out, so i tried to eat it. The mozzarella sticks were over seasoned, and as they bring my sister her plate, the waitress tells my dad that they are out of his Mashed Potatoes. It didnt stop there. I went to order a watermelon martini, and they are out of watermelon. At this point, I tell the waitress to just give me the check. For three people, the check was $67.92. To make everything worse, My dad and sister took me there because it was my birthday, and we were visiting Nashville. Thanks Logan for the WORST birthday dinner ever.

reviews.name: Doug D.
reviews.review: Loud, obnoxious clientele with bartender to match.  A good GM would ask people yelling f-bombs at the top of their lungs to either shut up or leave.  Disgusting.

reviews.name: Hank D.
reviews.review: Simple and a good value the service Prompt as well as friendly. The location is new and very close to where I work. The only thing I am missing is my family! Go and enjoy with yours as you won't be disappointed by the welcoming staff...

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Four Stars for Logans? Yes. I wish there was a way to choose 4.5 stars.1) This place is clean which is really cool2) The place is small with lots of servers running around and great service3) I was on a tiny budget was able to pull off a mealI can't help but brag on the place for being clean, having great service, and having an affordable way to grab a lil' bite.
