I ordered the wings (mild and cajun) and they had great flavor but were on the small side. No worries, I was on a small budget. Next time I go, I will order some real food and update the review. But, heck, with cleanliness and good service...this place is step ahead.

reviews.name: Omar S.
reviews.review: In town for the NIRSA convention, heard ok things about the place. Atmosphere is nice (very southern) and the server was funny and quick. Was lookin for some of the famous Nashville BBQ and it was...ok..Had ribs (not bad, w/ ok BBQ sauce) with Mac & Cheese (fake cheese, maybe microwaved..) with rice and beans (pretty good..) Lookin for good BBQ, not sure if its here..

reviews.name: Gary H.
reviews.review: Update... We went back last Thursday, August 21st. Everything was great! The greeters were friendly and cared! The waiter was attentive and very friendly and the food was terrific! Great job Logan's for turning it around!

reviews.name: Debby B.
reviews.review: Went here last night of business trip.  Service good.  Food came fast and waitress attentive and pleasant.  Salad delicious and crisp with juicy red tomatoes and well seasoned grilled chicken...not bland like most places.  Fries cold, but my mini brownie bucket was adorable and delicious.  Very rich, chocolate flavor.  Higher quality than I expected to find here.

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: The food here was great! They had surf & turf (steak & lobster) for $15! It's only a 6 oz. steak and a smaller lobster tail, but you hardly notice because of all the other stuff available ( shelled peanuts, endless yeast rolls) note of WARNING: yeast causes gas.... Be close to a bathroom.

reviews.name: Toby H.
reviews.review: This place needs to get some better management!  Poor guy behind the bar is slammed and the manager is standing up front with a employee shoot the shit while everyone at the bar is waiting to get the tables cleared. Bartender good manager bad

reviews.name: Morgan D.
reviews.review: Took family here for dinner and got the worst service possible. First Our waitress was sitting with the table behind us taking! So we had to wait about 10 to get our drink order. Then our food was cold while we had empty drinks the whole time and she checked on us maybe 2 times the whole time! She was to busy taking to the table behind us! wow never going back there!

reviews.name: Tom H.
reviews.review: Bar and burgers is the best bet here.  Keep it very simple.  Potato skins were overcooked as was the spicy shrimp.  It seems to be a local crowd at the bar which the staff caters to.

reviews.name: Mike S.
reviews.review: Not sure how this place can get over two stars.  Been there twice now and the food was mediocre at best.  Last night food was cold when delivered and had to send back.  Young, unenthusiastic servers....I'll go somewhere else next time I'm in town.  It is clean inside, I will give it that (maybe because it's fairly new?).

reviews.name: C F.
reviews.review: Good service sitting at a high top by the bar. The steak was prepared perfect. The fries were okay.  The happy hour margaritas were good. This is much better than the steak place right down the street.

reviews.name: Jesse M.
reviews.review: Excellent food and service. The chicken fried steak,  burger , and steak salad were all prepared and presented well. The waitress stayed on top with refills & checked back with us regularly.  She was cheerful without being annoying.  Good value for the money. Thank you!

reviews.name: Mike H.
reviews.review: Decent food, horrible service.  Waitress had 3 tables, forgot simple requests, and even thanked us for not complaining to the manager.  No wait at 730 on a Saturday so that's a plus, and the place was clean.  The service was a huge detractor, wouldn't return.

reviews.name: Eugene C.
reviews.review: As with most Logan's the place is poorly managed. We were told 20 min wait and after a hour I asked where we were in line and was told we were next. After 3 more groups of people were sat we got a table. The food was good our server was above average. Too bad the lack of management gets passed on to the servers who are having to serve people that are not overly happy.

reviews.name: Wanda R.
reviews.review: Went to Logan's near the Opry last night..what an awesome meal with top notch service & great management...will definitely be back!!!

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Love it! Never had Ethiopian food so decided to try this out. It's in a shady part of town where multitudes of different ethnicities reside. Prepare to eat with your hands unless you ask for silverware. If you are intimidated like I was, order some coffee first, it's excellent and served in what I assume is a traditional wooden coffee pot thing, very strong, very good. Staff was friendly and showed me how to pour it. I had the Abyssinian special. It had yellow lentils, beef, cooked carrot and cabbage mix, potatoes, and some incredible feta cheese, served on and with an additional piece of an unusual crêpe consistency type bread, with which you grasp the food and eat with your hand. Everything I had was delicious. I will definitely eat here again.

reviews.name: Lana S.
reviews.review: We drove an hour and a half to return to this restaurant. It is not easy to find, tucked in the back of a strip mall, but is well worth the search. The coffee here is the best I have ever drunk. The owner roasts the beans and then lets the water seep in the traditional manner.  The menu listed dishes in English on one side, but we chose to go with the family special, which includes yellow and red lentils, beef tibs, cabbage, and cheese served an injera. The food was excellent, the service warm but not obtrusive, and the entire meal, which also included three diet cokes, and tip for a family of three was $36.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Just as good and maybe even slightly better than some of the others around town.  Average prices $10 a dish, we shared an abyssinian mixed platter which was way more food than we needed, beef awaza/yellow lentils/cheese/wat/tons of injera and two spiced teas =$16.  The curtains were drawn and it was nice and cool inside.  Not a romantic date night with the TV on and the owners kids running about but it hit the spot.

reviews.name: James J.
reviews.review: We intended to go to Gojo, but it was closed due to a "family emergency." A quick search revealed Abyssinia close by so off we went. This place defines hole-in-the-wall. It is tucked between a gas station and a Mexican market, and may actually be impossible to get in to without bending space-time. After nearly running down a hooker and taking an unfortunate detour where I'm pretty sure we interrupted a drug deal, we parked and went in. We were greeted warmly and sat immediately, but then again, we were the only customers. The menu is incomprehensible. There are a few pictures, but no descriptions, and it is not in english. The owner/server clearly saw this, and immediately started asking questions and making recommendations. We ordered non-spicy meat and veggies, and crossed our fingers we would get something good. We did. She brought out a plate with some beef tibs, yellow lentils, red lentils, cheese, and cabbage. All was tasty, especially the tibs. A nice, relaxing meal, tasty and quite the adventure. Check it out, but be wary of wandering hookers.

reviews.name: Suz J.
reviews.review: Raw beef Kitifo dish is one you may wish to take a chance on ordering, especially if you like the raw fish in sushi. Expatriate Ethiopians consume raw beef Kitifo nostalgically. Ethiopian food in general can be basic and maybe a bit messy,  in a fun way? But why not take a chance?

reviews.name: Khyre D.
reviews.review: Great customer service! Large portions and delicious food. Not a pretty sandwich but a delicious sandwich. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Timothy H.
reviews.review: Real beefReal good Real fastReal good priceAnd real close to my jobI wish i could meet fat mo

reviews.name: Tim A.
reviews.review: Regardless of your opinions of the food quality, one thing is hard to deny...Fat Mo's delivers on the fat. These are gargantuan burgers, which I'll admitted sounded a little gimmicky at first. Anyone can slap together a massive pile of ground beef. Fortunately, Mo's did not disappoint.With a "When In Rome..." mentality going in, I took on the "Super Deluxe" burger, which pledges to be at least 16 oz. I didn't bust out my scales, but the visual inspection alone would suggest that Mo's certainly didn't skimp. Actually, I wasn't so tempted by the Super Deluxe's size as I was by its fixins: loved the mushrooms, loved the grilled onions and jalapenos, and while I was a bit worried that the BBQ sauce was going to drown out the burger, they were quite conscious of that potential catastrophe and put just enough on. Also, the bacon actually tasted like bacon, which  you'd think wouldn't be asking for much, but a lot of burger joints don't seem to understand this fundamental concept.In spite of the burger's awesomeness, though, what I am still thinking about the most are those seasoned fries. Why do so few places seem to understand the crispy-outside, smooth-inside standard to which all fries should be held? Fortunately, Mo's could probably produce a textbook on this topic. Even if you're not a burger person, stop by for a side of fries.

reviews.name: Lynne S.
reviews.review: Went here for lunch today and ordered a little Mo combo.  Food was okay nothing special.  Finished eating my meal and finished the Mt. Dew took the cover of my drink to chomp on the ice and found 3 fruit flies/gnats in my drink cup.  Can you say disgusting?!? I immediately wanted to vomit.  Will never return that's for sure.

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.review: My husband and I love the food quality, the giant parking lot & 99 cent specials! Ok; maybe just the food...

reviews.name: Perry M.
reviews.review: The only reason this place gets 4 instead of 5 is the parking....which is in and of itself a little charming.Fat Mo's burgers are the bomb.  Big juicy greaseburgers like the ones I grew up on, with all kinds of add-ons that just add to the delicious fun.And can we agree that its' just too cool to have a burger place named after a dude nicknamed Mo?When we drive through Nash on our way to Knox, my wife knows the go-to stopover for lunch is Fat Mo's.  It's now ascended to tradition status.

reviews.name: Aaron E.
reviews.review: The drive thru. Instead of shouting my order into some half-working intercom, this guy walks up to my car with a pad and pencil. He answers all my questions. Says what's most popular. I got a Number 5: half-pound cheeseburger with everything (lettuce, tomato, mayo, onions) and their seasoned fries. I love the fact that my order was handed to me in one of those styrofoam tray containers. None of this fishing fries out of a paper bag. Amazingly greasy-slightly-above-average-generously-portioned-reasonably-priced fast food.  I'm going back.

reviews.name: Steve J.
reviews.review: If you are in a hurry and want to avoid all of the national fast food chains, this may be the choice for you!  The location on Whitebridge Rd is a drive-thru only with a few picnic tables outside.  The place is not much of a looker, but the employees are friendly and provide good service.  They are slower that the average drive-thru, but that also means your food will be fresh and hot.I usually order one of two burgers on the menu, either the Fat Mo (1/2 pound) or the Little Mo (1/4 pound).  Mo's will fix the burgers exactly how you like them.  If you do not eat bread like me, they will gladly throw in a knife and fork.  I like the regular fries over the seasoned fries.  They also have many other items on the menu that look good, but have seldom tried.  I would go more often if they had dining inside, I really do not like to eat in my vehicle. They package their meals in Styrofoam trays, which is good for keeping the food warm if you are taking it home.

reviews.name: ashley m.
reviews.review: Cheese burger was soooo good, huge & juicy! Fries were not spicy more so seasoned but still super tasty! All in all this grub is on point

reviews.name: Jenifer G.
reviews.review: The burger tasted very good, quite like homemade.  Fries were thin and almost like potato sticks.  Didn't like.  Burger upset my stomach.  Won't be going back.

reviews.name: Craig M.
reviews.review: Great fresh cooked food at a very reasonable price!!! Can say no more. Big thick burgers! Wonderful fries. I got the spicy. Great Philly Steak too!!!! Drive thru or walk up only at this location, but took it back to the hotel fresh and hot!!!!

reviews.name: Xian H.
reviews.review: This Fat Mo's is probably just as good as any of the other Fat Mo's around Nashville, but since it seems to be the only one without a review, I thought I'd put it on the map.Pros: Satisfies that intense craving for a good, solid heart attack. If you want to die a slightly slower but just as joyful death, go for the deluxe (not the super deluxe). There is something magical that they do to the beef. Maybe it's just black pepper, maybe it's pixie dust. But it's delicious. (Think of it as a pimped out Burger King.)Cons: Doesn't satisfy that craving late at night (because this location closes too early). Also, warning: be prepared to hate yourself if you dare to finish an entire burger.

reviews.name: Elliott C.
reviews.review: Fat Mo's is yet another part of Nashville I have grown up with. I don't know where you can get a better corn dog in my opinion. The food is obviously greasy as hell, but are you eating a burger and hot dog to be healthy? Of course not! Either way Fat Mo's is a cool concept it is probably the last only drive thru or order and eat outside type places in town. If you are looking for a good fast food burger and fries, look no further this is one of the better ones in town.

reviews.name: Victoria R.
reviews.review: Good size handmade burger, decent fries. Overall good value.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: Ok, we've seen this place on the corner of Charlotte Pike and White Bridge so many times and today decided to try it out since they have a sign on the side of the place "voted #1 burger in town." So here goes, we stopped by for Sunday lunch, there was no line, not a good sign since most people seem to go out to eat on Sunday's. Next, we ordered our food (Fat Mo's Cheeseburger and Lil Cheeseburger and spicy fries). We got our meal and headed home. At first, it looks like a regular burger (a step up from McDonald's) and then you take a bite. My husband and I both agreed that this was not the #1 burger in town. In fact the burger tasted chewy. I really don't like to give bad reviews but this place is not a place I will ever be going back too. Maybe the other food is better but if you have a sign that says you have the #1 burger in town, you should be really darn close to having some AMAZING food.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: One of the best burgers in Nashville

reviews.name: Maria K.
reviews.review: You know how in movies sometimes there's some neighborhood spot where all the locals go and you always run into people that you know... This is what the Bellevue Pizza Perfect feels like. Every single time I ever go there, I see a bunch of people that I know and ends up being such a fun experience topped off with great food. It truly is a hole in the wall sort of place. The building is average, but when you walk in you are met by great atmosphere and energy!The staff there always goes out of their way to accommodate us. They are so friendly and cheerful and very appreciative of their customers. There are several huge Tvs to watch the game, as well as an arcade for the kids. On the weekends they have laser tag open upstairs, which is an absolute blast for all ages! The building is right by the train tracks so when it drives by you can hear the train and feel the rumble which I think is cool!The pizza is some of the best pizza you will find in Nash. It's made with real abs fresh ingredients and I can tell! It's delicious! We also always order the canolis too! They make them fresh to order and have chocolate chips in them! If you have a large group, you can reserve the back room for some privacy which is nice! This is really a great place for families and large groups! I highly recommend it!

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: I was happy to find this place in our neighborhood.  Don't know what all to say except that it's pretty good pizza, calzones, and people, but the Caesar salad needs a facelift.  It was very underwhelming.  And actually, one of our calzones was undercooked and doughy.  It's a godsend compared to Sir Pizza, though.

reviews.name: Ryan M.
reviews.review: Nothing to not like about this place, great pizza, good beer selection, will fill refill your beer grawlers, and the price wasn't bad.

reviews.name: Melissa M.
reviews.review: Standard pizza place. I got a anti pasta salad and cheese sticks as takeout. Both were good. Appears to be a popular place in the area that is kid friendly. Lots of families.

reviews.name: Megan H.
reviews.review: Best family joint in Bellevue by far. Take tons of quarters and you're set with the kids. Ample parking And amazing pizza! They even put anchovies on my Greek salad. Perfecto. It's noisy enough so that it's comfortable to carry on a conversation, watch sports on TV, and let your kids be kids.

reviews.name: Taylor C.
reviews.review: I love getting pizza here. It's super convenient and close to Bellevue neighborhoods. The specials on Wednesdays for XL pizzas are great for people with families who want a night to splurge on dinner. I haven't really tried anything else on the menu because I like the pizza. I would say the only negatives are the pizza can be extremely greasy at times and the wait times for ordering and picking up can be a long time depending on the night of the week, other than that I really enjoy this hidden gem in Bellevue!

reviews.name: Blu S.
reviews.review: We've been going to this place for 2 years.  As we drive over, we always say, "Let's try something different tonight." But we don't. And the reason is that their Margherita pizza is as good as it gets.  Joe and his crew are also a big part of the formula.  It's a terrific, energetic pizza-kinda-atmosphere.  Now I'm hungry.

reviews.name: Justin W.
reviews.review: My wife and I went to Pizza Perfect for the first time a few weeks ago. Overall, we enjoyed the experience.The good:- The pizza was outstanding.- Our garlic bread appetizer was really good.- They have a decent selection of beers on tap, so we each enjoyed a nice, cold local brew.- The arcade/kid zone is nice and separate from the dining area.- The staff was attentive and nice.The bad:- The employee who poured our beer had no clue how to pour beer. As a result, the outside of my glass was wet and sticky. -Why aren't there prices anywhere on the menu board? I always feel like this is deceptive marketing. - The Greek salad was a big disappointment. It was really small and didn't have much in it besides the lettuce. It should have been a $2 side salad instead of the full-size salad. In short, stay away from the salads.

reviews.name: Mary E.
reviews.review: I have to say I'm absolutely baffled by all these 4 and 5 star reviews. I've only lived in Nashville for a couple weeks and the whole time we've heard Pizza Perfect was the best pizza in Nashville and saw consistent good reviews, so we thought it was a sure thing. Wrong. We ordered the thin crust Margherita pizza. The positives? Umm... good basil? The crust was not thin and was very doughy, it was dry and bland and akin to eating cardboard. Not even close to a "meh" pizza experience. If this is the best pizza Nashville has to offer, we're in trouble.

reviews.name: Torrey C.
reviews.review: The owner and staff are very friendly but I think the pizza here is subpar I am from Up north and there is nothing like New York City pizza so you could say I have high standards but this pizza is average of not below average ..I am confused as to why there are such good reviews it is quite greasy....However they do offer a wheat crust pizza which I think is great considering most places to not have that as an option.

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: Based on their pizza, I'd give a strong 4-star review. Their pizza is great and it's one of the few places I can get my favorite, meatball & mushrooms. It loses the fifth star because it's impossible for my wife and I to enjoy a nice meal there most times because of all the kids running around. So why the 3-star rating? Their Chicken Parm subs are delicious and very savory and flavorful, but are made with just two really small chicken strips. They really leave you wanting, frustrated and unsatified. And overpriced at $7.99 for what you get.

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: I have to say, for me to give 5 stars to a pizza place means it's pretty darn tasty.  I'm not a huge pizza fan to begin with, so to walk out of a pizza joint exclaiming, "that was REALLY delicious!" says a lot about how I feel about the place.We came to Pizza Perfect on a chilly, rainy Sunday night.  We were immediately greeted by the manager and several employees with genuine smiles which, as cheesy as it sounds, warmed us right up.  We had never dined at PP before, so they explained how their system worked and recommended the antipasto salad for a starter before our pizza.  My boyfriend is a true carnivore and wanted the Hunter's Choice pizza with all of the meat toppings.  I, while not a vegetarian, don't care for pork products on my pizza, and was craving the Deluxe Vegetarian pizza.  We've run into problems before with pizza places who aren't willing to accomodate us with a half and half pizza--this was not a problem at Pizza Perfect!  We were delighted to be able to order our pizza the way we wanted, especially when our request was answered with a, "Sure, that's no problem whatsoever!"  When our salad and pizza arrived at the table, both of us looked at each other and smiled hugely before digging in ferociously.  We were both impressed with the crust, sauce and plentiful toppings.  The pizza was piping hot, not greasy in the slightest, and perfectly delicious.  The salad was delicious as well.  We ate every bite in less than 30 minutes!  We both agreed we'd be back whenever the pizza craving hits, and that Pizza Perfect is definitely Nashville's most perfect pizza!

reviews.name: Richard C.
reviews.review: What a hidden little gem this place is!  I used to live in NYC and as a result am a little snobby about pizza.  While this is not your Bensonhurst corner pizzeria, it is the best I have found in TN.  I have never walked out of this place and thought anything other than "Wow... that was some good pizza".  Add to this the fact that is so kid/family friendly and you have the perfect pizza parlor.

reviews.name: Abby H.
reviews.review: I love visiting the Vanderbilt location of Pizza Perfect. I've rated that location 5 stars. Tonight, I decided to try out the location closer to me. I come here for the Margherita pizza which at the other location is fantastic.  Here, they asked me if I would mind regular sliced mozzarella with the fresh mozzarella that normally comes on the slice. What they actually did was instead of going through the trouble of making a fresh margherita slice, then simply gave me a slice of already made cheese pizza and piled the fresh mozzarella and other "toppings" on it. Barely any sauce, way too much cheese and not enough toppings. We also ordered garlic bread as an appetizer which didn't arrive until after our pizza was already on the table. It's a shame because I love the Vanderbilt location and will be back there, but I will never return to the Bellevue location.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Just for the record I'm not a huge fan of the Pizza Perfect Pizza. I have had it at the location near Vanderbilt as well as here and the best way I can describe it is.. Pedestrian. However, I'm well aware that it has its fans, and from the standpoint of the location, I have no complaints.  Parking is quite ample, and the staff is very friendly!  If you are nearby and in the mood for Pizza its worth stopping in.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: I love this local eatery , hey who doesn't love hand made pizza , lasagna and toasted sandwiches! This local favorite sits in the center of Bellvue a little of the beaten Highway 70 S. Its has great quick lunch specials (ie.toasted Italian sandwich, chip , drink) and great evening or weekend treats such as my favorite pizza the Margherita  with fresh basil , fresh mozzarella , sliced tomatoe , olive oil. The best compliment I can think of is that they've turned me from a meat craving man to a more responsible eating adult w their flavorful more heathly choices! No more chain pepporoni for this guy, ugh. One more thing though how many eateries do you go and constantly see new faces -in training ! They are doing something else right here obviously as its the same crew year after here , young people too! -John S.

reviews.name: Dean A.
reviews.review: Been going here for years very good pizza. The salad is always a good complement to the meat lovers pizza.

reviews.name: Jeff B.
reviews.review: Saw the four star rating and decided to give it a try.  When we got here we weren't  sure if they seat you or you seat yourself or what.  Turns out at the far end of the restaurant you have to go to the counter and order.  We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza; typically my fav pizza.  It was mediocre at best. The BBQ sauce was not very good at all.  My buddy and I both commented that this was not a very good pizza. I may go back and try another pizza and give them a chance, but was certainly not impressed and certainly was not four stars in my book.

reviews.name: Megan W.
reviews.review: We visit this place every Wednesday for 2-4-1 pizza and beer with our friends. Good food, friendly staff, clean place. Quick service and it isn't as crowded as other places on their 2-4-1 nights. Pizza isn't the greatest in my opinion, but you really can't go wrong with two beers and two giant slices of pizza for under $8!

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: For this place being right around the corner, I do not go here nearly enough. This was only my second time here. I ordered a Spinach Calzone and a side salad with Italian dressing. The wait was given as 30 minutes, which I expected on a Friday night during Lent; however, when I picked up  the food, everything was ready and I probably could have picked the food up earlier. The calzone was of a good size for the price and had a nice mix of cheeses. It could have had more spinach in it; however, the spinach that was in it was fresh tasting. The sauce that came on the side had a little kick to it and was a nice complement to the calzone. The side salad was good, next time I know to ask for no green olives or black olives (I am not a fan). There were a couple of pieces of lettuce that probably shouldn't have been included. The Italian dressing was homemade and had a nice mix of herbs. Very fresh and light tasting dressing. When I picked up the food, the cashier had asked if I wanted Parmesan cheese  for the salad and next time I will definitely take her up on it. I like that the menu is varied and I look forward to trying their other offerings, especially some of the pasta dishes. I need to remember that this place is right around the corner more often.

reviews.name: Ashley E.
reviews.review: Our favorite pizza on town! Fantasy pizza is great, make your own is always good :), salads are great, and so are the calzones.  Management (Joe) is the best, service is quick, and the food is awesome. We get together with family there as often as possible (perfect for families with a game room and a kiddie table). My husband and I visit on our own as much as possible too. Don't forget that you can stop and get some pizza dough in case you want to make your own at home!

reviews.name: Maria A.
reviews.review: Great pizza and nice prices. Grab a beer and watch the game while the kiddos play a few games in the game room. Only problem... The pizzas are so hot you might burn your mouth! I highly recommend waiting a few minutes after you get your pizza before digging in!

reviews.name: Mell F.
reviews.review: My what a difference a little time makes. Was in the area with the kids and looked forward to another good trip to Pizza Perfect...Was sorely disappointed; Not only with the pizza (which was much worse than I remembered...the sauce was old, I think), but even more disappointed in the attitude of the people working there. It is purely amazing that managers and owners of businesses that deal with the public fail to instruct their employees on the absolute neccessity of good customer service in the age of immediate online reviews and social media. Astounding, really. So here's the deal:The Kids spent a little time in the game room where my 10 year old daughter put 1 quarter in a game that took 2. She wanted her money back and hit the coin return lever, but nothing happened. She came to the table to tell me and I told her to tell the young lady at the counter...I was trying to teach her a lesson about asking for what you want and was certain she would experience a good lesson in customer service when she got her quarter back. T'was not to be. The girl at the counter said that since she only put 1 quarter in a 2 quarter game she could not get her money back unless she put another quarter in and pressed the coin return (Keep in mind that this was an older game that just starts without giving you the option the get your money back...But I digress). No biggie, no problem, I thought, I'll just put the other quarter in and let her play the game. So I put another quarter in, and...wait for it...nothing happened. I hit the coin return lever (remember, old game), and...wait for it...nothing happened. So now back to the counter to get 50 cents. No biggie, no problem, I thought, they will just give me the 2 quarters and we'll be on our way. Not yet...Now I have to face the same girl at the counter who proceeds to say, "Well, did anyone else play the game between the time your daughter put her quarter in and the time you did (maybe 30 seconds)? No I said, there is no one else in there (the restaurant was nearly empty...I wonder why? There I go again: Digressing.) "I just need my 50 cents", I said. Finally she grudgingly hands it over, with an attitude. I decided to give her a little construcvtive feedback, so I say, "Hey, you probably should have just given her her quarter back in the first place. I would have been good customer service, you know." "Well", she says, "that's not our policy." Really?! She pulled the old, "not our policy" over a cool 25 cents. Brilliant."Ok", I say, "you have lost a customer as a result of your 'policy', be sure to let your manager know we won't be back." I get the kids from the game room to leave and as we're leaving I notice the girl talking to a slightly older guy in a plain white tee behind the counter and he's looking at me like I just took a dump in the middle of his restaurant. Oh great, I think, a 20 year old night manager at a pizza joint on a Monday: The very definition of 'a big fish in a small pond'. I look at him and say, "Great customer service you have here. We will not be back, and rest assured I will be writing some online reviews of how poorly we were treated in your establishment." "Well, that's against our policy, so you can write all the reviews you want." "OK, I'll be sure to do that. What's your name?""Matt", he says. "Great, I'll be sure to mention you." So there you go Matt. You've been noted and we will not ever be back. Promises kept. That's MY policy.

reviews.name: John W.
reviews.review: Every so often, while in Kroger or Home Depot, I'll see the owner of Pizza Perfect. He waves, says hello, an asks how we are.That's the best review I can give of the place. The pizza is very good. I love the calzone. Their tiramisu is better than even at pricier restaurants. And for parties (birthday, sports, etc.), there really is no place better.But it's the attention that you get that makes it such a great place. I've been in many restaurants in Bellevue, with a lot of visits to each place. Only the owner of Pizza Perfect has taken note of us, and says hi to us in public. I'll be honest: even if the food was mediocre I'd go simply because of that level of customer appreciation.Go for the food, return for the service.

reviews.name: Steven C.
reviews.review: I love their pizza...in fact....I think I haven't had pizza from other place for a long time. Friendly employees, kids friendly, and delicious pizza. They have 2 locations....one is in Bellevue and the one is on 21st ave close to Vanderbilt hospital. You should definitely go try them out if you are in Nashville. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Mary R.
reviews.review: Mell. F's review is not accurate, nor appropriate. I have never heard of anyone making a 16 year old girl cry over a quarter. Pizza Perfect has an upstanding and astonishing reputation for great customer service, and has always been fantastic with kids. I remember one time when my child was in the game room and got upset with another bratty kid. This kid tried to take her stuffed animal and one of the cashiers took it upon herself to come find us as parents and explain what she saw, and helped our little girl out. Tell me what place would do something like that? Tell me who would go out of their way to make sure our child, whom none of the employees knew on a personal basis, was safe and alright? Your child basically put one quarter into the machine and tried to get another quarter from the cashier but the cashier told your daughter it takes two quarters to activate the machine. So basically you got upset because the employee did not give your daughter an extra quarter to play the machine. That's childish and selfish of you to try to ask your kid to get a quarter out of a restaurant. Just give your kid a quarter it's not a big deal. You and your child are in the wrong and you are throwing an in inappropriate hissy fit if you ask me.You can ask all of the families in Nashville, who have been to Pizza Perfect, and I am 100% positive they will say the exact same thing I am. I love this place it has always been phenomenal and we have been coming here for 10 years now. Thank you for all of your wonderful pizza and customer service Pizza Perfect!! My family greatly appreciates it.

reviews.name: Vanessa S.
reviews.review: Great pizza. I would give it 5 stars if they only delivered!!!!!!!!

reviews.name: Lucy L.
reviews.review: The pizza here is pretty good stacked up against any large chain or delivery place. The sauce is good, dough pretty good and the topping are fresh and tasty. Not a big fan of their cannoli, probably because my first time I had a cannoli was a neighborhood place in Brooklyn so nothing compares. Cheesecake is tasty, with a fruit topping even. The salads are typical but fresh, I just don't care for iceberg myself. All in all best I have had in Bellevue and good value.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: I grew up out in Bellevue and Pizza Perfect was always a go to take out meal for my family.  I have my own family now and even though it is a hike out to Bellevue now, whenever we are out west we like to try and stop by Pizza Perfect.  The menu and quality are the same if not better than the 21st ave location and the Bellevue PP is much larger.  Also, for people with kids it has the awesome one-two punch of a game room and beer on tap.  Fun for the whole family!My personal favorite orders are the fantasy pizza (sun-dried tomatoes, pesto, garlic, spinach) and the sicilian (a big thick french bread-like crust with good cheese and sauce).  The sandwiches are also top quality and honestly there are no losers on the menu.  The only downside is that they don't deliver to the east-side, or anywhere else for that matter.  Still anyplace that can make a 4 year old and a 34 year old equally happy is a place with a lot going for it.   Perfect.

reviews.name: Sasha T.
reviews.review: Apparently I live in an area that is still considered a foreign country to places that deliver food. But thats ok because I am perfectly content to stop by Pizza Perfect whenever I have a pizza craving.The quality of pizza is really really really good. We've tried most of the pizzas you can get there but favorites are meatball and the white pizza ( which comes with artichokes on it...yum). The crust is perfectly done and none of their pizzas feel like a grease-fest. I usually only need to blot it once or twice to make me feel like I'm eating a little bit healthier (Yes, I pretend it does). I haven't tried any of the sandwiches but their calzones are very good as well.It may seem like its run by teenagers, but they are definitely among the most pleasant ones you'll find. If you live in the area this is the best pizza around. If you haven't tried it yet, you should!

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: I feel like this is my neighborhood pizza joint.We first started coming here with some of our friends from synagogue that keep kosher, plus, my wife is a pesky vegetarian.  So it took a couple of trips until I could get my favorite, a pepperoni pie.  In my book, there are few things that beat a NY-style pepperoni slice, and these guys do it right.Another great thing about Pizza Perfect is that they have a great place for kids to play and an arcade with air hockey.  I almost deduct a star because you never know if the air hockey is going to be broken or not.  But it has been fun 'teaching' my 2-year-old how to play arcade games.They have beer, too, which is one of the most important parenting tools I have ever found.  You can also get a draft pitcher of Bud for $7.  Typically, I despise domestic, mass-production brews, but somehow it is OK in here.  They have a number of specialty pizzas I can recommend, including 'The Hunter' - a meaty pizza that includes bacon, 'The Fantasy' - sun-dried tomatoes, pesto, spinach, feta and garlic, and my favorite 'The Sparky' - double pepperoni, mushrooms and green olives (copyright 2010, all rights reserved).They do carryout as well, but make sure you have some towels to wrap around the pizzas to keep em hot, this pizza is best enjoyed fresh and gets cold quickly.  Also, don't forget to tip the high-school kids busting their butts in there, too.

reviews.name: Matthew H.
reviews.review: Every time I get a slice here I'm tempted to make drastic statements about Pizza Perfect's greatness.  But with something like pizza, it's hard to commit...it's difficult to use words like "favorite" or "best ever".  While I may get railed by some pizza lovers out there, what makes great pizza is a combination of science and subjectivity.  We all have our preferred styles and cooking methods.  If I can take such a leap, I can't say I've had better pies anywhere else.  Maybe it's because Pizza Perfect reminds me of the pies I used to eat at a local joint growing up, or maybe I've been won over by the 2 for 1 slices on Wednesday with $5 dollar pitchers and 2 for 1 bottles of Sierra Nevada (2 bottles for 3.75.  THREE SEVENTY FIVE!!!!).  While those things are surely wonderful, I still say it's the tasty foldable slices that keep me coming back.  It starts with the dough, and if you like you can purchase fresh dough balls to make your own pies at home.  So good.  So why no 5 stars?  I can't commit.  But maybe if they had more TVs and NFL Sunday Ticket.  Maybe then.

reviews.name: Aubrey D.
reviews.review: My favorite time to come here is in the middle of the day during the week. There's hardly anyone there, and they have a sweeeet lunch special: 2 massive slices with 1 topping and a drink for 6 bucks! It's enough for both my toddler and me.He loves the arcade--especially the car games. He doesn't know how to work them yet but has a ball turning the steering wheel and pushing the buttons. I have also brought older kids here many times which is fun for THEM. At night it gets loud and chaotic and the kids get hyped up and obnoxious! The games are also expensive--50 cents to $1 per game. While Chuck E Cheese's is a better value in that arena, this one's closer and smaller.The pizza's also usually very good: flavorful sauce, fresh toppings, and yummy crust. There have been a couple of times where I was disappointed in it but, for the most part, it's solid.

reviews.name: Michael P.
reviews.review: A Neighborhood TreasureThe Pizza Perfect Bellevue is a great gathering spot for Bellevue folks, there is a game room for the kids, beer for the adults, and great pizza for all.We have become addicted to their toasted subs when we aren't in the mood for pizza (It happens, stop rolling your eyes!) Pizza Perfect contributes part of its sales to local schools on Tuesday so if ya don't like kids I'd skip that day. There are only two big flat screen TVs for sports but they are conveniently located so there isn't a seat in the house that you can't see them.. well.. if your in a booth facing the back.. It could be difficult. There is also a small monitor so you can keep an eye on your kid as he assaults the other children and tries to jimmy open the money box on the games in the game room. Very handy! So long story short drop by and give it a try, Four years voted best pizza (and 4 years as runner up) ya kind of get the clue.. its good pizza!

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: Ate lunch here on Sunday.  Good pizza.  A bit pricey.  I like that it's not greasy pizza.

reviews.name: Brad A.
reviews.review: You can't go wrong with Pizza Perfect.  Their thin crust pizzas are great.  Be sure to try some of the house combination like bacon cheeseburger, BBQ chicken, an the Fantasy.  The spinach calzones are great.  There is lots of seating and great for large groups.  You can also find coupons in some of the coupon books kids sell for school fundraisers around Nashville.

reviews.name: Tracy B.
reviews.review: This review is for music only (we didn't eat here).We came here because we heard a great band playing. At 5pm on a Saturday night, this place is exactly where you want to be. The music is great and so is the energy. If you need to get away from the noise, you get step upstairs, but we all had so much fun we only went upstairs for a drink before we realized the band was too good to miss out on. We stayed for the changeover (although the first band was better than the second), and then headed to dinner. I would come back for more. It's a less "trendy" place than Tootsie's, but I actually had more fun here than there because it was less crowded and the bands were better!

reviews.name: Christine P.
reviews.review: My husband, sister, cousin and I stopped in for a bit on 9/20/2015 to listen to some music and have a few drinks. The service was ok, nothing exceptional. Two bartenders during peak, although one disappeared for some time and it took us awhile to get our next drink. Understandable given the location and amount of business. The reason for the low rating is the drinks. My husband and I drank Bourbon on the rocks (our usual brand) and my cousin drank a mixer. Independently, all three of us made a statement about the booze tasting watered down. My cousin said she could barely taste the booze in the drink. Both my husband and I remarked that the bourbon didn't have it's usual bite, and despite just being set in front of us on the rocks, tasted as if it had been sitting for awhile and the ice melted (ie, watered down). All 4 of us have grown up in the bar/restaurant industry and know what a drink is supposed to taste like. I can understand watering down a mixer, but a bourbon on the rocks? That's ridiculous! My advice? If you go to check it out, skip the liquor and stick with bottled/canned beer.

reviews.name: Marissa M.
reviews.review: What I remember about Benchmark is not the band or the beer selection or seating, but the bathrooms. This place had by far the oddest bathroom stalls I've ever encountered. That being said, they were clean and had more than one in the bathroom. Helpful things. Also helpful was the giant container of water available for hydration. As a local told my friends and I, "Everyone comes to Nashville thinking they can out drink it. They're wrong, all wrong."Stay thirsty, friends. This place is A-OK to quench your thirst, alcoholic and non.

reviews.name: Francesca D.
reviews.review: Touch and go to say the least, but the music is SO worth the stop. My husband and I stumbled upon this place after hopping around downtown and we are so glad we did. A guys named Isaac Mathews was playing and he's absolutely incredible. We made it a point to find out his schedule and come back for round 2 the next day. Service is touch and go- our first day we had incredible service and the 2nd not so much. Again, didn't make us want to leave because this guy kicks ass. Suck it up and get a frozen bushwaker for $5 and listen to some good jams.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: Briefly stopped in here to grab a beer and listen to music - loved this place! There was a great band playing and it wasn't too packed so we could really enjoy ourselves. Will definitely be coming back!

reviews.name: Brent S.
reviews.review: Hold on to your drinks here!!!!! The barkeeps like to throw 1/2 glasses away if you aren't guarding them with your life!!!!!

reviews.name: Christy C.
reviews.review: Another bar on our bar crawl...the band here was great! The place was kind of busy when we got there however there were seats at the bar. You couldn't really see the band as well from where we were sitting, but really enjoyed the music. In total we stayed for 2 drinks each and a shot...I think this place was a bit on the pricier side for drinks but we had fun.

reviews.name: Curtis K.
reviews.review: loud, the only drinks options were things you could pretty much get at any bar. This place is full of noisy tourists. Usually isn't a place to sit. Not my scene I guess. The environment was kinda stressful.

reviews.name: James W.
reviews.review: Awesome place for live music and great drinks.  We came here multiple times over the span of a week.  The red bull slushie is amazing.  They truly have the best live music on 2nd.

reviews.name: T B.
reviews.review: Cool bar, always playing music. I believe they start around 10 or 11 AM. The place is also on 2nd Ave. so its a little calmer than broadway, yet still really close if you want to hit up those places. Bar tenders were really nice and observant.  Next time I'm back in Nashville, I will definitely stop in a few times.  I heard the egg rolls were really good, the locals (musicians) were eating them...

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: I really enjoy this bar on non Peak days rather than the weekend. This bar is unparalleled when they play good acoustic music without all the electric and full band overlay. The bar is comfortable the seating is private and it's a good mix of Ages people who are locals and visitors from out of townI suggest the beef or chicken skewers they are cooked well healthy and flavorful.

reviews.name: Katie F.
reviews.review: Music is great, but bar service is extremely slow. One bar tender sat behind the bar and watched the other while people were waiting for a drink.

reviews.name: Allie M.
reviews.review: My husband and I came here during CMA fest for a quick beer before heading to LP Field. Although the bouncer was super nice and let my husband take his Pita Pit purchase from next door inside, which was a perk, the music was pretty crappy, which was most definitely not a perk.The place has a decent selection of beer, and seemed to have a lot of space/seating, but there was definitely a better vibe at a lot of the other venues on Broadway. Maybe it's just that 2nd Ave thing.. I mean, after all, it is on the same street as Hooters and Coyote Ugly.

reviews.name: Collyn M.
reviews.review: Had a great time!! Cool place mixed crowd and great music. We went on a Friday afternoon. All tables were filled but it was not crowed. Next time I am in town I will definitely visit again.

reviews.name: Veronica D.
reviews.review: My first trip here turned out to be a bust. Totally my fault, though. It was a Saturday in Nov and it's college game day so everyone had already been parked there for hours (i was hoping to catch the last of the Irish game myself). But we came back on a Tuesday and it was pretty dead. The guy playing guitar was pretty good. I used a groupon and tried the BBQ burger. Not a bad choice at all. Overall, the food was ok. Nothing special, but it hit the spot that evening since I didn't feel like cooking.

reviews.name: Thomas T.
reviews.review: Very disappointed!!  Stopped in to have drinks at our second stop in Nashville, blonde Monday night bartender carded me and saw I was from out of state and decided to charge me $16 for two small shots of Jack in a paper cup. Very unprofessional.  When asked about the price, she mumbled something about having other shots for $5.  She lost this place some decent business as we were planning to meet people here for dinner.

reviews.name: Evaristo M.
reviews.review: Brought in by the live music 10/16/14. Tried a slushie. I couldn't finish it. A lot of booze. Went back to $4 16oz. PBR. We got there when one act finished and another one started. It was a husband and wife duet. Really liked them. A lot of rock covers gone country. Not a big country fan but I enjoyed it. I requested a song for my wife. She was surprised that we were from Wisconsin. She has had a lot of folks from Wisconsin the last few days. Wisconsin represent. I'd go back for sure.

reviews.name: Hall W.
reviews.review: Unlike the mid-town Benchmark. This benchmark is pretty good. The live music offerings were actually rather amazing. You get this homy laid back feel of a quality neighborhood bar with the sounds of Nashville.However, nothing about this bar blew me away. The menu is small (although the drink specials are pretty amazing).

reviews.name: Robert W.
reviews.review: This was wonderful!  I was walking through downtown Nashville and heard a fiddle playing (fiddles/violins are my favorite music).  I ordered a sandwich (I don't drink alcoholic drinks or carbonated drinks, so it is difficult to order in bars!)  The waitress was really nice and even offered me some caramel popcorn for dessert!The music (I believe Katie and Mark) was wonderful, I sat and listened for an hour and would have stayed longer, but I couldn't.A great evening!  Really as good as it gets!  They even played my favorite fiddle song "Orange Blossom Special" for me.  I was in seventh heaven!Food was excellent, no coffee.

reviews.name: G H.
reviews.review: The best place we visited the evening after a noon Titans/SD game.  Friendly bartenders, reasonable prices, good apps.  Outstanding female vocalist as well.  WIll most certainly be my go-to spot in BNA

reviews.name: Kourtney O.
reviews.review: Just a response note to P.R. To say that servers are not supposed to serve someone without their us government issued id. If you do not have a us government issued id, you must have a passport or military id. The servers and establishments that are serving you without that proper acknowledgement can lose their jobs or be fined among other things. Despite the fact of even checking an id though, a server has a right to refuse service to anyone. They are told when in doubt, do not serve. You can research the abc boards and their rules and regulations and CONSEQUENCES when they are not followed or even look into the TIPS training course. It will provide you with all that information as well. Here' a a link you can check for yourself . It will be listed under "acceptable forms of id." servercertificationcorp.…; ....

reviews.name: Kayla C.
reviews.review: So, we were here on the 4th of july. Granted I know it was super busy, everywhere was slammed.  We got the groupon, and decided to try it out.  We sat upstairs for around 20 mins.  Never got service.  There was a waitress, who was more interested in flirting with a table of guys than taking orders.  After waiting for a while, we walked up to the bartender to ask if we could just place our order with him, to which he refused.  We were pissed and over it, so we left instead.  So unimpressed.

reviews.name: nicole t.
reviews.review: This place was charming and had great music. Decent moonshine prices :)

reviews.name: Cara H.
reviews.review: I was there last December and had a great time. Good live music, good crowd. I'll be back next time I'm in town!

reviews.name: P R.
reviews.review: Don't go.  Very rude establishment.  Refused our valid government ID since we are not from the USA!!!  Demanded passports!  Who the heck carries around a passport?If you aren't USA born and bread, go elsewhere.  In fact, go  to the Swinging Door Saloon just around the corner.  They were happy to take our money, sang great music and provided us with decent food.  And the best was, they were happy to accept our NON-USA government issued ID and our NON-USA Visa card!!!!!Benchmark, you are the only place in Nashville that has NOT been pleasant to us!

reviews.name: Carolyn G.
reviews.review: I can't believe this place hasn't yet been reviewed. During our weekend in Nashville, someone handed us a flier for the Super Bowl specials at Benchmark. Since we knew they'd have the game on, we decided to go there for the game. The server was extremely friendly and provided great service. The specials were pretty good and the clientele seemed friendly enough. I would definitely go back, if we were planning to be in town longer.

reviews.name: Jordan C.
reviews.review: Benchmark on 2nd Ave. is now under new ownership!!! We have a brand new food menu and a brand new drink menu. If you have been here prior to these changes and enjoyed the music... You are in luck! We kept the BEST musicians in downtown Nashville and even added a few new faces! Still home of the $5 Fireball and we are KEEPING IT LOCAL by adding some great local brews on tap that we are sure you will enjoy!!!

reviews.name: Emily M.
reviews.review: This was my favorite bar in Nashville - quaint and old school style layout, very comfortable.  They had the most talented band of the weekend by far, and they were great about including everyone there to watch them.  Drinks were good, service was good - didn't try the food.

reviews.name: ryan k.
reviews.review: I also thought there'd be more reviews for this place. Really comfortable good bar feel inside (nice leather booths, good wood bar, good live music)...lots of flat screens, a private room in the back to watch games. Overall definitely a place I could escape the idiocy of 2nd ave and watch a game in a comfortable space.

reviews.name: Mark S.
reviews.review: Nothing special here unfortunately.  was staying in downtown Nashville and couldn't decide what to eat.  place had OK / decent reviews so I decided to give it a whirl.  good location, live music.  it goes downhill from there.  beer in plastic cups and it tasted stale (Yuengling).  the Spicy Chicken Mac & Cheese was sub par.  I'd say one step above Kraft Mac & Cheese from a box.  sorry. just didn't do it for me.

reviews.name: S.L. M.
reviews.review: We were in town for the NCAA tournament games last week and came here to watch the other games on TV. What a great spot. We went to the smaller upstairs area where there are lots of TVs. You could still hear the live music coming from downstairs but it wasn't crowded or loud. By the end of the night we had the place to ourselves.And the food is great. Order the skewers. They are quite the production. Not at all your usual sports bar food.

reviews.name: Brenda D.
reviews.review: Had fun, very good band and a mix of peeps having a good time.  Wait staff a little goofy, they would pick up your empty but never ask if you wanted another drink. Strange to say the least.

reviews.name: Kyle B.
reviews.review: Great breads and sandwiches! I'm not sure about their food truck offerings, but the store in the Arcade is great! Really friendly staff as well!

reviews.name: Kevin K.
reviews.review: The food truck is now a store front! The Arcade's newest member offers up a quick, tasty sandwich at a fair price. I ordered the Cali melt and was not disappointed. Freshly baked tomato basil cheese bread was the highlight. Happy to have more competition for my lunch dollars!

reviews.name: Chris W.
reviews.review: Do not eat the burgers. I had one at dancing in the district and it was terrible. I waited 15 minutes for a burnt burger patty. Save your money and go to sonic

reviews.name: Veronica D.
reviews.review: If you happen to see Two Guys in a Lunchbox drive by, be sure to follow it! Chances are it will lead you to one of our local breweries and let's face it, they go hand in hand. They have a great looking menu with sandwiches and loaded spuds; my favorite: the Chicken Fajita Spud and my better half raved about the Chili n Cheese spud. But, don't be fooled...these are GIANT spuds. I made 2 meals outta mine. The guys are very attentive and seek to make your lunch truck experience an awesome one in hopes that you'll return. You better believe I will!

reviews.name: Eric M.
reviews.review: We stopped in with my daughter and her husband, who were in town for a visit.  W all enjoyed the down to earth atmosphere and friendly waitress.  I ordered the 1/3rd rack of ribs which was excellent.  The meat practically fell right off the bone.  My wife also got the ribs, my daughter got the chicken and my son-in-law ordered the catfish.  It was all good, and very reasonably priced.From now on when out of town guests are in town we will take them to the Music City Smokehouse!  Check it out, you will not be disappointed, unless your a fussbudget.

reviews.name: Archie G.
reviews.review: Music City Smokehouse (aka Two Kegs) offers up beer, food, and live music. Unfortunately, none of it is particularly good.The beer is cold, cheap, and awful. The food is lukewarm, cheap, and awful. The service is minimal, cheap, and awful. The decor is rundown, cheap, and awful. In other words, the only thing that is inspired here is the live music. And even that ain't that good. Next.

reviews.name: Chris F.
reviews.review: Stopped by randomly. Had the pork BBQ and it was delicious. The sandwich was reasonably priced and was very tender and had a nice(not overpowering) smokiness.

reviews.name: Mala H.
reviews.review: This bar has a very down home feel. More likely than not, the owner is probably cooking your meal.The fried green beans were different but tasty. They have their own special punch drink as well.The smoked ribs are on the dry side, but with their sauce it's a good choice. Many of my friends also recommend the pulled pork sandwich.They have free poker on Thursday and Friday nights.

reviews.name: M L.
reviews.review: I only stumbled across this place by accident, and have only eaten there once, so it's too soon to give them a 5th star... but so far, it's a real fun/friendly hang with excellent BBQ (I had the brisket with fresh-cut fries - most tasty)I don't know my way around Nashville too well, but they say this place is only 1 mile from downtown, and has a big (free) parking lot. They say they have live music about every week, classic rock? Not sure if they charge cover or not.HARLEY DAVIDSONS! It's definitely a Hog-friendly spot, but don't let that scare you: these bikers are typically successful, fun-loving types who just love to ride, meet new folks & enjoy it all (gotta get me a bike!)

reviews.name: jerry a.
reviews.review: I eat a this place a couple of times a week and it is delicious.  They recently changed their menu but it still includes the same delicious standard that are sooo delicious.  Visit the website for the latest southern comfort food.

reviews.name: Patricia G.
reviews.review: I went here one afternoon and they had a band on the deck; it was a great bar expercience. The chicken fingers were good but the pulled pork was a big let down, dry and unflavored. One other night I went in and there was a poker tournament or something not my style going on.

reviews.name: Anne C.
reviews.review: FIVE STARS for1) the bartenders 2) actually being Open when they say they will be3) because tequila is tequila 4) because tequila Our favorite place during our stay at the Gaylord Opryland hotel.

reviews.name: Kelly G.
reviews.review: If you are looking for a sports bar just to grab a beer this place definitely works, otherwise I would not recommend it.  The prices are rather high and the food wasn't much to speak of.  We ordered the cheese fries and they were absolutely swimming in so much sauce it made them no fun to eat.  The chicken wings were very overdone and not super flavorful. Try another restaurant in the hotel for a meal.

reviews.name: Rian V.
reviews.review: This place SUCKS!!!!!!!!! Terrible service, worse menu.. The entire complex is confusing..

reviews.name: Kirk R.
reviews.review: Haven't even been inside yet and it's horrible service!!!  Why have a hostess section, if your seat yourself? And to boot, there's 4 of them not seating people. They don't keep track of tables, or take a guests name to be seated. Than, just let people walk ahead of you to go find a table on their own. WTF!!!!  Finally seated myself at the bar. Ordered a beer and bacon cheese fries. Beer tasted like 3 different beers and the cheese fries are cold. Mmmmm tasty!!!!  Second order of cheese fries come out, and just as cold as the first. Looked pretty, but shouldn't fried food be hot???  Shouldn't the cheese melt on cheese fries?  Looked pretty, but tastes nasty!!!!

reviews.name: Stephen M.
reviews.review: We ate at Fuse three times over the last week.  It was a little pricey, but is a good way to get your parking ticket punched so you don't have to pay for valet parking.  The staff was friendly and salad bar and chili bar (at lunch) were my fav.

reviews.name: Noel T.
reviews.review: Came here for a late night dinner/snack and the place itself had a great feel to it. There were plenty of TVs and bar style seating. Our server was nice however it took a long time for our food to come out. I had a chicken sandwich and it was terribly dry. I also had a bite of my bf's burger and it was dry as well as flavorless. In total, we paid $60 for a chicken sandwich, cheeseburger and two mixed drinks-- a little pricy for the quality.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: Fuse sports bar is located in the Opryland hotel in Nashville Tennessee. If I remember correctly I have been here four times maybe more. Here's the deal it's the only place in the hotel out of the 15 restaurants that you can get alcohol and food after 10pm.  The catch is that they stop serving food at midnight and alcohol at 1am. This place is expensive. We ended up spending a lot I mean a lot of money in this place. They get you two Ways. The first way is they are located in the hotel so things are going to be more expensive. The second way is after 10 PM they're the only ones that have alcohol. The fuse bar and Grill in my opinion difficult to find if it's your first time staying at this hotel. I had to have an employee escort me to find the fuse bar.  This hotel is so massive. make sure that you have a map or ask somebody to bring you to this bar. The sign changes color constantly from green to red to blue and they have a bunch of TVs with every single game that you can imagine on with DirecTV. They do advertise this place has a nightclub. From the outside it does look like a club but once you get inside it just looks like modern bar. I did not see an area where there was a dance floor there was no live music or DJ playing. Fuse was reasonably full at lunch and from dinner to midnight the place was pretty packed. I did eat here two times for lunch in the food was good. I had a turkey club sandwich $18 that I could only half of.  The next day for lunch I had a chicken quesadilla appetizer that was a really good for $15. One of the nights here we got like six appetizers and I can't remember how many beers there was definitely more than 20 beers on the table at one point. I did notice when I ate here for launch that the staff seem to take forever to refill our drinks or to come back to the table. But the night when we had the six appetizers and all of the beers there was two people constantly coming to work table to remove drinks get us refills and we didn't have to ask anybody.  The one thing that I did enjoy here was their wings they did have pretty decent wings but there quesadilla was way better than the wings. If you were staying at the hotel just be prepared that it's going to be expensive and you're better off just going outside of the hotel to a sports bar. Overall I'm sure I will be back here next year the food was okay but very expensive the drinks were good and they had pretty much every sports game you could watch on television. The only downfall is they stop serving food at midnight and they stop serving alcohol at 1 AM. PROS:- full bar and good beer list-staff was nice CONS:- food is expensive for bar food - staff was slow for lunch - stops serving food at midnight. - not a nightclub

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: Beautiful bar with several tv's. This place has so much potential but the service and attitude of the employees really bring this place down. We came in for a few beers and a snack, took several minutes to be acknowledged from our sweaty bartender and we he finally did take our order it was if we were bothering him. The food itself was typical, average bar food, nothing to want you coming back for.

reviews.name: Rodney P.
reviews.review: You can live and learn. Or you can check with Yelp.  Fuse has an inviting appearance; especially for the young adult crowd. But it's pretty lame food and service for the money. There's better food for a much better price on the other side of Music Valley Drive. If you go to a fair , or to the airport, you'll pay extra for so-so. Same thing here.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Tried to pay in cash, but the manager came up, grabbed the cash, wrapped it around the television remote, dipped it into their famous Ghost Pepper Saucer, and shoved it directly up his bottom. I thought that was strange. Also, the service is atrocious, and despite being a sports bar, they won't respond to requests for games within the hour (when it's less than half full). Hotel bars already set the bar pretty low, but Fuse masterfully limbos below it.

reviews.name: Richard W.
reviews.review: Great SportsBar  Great Menu & Outstanding, friendly, efficient service  Mercedes was our server  very friendly  We Will Be Back!

reviews.name: Garrett T.
reviews.review: Food menu was a bit small, totalling at about 10 menu items, Including starters. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger which was very good, but extremely over priced, about 17 dollars.

reviews.name: Mike B.
reviews.review: I ate here while I was staying at the hotel.  It was not too busy and they had a bar, so I figured I would give it a try.  The food was not that great and the service, which started off good got slower and slower.

reviews.name: Kevin R.
reviews.review: Service was slow, even though we only ordered nachos.  Server said it was because they were having a shift change, but everyone else around us was getting their food. The nachos were okay, but the chicken on top was old and dry. They use sliced cheese in the nachos, not shredded. I found that odd.

reviews.name: Kal Y.
reviews.review: Food is good and alright.  Nothing overly spectacular or gourmet, but tasty enough.  For a sports grill it has A LOT of TVs w Hi ich is ideal for viewing.  There's not a bad seat in the house.  The turkey sandwich is huge.

reviews.name: Otis G.
reviews.review: Good grief.  Terrible, terrible service.  Took the waiter 15 min to bring me a simple draft Bud Light.  Took him 20 min to bring a second beer 30 min into the meal!!  On his first visit to our table, he asked "are you ready to order?"  Uhhh, hello, no, we just got here and would like something to drink.  In the mean time, another waiter came by trying to deliver a tray full of food that we didn't order.  When told we didn't order it, he looked around in bewilderment and actually said "I'm new and don't  know the table numbers".  (Luckily, a nearby table of two flagged him down.)  This is an incompetent manager problem who doesn't properly train or operationally manage employees. Food was Ok, but definitely outrageously priced.  $15 for a cheeseburger?!  Crazy!  $10 for six wings!! Tourist trap restaurant with tourist trap prices.  We live locally and dropped  by with our kids to see the Christmas lights, but we will never be back to "Fuse", or for that matter, ever venture into another Gaylord Opryland restaurant.

reviews.name: Scott K.
reviews.review: Came in for lunch and to watch World Cup. Started with Thai chicken satay. It was ok but a bit too salty for my taste (which is a theme at this hotel). Ordered the grilled chicken breast sandwich in pretzel bun. It came out with Swiss cheese melted well onto it. Problem is that he menu didn't say it had cheese. And I don't like Swiss. Waiter had it remade which took another 15 minutes. It was very good and the roll was tasty as well. The fries came with the sandwich and were very good.

reviews.name: Katie D.
reviews.review: You certainly except a hotel restaurant like this to be meh, but I still expected better.If there's a game going on, this is certainly the place to go. There's huge flat screen TVs everywhere and a decent selection of beer.We only ordered the fries and that was pretty abysmal. Tasted worse than Costco frozen fries. Nooo flavor what so eve. If you're doing the sports bar vibe, can you at least provide half decent fries?

reviews.name: Sina N.
reviews.review: I have waited long enough to review my experience at Fuse which is located inside Gaylord Opryland Resort in Nashville, TN.I attended a conference, and it was the first night out of five, so I wanted to experience the "in-house" restaurants. Fuse seemed to be one of few restaurants that didn't require reservation,  and would accept take-out orders. So I hit up Fuse and ordered a BLT Burger.The burger was just awful. The bun was soggy, the fries were soggy. For being a $14 burger, it should at least have some good flavors, right? But no. The BBQ dressing was the only thing that had some flavor to it. I doubt that I will ever be back at Fuse, even though the resort was an amazing experience in itself.The experience might be different if you sit inside with a couple of friends, where they have a bunch of TV's (incl projectors). Fuse is a sports bar, so they seemed to have quite a few drink options as well.

reviews.name: Dustin N.
reviews.review: Good: it's open later than most places in the hotel and lots of TVsBad: slow service, overpriced drinks, food that tastes like microwaved leftovers from the freezerIn other words, unless you are desperate for a late night drink to escape from a hard day walking the kids around or to get away from the in-laws that for some reason are vacationing with you, don't go here. On a side note, every other establishment I have gone to in the resort has been far better.

reviews.name: Heidi B.
reviews.review: This was my first visit to Fuse. My friend and I chose to eat supper here during our visit to the Gaylord Opryland Resort for Imaging USA 2015. We got there around 8:30 PM and waited 15 min for a table. Service was okay; our waitress looked miserable the entire time (She looked 8 months pregnant so understandable, just not enjoyable for our experience.) After waiting about 30 min for our food it finally arrived. I ordered the Thai Chicken Skewers and Hummus. Both were quite delicious. Overall I was satisfied with our visit, but there was definitely room for improvement.

reviews.name: Wes L.
reviews.review: I had a pretty good experience here. Don't come expecting a normal sports bar. It's inside the Gaylord Opre land, so it's a bit classy for a sports bar. The service was good, and it was pretty packed. This place has tv 's everywhere, and plenty of seating for groups to come here. The food is good,  but it's still sports bar food. A bit overpriced if you ask me. Unless you're staying at the Gaylord, I would recommend choosing somewhere else.

reviews.name: Virgilio L.
reviews.review: Stopped in thought to get lunch and beer. Saw they had buffet looked pretty bad. Dried out pastas and sandwiches under heat lamps. Sat down ordered beers reviewed menu. Service very slow. Table ordered 3 beers and mixed drink beers took awhile 10 minutes. Ready to leave at that point. Mixed drink arrived a few minutes later. At that point asked for check n to go cups.  Waited 6 minutes. And then shorted a cup. Wife and I combined our beers just to move on and not wait longer. Ate at Demos last night and that was good.

reviews.name: Sue Z.
reviews.review: Meh.Stopped for a few drinks to watch some football.  They were out of bud light and Blue Moon draft at 3pm.  Excuse me - but these are not beers a bar should run out of...these are not special brews at all.  And on a Sat during SEC games?  Smooth move Exlax.Also- the bathrooms were filthy and the service was subpar.  How can you not know what you have on draught?So-  in a word- skip this place.

reviews.name: Jason C.
reviews.review: I truly hate offering up bad reviews, yet I must say I was incredibly underwhelmed by Fuse. Really trendy look and feel. I'd much rather have good food instead of a hipster cool look. Insanely overpriced and the service was vey slow. A $15 cheesesteak sandwich ... on toasted loaf bread. Really? No flavor. Small portions on the sandwich. Huge prices. My buddy echoed the same sentiment about his food. Low on taste and high on price.

reviews.name: April S.
reviews.review: The wings are big and flavorful, the banana dessert we had was "ok", the service was mediocre. The atmosphere is nice, lots of tv's. I would eat here again, but there was nothing fantastic about it.

reviews.name: Colleen C.
reviews.review: If I could this place less than 1 star I would. 40 minute wait for a wilted salad and "homemade" chicken noodle soup from a can. Overpriced and poorly executed.

reviews.name: Calyn B.
reviews.review: Went to get a drink with a friend and sat at the table for about 10 minutes before a waiter showed up. When we finally were able to order, the waiter was in such a rush to leave the table that he didn't hear the end of my order. I ordered the rootbeer float but I wanted it with the beer...another server brings out a glass with ice cream and a rootbeer. I tell him that is not what I ordered and he replied that he could not fix it and I had to tell my waiter. We sit around for about 15 minutes and the waiter never returns. I'm not normally the person to get up and leave but that is what ended up happening. Horrible service for my friend and I on her birthday. 10/10 would not recommend.

reviews.name: Kevin H.
reviews.review: Very disappointed.  While they are busy, not "slammed"...service was poor....15 min to get greeted and order drinks...watched a number of other tables go through the same.   Nobody here seems to operate with a sense of urgency.  Have 4 kids...2 adults...out of kids menus....35 min in and we've seen the waitress twice.  Stay away....the only reason they are in business is the guaranteed business from the hotel...and yes they do have lots of TVs for sports.    If we hadn't already committed 1 hour of our life in the wait...we would've left.

reviews.name: Kurt R.
reviews.review: This place is not a destination.  This is a high priced hotel sports bar.  If you are staying at the hotel and don't want to drive anywhere then this is your place. The food and service are ok and the atmosphere is decent.  It's expensive though.  If I were staying at the hotel with no car then I would go back here. To make a special trip to go there, no way.

reviews.name: Tom G.
reviews.review: The wait staff knows they have a captive audience so they pay little attention to whether or not the guests like their food or drink! The first time we went there the food was bad and the next time we went my margarita tasted like a science experiment! Pay for a taxi and go off property.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: Not much to say, really.PROS:+ a gazillion TVs+ lots of space+ convenient if you're staying in OprylandCONS:- like everything else in Opryland, hideously overpriced (e.g., $16 for 12 wings, though they were decent-sized)During the US-Germany match, there were hundreds of FBLA high school kids yelling and having a blast. Once the game was over, the place cleared out in about 2 minutes.

reviews.name: Neal E.
reviews.review: I watched part of the half time show and the second half of Super Bowl XLVII from the Fuse. I stayed at the Gaylord Opryland for a customer event - they had reserved the Fuse Sports Bar for the event.The place is pretty large - lots of seating - both at the bar and tables throughout the bar. And their are lots of flat panel HDTVs throughout the place - as well as several HD projectors.Food was good - we had a buffet - the mexican options for making your own Nachos were good - as were the chicken wings.Service was very attentive!

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: After a couple visits during a conference at Gaylord Opryland Hotel, it's easy to say this is one of the better restaurant/bar options on-site. It's a sports bar with a full bar and a menu full of burgers, salads, wings, and appetizers. For lunch, it was a place to chill out for a conversation or watch sports on one of the many TVs. After dinner, it was a bar to crowd around and let the company pay for drinks.I tried the Three Alarm Fire Burger for lunch. The 1/3 lb. beef burger comes with Pepper Jack Cheese, Jalapenos, and Green Chili Sauce, but it was made even better by upgrading to the Dante's Inferno version which comes with Dante's Inferno sauce. The waitress was helpful and brought extra on the side for dipping. 4 stars for the burger, but only 2 stars for the "Wrinkle" Fries which were simply old fries.During a late night drinking binge I ordered sliders. The bartender asked if I wanted them Coney or Chicago. I said Coney which apparently means they are Hot Dog Sliders covered in Chili, Cheese, and Onions. Good thing I was drunk because those "sliders" sucked.So, why four stars? Because I went twice and had a good time both visits. Compared to some of the other options at Gaylord then Fuse will do just fine if you aren't willing to leave the reservation and head downtown.

reviews.name: Timothy L.
reviews.review: If you're at the Gaylord and can't get away to downtown, this will do as a sport's bar in-a-pinch. Otherwise, the prices are way too high for the choices offered in both food and drink categories. Yes, it's a bar in a high-end hotel, but given the niche it attempts to fill, Fuse should be a much better bargain.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: So the interior makes you feel like you're in a night club.  The menu was really limited and pricey.  They do have a ton of TV's but the location of them is awkard I would not go here to watch a game

reviews.name: MITCH S.
