reviews.review: The place is very very noisy. We ordered a humus appetizer and was told they ran out. We have been waiting for over 20 minutes for a hamburger. Actually the humus did arrive along with the mediocre meal. Not on must come back list.

reviews.name: Megan B.
reviews.review: Very disappointing.  The wait at lunch was so interminable they ended up comping us only 25% of the meal and desserts to go (which only extended our misery).  Mediocre food.  Listless service. Server didn't seem to care. Not even a spoon with the soup (which took forever to get while the soup cooled)...Pick a different spot.

reviews.name: Stephen M.
reviews.review: Came in for lunch with my brother on a football Sunday.  Plenty of flat screens in a modern, airy, non-sports dive atmosphere.  Their bar seems to have an extensive beer, wine, and liquors' menu, though we didn't partake.  They have a relatively straightforward menu with limited options, but the chili and nachos were tasty and plentiful.  The salads (caesar and side) were ordinary.  The service was almost noon-existent, though the staff was very apologetic.  If staying at the Gaylord, it's a decent option for watching a game, but I wouldn't drive out of my way to go there.

reviews.name: Tina W.
reviews.review: Our food took 50 minutes to arrive,  my brother came in and his was to the table in less than 10 min. The workers all looked confused the entire time we were there. Upon returning to our table, he stopped to assist another employee waving all our CC's in the air.  It was ridiculous!! Horrible.  My daughter with us has a degree in restaurant management and is a culinary artist and she stated that the place will not make it!

reviews.name: Linda S.
reviews.review: Chop Chop Salad is a No No! Dressing is one of the oiliest and lacks flavor! Chicken is optional and arrived cold and pulled style without any seasoning or taste!

reviews.name: Gant P.
reviews.review: Went to have a beer with my wife.  Sat promptly.  Waited 5 minutes.  No waiter stopped by.  A table of 7 sat next to us.  Within 30 seconds a waiter stopped and took their drink order.  Sadly my wife and I got no service so left.

reviews.name: Pauline E.
reviews.review: The service is really poor - we had to ask for napkins, we had to wait for forks to eat our food after our food was delivered,  waitress never checked on us after the food was served.   The wings were pretty good,  but the salad was not - the lettuce was watery/ soggy, chips were stale.  We won't be back!

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: Service was ok, very pricey place to drink, lots of tv's, but definitely not meant for nashvillians, this ones for the tourists and their pocket books!

reviews.name: Mark G.
reviews.review: My wife and I ordered the wings with traditional hot sauce and garlic Parmesan. They were un-eatable. They were not crispy and the flavoring was over the top salty. The service was slow. There are a lot of tv's so I guess that is a plus. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. The main focus should be the food not the trendy hipster design.

reviews.name: Rick D.
reviews.review: They have great potato soup, but for a sports bar there chicken wings suck, tasted precooked and buried in not so good sauce, service not great

reviews.name: Brittani H.
reviews.review: Meh. I've had better sports bar food. Great place to watch March Madness, as I am a huge basketball fan. I ordered the turkey BLT, but my dad ate most of it. Turkey had a weird crust around it...ewwwhhhh. Can't believe this restaurant got 3 stars most of the time..wouldn't recommend. Better restaurants in the resort.

reviews.name: C D.
reviews.review: My friend and I came in one afternoon this week, and the food came out very slow. It took about 20-30 minutes to get our appetizers, which were cheese fries. It shouldn't take that long to make an appetizer of cheese fries, and they came out cold.  The cheese was not even melted.  Then the wings we ordered came out cold and my Turkey sandwich and chips came out with fries. They did replace the wings and brought the chips, but then it took another 5-10 minutes to get some ranch sauce.  I like fries, I'm not that mad I got fries instead of chips. No big deal, but it's the point that the order took longer than it should have, was wrong, and not heated. Probably will never come here again.

reviews.name: Shannon F.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed this place.This place reminds me of Vegas- Ultra, modern ambiance-dark dimmed purple, blue and black neon lighting throughout creating a very club like feel-plasma t.v.s mounted on just about every wall and not to mention, it is also extremely spacious with more than enough seating. I sat at the bar the 2 times I came here. They have  a basic selection of items to choose from with nothing really unique but all quite appealing.The first time I was here I ordered the Mushroom Swiss burger (protein style) with no bread and the chipotle mayo on the side. It also came with Fry's that I did not try.Took a few to receive my food, though it arrived looking quite temptacious. The burger patty was quite large and the Swiss cheese and grilled onions was smothered on there. Everything tasted extremely good, however, it was the grilled onions that were just way to greasy. I also put a little of the chipotle mayo on their (which I usually never do) and it tasted fantastic!I came back here another night with one of my coworkers and had a few glasses of merlot wine,which really wasn't a bad wine at all, and the service was extremely entertaining and friendly to add.Overall, the atmosphere is lively and entertaining however, not exactly kid appealing. The food wasn't spectacular though, still delicious and for the most part, I was impressed with the service.I would definitely go back again : )

reviews.name: Jeff C.
reviews.review: Recently at the Gaylord for a conference and decided to have lunch at Fuse with others from the conference. Food was fair and certainly not worth what they charge. Worse was some of the members of our party did not receive their lunch at all. They ordered at the same time and 50 minutes later they did not receive their food. Management did not seem to really care.

reviews.name: Seema P.
reviews.review: I've been here years ago at night for dancing and had a great time with the DJ and the bar service.  I recently returned with my husband for a late lunch fix.  I was disappointed they wouldn't let us order to go at the front and we had to walk in.  With the amount of time it took to get any attention, we figured we might as well sit and eat or else we'll end up standing around forever for our order.  We had the baked potato soup and the nachos.  Soup was delicious but it got cold quick and had a lot of cheese in it.  Nachos were a huge plate.  I asked for black beans to replace the chili.  I think they gave what was equivalent to 1 tablespoon of black beans.  Given that my nachos were skimped on so badly with the toppings, I had to knock down the star rating.

reviews.name: Quontay T.
reviews.review: Was super hungry when I came in for lunch and was excited for the shrimp tacos but when they arrived I was in disbelief. For $18 I had just order a sample in the form of 4 literally bite sized tacos. They were good but the biggest tease of my food life. Of your coming for a game it's great as they have over 100 TVs there (no exaggeration) but I would eat before hand.

reviews.name: Lily M.
reviews.review: I tried this place out while staying at the Gaylord one weekend.  Out of all of the spots in the hotel, Fuse is the best for a "club" type feel.  You can dance and have great drinks while listening to really good music. They even have tv's set up all around for game watching, as well as music videos.  I went on a Saturday night and it was not half full.I look at this place as a spot to go chill out at, but do not expect it to be a hype club, because there aren't enough people in it for that.

reviews.name: Anne L.
reviews.review: The service was great, sat in the bar area however the food was a different story. I ordered the Chinese Chop Salad, sounded delish but wasn't that great. First of all the chicken was cold & second they put a lot of the chicken grizzle in with it. It almost seemed like it was left over from a rotisserie chicken. There was barely any cabbage & some of the onions seemed old. For a $17.00 salad I expected much more. The salads at McDonld's are ten times better!

reviews.name: Steve H.
reviews.review: It is a great place to watch sports, but I would choose another venue for food.  Minimal food choices and over priced.  Service by the bar was adequate and drinks were ok.

reviews.name: Jan J.
reviews.review: mediocre service.  too bad there aren't more daytime options at this resort.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: When I see sports bar I am immediately interested.  I needed a place to grab a drink or two and eat dinner after the convention so I strolled into Fuse to see what was going on.  The place is not what you think of as a sports bar with loud TVs, lots of dudes sitting around with buckets of beer, hoots and hollers when someone scores, etc.  This place had tons of TVs for sure, but think nightclub.  There were red lights, sleek furniture and bar area, just very very clubby.  What an interesting combo.  At the point I was there it was dead so I just posted up at the bar to watch racehub to get my NASCAR info fix.  Bonus points for having closed captioning since TVs weren't up.  Also bonus points for Journey "Ask the Lonely" playing!!  I ordered a salad for dinner that had salami and other meats, goat cheese maybe, tomatoes, etc.  They don't have a vinaigrette as a dressing option but they will bring you oil and vinegar for you to make your own.  It was solidly meh really.  Not bad, totally edible, but not something you are going to want over and over again.  Wine pour, however, was excellent.I went back the next evening with some coworkers for drinks and it was definitely louder music, more clubby, but not too bad.  The martinis were great once I specified extra DIRRRRTY.  The Jager bombs were mixed all together instead of being separate (aka the bomb part).  And the evening ended mind erased.  Not bad Fuse, not bad!  So the verdict: don't really come here to eat, but definitely come here to drink and catch up on your sports.

reviews.name: Amber C.
reviews.review: I have been here twice now and I really enjoyed the elevated sports bar atmosphere however the service was slow and food and drinks way overpriced. I ordered the chips/salsa and guacamole which was definitely NOT fresh and they give you a small ramekin the size that you normally get ketchup in for a hamburger! Not enough to share which is what we had planned. Then I ordered the pork nachos which did not specify that these were small or appetizer size but when they arrived and she placed them in front of me, I almost thought it was a joke. 4 miniature tacos laid before me, not even 2 inches long a piece. I will admit while the pork was very good and the cilantro lime sauce that was on them was tasty, I was disappointed that these weren't more filling. I honestly think as a consumer they could give you 2 larger tacos with the same amount of ingredients with maybe a side of slaw (even in a small ramekin) and customers would feel more satisfied. If anything they should distinguish that they are mini tacos somewhere on the menu so you know not to order them if you are really hungry.

reviews.name: Bonnie C.
reviews.review: Fuse Sports BarThis past Saturday I was attending a Rodan & Fields training event, and lunch was provided. Because there were around 1,000 people in attendance and new the box lunches would be consumed at any available spots, one of my consultants and I wanted to grab some lunch with "real food" so we could discuss some of the events of the morning.  Fuse Sports Bar was close by.We entered the restaurant just as it opened at 11am, and as we entered, I was immediately impressed.  It had an ultra modern feel and TVs were everywhere you looked.  There was not a bad seat in the house.  A college football game was playing with sound - always a plus in the Fall.  The decor was fabulous.I've traveled a lot in my life and attended more conventions and trade shows than any one person should have to endure, so I've eaten in many hotel restaurants.  This place felt like a regular sports bar with pretty normal prices.I ordered a blackened cheeseburger with slaw  and fries.  It was superb! Not just ok, not just good, but superb!  I am from here in Nashville, and I know I will make a special trip back to Fuse Sports Bar to have that burger again.There was one thing that was highly odd about this place.  All of the bathrooms were single stall private bathrooms.  Typically that is a very good thing.  But all of them were unisex rooms.  In what world is it ever a good idea to have males and females utilizing the same restrooms in, of all places, a bar??? It's ok for the guys, but for women, this would disgust me!  The restrooms were clean, but again, I went just as it opened, not later in the day.  This concept seemed very gross to me, even as a guy.

reviews.name: Matt U.
reviews.review: A friend and I went in for a bite to eat after going to see ICE.  Amanda served us some delicious margaritas and Jack n' Sour's.  My friend wasn't expecting a $3 charge for making her margaritas frozen, which I would think it would be less confusing if that was mentioned while taking the order so patrons would know they add more alcohol to compensate for the frozen ice instead of wondering why each drink has $3 charges to it on the bill later. Overall a pretty good atmosphere.  My friends food first found it's way around to other tables before making it to ours.  I ordered the tequila-lime wings and they were so good.  I highly recommend trying them. I will definitely be back to try some more of their food.

reviews.name: jennie g.
reviews.review: Trapped in Opryland for a conference and surrounded by boring, overpriced food. Needed a close place for lunch meeting with colleagues so we went to the lunch buffet. The waitress was fabulous- the only reason for the 2 extra stars- the $15 buffet was a small and random assortment of starches: potatoes, rice, pasta, white bread with sliced processed turkey as the last option. Oh, there was some sad looking cauliflower, too.The salad was just a bowl of lettuce with one garlicy dressing option.But, as I said, the server was great. Understood we had alot to talk about and kept our drinks full and did not try to rush us out. Also welcome was that we were not subjected to the 24/7 "holiday" music that pervades the place from Nov 1 and on.

reviews.name: Shawn H.
reviews.review: Pros:-Great atmosphere. -Fancier than average sports bar.-Great managers and waiters. Cons:-When busy, staff gets side tracked. -Understaffed for the square footage and amounts of large tables.We had a great time here to start. The atmosphere is wonderful and they have numerous TVs with a wide range of sporting event on. We had a problem and the problem was resolved. However, an order of nachos took 4 attempts to get out and they still weren't right. Had a plate of nachos sent back to be reheated after the food had been out, never got the nachos back. The managerial staff was very nice and comped the meal and drinks, but some went without food. Managerial staff saved this place.

reviews.name: Craig B.
reviews.review: Nothing really good to say about this place. Was told our wait would be 1 hour, it turned out to be almost 2 hours. Once we finally got seated it took 15 minutes for anyone to come take our order. I ordered the sloppy joe which was OK...that's why they get two stars. The service on the other had was horrid. With too many negatives with the service I'll just say I won't be back at this restaurant.

reviews.name: John H.
reviews.review: Really good wings and excellent Margaritas.

reviews.name: Lisa M.
reviews.review: Oddly very few restaurants are open with 2 large conventions in the hotel. Service...well they are doing the best they can.  Food was fine, but man they had a lot of angry people. Very poor planning.

reviews.name: Adam M.
reviews.review: Wow this was TERRIBLE! It was croweded but not unmanagably so. However, the service was horrible. We went long, long stretches without seeing a waiter. We ordered nachos and they came out bland, with cold cheese sauce. COLD. We sent them back, and new nachos came out... COLD. AGAIN. Like all of the Gaylord resort they take advantage of a captive audience with BADLY overpriced food and indifferent to rude service. Get out of the Gaylord and walk a block or two to eat.

reviews.name: Marissa G.
reviews.review: We came here for dinner and drinks, and then again for breakfast all you can eat buffet.For breakfast and for dinner the prices for food and drinks were expected for this atmosphere. If and when we stay at Opryland Hotel again, I am sure we will return.  Just got to make sure i bring my check book. lol

reviews.name: Michelle U.
reviews.review: By far the most bland nachos I have ever eaten!!!! Waiter could not have cared less about the service, or so it seemed. Overpriced! One order of craptastic nachos. A dozen wings and 2 sweet tea's and the total was 48$!!! Never would go here again!!

reviews.name: kathy a.
reviews.review: T he salads were good, the shrimp with wing sauce was not good.. fried medium thick breaded shrimp drowning in wing sauce.  I heard the drinks are the cheapest on the property.  This entire place is expensive.  Drinks at the Falls are $13.00 for a rum and coke.. yikes. We had a catered dinner at the atrium and it was so average.  and forget getting the people a vegan lunch.. the kitchen could not handle it.  They were so polite about the horrible service. Anyway the property is very expensive.. Go next door to the mall to macaroni grill for the same food at 1/2 price. the waiter /bartender was super!

reviews.name: Julia S.
reviews.review: Great Nashville music!

reviews.name: Jon N.
reviews.review: The food is really not too bad - It's Pub Fare, after all - but the service stinks.  They are friendly, but every single time we ordered they made mistakes.  AND the dishes comes out on top of one another.  Definitely order appetizers and then wait until you're finished - or near finished - to order entrees.  Hot Dogs - $13Looks great and if you're into sports, there are a ton of televisions.  Some good live music, too.

reviews.name: D M.
reviews.review: Excellent service. Turkey burger with mushrooms and Swiss cheese was good. The quesadillas were awesome. Keep in mind that wait time fluctuates and because it is located in a resort, expect to pay a little more.

reviews.name: Lynn C.
reviews.review: This bar definitely has a smell....like someone dumped beer all over the place and then let it seep into the cracks.  I went in the afternoon for an early dinner (soup and salad) and sat at the bar.  There were about 20 customers and only one bartender so service was a little slow.  The lady who brought out my food didn't bring me a spoon and when I asked for salad dressing she said it was already in there...but I never found it.  I eventually had to walk around to track someone down to get those things for me.  The food was good, nothing special, but pretty good.  Everyone that works there seems to hate their job and makes it known to each other as well as the customers which doesn't add to the experience.  This is your typical touristy sports bar so don't expect too much!

reviews.name: Rick W.
reviews.review: They had Guinness on tap and great chicken wings. The caesar salad was good and more than one person could eat. I would go back!

reviews.name: vimal p.
reviews.review: Wow I cant belive Im the first person to yelp this place!Fuse was rented out for a private party so I cant comment on how it is on a regular night.It was a really nice place, reminds me of a vegas / LA style club, really nice inside, we were hungry so we ordered off the bar menu, (kitchen closes at 12) .We got the following, -shrimp corn dogs (3/4)- veg spring rolls (4/5) sauce was solid- kobe pita pockets (4/5) herd these were hella good- chicken flatbread pizza (4/5) yum!- truffles on a stick (4/5) choc overload!!awesome presentation of each item, it was kinda pricey (approx $80) but it was well worth it cause we were super hungry!

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: We were pleasantly surprised by this place. We were looking for a place to grab a late lunch and not many of therestaurants are open in the Opry hotel at 3pm. One member of our party has to eat gluten free and they were very accommodating! Our server was very friendly and double checked a few items the kitchen sent out to make sure they were in fact gluten free. The prices were average for an Opry restaurant and the food was excellent. We would definitely eat here again.

reviews.name: Jitan K.
reviews.review: Cool club good music, good food!

reviews.name: Sharon S.
reviews.review: This is Nashville's best-kept club secret.  Dress up and go, while there is still room to get in.  Once people find this place it's going to be tough to get a good seat.  Go for a place to sit or stand where you can see the dancers.  Try the food treats: truffles on a stick with champagne worked for us.  Bonus: valet parking is free.

reviews.name: Phil S.
reviews.review: I don't know why but this is the 1st time I've been to this WH it DEFINITELY won't be the last. Watching the cook staff work is a show in itself. The place is rocking and every order is out quick! The place is clean, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food was excellent. Unlike some other Waffle Houses I've been to this store is fabulous.

reviews.name: Celia T.
reviews.review: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Food is filling and the location is convenient. The servers there were nice, albiet the service was a bit slow when we came. Got the stead for 10 bucks which was a good deal and the bacon patty melt was solid. For the price, you can't beat having a great hot meal. Its not the cleanest and its not the nicest place, but you go there to get some quick hot food.

reviews.name: Bruce K.
reviews.review: It's hard to believe, but I've landed at the same Waffle House again. Last time, I was just driving through Nashville. This time, I'm actually here working for a couple of weeks and my hotel is around the corner.Night and day, comparing this Waffle House to the one on Elm Hill. A much friendlier and happier staff. Cleaner tables. And the food was cooked better.I usually have the same thing at a Waffle House - the All Star Breakfast. Eggs over easy, wheat toast dry, hash browns with cheese (covered) and with ham. It was all perfect today. Exactly as it's supposed to be at a Waffle House.Yay! I'm a fan!

reviews.name: Tichapiwa J.
reviews.review: The staff too loud and tables not cleaned the bill was rather too high for the quality of food and service I have not been to a Waffle House in a long time dang they messed up my day

reviews.name: Brian B.
reviews.review: Cheap waffles that are pretty good.  They also serve burgers, hash browns, etc.  Best feature is it's open 24 hours.

reviews.name: Eboni S.
reviews.review: I mean... It's Waffle House. I eat this about once every few months.  I'm never disappointed.

reviews.name: John E.
reviews.review: This place completely hit the spot.  Food was awesome, our waitress was genuinely kind and attentive, and the staff worked together to make a busy morning not so hectic.  Great job!  This is how breakfast should be every morning.

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: I've always liked Waffle House. This week had a early call time for work. Just before 6 am i call so i could just pick it up. Ordered 8 bacon egg cheese biskets. They were just finishing up as i arrived. They were awesome. Great job to the fast and friendly crew.

reviews.name: Michael J.
reviews.review: The food is excellent. The staff was awesome, professional, and friendly. I'd usually reserved four stars for high end restaurants. However, the personality of the staff was so friendly that I can't help but priase them. Really liked the jalapeño biscuits. Service was fast. And even though they were busy, the whole staff stopped long enough for a picture.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: president in town had traffic stopped so i made the best of it and stopped here at waffle house. older staff here but the omelette and bacon were cooked perfectly and exactly what  i asked for. no better bacon than crispy waffle house bacon and the omelette was light and fluffy. very well done. so im giving a thumbs up to eating here during the day with this staff.

reviews.name: D J.
reviews.review: Great place. Great staff. Just what the doctor ordered after a long flight into Nashville late at night.

reviews.name: David T.
reviews.review: For a Waffle House, this is 5 stars. They have a very friendly staff. The place is clean. The food didn't take long at all. And it was delicious. It satisfied my late night craving.

reviews.name: Scott C.
reviews.review: Given the very standard set up of all Waffle House restaurants, I think what can distinguish them is their cleanliness and their staff.   We had breakfast food at lunch time on a Sunday.  We seem to get their after a rush as initially I noted several tables needed busing and there was only one open spot.  After we sat down they did catch up on clean up and cleaned up all the open tables and one of the staff went on the mop the floor of the entire restaurant while we were there.   Our helper seemed tired but was extremely friendly and helpful with out order and our service.  She offered us an extra waffle, I think because she became slightly confused about our order.  We would not have noticed she was confused, so were surprised when she offered to extra waffle.  We ended up declining because we had plenty of food.They had plenty of staff on hand so everything was made quickly.  She gave us a waffle first to have like an appetizer and but the rest of the food came very soon after.  The food is very basic and was appropriately cooked but I would not really say anything stood out as being better than expected.  You get what you would expect for breakfast food at a Waffle House.

reviews.name: Alex W.
reviews.review: Great early morning stop before catching a flight at the Nashville Intl Airport.  It was very clean and the service was very friendly.

reviews.name: Kiko' N.
reviews.review: Good place to eat before go to air port I highly recomemded. Nice and hard workers are here!!!!!

reviews.name: Bianca W.
reviews.review: Cheap and quick. 4 people ate well with drinks for $25. Unheard of in CA. I had my hashbrowns ALL THE WAY except peppered. The waitress looked at me like I was crazy. I thought it would be the norm. Very good. And the waffles are nice and light.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: I can't believe I'm giving a Waffle House 4 stars. Everything was just spot on. The coffee was hot and fresh, the service was friendly and had just the right amount of personality. My wife and I stopped by for some breakfast on a lazy Saturday. We had initially intended to go to Cracker Barrel, but didn't want to wait 45 minutes for a table. We sat down immediately at Waffle House and were on our way having finished a tasty meal before our table would've been ready at Cracker Barrel. I have many fond memories of coffee and hashbrowns at Waffle House during my college days. If you're similarly nostalgic, this is one of the better Waffle Houses I've dined at...give it a shot and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Dale H.
reviews.review: This is a great Waffle House. If you're visiting and have a midday flight out of Nashville, this is the place to go. The staff are friendly and entertaining, the food is great tasting and hits the spot for breakfast. We've only had the waffles, but that's what you should order!  Get in early because it is small and gets crowded.

reviews.name: Peter D.
reviews.review: Try to say hi before they do! That is a fun game

reviews.name: Zoraida K.
reviews.review: I have been coming here forever, or at least since 2002 when it became a kitchen away from kitchen at the end of an hour commute, conveniently located near my office. I would leave early to avoid traffic, but that left me hungry, needing more coffee, and at the office too early. So I became acquainted with this eatery and know all the morning staff by name, as they do mine. My coffee is served as I walk in the door and they yell their "Hello-Welcome to Waffle House" with my name at the end.The food is served hot, fresh and the coffee is refilled almost too regularly. What's not to love?

reviews.name: W. N.
reviews.review: Don't set your expectations too high people.  After all, this is a Waffle House.  Staff is engaging and easy to talk to.  Also, every WH I go to there is ALWAYS, always, always some sort of drama behind the counter.  Servers getting catty or getting gossipy.  I had a front row seat to this and it's like the staff doesn't understand the customers can watch all this take place.Triple order hash browns scattered and two eggs overhard.  Nothing like a gut bomb before getting on the plane going home.Two stars for the simple, fast breakfasr.  Another for the excellent people watching behind the counter with the sweet-as-molasses-Southern Drawl.Right down the street from the airport!  Winning!

reviews.name: Seema P.
reviews.review: This was my first Waffle House experience ever and I didnt know it was so stinkin cheap!!  That chocolate chip waffle sure was super delicious.  Cant wait to go back and try has browns next

reviews.name: Nathan G.
reviews.review: Fantastic service (with smiles), excellent food & very CLEAN! Best Waffle House I've been to.

reviews.name: Katie S.
reviews.review: Love love love this WH. Mostly because of the staff. Super friendly and welcoming. Funny and interactive. I look forward to coming here every time I visit Nashville.

reviews.name: Kat G.
reviews.review: The food is good, but the staff is what made this place something to remember. Once we walked in, it felt like we've been there before. Sat at the counter and right away this lovely older lady was asking "What would you like to drink hun?" I ordered a coffee and it was always getting refilled. Being from out of town, we some how started talking to every person who worked there about how our stay was, where we were from, how their experience was visiting Los Angeles, and just a lot of random things that made breakfast comfortable and enjoyable. No one was stuck up, rude, or just working and focusing on rushing around like you might see at Denny's in LA. They had great personalities, and since the stove is right across from the counter, you can just interact with everyone easily. I can't wait to go back there again!

reviews.name: Daniel M.
reviews.review: Love eating here. They can be busy at times so it may take a few minutes for your order to be called. However, the employees are very nice and food is what you'd expect.....delicious!!

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: I love  eating ribeye steaks medium well at Waffle House you just can't beat the price they're good and juicy fresh off the grill love it.

reviews.name: M H.
reviews.review: Best waffle I've had from a Waffle House! Super fluffy and thick YUM! Super fast and friendly service too.

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: If you are in the South, this is an institution!  This particular location was across from my hotel so I decided to drop in after a 3-4 year absence.  The cheesy eggs, toast and grits totally hit the spot.  Fresh, hot and good... just what my tummy needed after 4-5 hours of in air turbulence and roasted peanuts.   Order was up in under 5 minutes, service was very attentive an the price was good.  Yup, Ill be back!

reviews.name: Andrew O.
reviews.review: This is the best waffle house is Nashville in my opinion. Friendly staff, and they really want to take care of ya. Toddle house omelet w/bacon, smothered, covered, and chunked hashbrowns FTW! So freaking good. Leah was an awesome server.

reviews.name: Jessie G.
reviews.review: Quick stop or here to kill time, always friendly always hot coffee.

reviews.name: Sonya N.
reviews.review: I ate breakfast (omelette) there on Sat., Oct. 13, 2012 and got food poisoning. The symptoms started almost immediately and lasted through Thurs., Oct. 18. I missed 4 days from work. Headache, backache, stomachache, nausea, diarrhea.

name: El Paisa

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Straightforward and perfect come to mind when I think of El Paisa.  Simply put, it is the best taco stand I've had the pleasuring of visiting in all of Nashville, and I've been to a few or more. There's so much thought put behind these simple ingredients, that the sum of it's part equals something remarkable.  Let's start with how perfectly grilled the tortillas are.  Their cooked enough to where you get a crispy texture, yet it's not over-crispy.  The carnitas are fried golden brown and have crispy exterior.  The pastor is spicy, you get enough heat, but it doesn't take your head off.  I saved the best for last and that is the barbacoa.  Imagine the most tender, melt in your mouth pot roast, take that and multiply it by a 100 and you have the barbacoa at El  Paisa.  A touch of cilantro and grilled onions rounds out these beauties.  You're served with 2 different sauces and slices of radishes to cleanse your palette.The stand is located in a parking lot with a discount tobacco shop.

reviews.name: Joel P.
reviews.review: Traditional lonchera mobile. Tacos with your choice of carnes. Lengua al pastor carnitas, buche, barbacoa, chicharones, and asada. Burritos, quesadillas, tortas, gorditas are also available.  They also feature mariscos tostadas and cocktails. Ceviche, pulpo, camerones, pescado. Good quick and cheap. $1.25 for a taco.

reviews.name: Jeremiah W.
reviews.review: The beef tongue tacos are excellent here, highly recommend them. I love this little place.

reviews.name: Pamela N.
reviews.review: Had a really good experience here! We ordered the Barbacoa Burrito and the El Pastor Burrito ($5ea). They were really tasty, but probably too much food for lunch. Need to try the Tacos for lunch, but this was our first foray into eating at one of these Mexican food stands and we were well pleased. I only rated it a 4 star because we have nothing to compare it against. When we have tried a few more places, I may change my rating.

reviews.name: Joseph E.
reviews.review: Really REALLY good, I found this place on accident and had to try it; I can only speak for the tacos and burritos. I highly recommend the pastor tacos :P

address: Gallatin Pike N at One Mile ParkwayNashville, TN 37115

reviews.name: Heather J.
reviews.review: For a late-night spot willing to serve a hungry crew of inebriated partiers, Caeser's didn't disappoint. I think there were about eight of us desperately hoping our Uber driver would take us somewhere decent. Thankfully, he did.  The pizza was delicious, the server was willing to split the check (which some people in our party were incapable of figuring out on their own), and no one complained about us dancing in the dining room.Best part? I evidently dropped my license there and Shellie found me on Facebook to return it to me. She was even willing to mail it to me!  How's that for service?  I'm impressed!

reviews.name: Kristin S.
reviews.review: We ordered food off of Grub Hub and had it delivered. The food is delicious!! The large Calzone is really large and cooked perfectly. If we lived in this area it would be a place we visited regularly.

reviews.name: Phil C.
reviews.review: Might possibly be the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. I ordered a pizza and then shortly thereafter called to cancel the order thinking everything was fine. Much to my dismay, they continued to charge my credit card. When I called to inquire about the incident, I spoke to the manager, Mike, who questioned whether I was "drunk and didn't remember eating the pizza?"  I could not believe my ears. After this, he sent me a copy of the receipt that a "mystery" person had signed, and not only was I charged for a pizza I did not order, the receipt shows that the person who signed (I imagine the driver) gave himself a generous $3 tip on top of the free pizza he received. I have called repeatedly and the staff answering the phone are never helpful as now, mike, the manager does not even answer or return my calls. This has been an ongoing issue for three weeks now! Please do yourself a favor and do not order from here. Terrible service, and from what I read from previous reviews, awful food to boot. Terrible, sad and unfortunate that this theft continues.

reviews.name: Marion A.
reviews.review: I was a little afraid , I order my meal then read the reviews but  I was very happy to find I had great service.. The delivery was fast and the pizza and salad very good!!!

reviews.name: Johnny T.
reviews.review: Nashville is still growing. In a year (hopefully sooner), there will be more options for late(r) night quick eating Downtown but until there are, there's Caesar's. A staple of post-room service munchies at the local hotels, Caesar's has the pizza thing down to a science. On a Wednesday night that had me running from pillar to post, I needed food for the safety of all around me. Striking out nearly everywhere within a four-block radius, I went with Caesar's. A 10" supreme pizza sounded just right. What did not sound just right were the fees associated with delivering it to my hotel. I saved nearly four dollars (not including the tip I'd had to give to the delivery guy) by hoofing it and picking it up myself. I understand that everyone has a bottom line and that businesses are in the practice of making money but when you've practically cornered the market, think of the future. When there are other choices around, brand familiarity might not be enough to keep you afloat.I picked the pie up, received a couple of grunts from the guys behind the counter, paid my money, and went off in to the night. The pizza was what you expected: cheesy, not-too-greasy, decently-adorned with pepperoni and the (standard) rest. It was enough to fill me up (of course I ate the whole thing; I hadn't eaten in eight hours) but it didn't send me in to flights of ecstasy. Points, though, for eating a pizza late(r) at night and not being plagued by indigestion. #oldmanproblems

reviews.name: Noell B.
reviews.review: We walked in and it was empty, so of course you almost want to turn around and walk out. So glad we didn't. It was fantastic!!

reviews.name: Chad H.
reviews.review: This place was recommended by our hotel front desk for good pizza. We arrived at 4:30 pm. You would expect decent service when you are the only people in the place. The pizza was ok at best. The waitress was a complete air head barely knew her name. We ordered a pizza with sausage, onion and green pepper for the waitress to come back to tell us no green pepper. But my wife's salad came out with green pepper on it. I would not recommend this place to anyone!!!!!!

reviews.name: Ken A.
reviews.review: The customer service has improved since by last review. I would recommend Caesar's for lunch.

reviews.name: Alicia W.
reviews.review: My group of six walked right in and were greeted by...no one.  We found a table easily that would accommodate our group.  After sitting for a bit I approached the only waitress in the restaurant at the register that was also busy taking phone orders to see if it was counter or table service.  She soon came back to take our order.30 minutes later my group received our orders pizza specials, calzone and hoagie.  The pizza was okay -nothing special but I was told the calzones were good.The service was slow but I can't blame the waitress since she was running the entire front of the house.  It's just too long to wait when you've only got an hour for lunch.

reviews.name: Cade C.
reviews.review: The food is OK, but the customer service is the worst.The first time I went, I didn't post a review because everyone has a bad day sometimes. The second time, I called an order in after they left a menu on my apartment door.When the girl answered the phone (the same girl from my first visit with a terrible attitude), I told her I wanted to place a delivery order. Her response: "Alright, that's fine, but hurry up." What? Are you serious? There's 7+ pizza joints in the downtown area. I chose yours over all the others to spend my money. The last thing I want is to AGAIN be treated as though it's an inconvenience for me to place an order. Anyways, I quickly told her what I wanted, she gave me the total, and hung up the phone. No "thank you", no "have a nice night", no anything. Next time, I'll give my money to someone else.

reviews.name: Clay W.
reviews.review: Great place for pizza in downtown Nashville.  It has daily lunch specials. Great place for those who work downtown and need a place within walking distance. Strengths:Pizza is fantastic. Food served quickly. Opportunities:Service not great, but not rude. More McDonalds attitude than higher end restaurants in the area. Rarely do I see a crowd there. That makes me nervous for it's future. Summary:Great place for lunch or dinner.

reviews.name: Martha N.
reviews.review: Went last week only because it's convenient to work & not because the food is good (it's just so-so). Apparently, our order was lost & we weren't even given an apology. Worse customer service EVER.

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: Work very close by for past 14 years though this place has only been open for the last 4-5 (?). Use to be a meat n three... I try it occasionally in an attempt to eat close to the office but never amazed or impressed. I would say this place is only OK. Their pizza rolls are ok but have heard rumor some of their stuff is actually frozen? Don't know for sure but wouldn't be surprised.

reviews.name: Adhiraj B.
reviews.review: This restaurant is one of the worst in Nashville. Not only did we have to wait for 45 minutes for our food, the waitress didn't even know which food we had. The food itself was alright, but it was ordinary Italian food at best.

reviews.name: Boni S.
reviews.review: Good service, quick and easy.  Food was very bland...atmosphere lacking a lot.  I would recommend this for pizza only.

reviews.name: Carol K.
reviews.review: My motto?  Go where the locals go.  So when someone piped up that we wanted pizza one night after midnight- we turned to the local person in our group who turned us on to Caesar's and their terrific pizza!We were staying at the Sheraton downtown and one call to Caesar's got us two large pizzas delivered right to the bar, piping hot in about 30 minutes.Gourmet?  Definitely not.  This is greasy, cheesy, well topped slices of America's favorite fill up food served quickly and also relatively cheaply.And what could be better than that??

reviews.name: Kristina M.
reviews.review: ( one star bc can't give ZERO STARS) Negative 3 stars!!! Customer service was horrible ( girl answering phone --- rude 2 nights in a row) Pizza was burnt ( black) !!! Called back to complain, they brought new pizza to "swap out"... First time to Nashville very disappointed ... Should of called papa johns!!!

reviews.name: Katie C.
reviews.review: This is the WORST customer service I've EVER experienced in Nashville. I tried to place a work order - 5 quick salad orders. The girl on the phone was not listening and I had to repeat information SEVERAL times. She placed me on hold in the middle of an order without any warning. I was on hold 12+ minutes. I hung up and called back. The owner answered, I explained what happened - he did NOT apologize, and when I stated that I wanted to cancel the order he said "but you already paid with two credit cards". I again asked him to cancel the orders, he said, "ok" and hung up on me. I called back, confronted him for hanging up on me, and asked that he CONFIRM that the orders were canceled. He again did not take ownership for bad customer service and bad communication, but instead blamed me. I explained that he and his employee were very rude, and that our company are loyal patrons. He yelled at me and said that they were not rude, just very busy, and then hung up. UNACCEPTABLE. Nashville is better than this. Our company is never ordering from this restaurant again.

reviews.name: Jen D.
reviews.review: Some of the best late-night food I've had in a long time. My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton and ordered from Caesar's both nights! Eggplant parm sandwiches were killer!!!  Cheese sticks, great. Do NOT get the ranch... it's disgusting and out of a bottle. I definitely recommend this place to anybody in downtown Nashville, wanting a late-night meal to soak up all that Jack. :)

reviews.name: Rebecca H.
reviews.review: The worst Veal parm I ever had! The veal was completely dried out, I guess they thought if they threw a whole pound of cheese on top it would make it better. My boy-friends spaghetti and meat balls were no better. If he wanted frozen meat balls he could have gone to the store and bought it.

reviews.name: Richard K.
reviews.review: Good pizza, nothing special but overall good.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: we went there 3 nights in a row on a holiday weekend. Does anyone know Tommy? (Sometimes goes by Tom). I've been trying to get a hold of him because he's amazing. Great service. We will go back there everytime we go to Nashville. Please refill your cheese shakers. We ate ALL the cheese.

reviews.name: Erik N.
reviews.review: This place is fine. Nothing special. If a friend at work wants to take you there and you have absolutely no better suggestions, go here- if not , look elsewhere.

reviews.name: Elizabeth E.
reviews.review: Okay, yes, I give Caesar's only two stars. BUT, if we were basing those stars on food after 2 a.m., then it would receive five stars.LOCATION: Nothing amazing - totally dead on weeknights. I wouldn't recommend eating there - I'd take it to go or have it delivered. Last time I was there waiting on a to-go order, they blew a fuse and half the restaurant's lights went out.PRICE: A little on the expensive side for what you pay for, but oh well. It could be worse.FOOD: I wasn't in a pizza or pasta mood, and instead ordered a Buffalo Chicken Salad. The salad turned out to be pretty good, actually! I knew I was not ordering fine dining, so my expectations weren't extremely high to begin with, but I was pleased when I got home and opened up the container. Tossing it into my owl bowl made it even more appealing. The bread sticks were a waste of calories :)OVERALL: Caesar's will continue to be a "go-to" in my book when I'm desperate after work or ordering something late-night. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it on a regular basis.

reviews.name: Roy H.
reviews.review: Perfectly serviceable pizza, at a reasonable price. Pasta dishes not so good. Food was delivered, arrived within a reasonable time for Saturday night.

reviews.name: Brent V.
reviews.review: ABSOLUTE worst food I have ever had.  Frozen food from costco/sams club is 10X better.  I am eating (just stopped eating because it tasted so bad) a meatlover's pizza and chicken tenders.  Dear Caesar's,How the hell do you create, deliver, and charge for food that is worse than frozen food that you can get at 7-11.I would recommend getting a cab and driving to 7-11 instead of ordering from Caesars.  What a waste of money.  If I could could attach a picture to this post it would be of an order of chicken tenders with 1 bite out of them and an entire "12 pizza with with the same.Absolutely disgusting, I'm appalled, Caesar's,  WORST FOOD I HAVE EVER ORDERED!!!  I WOULD LIKE MY $25 BACK!!!

reviews.name: Scott P.
reviews.review: Awful, do not eat at Caesar's.  I was in Baptist hospital with my wife who just had a baby through C section surgery and I couldn't leave.  The nurse's desk had a binder of menus.  I ordered delivery from Caesar's and when it showed up, I opened the styrofaom tray and there was a huge gray bug crawling on it.  I almost vomitted.  It was very gross.  I didn't want to touch any of the food.I called back to complain and get my money back.  The guy on the phone was rude to me, asked if I wanted him to send the same dish again and I said I didn't want to eat anything out of that kitchen, I was grossed out.  I didn't eat a bite of the food and wanted to return it.  I just wanted my money back.  He said the manager was not there on Sunday but he would call the manager and call me back.  He never called back so I tried again an hour later, he said he'd leave the manager a message.  Monday afternoon, no call back.  I called and got a different person who said the manager would be in later that day.  I called later, still no manager present.  I asked for the manager's name and he said Frank.  I asked for last name and he didn't even know.  He wrote my information down and said Frank would call me. It's now Wed and I have not heard since Sun night.  The people on the phone don't speak English very well and are flat out rude.  It's clear this place doesn't care about customer service.  I told the guy on the phone I was going to call the Better Business Bureau, the Health Inspector and that the nurses at Baptist hospital are removing the menu from their list and won't let patients order from there.  He didn't seem to care.  With a new baby and caring for a wife after surgery, the last thing I needed was to deal with this crap.  When i get a chance, I'll be calling the health dept to investigate them.  If they don't want to give me my $23 back, maybe it will cost them a lot more in lost business and fines.

reviews.name: Taylor Ann D.
reviews.review: Walking in this place on a Friday night and being the ONLY people in the restaurant made me wonder.  The table tops are plasticized and the decor could be Italian, Mexican, or American depending on the eye of the customer.  I was surprised though when my fettucini alfredo came out and it was pretty damn good.  My BF got a calzone, which he said was "good".  Also, the fried mushrooms were really good (and hot).  Yummy cannoli.  I'm assuming (and hoping for them) that this place is bumpin' during the lunch hours considering it is right downtown.

reviews.name: Jenn R.
reviews.review: Open late and they delivered to our hotel in good time. Cheese sticks have no taste, and the chicken calzone has cheese as the top ingrediant. Would have liked some chicken. My friend ordered canneloni, seemed to like it.Would have been better if they would have given napkins and silverware, as we do not travel with eating utensils.

reviews.name: Soukie K.
reviews.review: This restaurant is a nice little cozy place, which is just across the street from where work. I'll usually stop by and make a to go order once in a while, because their dishes are kind of expensive, especailly for some spagettii.

reviews.name: Tara M.
reviews.review: Great lunch special!!!  Get a simple gyro with fries, or try one of their delightful salads!  Just be sure to watch the prep your gyro if you get one...it's amazing how much they can cram into such a small pocket of pita!  Love this place!

reviews.name: Daniele H.
reviews.review: In my opinion this place is an unknown gem on Murfreesboro Rd. The quality of the food is excellent, and very well priced. If you like Arab food and are in the area, you can't go wrong with this no-frills little gem.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: this place was cool.i got a gyro plate (no drink) to go which came out to a little more than seven dollars after tax. it was good, and the portions were really good. it was more food than i was expecting, actually. the lamb was good, and seasoned very nicely. the rice was great, and i remember the tzatziki being pretty damn exceptional. i need to get back to this place sometime soon, i liked it!eric b

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Great local restaurant! Has all of your standard Mexican fare, great for lunch, food comes out fast. It is family owned and the staff is attentive and friendly.  Their food is similar to most Mexican restaurants around town, but I give them a five star review because their prices are low, their service is very good, the food comes out very quickly, and they do have some items on the menu that are unique. They have pork Carnitas which are very good and if you are looking for something besides your standard burrito or taco or enchilada the Carnitas are great. They make a good salsa Verde which comes with the Carnitas and there is also an enchilada Verde dish I like, although I would ask for the sour cream that comes with on the side as they are liberal with sour cream in

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: It kills me to write this. I had hopes that this could be my neighborhood favorite, being such a huge fan of Mexican food and local eateries. Unfortunately my first experience was too sub-par to draw me back.The Staff were very friendly and accommodating. It was not busy for Saturday night dinner and everything hit the table in good time. None of this matters if the food is lacking and that was the unfortunate case.I ordered a plate of enchiladas. I love spicy food and requested they be made extra spicy. I explained that I wasn't concerned with how the spice was added (add jalapenos, spicier sauce, etc) and when the server seemed to understand my request I explained, "whatever the kitchen feels will make it spicy and taste the best." I am confident there was no language barrier, which, to be honest can happen in a Mexican restaurant.What came out was bad. The tortillas were soggy and discolored, having been covered in a sauce that was absorbed by the tortillas and made mushy, like when you take leftovers home and re-heat them. Except they were cool. The chicken and steak inside were dry and bland. They had thrown some diced jalapeno into the mix inside, but just a little, providing no real spice and flavor. After attempting to choke them down for a moment I called the server over and asked for some hot salsa; not just for the heat but because they were so dry. She replied that the cook put jalapeno into them, but I explained it was not just for heat but also dryness. She brought back some spicier sauce and that was the end of it. Enchiladas are by definition something rolled in a corn tortilla and smothered in sauce. I really believe this was prepared well ahead of time with some war surgery attempted to make my more special order.Had it only been my meal, I may have been willing to pass this off as a bad first attempt at my "special order", but my son's child's meal was bad as well. The rice was very dry and tasteless. The quesadilla was not browned and very greasy. It was too mushy when I attempted to cut it for him. A quesadilla is at least supposed to attempt to be crunchy on the outside.If this had happened when they were very busy, I could rationalize the issues and try again. But they were not busy. My special request was not complicated. My son's simple meal was bad as well. I break up.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: Really hard to get adequate service here sometimes. They don't seem to staff appropriately. Food is Okay, but she is forgetful and if it's even semi busy plan to wait. We've decided not to return.

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: What is it about places opening and then saying screw good we will be decent like ever other place.

reviews.name: Melinda B.
reviews.review: I love this place. My family & I used to go to the owner's 1st restaurant in Rivergate behind Hobby Lobby. They staff is friendly. Restaurant is inviting plus music is great. The food is amazing I've never had anything that was bad.

reviews.name: Carrie W.
reviews.review: Great Food . Good size portions.  Just a really good mexican food spot. We absolutely love it. An it's at a good price point. I also noticed a good selections of dessert (which i was so full i couldn't even think.about dessert...lol) they also have Horchata on the menu which a lot of places don't.  My daughter & i loved it an we will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Eddy W.
reviews.review: First time here for us and the food was great.  The prices are good.  They have a lunch menu and the food comes out quickly.

reviews.name: Jason G.
reviews.review: I really like Mexican & I was really looking forward to having Mexican food close by. Unfortunately I have not been pleased. The quality of food just isn't there. I know what your thinking, "How do you mess up Mexican?". That's exactly what I thought. I have tried this place 5 or 6 times, simply out of convenience and each time I am angry that they can't make good food.

reviews.name: Ceile G.
reviews.review: Great food. Beautiful seating. newly opened in the heart of Old Hickory/Lakewood.  Salsa is the bomb!

reviews.name: Joseph P.
reviews.review: Had a peculiar smell when I came in- sort of like a raw poultry smell? Wasn't pleasant. Food wasn't impressive- I left about 65% of it on my plate and didn't care to take any leftovers. Salsa was ho-hum. Only had one guy waiting tables, which shouldn't have been an issue with only one other table seated, but he came only twice to my table. Once to take my order and the other to bring my drink and food. Not sure I'll be back- and I only live a mile away!

reviews.name: Bailey L.
reviews.review: wasn't too impressed the one time we went. food was decent but I'd rather go to Cinco de Mayo.

reviews.name: Wendy H.
reviews.review: Awesome food! He was very attentive and filled drinks numerous times...they used to own and run Las Cebollas in Rivergate...

reviews.name: Andrew R.
reviews.review: Ok its ruby Tuesday's and I know I shouldn't have expected too much. The salad bar was pretty sad looking when I got there. Lettuce was hanging all over the place, the tomatoes were soggy and stirring in a stew of their own juices the croutons were not crisp (maybe on purpose but I still didn't like them) and the dressing had to be scraped off the bottom of the barrel if you wanted ranch ( I went with  Parmesan). I ordered the Asiago steak and a baked potato with butter and sour cream but only got he butter (it's cool) but the biggest problem I had was the Asiago steak was so smothered in cheese sauce I couldn't even taste the steak. I even scraped it off and nothing. So if your in the mood for mediocrity I would highly recommend this place to you. One plus side. It was pretty cheap.

reviews.name: Tokuda B.
reviews.review: Just somewhere to grab a bite....nothing speacial..although I didn't know they had a salad bar...oh well

reviews.name: Brenda G.
reviews.review: We had such a great time! Service was on the mark!! The Ruby relaxer drink hit the spot!! And there ribs fell off the bone!! And the all you can eat salad bar was fresh !! We were impressed!! Thanks Ruby's for an awesome time!! And your 5$$ all day cocktails this is are new spot!!

reviews.name: Matt S.
reviews.review: Not great.  Pasta lacking.  Everything that's fried is fried too much.  Menu is too "busy" and overwhelms many folks.  Salad bar didn't look too appetizing walking by.  Food came out late.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: Combo's for 10.99 are a great value for lunch or dinner. Tried the new quesadilla and had salad bar. Service and food were both good.

reviews.name: Rob S.
reviews.review: The food was awful. I had the ribs and fried shrimp - two things hard to screw up. The ribs were tough, bland and visually unappetizing. The shrimp was fried in oil that needed to be replaced. The bar staff was nice, but not responsive. Overall, a very poor experience, especially considering I didn't have high expectations. Clearly this chain is withering away.

reviews.name: Kim B.
reviews.review: I recently stayed one night in Nashville at the Drury Inn & Suites located across the street. We decided to stop in at Ruby Tuesday because it was late-night on New Years Day and nothing else was open. Imagine my surprise when the dining experience here was actually pleasant and enjoyable. The service and food were much better than expected -- especially when seeing the horrible reviews on Yelp. How can you not enjoy complimentary biscuits and a $2.99 salad bar?

reviews.name: Greg M.
reviews.review: This chain is dying a slow death and it is no suprise why. Inattentive staff, lackluster food , corporate decor. There are so many better choices. Hadn't eaten here in years...and now I remember why.

reviews.name: Alycia B.
reviews.review: Never EVER get take out at this place. I was already never a fan of Ruby Tuesday to begin with, but especially not since their whole revamp-trying-to-be-fancier or whatever the attempt is with the knockoff Red Lobster cheddar bay biscuits (which by the way are TERRIBLE and nothing like the real thing).Anyway I was forced to come here because I was in town on business and outvoted by my coworkers. I just wanted the garden bar because I knew everything else would be bad, but I wanted to be a team player and didn't want to have them waiting on me to fill up my plate since we were ordering takeout. Anyway I ordered the cajun shrimp pasta, the southwest taquitos, and the steak and lobster to take home to the bf.The pasta was terrible, the shrimp were not seasoned, it was like they threw it together and then sprinkled some cajun spice on top. The taquitos were surprisingly not bad in taste, but the outside roll to inside filling ratio was downright pathetic. My bf's lobster was overcooked and the steak smelled like an old man. It was just all to the bad. Never again!!

reviews.name: Tracy H.
reviews.review: Went here after the CMA'S,great little place to eat! Good service and nice menu,and they have all you can eat salad bar."yum"

reviews.name: Charlie P.
reviews.review: Ruby Tuesday "is what it is..." You kinda know the food you're getting so what really differentiates is the service...or lack thereof. I met a friend for a quick bite in the bar. There were different groups of people, of two people or less, including me. While there, I observed three of us have issues. One poor girl's food was wrong, she didn't have time for them to fix it, so she was offered a free dessert. She LEFT without the free dessert because it took them too long to bring a slice of cake. She gave up after 10 minutes. The area wasn't crowded, but the lackadaisical attitude to orders was ridiculous.

reviews.name: Kelly G.
reviews.review: The positive about this reataurant, it is close to the airport-BNA. Food is average, and actually reminds me of airport food. I had the salad bar, which is consistently good at most Ruby Tuesday's. my husband had the grilled chicken salad, which looked like they got everything off the salad bar, (except the grilled chicken), and threw it in a big bowl. Our waitress was attentive and very sweet. She actually gave me the salad bar for $2.99, instead of $8.99. My rating is more a 2.5 star, then a 2 star.

reviews.name: Robert P.
reviews.review: This review is based on many times eating here. There are really only 2 reasons to ever go... Service & Salad bar!  The entrees are microwave cooking at its finest and some of the coldest fries you will ever find.  Thought long about giving 2 stars but the reasons I mentioned bumped it to a 3. The Resturant is always busy which explains how poor the food selections are around the airport area.

reviews.name: Zoraida K.
reviews.review: I eat here fairly often due to convenience and great salad bar.  Today I decided to eat the turkey swiss sliders with a bowl of chicken tortilla soup. They were crazy salty! So they let me grab a salad instead and comped the whole lunch without even knowing I am the Duchess! : ) Thanks!

reviews.name: Scott B.
reviews.review: As soon as I walked in, I knew I should have turned around and walked out. There was an awful smell pervading the entire place. Like an old folks home that hadn't been properly cleaned. Getting a scent picture?As I was hungry, I ignored the flight reflex and sat down to eat. First thing I ordered was a glass of Malbec from the pre-printed corporate menu. Five minutes later the waitress returned to tell me that they, "no longer carry that wine." Really? So I ordered. Syrah. Got a healthy glass of wine, to their credit. Salad bar was well stocked with fresh ingredients. My steak, however, was tough and very clearly microwaved. Yes, they nuked a steak. Blech!When my check came, I had been charged for the Malbec they "no longer carry." Had to tell the waitress to change the price. And, making matters worse, I woke up at 3AM with an upset stomach. I guess I should have followed my nose, after all.

reviews.name: Tom M.
reviews.review: The stench of the place was overpowering and dingy looking. Considering it was after dinner we stayed. The chicken musroom pasta and Baked Ravioli were good. As was my cheese burger with frys. The service was as expected. The salad bar was very fresh and well maintained. If one can get pass the initial wall of  fog without gagging. The food is probably what you would expect.

reviews.name: Jennifer M.
reviews.review: What a terrible location! This place is out of everything we have tried to order and the servers are incredibly rude. Next time, I will make sure to visit another nearby chain.

reviews.name: Bryan G.
reviews.review: Great place with a great staff. I could eat anywhere but these guys and gals are too notch and the apps and desserts are more like high end restaurants than a franchise.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: I love Ruby Tuesday mainly for their garden bar and croutons.Where else can you go fill your box with greens to your hearts content and them not weigh it? I'll tell you where... Ruby Tuesday's. Most places like Harris Teeter or Kroger would weigh that salad and charge you your first born, not RT.This place is a quick and easy lunch stop. For me, that's good enough.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Stopped in for a few cocktails with friends, we did enjoy an appetizer and some good conversation too !

reviews.name: Janet K.
reviews.review: It's a chain and it's all the same!I work in the not so hip trendy district so your lunch selections are limited to Ruby's, Applebee's and Hooters.  Lunch service is fast and efficient; food is good.

reviews.name: Erica C.
reviews.review: Ruby was me and the dude's go to spot in times of indecision. That is until we went one night and had to wait. The wait was not the problem, however it allowed us to notice things we wouldn't normally pay attention to. Specifically a score in the eighties. You know what score I'm talking about. I don't play that. Exit stage right.

reviews.name: Jackie W.
reviews.review: Good Salad Bad has been better.

reviews.name: James B.
reviews.review: not that great of a menu, food is most always bland

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: Clean restaurant and a fantastic salad bar.

reviews.name: Gina D.
reviews.review: We had dinner here, early in the evening, but the servers seemed overwhelmed.  The salad bar was good, a wide variety including edamame, baby spinach leaves, potato salad, plus the usual fare. For entrees, we have mixed reviews. First of all, they arrived at different times, my hubby getting his, then we had to stop the waitress to see when or if mine was coming out. She had to get help to get the entree out. My hubby did not enjoy his Chicken Trio....the Chicken Bella, Fresco and Cajun spiced he judged all to be overly spicy and seasoned  [and he normally enjoys a little spice on his food]  They did seem to be covered in spices. His portion of garlicky mashed potatoes were darker and stronger in flavor than mine were.....last ones of an old batch on the stove no doubt.  Mine were softer, fluffier and a lighter color, milder taste. I enjoyed them along with the very moist Salmon Florentine that had a wonderful sauce to accompany it. I had some strawberry lemonade as a beverage that was very fresh and refreshing.       I'll not say we will never return, but will be more knowledgeable when we do.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: The service is good, their food is good for a commercialized restaurant, and the bartenders are nice.  We've been having their absolute mess martini, which is delicious & very strong.

reviews.name: Joe D.
reviews.review: Gotta love the salad bar!  Actually it was slightly understocked when I was there.  However, I do recommend the blackened Tilapia on their specials menu.   The service here was excellent at a late dinner hour of 930pm so I appreciated it.  If you in the area then dont be shy!

reviews.name: Wade H.
reviews.review: Got seated quick had the mini buffalo chics and salad it was great but the waitress had no personality

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: Ruby's is consistent with good food and fast service. Their timing between salad dinner was perfect. They also have WiFi here which worked great. Nice for those of us that travel alone. Great choice.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: Love the salad bar and the prime burgers.

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: Enjoyed the prime burger and endless fries, but they were nothing special. Shame the service was wore than the food. Slow, only refilled my fried once in the 90 mins I was there.

reviews.name: Christina S.
reviews.review: I really thought the food was surprisingly good here for the restaurant being smack in the middle of the main foyer of the Hall of Fame.  There was a guitar player entertaining nearby. I had a Southern Fried Chicken Salad that was really good while I rested my poor feeties while waiting for the rest of my family.  If you are looking for a bite to eat, this is a great place versus the To Go take out on the other side of the walkway.

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: This is the restaurant inside the Country Music Hall of Fame. I had no idea this was an actual sit-down restaurant until I had a Sunday brunch here a few weeks back. The food was so excellent that I will be making it a regular brunch spot! I'm reluctant to even write this review because this appears to be Nashville's best kept secret! Heck, I'm the first one writing this review? I couldn't believe how much food I got for about $10.  I ordered the oatmeal pancakes that were fluffy and divine. They have these jalapeno potato fritters that make me salivate just thinking about them! I felt there were so many items on their menu that there was something for everyone in our fairly large group. I can't wait to go back and try something new. Everyone in our group was raving about their individual dish. Discounted parking is available at the Pinnacle Garage at Symphony Place (3rd Ave. and Demonbreun St.). The restaurant allows you to purchase 2-hour parking for only $2.00.

reviews.name: Aaron F.
reviews.review: Rarely do I come home from a restaurant thinking, "I must Yelp that place now" - unfortunately my experience today at the Two Twenty Two Grill forced me to do so. Let me begin with a caveat - the rating is not about the food (which was tasty and quite good). It instead belongs to the service and the experience. My friend and I arrive for our brunch reservation and are promptly seated. Our server doesn't greet us with any warmth, but this is hardly a must, as long as the service is good (which it was not). She takes our drink orders and returns a few minutes later asking us if we're ready. This is where the service takes a nose dive. We waited forty minutes for our food, and considering only one other table had not been served, this is an atrocious wait time. While we were waiting, our server stopped by to refill my water once, but never asked if I wanted more coffee - and I had to flag her down to do so. Mind you, there are three servers covering seven active tables - at one point my friend joked that the staff outnumbered the customers. I understand if it's crowded or busy - but it was neither crowded nor busy. Our food comes, and it's outstanding. By the way, the Fried Chicken biscuit is simply delightful - moist fried chicken, eggs, cheese and gravy all come together nicely on a flaky and thick biscuit (not dry at all!). My companion asks for butter...literally five minutes go by before we flag another server who brings it to us in 15 seconds. We ask for the check and a box for my leftovers - the girl takes another 5 minutes. And she doesn't even bring the box! I had to ask another guy working there for it. We did leave a tip, but frankly she didn't deserve one. When I asked about the validated parking, the hostess had no clue and directed me to the front desk (shouldn't you know about this?). The front desk folks gave me a validation ticket, but when we got back to the Pinnacle garage on 3rd and Demonbreun, the validation ticket took $2 off. But it was supposed to give us parking FOR $2. On their own website it says,"Two Twenty * Two Parking Discounted parking is available at the Pinnacle Garage at Symphony Place (3rd Ave. and Demonbreun St.). We will provide guests with the option to purchase 2-hour parking for only $2.00.See map here. "Sigh. So we had to pay $6 for a smidge over an hour of parking.Like I said, this is no reflection on the Country Music Hall of Fame nor the food at the Two Twenty Two. But come on people - get your act together. I can't recommend this place when your servers don't give a crap about anything!**my friend and I compiled a list of what we thought might be the problem**-Hungover from a late Saturday night at Tin Roof-Sore from dancing at the Stage-Pissed off about the jerk she met at Cadillac Ranch who bought her a light beer then proceeded to make out with her friend-Angry about irritating customers (which I didn't want to fall into...but it's a vicious cycle, this whole service thing)-Just didn't give a shit-Hasn't sat in her own restaurant before-Is a struggling country music singer stifled by competition and irony (that she works in the Country Music Hall of Fame but isn't memorialized there)

reviews.name: Doug W.
reviews.review: Was here in town on a rainy Sunday. Noticed in a visit yesterday to the Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum that a Sunday brunch was available.  In the spacious lobby, which has glass roof and walls, a fine dining kitchen operation is available. I had a "Fried Chicken Biscuit," which was a nice biscuit/bun, with a sizable portion of chicken breast battered and fried crisply. An egg to order and sausage gravy, and a melted cheddar completed the updated version of the fast food staple. Biscuit wasn't up to the task and bottom fell apart, but the choice was a very good one! Tasty and satisfying. I couldn't finish.As a side, I chose the Cheddar Jalapeno Cornbread. Was a little dry, but requested butter and solved the problem.The reason for only four stars is important. On a day that didn't appear busy, it took nearly thirty minutes for my order to arrive. DON'T COME HERE IF YOU ARE IN A HURRY!On the bright side, service was extremely good (server was Steve) and environment was very pleasant. Many coffee refills arrived as needed, and requests (e.g., the butter for the cornbread) were answered promptly.There are a number of interesting menu options, so I would return if/when in the area.

reviews.name: Kiki Z.
reviews.review: Came here for dinner because we found a groupon while on vacation, and ordered the teriyaki salmon and the pork chop. Both dishes were absolutely perfect!!! The salmon and so many different textures and did not have a fishy taste. Perfectly cooked! The pork chop had an amazing 'fall bonfire' taste to it. Both are highly, highly recommended!!!

reviews.name: Geida C.
reviews.review: If I could rank this place lower than one star I would! The service is awful!!!! My friend and I ordered drinks. He brought one and forgot the other. My water had bug in it so I asked for a new one. 10 mins later he asked, "how are you doing?" Still waiting for a water. I had to ask for water/other drinks three times. We only order two drinks and one pasta entree--- we were there for an hour and 45 mins! 1:45!!! That is sooooo slow! Don't go there! Everyone around us was having issues not just us! Not worth it!

reviews.name: Faith E.
reviews.review: The Commerce Street Grille is located in the Renaissance Hotel on Commerce Street. The staff is friendly and they certainly know their menu! I chose the salmon which came with grits and wilted kale. The salmon was... Ok; overcooked. It was a bit chewy. But edible. Surprisingly, they've got a pretty good kid's menu. Our daughter had the grilled cheese. It was pretty chewy and stiff by the time they brought it. We were with a large group so I'm assuming they made her sandwich too early. We did have reservations, having a group of roughly 20 people but that particular night, there was still plenty of seating. Just allow a little time for your food to arrive.

reviews.name: Ted W.
reviews.review: Commerce Street Grill is the cafe/eatery inside of the Marriot Renaissance hotel in downtown Nashville.   I popped in for a bit one afternoon and was pleased to find that they grill the burgers over an open flame, not on a griddle (which isn't grilled - it's griddled).   I also had the French Onion soup which was a nice portion, hot, tons of cheese and bread.  It could have been a tad-bit richer for my tastes though but then again I was coming off a night of excess drinking so my tastebuds weren't 100%.Service was efficient and friendly.  I chatted with my server for a bit and we talked about the area etc.    A very nice girl.The best thing though was that these weren't hotel-eats prices.  Just a bit cheaper which is welcomed.   I'm sick of getting reamed on eats and drinks by these large chains.   Hopefully they'll one day realize that the more comfortable people are at a location (cheap drinks/eats), the more they'll imbibe.  The more they imbibe the more likely they are to return/recommend.

reviews.name: Justina L.
reviews.review: Stay away from this place. Even if you are super lazy and don't wanna leave your hotel, trust there are better options on Broadway which is a 5 min walk.Service was poor and slow, and food was mediocre. Prices are expensive and quality simply wasn't there. No wonder this place is always dead. The hotel offers elite members 25% off this restaurant and I can see why they need to give people an incentive to eat here.Eat somewhere else. It's not worth the convenience and potential cost savings.

reviews.name: Robert A.
reviews.review: We dined here three times, once for a quick dinner when we arrived at the hotel and twice again for breakfast since the concierge lounge was closed. Dinner was on Christmas night, so we were just interested in some food, nothing real fancy. The hot chicken appetizer was on a par with some of the hot chicken places in Nashville, so I was pleased. Nothing particularly outstanding from the meal, good or bad. The waitress was quite helpful in guiding us through the menu.Breakfast was two different experiences. On Dec. 26, the buffet was dark, so we were able to order off the menu. The omelets were well made and tasty. Our waitress was a little forgetful, but was attentive and good humored.At the second breakfast, the buffet was open and so we were prevented from ordering from the menu. The buffet was okay - nothing outstanding on the hot table. Had some trouble tracking down our waiter a couple of times when we needed his assistance.
