Literally, the shows on cruise ships are far better.

reviews.name: Scott H.
reviews.review: I went on this riverboat on a law-enforcement conference, it was all you can eat and all you can drink. You just can't beat that!

reviews.name: Kerri H.
reviews.review: Great show!  Very talented actors and singers!The food was good and we didn't have to wait to eat.  We were served as soon as we walked in!  A nice Christmas dinner with turkey and ham.Fun adventure to go on while visiting Nashville!

reviews.name: Laura H.
reviews.review: We enjoyed the dinner cruise on July 3rd. The food was very good, but the show Hot Country Nights was amazing.  I didn't want it to end.

reviews.name: Dee W.
reviews.review: We did the lunch cruise.  We ate as soon as we boarded...before even leaving the dock.  Buffet was  ok nothing great but good enough. Salad, grits, mashed potatoes,  chicken,  pork tenderloin,  corn bread and dessert. Show was very entertaining. Jusst lots of hits by lots of different people. Definitely would recommend as a tourist :-)

reviews.name: Alyssa G.
reviews.review: Went on this dinner cruise during a trip to Nashville and had a wonderful time! My boyfriend and I went on a Monday night and at first were a little worried because when we look around all we saw was really OLD people, we were the youngest ones there and we were over dressed compared to everyone else. Before entering the boat, there is a person there taking pictures and we were able to take one infront of the General Jackson which I thought was pretty cool. When we actually entered onto the ship everyone spread out and it became more intimate for us. We took tons of pictures, the sun was starting to set it was just wonderful. The river was absolutly beautiful and the staff was very welcoming when entering the ship.  I found a waiter and ordered a bottle of white wine for my table to be there when we were ready to be seated. About an hour we were outside and on the upper deck having cocktails and watching the band that was playing. On a loud speaker they told everyone to enter the main dining room for dinner.The dining area was huge and looked very elegant! There was a large stage in the front with the curtain still up.  We shared the table with about 8 other people. This was nice because everyone was interacting with one another and we got to meet people from different places. When we got to our table our bottle of wine was warm, however, one of the servers realized that it was sitting there awhile and took it back and brought us a new one nice and cold. They poured us both glasses of wine and ice tea. They immediately brought us our salads and bread. I also noticed that there was a small menu on the table just in case you wanted to order more appetizers. The salad was very fresh and the dressing was very good. After salad was done they brought us dinner which was also very good but I think it could have been a little more hot. But this was understandable due to the fact there were tons of people to feed at one time. After dinner, we had about 30 mins to break away from the dinning area and they brought us to downtown Nashville where we were able to take even more pictures. The whole city lit up at night was just gorgeous and we went right under the bridge which was also lit up. When we went back into the dining area our dessert was already on the table. They forgot to bring my boyfriend and myself coffee and it was a pain to get them over to serve me. I also wanted to order Ammerato but before I had the chance to they have already walked away. During dessert the show started and it was excellent! They actually pulled my boyfriend on stage and made him do the funky chicken infront of everyone with the rest of the entertainment staff which was both hilarious and fun. We wound up having a great all together and is something you should do of you are visiting Nashville. The only complain I have is that the wait staff is very slow and rarely check up on you to see of you need anything and when they do come by the give you your food and leave quickly, if this is fix it definitely has the potential to reach 5 stars.

reviews.name: Haley L.
reviews.review: The buffet starts right when you board the boat, so if you come in a little later than 6:30 your food will be cold. Also the show starts at the last 30 minutes, so you are sitting on a boat for two hours with no entertainment except looking out at the river. I came in with the expectation that I would be eating while a show was taking place. The only great thing about this place is that the waiter was extremely kind and helpful. Since most of our table was freezing, our waiter brought us all table cloths to warm up with. He was excellent!

reviews.name: Angela B.
reviews.review: I'm shocked that by how few stars this was given. Everyone in my group of 25 really loved the cruise and it was the highlight of my trip to Nashville! We went during the day, the views were great and we got tons of fantastic photos. The dinner show was great. Very amusing! Loved Heartbreaker Barbie and some of the other characters ;)Food was just ok. But everything else made up for that. Really enjoyed the desserts!

reviews.name: Alexandra S.
reviews.review: Wow! What a remarkable journey down the Cumberland river in nashville. One thing I loved about it was being able to see on the outskirts of the city. It was a treat to see the river and the side of Nashville off road. The nighttime view of city was remarkable, very beautiful sailing underneath the pedestrian bridge. There's a show at the end of the night on your way back to the dock which I was very impressed with. The entertainment was amazing, it takes you all the way back to when country first began and had a great timeline that shows you best of country hits of each decade. The flow of the show was just perfect they did great, but the last 10minutes did seem to drag a little because your getting a little tired around ten.The downside was the drinks were crazy EXPENSIVE for a single beer of a local brewery. 14.50$ Whaaaat???? There insane to ask that much for a 16oz beer. The food was average not like mamas home cooking food and service a bit slow but very pleasant. Ultimately if your looking for a good southern country entertainment and love country music this would be something great for you and your family to check out. Very family oriented!

reviews.name: Jennifer H.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I booked this at the recommendation of someone who had been to Nashville as well as tourism guides.  The food was ok - the first vegetables we had gotten since arriving in Tennessee! Alcoholic drinks were a bit pricey and you didn't have any choice but to purchase the souvenir cup.  The performance was exactly what you would expect for a showboat but it was a ton of fun.  They played a wide range of country songs, the performers were all very talented.  Best part was after the choreographed show some of the guitarists went up to the top deck and play some more and interacted with the crowd.  A bit corny, a bit honky tonk, but why else would you come to a city like Nashville??

reviews.name: Charlotte L.
reviews.review: My parents, my kids (ages 10 and 11) and I went on the Friday night dinner cruise to celebrate my parents' 45th wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time.  We had a great table right next to the stage, close enough to the performers for one of them to reach down and give my son a fistbump which we all thought was pretty cool.  The servers were very attentive and knowledgeable about the experience as a whole.  The food was so-so, hence only 4 stars instead of 5.   Salad appetizer with ranch or italian dressing.  Entree was a baked potato, asparagus, steak and shrimp.  Chicken tenders and fries for my kids.  The steak could have used a little more seasoning and I would have loved some cocktail sauce to dip my shrimp in since it had no other seasoning on it.  Mom loved the asparagus.  The key lime pie was awesome.  My parents got a free slice of pecan pie each with "happy anniversary" written around the plate in caramel sauce.  Very nice touch.  The show was great too and I am not a country music fan at all.  It was a good mix of genres and very entertaining.  Even my kids loved it and want to go back.I highly recommend taking the dinner cruise to celebrate a special event.  Let your server know if it's a special occasion and the host will announce it at the beginning of the cruise.  My parents got a special round of applause for having been married for so long.  That made their evening extra special!

reviews.name: Rebecca S.
reviews.review: The "one star" rating does not reflect the performers or the performance overall. Unfortunately, I have no choice but to rate General Jackson's show boat one star due to their lack of customer service. I was on vacation in Nashville and was scheduled for the daytime cruise. The signage outside the dock is atrocious. We couldn't find the dock and ended up missing the boat. Talk about devastation! I called general jackson customer service to see if there was a way to use our tickets for the next day or even pay a penalty fee to reschedule. Let's just say the customer service rep's have a thing or two to learn about "southern manners and hospitality" . No way were they budging! We had to buy tickets all over again. Fast forward 24 hours, a few tears and sniffles later, we boarded general Jackson's showboat and the rest is history. Overall, Buyers-beware!!! Arrive at least an hour early to prep for parking/actually locating the place....Then sit back, relax and enjoy covers of Jesus Take The Wheel and other country classics!

reviews.name: Randy H.
reviews.review: The General Jackson Showboat was pretty nice. The boat goes from Opryland to Downtown Nashville. It provides plenty of great spots for pictures. They did a performance that was basically the history of country. It was a great experience to see as I was not a big country fan. The food was okay. It seemed satisfactory. The desert was great. It was an interesting twist in strawberry shortcake.

reviews.name: Abe H.
reviews.review: We went on the lunch ride despite the poor reviews, because this is the only paddle boat ride available,  and had a fantastic time. The price was affordable, the staff was very friendly and courteous, the boat and bathrooms are very clean, the food was delicious, the show was entertaining and the scenery was beautiful. Very relaxing thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Ed D.
reviews.review: Great show, a bit on the pricey side if you take the evening trip.   Not really worth the $$.  Dinner is not good, not well prepared and the quality is very poor.  The steak, which is supposed to be NY strip is anything but!    A nice way to spend an evening on a paddle wheel boat with nice entertainment, but eat somewhere else.

reviews.name: Skip R.
reviews.review: Paid in advance for a Luncheon and River Cruise.  The boat was down for a repair but the staff promised a refund on the cruise portion.  The food was buffet style and nothing to rant about.  I have contact them twice and no reply.  The entertainers were very good! Huge waste of money for the food and cruise portion and too bad their management can't follow up on the promise to refund.

reviews.name: Tracy M.
reviews.review: Nice cruise and lunch on the river. Worth it , cures a hangover after partying on 2nd Ave.

reviews.name: Jessica G.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I spent a few nights in Nashville and booked a dinner cruise on the General Jackson Showboat at the suggestion of our concierge.  This was a waste of a perfectly good vacation evening.  I cannot speak to the views as we took the boat in the late fall and it was dark the entire time (and there was not much of a view until we pulled into Nashville), but what I can say, is that this is best avoided unless you seriously don't have anything else to do with your time.  First, our waiter was inattentive, hard to track down and generally seemed like he resented having to wait on us at all.  Perhaps our much much older table-mates had a better experience with him, but ours was dismal.  It was impossible to even get a re-fill on our drinks over the course of hours.  Second, the food was abysmal.  Dinner was Prime Rib, period.  There were no options.  And this was not good prime rib, it was the cheap, salty, grey, gristly nastiness that you might expect to find on the buffet line of a rundown strip club in old Las Vegas.  No thanks.  Even the dessert was inedible.  Believe me, I have a sweet tooth, so would generally be inclined to eat my dessert.   If you cannot make something that I can stomach more than one bite of, you are definitely doing it wrong.  I think it was supposed to be strawberry shortcake, but no other strawberry shortcake I have ever had featured overly sweet strawberry jam-type goo over a tasteless hard puck of a biscuit.  Disgusting.  Finally, the show was energetic and had a decent premise - an overview of the music of Tennessee (Appalachia, Nashville and Memphis).  The performers were good and it is due to their efforts that this receives more than one star from me.  The execution of the show however was cheesy and there was a definite undercurrent of Southern Republican ethos to it that I could see making some people uncomfortable.  I would not do this again.  If you do book this through a hotel, be advised that your shuttle driver will have your tickets (they will not be held at will call like you might suspect).  This is relevant if you miss your shuttle (like some other people we ran into did) or opt to drive your rental car to the boarding location (like we did), which will require you to find out which shuttle was meant to be yours and hope you can catch it when it arrives so that you can get your tickets.

reviews.name: Vicki O.
reviews.review: Poor entertainment. Performers came out right when we were seated for a short intro song, then nothing for over an hour during dinner and dessert. Pathetic!  Dinner theater means watching a production during dinner. Steak was tough to cut and and chew. Unfortunate!!!

reviews.name: Ruth L.
reviews.review: horrible experience! food wasn't good and you didn't even get to finish before they rip the plate from you. drinks over priced. everything is outdated. honestly felt like I went on a cheap boat ride instead of an over priced "luxury" cruise. never again! total rip off.

reviews.name: Holly C.
reviews.review: I don't know what everyone was complaining about the show was AMAZING !! The view of the city was excellent and the food was great !!! We didn't have the best of servers but the manager fixed the issue and the night went on :) my son even got a high teething fever and they had a medic on board thankfully he was fine but how can you beat a service like that :) .... Also it was worth every Penney !! Sit as close to the stage as you can

reviews.name: Danny R.
reviews.review: Enjoyed the cruise so far. Food is good for the amount they have to cook and serve at the same time. Overall very enjoyable trip.

reviews.name: Alena B.
reviews.review: Yes, I get it, I'm a Yankee in the South.  Yes, I'm going to be more liberal than anyone else here...just because I'm from up north....but I'm pretty open minded!  Or so I thought...(more on this later)This boat ride is a bit long.  It's a nice boat and clean.  The staff was nice and the scenery was great.  My friend and I had fun taking pictures up on the deck and looking out over the shore.  The other tourists were pretty nice.   The food was overpriced but decent.  Nothing bad or great really...the problem came later.During what was a cheesy but cute show one of the male performers started going on and on (okay this is an exaggeration, but each of the following issues were mentioned at least twice each) about the wonderful war in Iraq, prayer in school being outlawed as the cause of the downfall of society and Bush being the most wonderful president ever.  I don't care if this is what he believes, but c'mon is this supposed to be a fun show?  Isn't this supposed to be a lazy river cruise where we watch cheesy shows and enjoy not being wherever we live?  REALLY?  I don't want to hear his or anyone else's opinions on politics OR religion while on vacation hanging out and just enjoying my day.  Even if he and I agreed 100% regarding every single political and social issue in the world, I don't want to hear someone who I paid to perform talking about it during a show.  I, obviously won't go again.  Too bad too!

reviews.name: Penny J.
reviews.review: Had a good time.Took the Easter brunch ride. It would've been nice had it not been so cold and rainy. Food was alright. Plain, but edible. Drinks were good, a little pricey, but they were good. Loved going to the upper decks and sitting at the tables and just enjoying the ride. Wish we could've just done that rather than paying for the show and food. It is a nice boat and a neat experience though.

reviews.name: Anthony C.
reviews.review: You can't beat the value of this place.  For $30 you get a three hour long cruise, a buffet, and entrance to the Country Music USA show.  The food was horrible, but since reading other Yelpers reviews I was already aware of that so I had some food before I got on.  The cruise itself was very relaxing and a nice change of pace from all the hectic traveling that I had been doing during the daytime.  Moreover, you get to see downtown Nashville from the river at night which is beautiful.  Really wished that we could have gotten closer but because of the rain the river was running high so the steamboat couldn't get under the last bridge.  The show was very entertaining and lively.  Country Music USA was a historic show that brings you from old country music to contemporary country music through song and dance of the various hit artists during their time.  The performers were great and extremely talented to be able to do all those songs from all those artists.  I would highly recommend going on this tour if you can get the cheaper tickets.  Mostly they are selling the $90 dinner ticket, which lands you a first floor seating and a fancier dinner, but really I liked on the second floor and the food didn't look much better then my buffet.  We were lucky to get those tickets as we went all the way to the booking area and asked the staff who nicely sold them to us (apparently they generally don't sell them for some reason).

reviews.name: Estefania A.
reviews.review: I went to the boat with my husband last weekend to break up our "dinner and a movie" date routine and enjoyed it for the most part. The boat makes its way from Opryland to downtown Nashville and provides a great backdrop for pictures. The entertainment was good; the music wasn't necessarily what I would listen to but I appreciated the talent of the performers. The food was okay- think tough, reheated frozen dinner rolls and pretty dry roast beef. The cheesecake with cherries and chocolate sauce at the end redeemed the meal somewhat. The service wasn't so great, seeing as the only time I got a water refill was once about halfway through the meal when I called our waiter over and asked for one. They get three stars because of the entertainment and the scenic route. If I had it to do over again, I wouldn't get the $90 dinner ticket- I would buy a ticket for the cruise only and eat dinner beforehand.

reviews.name: Nydia A.
reviews.review: I actually really enjoyed this ride. It was a little bit on the long side, but it was scenic and quite beautiful. The food was OK, and the entertainment was good. When I went, they had a hell of a fiddler performing. I would totally do this again.

reviews.name: Rick G.
reviews.review: The show and the performers are 5 star all the way.  They have a ton of talent, poise and stage presence.  I don't know if it's a rotating cast, but the 3 men and 3 women I saw were terrific.  The band is also very good, but most of the band members looked as though they were about as excited as doing session work for the Dixie Chix ("Oh No...Why Me").The service - average at the best of times.The Food - It's ok but don't expect much.  It's sort of like Biz class airplane food.

reviews.name: Mary A.
reviews.review: I was aboard the General Jackson Show Boat this weekend with mom & dad;   We went on a Sunday lunch cruise.   The show and talent here was A-1 excellent.   The food buffet was simple and tasty.  For the price I would say this is a great value and we would have loved doing a night time cruise if we could have, even though the rate is about double.   The service staff was excellent as well.   If you (enjoy country music), and are looking to have a good time away from the downtown crowds, I'd say you should not miss the General Jackson Show Boat cruise. The guests were mostly 40's - 70's age range and all seemed to be down home fun loving people and the show was extremely entertaining.  If you are into big crowds and lots of bars, then downtown Broadway street is indeed an endless honkey tonk party not to be missed, the town is full of many talented bands.  Today, good fun with good music & elbow room was on our menu.  Thank you for an excellent afternoon in Nashville.

reviews.name: Kathryn H.
reviews.review: We went for a holiday dinner and cruise right before Christmas.  The service was good and the experience of riding on a boat down the Cumberland River was also nice.  However, the food was terrible.  The menu is fixed, which is okay, but the quality of the food was just bad.  Our menu was supposed to be braised beef loin and tiger shrimp.  It consisted of over-cooked pot roast and three tasteless shrimp.  The accompanying vegetables were good, but there were hardly any vegetables there...three carrots and 1/3 cup of mashed potatoes.  If you want to ride on the General Jackson, buy the cruise and show only and eat somewhere else before you go.

reviews.name: Dee a.
reviews.review: We went to the General Jackson lunch cruise with friends/family and though the river ride was nice the food and experience left a lot to be desired. The only drink options included in the ticket price are tea, coffee and water. You can purchase sodas and adult beverages at the bar. The salads were sad looking shredded lettuce with watery ranch. I had the vegetarian plate of roasted veggies. They were OK, but pretty bland. The other guest stated the pork was pretty bland as well. It reminded me of retirement home or hospital food, definitely not what we were expecting from a lunch cruise. The portion sizes were very small. The apple cobbler for desert was very good and was the only truly enjoyable part of the meal.The entertainment was good, when they actually entertained. They spent about half of the time trying to hock their merchandise or "special" drinks. It was like watching TV with all the commercials. The singers were decent, though lead guy did go off on a rant about Jesus. We were there to eat and be entertained, not listen to a sermon. The fiddle player was amazing. It really was good talent we just got sick of all the "buy our CDs!!" announcements. We were not able to make the full journey, as the river was too high to allow us to continue to downtown Nashville, but the ride was quite nice. Over all it was an disappointing experience, definitely not one we would repeat.

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: I have to confess.  I have been on the General Jackson one time in my nine years here in Nashville.  And, honestly, that was about one time too many.  Let me start with the positives, and the reasons I give it two stars when I really want to give it one.  1) It's a generally scenic--and different--way to see Nashville.  However, if you are a tourist and only have a day or two to see the sights, I don't suggest this.  You only get a view of downtown from the river--again, nice, but you are not experiencing the fun that is Nashville when you are on the deck of the riverboat.  2) It's a great way to travel from the Opryland Hotel to downtown Nashville while avoiding the interstate--that is one of my most hated drives--BUT, you can't get off the boat, so I guess this isn't a viable option for those just looking to avoid the interstate.  You do get to see everything from the Opryland area to LP Field though.Those are the positives.  There is entertainment on board--if you pay for the whole dinner cruise, that is--but it's lacking.  Big time.  There are so many outstanding bands and singers/songwriters in Nashville, please do NOT base this show on what the Nashville music scene has to offer.  It reminds me more of what a casino in Nowhere, Mississippi would showcase.  Food is not good either.  If you feel the need to take the General Jackson as a means of entertainment, do what Tamara M did and just hang out on the deck and check out the Nashville skyline.  Save your money for the real entertainment at one of the many music venues around town.

reviews.name: Donald M.
reviews.review: Maybe I would have found this worthwhile if I had used my four drink tickets at the bar.  Food is poor.  The show is ok if you're into cruise shows.  The ever-changing scenery is certainly nice but I would not recommend this overall even though the staff clearly did their best.

reviews.name: Roz Z.
reviews.review: My friends and I took the dinner cruise, price was about $90 per person...to us, not worth it.  Rather than getting your tickets on line, go to the little tourist office in Nashville Plaza by the Fiddler Inn...you can probably save on all the  additional "internet fees".Tickets are non refundable, so if you buy insurance, be prepared ( even with a medical emergency), to fill out about 12 pages of documents.  Some will require your MD or physican to complete.   Any changes (like transferring tickets to someone else's name are in your party are another $20).You don't have to ride the bus as there is pleanty of free parking across from the ticket office.  Lot's of handicapped parking available, too.The General Jackson boards 1 hour early which allows you time to listen to a live band while enjoying beverages which are available for purchase.  There are stairs involved, so be prepared...anyone with heart conditions or disabilities should take note.   I know there is an elevator but I don't know if it goes to  the top deck.  The boat is clean, cutely decorated with colored patio light strings.  There are lots of nats or mosquitos as you are on the river.  The smoke stacks are not real.  While  the boat is pretty but it is not an autentic paddle wheeler.An hour later you climb down three flights of stairs to the dinner theatre. You can sit virtually anywere they seat you and enjoy the show, however, there are poles that can obstruct your view.The table was set nicely, but a closer look in the dimmed lighting revealed stained and greasy tablecloths.Our waiter came out to introduce himself, welcome us and explain the menu.   I think his name was Habib or Babib.   From our party of 6, only two were able to understand him.  He was not from TN, or from America for that matter.  He was very serious when he explained the menu and the dessert..."Bunkin chest cake", which turned out to be Pumpkin Cheesecake.   We had to call the assistant waiter "Jennifer" who was American, over to ask for a repeat of the menu.  We also asked if there were "other options"   ie: vegetarian meal and fruit cup as opposed to cheesecake.  Those options are available.Rolls, Butter & Salad is served.  Ranch dressing is served as a standard.   If you want anything else, like Thousand Island, you have to ask, but the waiter will not set it on the table.  He holds it near and dear.   I belive Thousand Island is a rare commodity on this boat and it is not generously dallped.  Before dinner is served, the wine/beverage glasses are quickly whisked away.  The waiter put his fingers inside the glasses so that he could remove 4-6 at a time.  Ice Tea comes with dinner but is not offered.  You have to ask, and it is poured into those same fingered glasses. Who knows where those fingers have been?  The bowls of salad are then whisked away before you can get a second serving.This is a timed event, everything is whisked away pretty quickly.  The waiter constantly bent over my shoulder to clear the table, each time putting his underarm pit right in my face.  I called it to his attention, but he didn't understand what I was saying. So, dinner is served.  BonelessChicken breast was so-so, boxed stuffing was extremely salty, small potatoes, broccoli and a slice of tomato.  My husband was one of the last still eating .  Boy was he surprised when the waiter grabbed the fork right out of his right hand!  The same waiter did this to the party behind us.  A glass of diet coke is $3.50 but it does include refills.Coffee was very good, and the Bunkin Chest Cake was enjoyable.  So, on with the show!  (Between dessert and the show you have an opportunity to go outside and view the downtown skyline at night.  Save for the nats, I hear this is beautiful).  Unfortunately, we did not get to see it, as we were one of the last tables to be served coffee and Bunkin cake.  The show was entertaining, covering the history of country music from the early years to modern day.   The show is similar to what you would see on a cruise ship or at Disneyland.   I always enjoy a show where they acknowledge anyone that has served our country - asking them to to stand while the entertainers sing "Proud to be an American"  Very touching, but somewhat annoying as  50% - 80% of the servers sadly are not from this country.The waiter made it a point to ask us to stick around after the show as he would be back to say bye-bye (tip language, naturally).  After the show is over, one needs to climb 3 flights of steep stairs to get off the boat.  Many people complained.  The elderly and handicapped had a difficult time.  Some of the middle aged folks complained.  Disembarking is very strenuous,   Again, an elevator is avaiable but you can imagine the crowd and the wait.To us, not worth the $90 per person.  For $720 , our table could have done so much more.  We will not be back.

reviews.name: RICK C.
reviews.review: Had a great time, saw a great show  ( country music U.S.A. ) and enjoyed a great meal. This was  a very nice evening out.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: If I were compiling a list of the most Cheezy touristy things to do in Nashville, I think the General Jackson would top my list. You start at Oprymills cruise downtown and then cruise back. There can be a banquet or buffet meal included as well as a show. There is also an event before home games where you can cruise down to LP field. I haven't done that one yet. The only pro is that it is kind of a picturesque cruise up the river and coming in to downtown at night is really neat with the Shelby Pedestrian bridge and artwork all lit up. The downs are that the boat is filthy and gross. There is absolutely nothing authentic about it. Hell the fake smoke stack lowers so we can go under one of the bridges. The food is sub par at best and the servers really don't' seem to know what they hell they are doing. I think they must be temps. The shows are all really cheezy and I don't' mean good cheesy, I mean, I can't believe I am sitting here watching this. They will do large group and corporate events and I have certainly seen people that appear to be having a good time so I am probably a curmudgeon but ick... I always cringe when I get "treated" to a cruise on the General Jackson.

reviews.name: William L.
reviews.review: This is an extremely good time just waiting for you to board.  My wife, and I went on this cruise last night and not only was in fun, but entertaining at the same time.  We had cruise only tickets which means that we couldn't go in the show or the buffet, !BUT! before the show one of the workers approached my wife, and I and asked why we were sitting there all alone (very politely as to just check on us) and we replied we were watching the water, and land pass.  He invited us (free of charge) to go into the show.  All the crew members are GREATLY helpful, and knowledgeable of the ship.  We asked one of the workers the history of the ship and she told us the entire background of the ship.  We did pay $5.50 for a thing of nacho's, but I have no regrets.  In fact I'm looking forward to making future reservations.  It was just that good!

reviews.name: Mark G.
reviews.review: Pros: friendly staff, nice boat, alcoholCons: cheesy, only ok food, the ride is too long (3hrs)

reviews.name: Jim P.
reviews.review: Our family took the dinner cruise.  Overall it was an ok experience, not sure I would repeat it.First the boat boards about 1 hour early.  They herd you up two flights of stairs.  The view is fairly nice.  There is a gift shop to browse in.  There is a bar, but beware the souvenir glasses they push inflate the cost of the drinks and aren't required - the will give you a plastic cup if you remember to ask.  They do push $3 waters of water for the kids - ridiculous.Promptly at 7pm the announce seating for the dinner and show.  You have to rush down those same two flights of stairs.  The boat hasn't set sail yet, so you miss that experience.A very nice waiter announces tonights menu, chicken.  This is preferred over the web site menu which was prime rib.  Takes about 45 minutes for salad.  Another 30 for .... Prime rib.  To the waiters credit he gets 2 chicken dishes for those that can't eat beef.  Then mystery desert turns out to be cheesecake - we were told chocolate covered strawberries.  The General seems totally confused.Meanwhile it is now 9:00, two hours into a three hour cruise.  It is dark, we haven't been able to see any scenery, ?what about the show?At 9:10 the show starts.  All the performers are good.  The show is a nice compressed timeline of country music history.  This is Disney like G, family type entertainment.  Simon would say 'karaoke'.  Show lasts not quite an hour.I think I'd put together your own dinner and show package.  Too many other good, real options nearby.

reviews.name: Tamara M.
reviews.review: A cruise on the 300-foot paddle wheel riverboat the General Jackson Showboat was one of the choices on my Nashville All-Acccess Pass. It featured live music, a cruise down the Cumberland river, and great views of the Nashville skyline at night. The only negative was the price of a drink: $12.50 (though we did get to keep the souvenir glass).  If you pay a bunch more, you can get a full dinner and a show.  We just stayed out on the deck for this part, which was great once the crowd went in for dinner.

reviews.name: JC C.
reviews.review: I am the last person in the world to ever do anything "touristy", but I have to admit that I did enjoy the General Jackson.  We went as part of a company Christmas Party.  Prior to the show I read several reviews here on yelp, so needless to say I had my doubts.  The show that we went to was the Christmas Show...the singers were pretty good and the food was decent.  The music is geared to those that are more traditional (Country Christmas, and other Christmas Songs).  I don't know if I would pay the price of the ticket (around $80 a person) to see the show again, but I would recommend it to someone who was interested in a showboat cruise with traditional singing and dancing.  One thing that was disappointing (but was unable to be avoided) was that the boat didn't ever go downtown.  The river was up so high that they didn't want to take the boat under the bridges between Opry Mills and Riverfront Park.  Since it was a night show and about 25 degrees on the deck, most people didn't really notice though.

reviews.name: Tamiko J.
reviews.review: I visit here often for my lunch and I always call in my order. They have always been prompt with my order and the prices are reasonable. I have always been pleased with my meal and the service

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: Wise Burger basically replaced the Cheeseburger Charley's that was here before and kept the same exact concept as kind of a knockoff if you will.  But since it is near all the other fast food places in the area, I sometimes go here when I forgot to bring my lunch with me to work.They have regular burgers, something called a spicy wise burger, turkey burgers, buffalo burger, veggie burger, etc.  You order that, with fries and a drink if you want, then wait and they call your ticket.  There's a condiment bar with lettuce, tomatoes that always look overripe and kind of rotten, dill pickles, etc.  It has never looked very appetizing to me so I usually skip it.  Serve yourself your fountain drink so that's nice, but be sure to check and make sure it has carbonation....or....you may be disappointed.  I have only ever had the turkey burger and it is standard, not bad.  The fries are meh, they aren't the skinny fries I like.  Onion rings are better but they only give you like 4 or 5 of them so if you have a bigger appetite you are not gonna like that.  The interior is standard fast food with tables...but...it always looks kind of dirty in there to me for some reason.  And I have never even considered going to the bathroom and my friend informed me that I never should.  You won't go out of your way to eat here but you may choose it when faced with all the other fast food joints in the area.  It won't impress you, but it won't disgust you either!

reviews.name: Lucas S.
reviews.review: Food was excellent definitely not mainstream we were on a trip back home and just happen to stop at a local eatery deathly worth the time fast food friendly service

reviews.name: Cherie D.
reviews.review: Decent burger for a great price. Nice customer service. They do free delivery between 10-3. Wish I had known earlier would have chosen that over walking there in 30 degree weather. Oh the joys of being a FA. They serve an assortment of burgers, grilled cheese and chicken. Nice selection on fresh toppings on the side and coke products. Great burger joint.

reviews.name: Andy O.
reviews.review: I came here because I used to love Cheeseburger Charlie's turkey burger.This place kept the same business model at CC's, but with an Asian touch.The good:They kept the turkey burger patty used by CC's which is the best aroundThe bad:The soda machine was out of carbonationThey messed up the 2 orders ahead of me...and then they messed up mine too (they gave me fries instead of onion rings...onion rings are a $1 add-on)It feels a little low rent and dirtyThey added a couple of odd hibachi-themed menu itemsBags of frozen fries and onion rings sitting out next to the fryer for all to see (hand dipped!)A pretty miserable customer experience all aroundThe best way to sum this place up is; a once decent burger place that was purchased by people with zero food service experience who are clearly trying to cut some corners.The owners/operators of this place are nice enough, but I seriously doubt this business will be successful.The only thing driving customers into this restaurant is the pitiful lunch options found in MetroCenter.

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: I actually have enjoyed everything I have ever ordered, the burgers, salads and especially the wraps. I gave them 3 stars because they are inconsistent. You never know what you are going to get on a salad you order,they throw in whatever they have. They discontinued the delicious wraps. Whoever answers the phone and translates delivery orders screws up every time.Besides that the grilled chicken is delicious, in fact best in town. The burgers are great and fries are good.Bring the wraps back!

reviews.name: Bill S.
reviews.review: The $5.99 turkey burger combo is a terrific deal. And the hand-battered O-rings are to eat for! Pretty good sweet tater fries, too.

reviews.name: KC S.
reviews.review: Went here during a lunch hour for a quick bite. The prices are reasonable and the food came up quick. I had a teriyaki chicken burger and it was great! The chicken wasn't too thick and the sauce was good. I also had the sweet potato fries and I would definitely recommend them. Yes it isn't fancy and maybe they could use some new tables and chairs, but they produce good food at a reasonable price and I was back to the office in under 25 minutes (eating in).Will be back!

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: I had gone there right after this location was changed from Cheeseburger Charleys (yuk) to Wise Burger. They were good then and better now. Their menu has grown and is tasty. The last time I got a turkey burger and fries. It was noon on a weekday and the wait was a little longer than maybe you would expect. However, the wait was worth it. Both my burger and fries were hot and fresh. The toppings bar was well stocked with fresh items and I got a bunch of them.I got iced tea, and they have one of those self serve machines where you can press a button for sweet, unsweet, or fruit flavored tea. I mixed all 3 as I have started doing and enjoyed the result. One nice thing is an employee noticed when we had finished eating, and then she picked up our trays and trash. She didn't appear to want us to leave as I've noticed at some other places. I only get out to that part of town once in a while, but next time I'm there, will definitely go back to Wise Burger.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: I was pleasantly surprised by this burger joint.  I think the main reason I liked it so much was the option to order a "wise" burger vs a regular burger.  The wise burger has onions (and maybe mustard?) cooked into it.  This is the way I love homemade burgers and the main reason I generally dislike bland restaurant burgers.  It does have the get-your-own-toppings bar like Cheeseburger Charleys, with an excellent selection including multiple types of pickles.  This is definitely one of the best burgers I've had from a restaurant.The fries and shakes are just average though, not bad just not as amazing as the burgers.

reviews.name: Devin P.
reviews.review: So I was gonna head over to Sam's Sushi Bar for lunch and as soon as I got close I noticed he wasn't open til later. What do you do?Well I headed back up on 4th ave. and hit Wise Burger! I'm telling you,best bang for the buck by far downtown AND the food is actually pretty darn good!

reviews.name: Simply S.
reviews.review: This place used to be Cheeseburger Charlies and was my favorite "fast place" to go when I wanted something not so good FOR me ... but oh SO good :) I noticed that the name changed and wasn't for sure if the franchise changed or what.  So I went in to see if it was any different. The owners are the same and the menu and everything inside the store was also exactly the same as before. The only difference .. the fries.  They are different.  Not bad .. just not as good.  Thankfully they still have the yummy seasoning that I loved so much.  It's clean, they have a huge condiments bar and even though they make everything for you as you order .. it's still pretty fast .. even when they are busy!

reviews.name: Joshua S.
reviews.review: I've actually been pleasantly surprised by Wise Burgers. This storefront has changed hands a few times since I started working in the area, and most of the inhabitants have been unremarkable. I've tried several of their offerings over the past few months. Their buffalo burger was very tasty. The receipt actually gave them away that it was probably a beef/buffalo blend by labeling it as beefalo, but at the price I wasn't expecting anything different. Their turkey burger is also quite good. They chose a wheat roll for me on that one, which I wouldn't choose myself, but it worked out. The burgers come in a great deal of varieties, starting with the plain "Wise" burgers that come in 1/4 and 1/3 pound sizes. They tend to have a pretty decent seasoning mix, salty and spicy. There are also teriyaki burgers, black bean burgers, salmon burgers, and several other types, along with non-burger choices. The chicken tenders are surprisingly good. Their French fries are straight cut generic diner style fries. They are often fried perfectly, just like in a NJ diner, but once in a while they're soggy. They also have the biggest onion rings I've ever seen. I've been very impressed with the food. Very fair prices, too!Now on to some constructive criticism. The interior needs some work. They've got run down seating in long table format, which makes small parties awkward. Many of the chairs wobble. It is clean inside but could stand to be updated...the decor is very bargain basement. There is often garbage on the landing in the parking area. Also, the lady who calls your orders does so very quietly. Oh, and there will be soap operas on the TV.Edit 1/5/14: They've done some updates that make me willing to update to 5/5. The seats were replaced, although the tables remain. They also added some stools. The TV is gone (thankfully). They have always given me correct change, and we always get courteous service from the counter staff. Probably doesn't help that we are in there so often they recognize us and start entering my order in advance. Great turkey burgers! Decent health department score (98) and their kitchen appears spotless, so don't let the dining area fool you. The garbage in the back has been dealt with.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: I remember when this location was a Cheeseburger Charleys, and I'm just not a fan of the chain.  It's pretentious, it's over-hyped, and it's just not as good as it thinks it is.So after passing by the location under a new name and new ownership: it kept some of the same trappings: the condiment bar, the promise of several burger meats, the milk shakes.  However, they offer some differences, like the hot wings and other sandwiches, which is nice.The burger is significantly better than it's predecessor, as far as I'm concerned.  I got a half-pound burger combo and it really was tasty.  The fries, on the other hand, were nothing to write home about.  Not crispy, kind of soggy, not particular flavorful: just generally forgettable.Still, if you're actually downtown, this is probably one of the better burger places within walking downtown.  Worth a visit.

reviews.name: MustangQT M.
reviews.review: Stopped by here when I was staying at the Millennium Maxwell Hotel down the street. Got a buffalo burger, which I was excited to see on the menu. Tasted like a normal, greasy burger. Fries were the most generic things ever. Won't be stopping by here again.

reviews.name: Michelle S.
reviews.review: Dont let the outside throw you off. This place is super good!

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: Korean is background of owner of Wise Burger, and the sandwiches & hot wings are all-American. Her burgers range from a couple dollars to five or so for the salmon burgers. Veggie patties are mid-range in price and in quality. My beefalo burger was most expensive and was chewy like most low fat lean buffalo mix burgers elsewhere. Best part is the free big condiments bar for dressing the sandwiches. Tomatoes, pickles, lettuces, fresh onion and other veggie toppings for the Wise Burger add up to make this a quick middle of the road cheap eats spot.

reviews.name: Dee B.
reviews.review: food is ok but make sure they give you the right change..  gave them a 20 noticed later that afternoon they had given me change for a 10, a friend said the same happened to her awhile back at this same place.. better watch out for the cashier :/

reviews.name: Simon C.
reviews.review: This has been one of my go-to Mexican places since discovering it 5-6 years ago.The highlight of el mariachi is a combination of the quality for the price and the outdoor patio. Great salsa and chips, and awesome margaritas with good deals on lunch specials etc. I've eaten here enough to try almost everything on the menu and there is something for everyone here. Friendly staff and fast service.My personal favorite thing is the patio seating on a nice day. Great place to eat a meal and relax.

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: Definitely go for the Texas Margaritas. They have a bit more punch the the regular lime margaritas. On Fridays, they have $20 pitchers and 2-for-1 draft specials.The outdoor patio is covered with ample seating and several televisions. The waitstaff is also incredibly friendly and will offer great chips and salsa that is mildly spicy and thicker than some of the watery salsas you'll get at other Nashville restaurants.In terms of menu, there are some dishes that differentiate La Mariachi from other area Mexican restaurants, including some specialty dishes that I assume are named for family members or employees or friends. Seriously, the steak menu has the most appealing draw and value, especially the Bistec a La Diabla. I, however, was underwhelmed by the chimichanga and other combo platters.One note about cleanliness. I dropped my napkin, and when I went to pick it up for the floor, I realized there was a dirty butter knife on the floor next to my foot that was there before I got there. When I looked around, it looked like the floors were not swept as frequently as they probably should. It wasn't in dire straits, mind you, just slightly less kempt that I would've expected. Definitely not enough to alert the health department.On the scale of authenticity, this place delivers more spice level than some other local places. Keep towards the fajita and steak menu, and you'll be happy. And order the Texas margaritas.

reviews.name: Jamie E.
reviews.review: Ok, let me start out by saying, I am from Texas... We take our Mexican food VERY seriously!! When I try a New Mexican food place, the first thing I judge them on is the chips and hot sauce (ya'll call it salsa)... If the chips and hot sauce isn't good, you might as well get up and leave, because you're not gonna be happy with your food either!! I had been dying to try this place, had heard several good things about it and I'm constantly on the hunt for authentic Mexican food that reminds me of home... I have to say, I think I may have finally found such a place!! I stopped by for an early lunch, was seated right away, chips and hot sauce delivered very quickly! I ended up being glad I got there early, because it filled up quick!! You know a place is good when they're packed for lunch on a Thursday!!So, chips and hot sauce... Delicious!! Nice and spicy!! Didn't taste like they dumped out a can of tomato paste and mixed some onions in it, like other places in town I've tried. Chips were super crispy and nice and thick, perfect for scooping up some hot sauce!! I ordered the Nachos El Mariachi and they were fantastic!! Had ground beef and shredded chicken, nice creamy sour cream - not the nasty cheap stuff some other places in town try to pass off as sour cream!! Really enjoyed my meal!! So, if you're looking for a pretty authentic Tex-mex experience, I'd say look no further than El Mariachi!!

reviews.name: Phil D.
reviews.review: Been here several times & the food is great as well as very reasonable! We moved here from California & I've had some great Mexican food. This place ranks in my top 10 for sure.

reviews.name: P P.
reviews.review: Really good and really fast Mexican food. Not sure why there are some bad reviews. But this place is legit. Try it once at least before you make judgments based on other reviews. We had a lunch special and chicken fajitas and a drink. With tip paid $19.50. That's a steal especially considering the food was really good.

reviews.name: Charity L.
reviews.review: This is my go-to Mexican restaurant for lunch in the spring and fall because they have a GREAT covered outdoor seating area. The food is really good.  I can honestly say I've never had bad service here either.  The waiters and waitresses are always very attentive and helpful.

reviews.name: Hannah C.
reviews.review: Me grandma and my boo decided to give mariachi a try again (see last review) and I'm happy to leave 4 stars. This time we ate in the outdoor patio area. My grandma likes to sit there so she can smoke haha. Chips and salsa, delicious, but salsa not spicy enough for me. The boo loved it. My plate: 2 tacos shredded beef rice and beans. Unlike last time, my tacos were loaded with beef this time! Rice was good, beans were up to standard. The only thing was the taco shells. They are nasty. I grew up eating authentic Mexican cuisine (parents owned a restaurant) so my standards are higher. This isn't California or Mexico though. So I'll cut some slack. New taco shells = 5 stars.

reviews.name: PC N.
reviews.review: Standard Mexican fare, nothing bad but nothing spectacular either. Salsa is pretty spicy, I ordered the fajitas mexicanas, really good and had several shrimp in it. My wife had the spinach enchiladas, spinach did not seem fresh.

reviews.name: Renee C.
reviews.review: Our favorite "hole in the wall" Mexican restaurant. My husband is obsessed with the fresh chicken tortilla soup! I love their cheap margaritas (that don't taste cheap). If you're looking for traditional Mexican (not Americanized white girl tacos!) this is your best bet in town!

reviews.name: Kyle B.
reviews.review: Fantastic steak taco!!! Very good service!! And it's next to my bank!! Prices are perfect and the bar tender even flirts with you! In a good way!!

reviews.name: Vanessa T.
reviews.review: Yes..... They have a $2 and $3 margarita with real tequila in it. Staff is super nice and our bartender was fun and funny. I get a steak taco everywhere I go, and theirs didn't disappoint. The steak tasted fresh and I imagine their steak fajitas re excellent. Not sure if it's any good, but they also feature a Mexican style buffet for only $7. Happy I went!

reviews.name: Shannon P.
reviews.review: Food was good. Portion sizes are smaller than other restaurants, but the service was good. All in all good experience.

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: Me and a friend went here last night at her suggestion and it was VERY good. My usual dish at most Mexican resturants is the Shrimp Quesadilla(had this Saturday at Chuy's ha ha) and it did not disappoint. It was HUGE, loaded with juicy shrimp, and all the fixings. This plate was only $7.75!!! Had this plus a Peach daquiri and my total bill was $13. NOT BAD! Very satisfied. Establishment was clean, we was seated, and watied on promplty, received our food in a few minutes. Ticket time was great! Will return! Dang...should have took a pic of my food! I couldn't eat the whole thing! Will do next time :-)

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: Gag....dirty place the food was poor service was even worse.  It's cheep but so is Taco Bell.

reviews.name: Richard W.
reviews.review: We drop in here occasionally, usually before we go bowling across the street.  The food is generally edible, the margaritas are okay (a little too sweet for me), and the service is always friendly and efficient.  Our last visit provided us with decent Chile Colorado, but a horrendous Alex Special (burnt nachos - chips with little else.)

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: I've been here two or three times and don't really have any complaints... but I don't really have anything terrific to say either.The food is decent, average Mexican fare.  The margaritas are decent.  The service is decent.There's a big patio for warm weather (often the distinguishing characteristic by which I refer to this place - the place with the patio - since I always forget the name...)Last time I was there, there was some sort of happy hour special advertised on handmade bright pink poster board signs that may or may not have been written by someone's child? They also made it clear that 2-4-1 deals only apply if one person drinks both beers because "sharing isn't fun." Overall I wouldn't necessarily recommend this place over other nearby options if someone was looking for Mexican food, but it'll do the trick if you're in the 100 Oaks area and have a craving.

reviews.name: Kelly A.
reviews.review: The service was awful. I don't even think we had a waiter cause EVERYONE ignored us. I am a waitress and I didn't even want to leave anything more then 10 percent but my husband left it. The food was okay. Not coming back...ever.

reviews.name: Martí M.
reviews.review: I'm quite the snob when it comes to Latin food. Therefore, I do not feel it would be fair to review El Mariachi's dishes. I will simply say I have eaten there twice and was definitely not impressed.However, I have stopped in several times for a beer (or three) with friends. The service is usually great, and the covered deck in warmer months is fantastic. The beer has always been ice cold, which makes the chips and salsa quite tasty.While brightly painted, the Ladies room is a bit of a disaster. A vent sits high on the wall, and as a direct connect to the elements, it makes for a rather chilly restroom in winter months. A small wall heater does exist, but it's just not enough to keep the restroom warm. One of the stall doors will not close properly, and neither stall provides a hook to hang your handbag or coat. The only mirror is on the opposite wall of the sinks. It's just weird...and cold.Parking has never been an issue, but getting your car into this lot can be. If coming from Berry Hill, I suggest turning left onto Eugenia Avenue, then the second right - taking the "back" route into the restaurant parking lot.

reviews.name: Minny R.
reviews.review: Nice down-to-earth Mexican restaurant.Generous with the free chips and salsa.Love the lunch buffet.Friendly staff.

reviews.name: Adam B.
reviews.review: Went here after works for drinks and lunch with co-workers. It took forever for us to get service. The drinks were good and food was okay. It was your normal Mexican restaurant food. If the service had been even half way decent they could have made a boat load of money off of us. Instead twice we had go find our server. This could halve so much potential if the would just half way try. I would try other places before coming here.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: It's completely acceptable food.  There's really not a lot going on in the cuisine department, pretty sure it's restaurant supply cheese/tortillas/chips/everything, the deck is fabulous however.The staff is pretty good, the prices reasonable, if I was going for the food though I would probably go a mile down the road and hit El Ranchero, however, as stated, this place has a deck and that is pretty darn wicked.They have all a vegetarian can eat, from Vegetarian option #1 all the way to Vegetarian Option #7, basically any combination of cheese, beans, rice and tortilla you can come up with... which I think is 7 possible combinations.The margaritas are large, potent, and unrelenting in their attempts to get you to change your mind about the general dissatisfaction of being surrounded by 3 banks and a futon store.Only had bad service once there, and we're sort of unsure what happened as one of the waiters suggested to one of our group that perhaps we should go down to Logans and drink.  I was informed of this and told that the manner was "y'all should leave" which was kind of odd as we were one of 3 groups out there and not obnoxious.  Odd, we didn't leave, had no issues. Perhaps a misunderstanding or perhaps that waiter didn't like us - no idea.One thing to note if you go here at night and do not know the parking lot.  Under no circumstances go out what appears to be the center - that will drop you off a sidewalk and create a sparks show for all the people on the deck.  Go either far right or far left and make sure you're looking.

reviews.name: A A.
reviews.review: My wife and I started going to this place after we became sick of Las Palmas on 8th by Kroger.  Maybe it's only a by comparison thing, but we've been really happy here.Is it authentic or real special?  No, but after Las Palmas became more a la carte, more gristle in the chicken, and watered down tiny margaritas, this place seems like heaven.  The deck is huge and a plus.  You can even feed the finches and grow in cholesterol together.   When no one is looking of course.  And the wicker light fixtures kick ass.  They get half a star solely on the fixtures and the struggling rose bush by the front door.  I also like that half of the original flourescent cabana sign is now enclosed with the patio.  They also have old tube TV's on the porch, usually not too loud, and an impressive mix of ecclectic chairs and other things hung up in the rafters.  Character counts, maybe more when drinking, but it counts.  The food seems better to us not only because of larger portions, but better combinations and specials.  I get a Special Burrito, one chicken, one beef, a little lettuce, sour cream, and salsa on top.  Pretty dang good in my opinion.  Haven't hit gristle yet.  I get the feeling they want us to like the food and are trying.  That is an improvement.  Have also tried other mainstays typical of mexican places and I like them all.  After we have two margaritas a piece, we are effectively able to get our buzz on.  I can't ask anymore in that department, but admittedly am not very discriminating.  They are not complete margarita mix bombs, and taste semi-strong at first.  If I pucker up and get a shiver with a little bite on the first sip, that's a good thing!  My wife is a vegan and she tries all kinds of stuff.  She's pretty happy with the place and we've been going every other week or so with no complaint.I also must warn you that there is a Futon store next door.  Futons remind me of all kinds of weird times in my life, but I am able to work thru it, and really enjoy this place!The staff is usually very nice and prompt.  The other patrons sometimes are a little sketchy, but I don't feel threatened, and have even communicated in a friendly manner with some of them.  Springer-esque looking folks sometimes, but I bet they think I look like wierd, so all is fair.  I would def check this place out, and keep your hopes realistic.  Go to taco mammacita or whatever that place is if you want flashy.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Lunch was OK, nothing really to brag about other than it was Fast.  Oh and I brought my home grown peppers, calante'

reviews.name: Jay G.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times, and always for the lunch. I always get the grilled chicken and rice, ~$6. It's pretty straight forward: rice + chicken + cheese dip poured over the top. I know it's not much but it is great. Sometimes, I go places and they have very unique and innovative dishes, but lack technical cookings skills. All I am saying is if you are in the business of selling food, please cook the basics perfect then move to more elaborate entrees. That being said that's why I love this dish. They grilled the chicken perfectly, seasonings compliment the grilled flavor, and it wasn't dry. Placed delicately over a warm bed of rice with everybody's favorite cheese dip holding it all together. Chips were tasty. They were thin style but extremely crunchy. The salsa had a good kick of spice, so those of you can't handle a little heat, beware. All in all after the many times coming here, they have yet to disappoint, therefore I'm giving a positive review.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: El Mariachi isn't anything special in terms of a culinary adventure, however if you are looking for some standard Mexican food you certainly won't walk away unhappy. They have all your old favorites... tacos, enchiladas, burritos, taco salads, ect. They also have vegetarian options on the menu.The food was decent, the staff was nice, the place has a patio and it was clean. All in all, if you are craving Mexican this place will meet your needs.

reviews.name: Allie R.
reviews.review: I have been searching for standard, Americanized, yummy, cheesy, Mexican food for quite some time now.  I tried and didn't like Las Palmas, Cozymels, and Chuy's isn't really Mexican (their rice stinks so they are no good to me).  My husband brought me here because he has lunch during the work week here all the time, and I loved it!  The inside is cute, very stereotypical Mexican restaurant, it was perfect!  At first we went to sit out on the patio, but once we realized that patio was smoker friendly we went back inside, which was no problem.  Their prices were very fair, especially their alcohol.  I had two very boozy frozen lime margaritas and really enjoyed them.  And apparently their 32 oz beers were buy one get one!  What a deal!  I ordered the chicken quesadillas, they were delicious.  Cheesy, juicy, and hot.  Their rice is great, and rice is always one of my favorite parts of Mexican restaurants.  My husband got a beef burrito and taco (like he always does) and enjoyed them very much.  As I've stated, this isn't a ground breaking Mexican restaurant.  They have delicious Mexican classics that most certainly will be back for!  Very happy with my experience.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: Super fast Mexican food here.  Nothing extraordinary, but a decent meal and good service... Much better option than say, any Las Palmas location these days.

reviews.name: Libby B.
reviews.review: El Mariachi is a pretty average Mexican restaurant, good enough to satisfy a craving, but perhaps not someplace I'd recommend to someone looking to taste some truly authentic Mexican cuisine. Their menu covers all your traditional Mexican food items - burritos, fajitas, nachos, etc, and also includes vegetarian choices and things like burgers for kids. I will say that this is probably not the place to come to if you're looking for a light meal - even a single beef burrito seems excessive to eat all in one sitting.All in all, not a bad place. The service is speedy, the atmosphere is festive, and the patio is a lovely place to spend a cool summer evening.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: I visited El Mariachi with my dad for lunch yesterday.  The restaurant is clean and nicely decorated and furnished.  Those are the positive things I can say about it.  The food was bad.  My dad had a Speedy Gonzalez and I had Huevos Rancheros.  Both of us felt that our food had was bland and we have had much better food at other Mexican places.  It was the worst meal I have ever had at any Mexican restaurant in Middle Tennessee.  The service was even worse. Our server was absent for most of the time and rarely even bothered to refill our drinks.  She spent most of her time talking to a guy who was two booths down from us who was apparently a regular there.  We even had to walk up to her to ask for our check.  You should never have to approach the server to ask for your own check due to their inattention!  Needless to say, that was our first and last visit to El Mariachi.

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: I love El Marachi. Very friendly staff, great fajitas and chimichangas! The patio is one of the best in town for Mexican restaurants. It's a great place before bowling or the movies!

reviews.name: Danielle R.
reviews.review: I love this place. Great food and great service. Been going for years great drinks

reviews.name: Sammy K.
reviews.review: I eat 3 star meskin a lot in this damn town.  and this place gets the job done.  I've passed out here in a booth by myself a time or 5.

reviews.name: Mariah B.
reviews.review: I love that place. They have a patio and you can smoke on it. My favorite dish is a shrimp quesadilla. House margaritas are heavenly - I love to have them for breakfast ( I know - weird ) My favorite restaurant and its close to my house.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: I live nearby so I frequent El Mariachi quite a bit. Perfect before or after a movie at 100 Oaks. The food here is totally average - exactly what you expect from a Mexican joint.  The thing that makes El Mariachi stand out is the HUGE covered patio. It seats about 50 people. Perfect in spring, summer and fall. El Mariachi does have one dish that I really love. Grilled Chicken Plate #2 is so plain, yet so yummy. Rice and pulled chicken with queso on top.p.s. the margaritas taste a bit weak, but all that sweet and sourness much be hiding the tequila cause I'm sober... then I'm tanked. That stuff will sneak up on ya.

reviews.name: Dylan B.
reviews.review: Our favorite place for Mexican food. Not "gourmet," but I'm not sure Mexican food as American's know it is meant to be gourmet. We always leave satisfied and like to make our own dish out of the cheesy rice with chicken and have them add fajita veggies. Very reasonable too.

reviews.name: Max K.
reviews.review: My wife ordered a dish, but what appeared was completely different.  When we asked them to replace it with a correct entrée the waitress looked like she was about to spit in our food.  My food was average... but since when do Mexican restaurants charge for chips and salsa refills?  :) "Unamerican".

reviews.name: S S.
reviews.review: This is the second worst Mexican restaurant I have experienced in my adult life.I got one of their combination platters. Think cheese dip that looks like snot, taquitos that are about as good at the frozen things you get from cost-co and very very unauthentic quesadilas. It is the kind of place your cousin who has never been outside the US thinks is 'exotic'.

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: I went here last night with a friend who doesn't really like Mexican food, and another who swears this is the best place ever--she and her husband go almost every Sunday.  Well, when we left, she was apologizing that this experience was a total fluke and it's not normally like this.  Yeah, I was not so impressed.  The patio is great, for starters.  I can see how that is a huge draw of this place.  The waitress (who was not the person that "normally" waits on my friend, I guess) brought out chips and salsa, but the chips tasted burnt.  We asked for another basket, and these didn't taste much better.  But we were starving so we ate them anyway.  I also ordered sangria--that tasted like fruit punch.  It was not good.  Usually, sangria is served with fruit in it and some ice, but this had neither.  Just a weird color, and I half expected the Hawaiian Punch character to jump out at us while we were eating.  Anyway.  Food was so-so.  Got the chicken quesadilla, and it was fine but not nearly mind-blowing.  I'll go again, on the advice of my friend--apparently, it's usually a better experience than this.  I'll update this after my next visit, but for now, two stars.

reviews.name: Kelly T.
reviews.review: I like sitting on the patio and the margaritas are HUGE! I think the food is okay & cheap.

reviews.name: Johnny N.
reviews.review: Patio for drinks gives it a couple stars.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: I come here with some of my co-workers and I'm not sure if we come here for the patio or for the food, because both are good.  I don't know if it is "authentic" because I have never been to Mexico, but it is pretty darn good.  After sampling the majority of the menu, I usually decide on the chicken chimichangas, although there are some really good lunch combos that allow for a good sampling.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Do you get the idea from the name that beefy Mexican singers will stroll up to your table and sing Mexican classics? You guessed it, and I think they're the best mariachi singers in Music City, USA. Skip requesting "La Cucaracha!" That might go over as good as requesting "When the Saints Go Marchin' In" at Preservation Hall. El Mariachi is worth the drive for the musicians, and for the food. It's in Berry Hill near Melrose. Call first for times they play.

reviews.name: Melody H.
reviews.review: My other favorite of two Mexican restaurants. I hadn't found a good Mexican restaurant since I had moved here. I'd been to Las Palmas (on Franklin/8th ave. so.) several times, and hated it. Didn't know what everyone was raving about. (Maybe I ate at the wrong location!) When I found this place, it was a pleasant surprise. They've got good sangria (although they serve it with ice, which is weird to me), and two vegetarian options that I'd never seen at your average mexican restaurant before. One is the spinach burrito dinner, which comes with beans and rice. I had never even heard of a spinach burrito before, but man, do they have it perfected! It's really good. My other favorite meal there is the Rancheros Rolls (I think that's what they're called), it's spinach, lettuce, beans, tomato rolled in a sort of little wrapping, and cut into four pieces. They serve it with ranch, and I think you get a side with it, but I never have enough room left for the side. Also, their chips and salsa are some of the best I've had. Queso dip is great too. They are a little overpriced (imho), but it doesn't seem to be anymore expensive than any other mexican place. Most of the time, the staff is polite, I've had a few odd experiences, but overall, good.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Great place .  One of my favorites for lunch, but I'm sad to say that they've closed.  Puckett's is now in that location.Still miss their fruit tea.  :-(

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: One of the more cozy places to eat downtown for lunch is A City Diner.  It caters mostly to business types looking for a relaxing atmosphere with quick service.It is a sit down lunch place with very fast service.  The day I went the special was Spaghetti with meat sauce.  I was happy with my order because it was a hearty portion and very good!  However, I ended up getting tomato sauce on my white shirt, which was not good!The huge menu is filled with lots of salads.A City Diner is a great alternative to some of the sandwich shops around the downtown area especially because the price is right!  I spent only $10.00!  Too bad it closes at 3:00 p.m., because it would be a great laid back place to have dinner with friends downtown!

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: A City Place was another one of my downtown lunch spots. I would often wander out of my building not having a clue where I wanted to go for lunch or what I might want, and A City Place was where I often found myself.If I didn't feel very good, I knew I could always get a nice bowl of soup and a sandwich. I would always get that kind of comfort food here -- tuna fish, chicken salad, etc. They did have other, more substantial options. There's a rotating list of daily specials. I believe they did have some pretty tasty spinach enchiladas on one of the days I went in.There's seating at the counter where you can watch them make your food. The service is efficient, the food comes out even faster. Quick, simple, and easy. That's A City Place.

reviews.name: Bebo B.
reviews.review: Awesome service, great burgers!They have a veggie burger option, which is very nice of them, and the mac and cheese bites were the bomb. They have a burger and a milk shake of the month, which keeps things fresh and interesting!

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: Not too much to say about this place.  It's a decent burger, but not exactly cheap at $8 or whatever my double patty melt + mushrooms was.  Too bad the patty melt bread is just upside down burger buns.  It was pretty good and very clean.

reviews.name: Spence R.
reviews.review: WAAAAAYYYYYYY over priced. $10 for a double cheese burger with stale fries and a drink?? That was a mistake.

reviews.name: D. B.
reviews.review: While in Nashville I wanted to try a good local burger and chili cheese and onion rings very good find while i will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Josh C.
reviews.review: This was better than McDonald's but jot as good as Wendy's. Very nice, helpful staff, but the food was fast food quality.  The beef comes in a frozen unformed patty and then cooked on the flat top.  Burger isn't salted. Churro shake had good flavor, but some weird ice flakes in it. It wasn't bad ,but it was priced similar to five guys, which is in another league.

reviews.name: Eric H.
reviews.review: Clean little place. I like the decor and loved the music which was all old school American rock (since we've been here and as I type this, half the score of Dirty Dancing has played!). Staff is friendly and attentive. The food is just ok. Decent burger, but the patties are small and a little on the greasy side for my taste. The fries weren't the best. Honestly Wendy's are better. To be honest, for the price and convenience, I'll just stick with Five Guys for my occasional burger and fries fix. It's disappointing  because we wanted this place to be better. Just have to keep looking for those hidden gems. This place isn't it.

reviews.name: Kari S.
reviews.review: This place was great! I loved the mac n cheese bites!  The burger is one of the best I've had in a long time, and the chili cheese fries, soooooooo good!

reviews.name: Dude S.
reviews.review: I'll start out by saying that the girl at the cash register taking my order screwed that up right off the bat. I didn't notice until I had paid and the order was in. She rang up my burger with cheese and charged me for it. I never ordered cheese. I can't stand the fake cheese product you get at fast food places. I could have read the receipt through the bacon it was so thin too. But it was a decent burger and fries 10 bucks for a combo is a little pricey but not a big deal. I would compare this place to Five Guys Burgers and Fries just not as greasy which is a plus. It is definitely better than the run of the mill fast food chain burger joints. They seem to have a good menu selection with veggie burgers and chicken sandwiches. I'll go back to try out a shake and a different sandwich maybe the buffalo chicken with onion rings next time.

reviews.name: Cam C.
reviews.review: Been meaning to try this place, and they are excellent! Very attentive to customers and everything can be ordered the way you like it. The chili was good (not great, but very good) and the burgers are excellent. They have salads and milkshakes as well, so I'll be back.

reviews.name: Jonathan S.
reviews.review: Good for a Tuesday nice and quick lunch.

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: Can now say that I've tried it. Nothing special. Cheeseburger and fries. Very small patty. Vegetables tasted fresh.  Fries were just OK. I was really hungry and it just didn't satisfy. Staff friendly enough. Probably my only visit.

reviews.name: Shannon S.
reviews.review: Heard this place was pretty good. Went in with high hopes, but this place is mediocre at best. Prices are too high for the quality, and the burgers have no seasoning at all. I'd compare it to Wendys .

reviews.name: Brent v.
reviews.review: Great burgers and onion rings. Love their southwest chipotle burger. It's got a little kick, but very flavorful. I'll be back.

reviews.name: Jonathan S.
reviews.review: Yet another fast food chain burger joint that wishes it was Gabby's. Prices are high for Burger King quality food. Save yourself and either get good food for this price range, or get cheap food of this quality, neither combination is available here. Oh, the food?  Burger is ok at best, fries were limp and on the greasy side. Overall disappointment.

reviews.name: Linda D.
reviews.review: Some of the best onion  rings in town. The milk shakes are amazing too.  Burgers are better than 5 guys.  Great  addition  to the  neighborhood.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: The food was great, no complaints there. The employee charged me for a drink that I didn't order but was able to fix it and give me back the extra dollar easily enough.
