They appear to offer some type of customer loyalty program but nobody offered to sign me up for it, which means that I wont get any kind of credit for the $15 that I paid for the 2 burgers and order of fries. Overall my experience was good and the food was good but I don't like not being given the opportunity to join their loyalty program and I absolutely hate having a company attempt to charge me for things that I didn't order.

reviews.name: Pamela P.
reviews.review: My husband and I have eaten here many times.  The employees always remember us and are very kind and helpful.  The burgers are amazing and we love that they have the Old Bay at hand to put on the fries.  The sauces are delicious and the building is in a very convenient location.  We'll be back.

reviews.name: Ebony Da'na C.
reviews.review: I'm not a fan of fast food burgers but often times I do have a craving for a good burger without having to go to a sit down casual dining restaurant. For these occasions I often go to Five Guys but when I saw Wayback Burgers was coming to the shopping center near Walmart on Charlotte Pike, I was definitely interested in checking it out. The premise of the place is old fashioned burgers cooked to order. They also have milkshakes and onion rings as well. I got the Wayback burger (two patties with cheese) and they let you chose whatever toppings you want too. I wasn't into trying anything different so it was just fries for me to go with my burger. I paid about $10 so it was a bit cheaper than their competitor. Although it the store wasn't super busy it took a while for my food but I do appreciate having food cooked to order so it was hot and fresh. The bun was better than you average burger bread but it also wasn't pretenious like a brioche. The meat was juicy but had a weird texture (its real beef obviously), not sure if this was because a high fat content or what. My only complaint is there was no taste. I'm not say you need some crazy seasoning but a little salt and pepper would be nice. Fries were crisp and hot, what more can you ask for? The burgers do remind me of a homemade burger my family would have growing up so I'm not opposed to going back especially if I'm in the area. Overall a-ok.

reviews.name: Eric C.
reviews.review: Wow.  This place gives five guys a run for their money. Chili cheese fries are amazing. Kids are raving about the shakes. Burgers are fantastic. Will lettuce wrap burgers.  Service is great.

reviews.name: Sierra N.
reviews.review: My family eats here every now and then, and the food is great. We usually always deliver, because the actual restaurant isn't that pleasurable. But the food is great, usually a dinner plate will fill you up, but I do wish you would get a little more for your money, that would be my only issue. Other than that, I love Chinese food and will be going again!

reviews.name: Marty D.
reviews.review: I've stopped writing reviews after one visit to an establishment. One visit is MY first experience, two visits gives a better idea and three visits tells the REAL STORY. I am happy to say that after three visits to New China Restaurant, it rocks!  Each time out they have met and exceeded my expectations.  One heads up for anyone ordering delivery...they are not the fastest to arrive but each time I ordered and had my food delivered it was HOT and really tasty.ENJOY!

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: I ordered the lunch size portion of the Mongolian beef and hot and sour soup. It was delicious! I could definitely taste the msg but I didn't go here for a healthy meal. Ha! My meal was around $6.50.  I'd come here again.

reviews.name: Shannon M.
reviews.review: So I placed my order for the (Lunch) Sesame Chicken (Served with rice) $5.25, (with lunch special) small Egg Drop 50 cents (which was a big size than what I've ordered from other Chinese places), Mixed Vegetables (one size) $6.65, Fried Noodles (per bag) 79 cents, Fried Crab Ragoon (8) $4.25. Paid about 22$ + 4$ tip. They were 10 minutes away from me. I waited an hour. Everything was great! They gave me plenty of sweet & sour sauce. I mean plenty. Lol I got an egg roll I guess because I ordered the lunch special. One thing I didn't like was no fork & napkin. That's all!

reviews.name: Dan Z.
reviews.review: This review was posted in error.

reviews.name: Stefanie P.
reviews.review: You're thinking wow how can 1 review have 5 stars and another has 1 stars. This all comes with your Chinese Food Background. What I mean is look, if you believe that Chinese resturants should be clean, and the food should be hot, and the people should speak English thats fine, but maybe you're a person who thinks the dirty the place the better the food. And good ol New Chine Restaurant, for me, is right in the middle of these two 'backgrounds'They have a 95 food rating. (does this help) People complain on Yelp ALOT that food is too expensive. Okay Alert Alert -- this place is Cheap. I mean lunch, a can soda, and tax was $6.45. How is that possible?? I asked the nice women there what was the spiciest -- and she told me. I asked if it came with onions and peppers. She said, "No, but trust me" Fine. I'm up for adventure. And about 10 minutes later the most yummy super spicy, chicken with onions and peppers, fried rice AND a egg roll AND a coke came out HOT flavorful and for $6.45. It's a miracle. As I waited, about 5 other people came in picking up togo orders. Also it appears they have delivery (within a certain area maybe)Look just try it, you might totally love it or totally hate it. It makes life fun.I liked it! ;-)

reviews.name: Lily S.
reviews.review: Worst service. .... waited in the hotel lobby for over an hour and when I asked about their whereabouts,  I was told the delivery person is almost there.  Really annoying

reviews.name: Lindsay M.
reviews.review: Shrimp and broccoli is AMAAAAAAZING. Vegetables and seafood are fresh, crisp, and cooked perfectly. The service was super quick. I never wait more than 5 minutes for my food. The only complaint I have is that you get twice as much food at other Chinese places...I've never seen portion sizes this small and my husband and I weren't able to share like we usually do. The quality is worth spending more for two entrees, though! I will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Kimberly A.
reviews.review: After a delayed flight coming into Nashville, I was craving some serious junk food. Only options around were Italian and Chinese. Glutinously I over ordered...CHICKEN EGG FOO YUNGGENERAL TSO's BEEF ROAST PORK FRIED RICE STEAMED VEG AND TOFUI covered all the major protein groups! And I didn't feel that bad...it was for a family of three. One word... BLAND. All dishes were in desperate need of salt, pepper, and flavor. There was a mystery oily sauce that did not even come close to providing any flavor to the dishes. My first taste of Chinese in Nashville. Major fail.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: Standard decent Chinese take-out. Serving sizes were HUGE... food was greasy, but nothing atypical for Chinese take-out. We ordered online (a perk!) and picked up within 20 minutes. Food tasted fresh, chicken lo mein was top notch (we requested it be spicy--it was delicious)... Sweet and sour chicken was great, beef and broccoli was a little bland and gravy-heavy, but decent. Fried rice was the yellow grain--a little off-putting for me, but whatever. We'll likely return when the late-night craving hits again.

reviews.name: Monica S.
reviews.review: We stayed at a nearby hotel, got it at 10:30 pm and needed something open. The do delivery, but the wait was about 30 min compared to 10 if we picked up, so we picked it up. We got the Kung pow beef and the chicken lo mein and asked for both spicy. The portions were huge! The chicken lo mein was excellent but the beef was not very good - weird texture. Overall I would say it was average, hits the spot for a late night or similar situation, but nothing spectacular.

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Well, damn. I ordered the General Tso's chicken and it was 10% dried out dark meat and 90% breading. What a sneaky way to save money.  Not cool. The broccoli was good.

reviews.name: Leah S.
reviews.review: I got sesame chicken, it was okay. The fried rice was so delicious though! However I got delivery to a hotel and they wouldn't bring it to my room, didn't like that at all Bc if I wanted to get out I would have just picked it up myself.

reviews.name: Steve W.
reviews.review: Food was good prices are decent. Ordered for delivery $15.00 Minimum. Chicken rice soup was not a good thing to order. Beef Chow mein and fried dumplings were good. Customer service is lacking. Staying in a hotel and ordering delivery this would be a first to get a call from delivery man asking me to meet him in the lobby because hotel staff would not let him past the desk. So me being a hungry fat kid I took the elevator down and found he wasn't there yet. Waited a couple minutes and he pulled up walked through the door handed me the food took the money and he was outta there quick like nija.......

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: This place was the worst.  First, it is a dump which is only OK if the food is good.  But, it wasn't.  There were three of us and it was a consensus dud.  The sesame chicken was awful...like biting into little hollow rocks with no chicken on the inside.  It also had a weird taste that I can't explain other than it wasn't like any sesame chicken I've ever had.  By far the worst Chinese we've had since moving to Nashville.

reviews.name: Holly M.
reviews.review: I travel a lot for work and if I don't have a car I tend to go for Chinese delivery for dinner.  But I also tend to get discouraged since Chinese restaurants by the airport are hit or miss.  I was very pleased with New China.  I ordered the orange chicken combination platter, and they let me swap steamed rice for the fried rice and a spring roll for the egg roll.  I also ordered Chinese donuts.  Everything was very good, and I still have enough leftovers for another meal.  The price was great, $7 for the combo platter, $3 for the donuts, and only $1 for a delivery service charge.  Sometimes when I order blindly from a place I'm unfamiliar with I end up getting charged $20 for mediocre food I don't even want to eat the next day due to BS service charges and overpriced menu items, so the quality at New China was great for the price.The staff was also super nice.  It may sound silly, but I appreciated how nice the lady was when she took my order on the phone, a lot of times I find people to be rude and impatient when taking phone orders, so it was refreshing to talk to someone who was so nice and helpful.  The delivery guy was nice too!So overall the food, prices, and service was great, I would order food here again.

reviews.name: Nick H.
reviews.review: Probably one of the worst Chinese food places I've had. The 2 stars were given to the wonton soup but that's pushing it. I ordered kung pao chicken and the chicken was fried. I've never had king pao with fried chicken and let me say it was bad. The taste wasn't like any Kung pao I've ever had. It wasn't the same. The whole meal seemed dry and uneventful. Honestly the best part was the fortune cookies.

reviews.name: A M.
reviews.review: This place sucks.  Food is too expensive and it's not that good.  Don't come here unless this is your only option

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: I have been getting my Chinese take out here for years.The service is Great, fast and always ready for me to pick-up and go.They also offer delivery service.

reviews.name: Thugnificent M.
reviews.review: Decent Chinese take out spot.  I came in on a Saturday night during dinner time.  There was no one eating there but the phone rang there every five seconds.  I ordered some food to go; chicken broccoli and beef lo mien.  As busy as they were I got my order pretty quickly.  Food was good.  I was happy.

reviews.name: Kristina G.
reviews.review: I got crab rangoons, honey chicken and a side of chicken lo mein.  The crab rangoons were eh, there was nothing special about them and the wanton rappers seemed like they were a little stale.  The honey chicken was horrible, it was all a congealed mess in the bowl and I'm pretty sure they used pancake syrup to make it, it made its way to the trash can instead of into my stomach.  I would only consider going back to this place if it was to get the chicken lo mein,  it was not the best I've ever had but it was decent.  I gave it two stars because of the low mein and the fast and friendly service.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: This is probably the best Chinese restaurant in Donelson It's not great but it's good worth trying.

reviews.name: Shane M.
reviews.review: Pretty good Chinese and decent prices. They deliver too.

reviews.name: Sean W.
reviews.review: Good food, better than Super Wok in Hermitage. They have traditional pork fried rice plus the food is pretty tasty. Be on the look out for coupons in the clipper magazine. Cute plastic containers are nice as well.

reviews.name: Dustin T.
reviews.review: An unknown treasure hidden away in Green Hills. The food is excellent and the staff are attentive and friendly. I highly recommend this place. I ordered the curried goat (spicy) and it was perfectly spiced, flavorful, and served with the standard rice, cabbage and carrots, and plantains. I cannot wait to return.

reviews.name: A M.
reviews.review: Finally, a really good Jaimacan restaurant...elegant and inexpensive.  The curry goat was perfectly cooked and spiced, the rice and peas light and fluffy. A strange location but wonderful food...go quickly and make them a success!

reviews.name: William G.
reviews.review: Simply the best subs!!!  I ordered a chicken salad with bacon OMG!!  It was the best and the bread was outstanding, too many choices to chose from but I did great.

reviews.name: Beth S.
reviews.review: Does the sub was the right size to split for two people. Service was great and a friendly staff.  The decor within the restaurant is fun and it's about the different states in the different cities and the fun things you can do with in the cities.

reviews.name: Kate J.
reviews.review: This sub sandwich shop is a regular stop for my co-workers and I each week. Typically pretty good sub sandwiches and salads, however the last 2 times I have been, the sandwiches and wraps have been very skimpy and noticeably smaller portion. I ordered the California Veggie wrap which says extra tomato and avocado,  I got a slather of avocado and 2 thin slices of tomato.  If the sandwiches are getting smaller, so does the price. I paid $10.25 for basically a "condiment sandwich" and a tea.  With a new Panera Bread across the street with artisan food for the same if not cheaper price, something needs to be addressed or we will not be returning.

reviews.name: Courtney G.
reviews.review: Wow! I am pleasantly surprised by this place! I am in town for work and staying across the street. The yelp reviews were great so I thought I'd give it a try - glad I did! The sub is huge and very fresh. There are so many sandwich options, salads, etc. Very clean inside and the staff was very nice. Too bad I couldn't finish it all... The sandwich is big enough for two people!!

reviews.name: Emily F.
reviews.review: My favorite sub place ever!!!  I get the turkey & cheese & top it with mushrooms & other yummy goodness (perfect when steamed), but you really can't go wrong.

reviews.name: Ryan N.
reviews.review: This place makes a solid sub.  You definitely feel like the bread you're eating in the sandwiches here is homemade (not like the frozen stuff competitors use).  It just sort of delicately collapses in a bite--soft and crispy from toasting.  Excellent bread.There are so many options and the staff are extremely helpful in the process of ordering.  The toppings were good, and it all just really came together in a great sandwich.Beware, the interior looks dated.  Also, the lunch rush was a little hectic (but surprising quick considering).  They do have fountain drinks--so free refills!

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Why would you even go to subway or any of those fast food sub shops? Well, stop it and go here. This place is good, super friendly staff, food was real good.  Had the 3 cheese steak with bacon.  They can steam them or toast them too.  Go here for your sandwich fool. LOL  have a great day. First time here

reviews.name: Marilyn L.
reviews.review: Wow. I was dropping my mom off at the airport a little early and we decided to grab a quick bite before her flight so we found this sandwich shop on yelp. We pulled up to an interesting strip mall with a tiny sand which place and boy, never judge a book by its cover!! I can tell you I had the BEST sub in my whole life. Not one of those crappy subways or jimmy johns or even pot bellies. This was fresh, tasty, and the bread is homemade! Nothing better. Going back for sure!

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: This is our office's favorite sub shop in the Donelson area.  They offer a huge variety of subs that can be cooked a variety of ways.  Everything tastes really good & fresh and the service is quick.  The atmosphere is simple but that's a good thing.  Overall a great lunch spot!

reviews.name: Tsz-Cheong C.
reviews.review: Nice sandwiches, gets really busy starting at Noon. The food comes out pretty quick though. These sandwiches are densely packed. You definitely get your moneys worth eating here. The "Torpedo and Destroyer" are one of my faves. The decor is typical of a sandwich joint. If you're ever in the area stop by, you won't be disappointed!

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: This is a pretty good joint it depends on who's making the subs some days are better than others I normally get a 8 inch rye with pastrami and corned beef mixed with all the fixings... Love it!

reviews.name: Ken A.
reviews.review: I stopped here the other day for lunch. I was impressed the the amount of sub combinations, even several vegetarian selections. I would highly suggest looking at the on-line menu before going. One unique visual about the place is all the maps on the walls. Very cool.

reviews.name: Jamil M.
reviews.review: The only reason I take a star away is the hours. They cater to the lunch rush mostly, so they close early on Weeknights and Weekends.I have had 5 sandwiches there and they were all good. I don't do deli sandwiches often but these are excellent.

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: Sub Depot. Sounds pretty boring right? Well, don't let the exterior fool you(not that the interior is something to write home about). This place is happening every day for lunch. Every time I go there is a line, and sometimes the line goes out the door! The line probably has something to do with their wide variety of delicious food. It's not just subs, people!  Don't get me wrong, they have a nice array of different subs(and you can build your own as well), but they also have soups, salads, french bread pizzas, and even some tasty sweets. Everything that I have tried has been pretty good. I think it beats any of the sub chains in the area hands down.Might I also mention that they have free Wi-Fi. This seems like a no-brainer to me, yet there are not that many local businesses jumping on the free Wi-Fi train. In conclusion: If you need a sub fix, then try just about anything on the menu. Speaking of menu, the one they have above the counter is kind of large, overwhelming, and hard to read. You may want to grab one of their to-go menus when trying to decide what you want. Support your local sub shop!

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: This is one of my favorite sub places.  They have an extensive selection of delicious sandwiches, and I also love the potato salad sides you can get instead of the stereotypical bag of chips.  Although everything I've tried on the menu is delicious, the food is just a hair shy of a 5 star rating.I do wish they were open a little later but they have extended their hours since I originally started eating there.As others mentioned, the inside decorations are another plus with the skyline pictures of Nashville and the artwork of other cities.

reviews.name: Don A.
reviews.review: Great food!!  I only had the destroyer and it rocked.  That have a ton of different subs and if you don't like any build your own!  Like another review said don't let the location or outside fool you.  I travel alot and love all the maps inside,  just some neat stuff.  Food is very fairly priced and you won't walk out hungry!  A+ for this place can't wait till I'm back in Nashville for another sub

reviews.name: Tom G.
reviews.review: The subs are very good.  I would say they are above average and worth trying.  However, I've been there twice and I will never return.  I had the same cashier both times and she is very rude and sarcastic.  I feel like I was bullied each time.  From now on, I will avoid this place.

reviews.name: Chris R.
reviews.review: this place has a lot of great sounding sandwiches, interesting sides, 3 kinds of iced tea, awesome decor of maps and cool drawings of cities

reviews.name: Susan K.
reviews.review: In college, I worked at a locally owned sandwich shop in Arkansas called Munchy's that served their sandwiches steamed. It has been since I left there and moved to Nashville that my heart has pined for a locally-owned little sub shop akin to Munchy's that serves their goods steamed. My grandma recently told me about Sub Depot, and in the past week, I've been in twice. First of all, the menu is huge! You can get anything from the Destroyer (ham, turkey, salami, roast beef) to a meatball sub, philly cheesesteak, or chicken sub. They have sandwiches made to order, but you can also build your own sandwich consisting of the wide array of toppings and condiments. Now, these are not little piddly sammies with 3 slices of meat on them. These are 8-inch man-sized sandwiches loaded up with meat, cheese and veggies on freshly-baked bread. For a smaller sandwich you can get the mini, which is 5 inches, and the biggest sandwich is 14 inches.You can get your sub steamed, but you can also order it cold or toasted. I tried the meatball sub toasted last time I was in and it was wonderful. You can order chips with your sandwich, as well as a cup of soup or pasta salad, and I highly recommend the broccoli cheese soup (it tastes like it might be homemade). The location isn't that great (for me), but I feel it is worth it to drive a few extra miles to the Donelson area to score a solid sandwich. Good stuff!

reviews.name: Joanne R.
reviews.review: I tried La Parrilla for the first time last night. The atmosphere is very nice and very comfortable. We were seated quickly and just made the cutoff for happy hour. The mango margaritas were fantastic and those alone merit a return visit. The salsa is served in a very generous portion and was fresh and delicious.The menu is small and I think they excel at drinks and small plates. I had the Sante Fe burger and my friend had the traditional fajitas. Both items were slightly overcooked and my burger was more like a spicy meatloaf. It also was not dressed as described on the menu but overall the food was good. The side salad was slightly better than a value menu salad but about the same size. The star of the show however was dessert. I had the Tres Leches cake and my friend had the churros. Both were fresh and homemade and beautifully presented. Definitely save room for dessert. Overall, great atmosphere, good service and a wonderful place to grab a drink and appetizer.

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: Let me first say that I don't recall EVER returning food to a kitchen at a restaurant. If I have in the past, it's so long ago I can't recall. But I did today!!  Let me start from the beginning: I tried this place for lunch today. Was seated fairly quickly by a polite hostess. All good so far. I took a look at the relatively limited menu, when compared to other Mex places like La Hacienda or Mazatlan. It took a full 10 minutes before anyone else acknowledged me. If they would have been busy, that wouldn't be a problem, but the servers were all gathered around the hostess station talking while I just kind of sat there. When my waitress finally did come up and take my order, it was pretty obvious to me that she wasn't completely comfortable in her job. Seemed new to food service altogether in my honest opinion. But, she was polite enough. Decided to order the steak Quesadilla, on the very first bite, I hit a "meat" chunk I couldn't chew. On my 4th bite, I hit what I could only describe as a brittle bone...that was it. Told the waitress I wanted the check. I didn't even want to fix the meal, just wanted to pay and get out. She said she would talk to her manager, who then came out. Miguel, I believe his name was. A nice guy, but he basically told me I was wrong and it couldn't be a bone in my food, because the meat they order doesn't have bones in it...?? So they must buy from those farms with boneless cows I guess. I realize that the product they buy is supposed to be bone free, but it's certainly still within the realm of possibility that a bone made its way through the process. What is scarier is that, if it wasn't a bone, then what the heck was it?!? In any case, he insisted that he make me a CHICKEN quesadilla to go. I figured ok what the heck. Took it to go and paid my $12.02 bill, leaving a $3 tip.  (that's for a quesadilla and iced tea).So I got home, thinking maybe I shouldn't write a bad review for this place. After all, as a rule I don't do Yelp reviews at all. But then I decided to try a couple bites of the chicken quesadilla just to see if it was any good. It was not great. I tried dipping the 2nd bite into my refried beans, and I literally spit it out. The beans had a strong fishy aftertaste. I chucked the rest of that quesadilla and sat down to write this. Lesson learned, I will not be going back there!

reviews.name: Karl S.
reviews.review: I honestly don't mind waiting my turn, but when I've been standing in you entrance and the hostess asks another person to please seat me why she's helping someone else, I expect to be seated.  Unfortunately, the second employee felt it was more important to turn around and renter the kitchen, and then walk past me twice while ignoring me. Would have liked to eat, but too hungry to deal with this BS.

reviews.name: Lynn I.
reviews.review: Poor choice of restaurant! Salsa is stored next to dirty dish cart, cleaning supplies, and bucket to wash the floor.This place should be shutdown! Where's the health department when you need them

reviews.name: Licinius S.
reviews.review: had the top shelf margarita and 2 beef tacos for lunch - good lunch deal on the two tacos for 9$..  top shelf margaritas are awesome..!! (9.50$ for those) tacos were advertised as having cheese on them, but had none, manager was assisting employees on monitor order system, so i dismissed the error, and i received a double order later due to the systems being down/messed up when my order was placed..   still good tacos though..  will return..  they are still working out some kinks, but this is expected as new employees come in and people figure out the 'flow'.. regular 'house' margaritas are 6$..  not too bad of an up charge for top shelf..  I've seen 12$ elsewhere.. cilantro rice was good, but lots of cilantro, so beware if you don't like that..  NOTE: they add orange juice to their house margaritas- if you don't like that, just ask for them w/out it, they will leave it out..

reviews.name: Bianca D.
reviews.review: Amazing food and great service!! Was a bit hesitant after reading the reviews, but this place blew my expectations out of the water. I had the green chile fried chicken which was absolutely delicious. Me and my girlfriends also had some of the house margaritas. They weren't too strong, but definitely strong enough for me to feel something! The all around atmosphere was fun and inviting! The service was also pretty quick. Definitely added to my top three favorite places to eat in Nashville! Will definitely be back soon!

reviews.name: Rhonda A.
reviews.review: It breaks my heart to give this place a bad review, because almost everybody was so very eager to please! The mediocre service is due to inexperience, undoubtedly.Clearly not a one of these people have worked in the hospitality industry for over a month.The food, however, was the real dealbreaker!I had the Barbacoa BBQ tacos:the meat was like shoe leather, the cilantro slaw was nonexistent,  the sauce was goopy and sweet, the tortillas were old and dry.Not good.

reviews.name: Shane M.
reviews.review: Great place! Great atmosphere, VERY clean. We had a great server who was super friendly and helpful with our 2 yr old. The food was awesome as well! Chicken fajitas were amazing! Big portions, tasty, and they don't skimp on the red peppers too. They have happy hour 4-7pm every day, ladies night on Thursday, outside patio, and Karaoke mixed in too. Great place!

reviews.name: Kristin M.
reviews.review: Disgusting!!!! I hate to give bad reviews but this was just awful. The restaurant recently changed from Casa Fiesta to La Parilla and is nothing like its predecessor. I had a Chimichanga with rice and beans. The rice was completely bland and the beans were absolutely horrible. I should have known it would be bad when the waitress asked if I wanted red or white sauce on my Chimichanga. I thought they always came with cheese sauce.  The bread was doughy and not really "fried" at all. It had shredded chicken, onions and NACHO Cheese sauce on the inside! Yuck! Not to mention the queso cheese on top. Nothing had any taste or flavor. The margarita I had was even kind of watery. They should go back to the old cooks and owners and beg them to come back. Also, lunch was VERY overpriced. Never again. Casa Fiesta on Bell road is where I'll be from now on. I'll end it like I began, Disgusting!!!!

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: Wow. I'm astounded at how bad lunch was. Combo #1 beef taco, chicken chalupa-easy order right? Not so much. Came out all beef and without the sides. So the barkeep attempts to get me the right chalupa, however, what I get is an entire second meal all chicken. Come on man! This is Mexican, it's supposed to be easy. The beef was greasy as all hell and the chicken "tinga" tasted the absolute same as the crap in the cold case at Kroger. Portions were weak for Mexican and the quality was meh. The remodel of the place was pretty half assed too. Never again La Parilla. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice, well that's just not gonna happen. I give the place six months tops.

reviews.name: Katie H.
reviews.review: I am not understanding the bad reviews...Sissy the bartender rocked!!! Two less than positives:  I ordered a top shelf margarita only to find it was made with Josè Gold.  Yuck.   She quickly offered to make a Patron margarita with Grand Marnier.   Perfection.   The only other down I have is the guacamole was bland.    The positives:   The food was wonderful with generous portions.   Loved the salsa.   Service was fantastic! Restaurant/bar/restrooms were super clean and nicely decorated.   The service was the only thing that outdid the food.  I definitely recommend and will certainly be back!

reviews.name: Rick D.
reviews.review: The two stars are for service, they went over and above. Even thought I lived in Texas for 10 years in the 80s and 90s I guess I don't understand the term "Tex-Mex" at least not in this case. Chips, Salsa and Margaritas were good. I had the Steak Fajitas, meat was a little dry but onions and peppers were good. Beans and rice were very dry. I have never had Fajitas without Pico, sour cream, guacamole, shredded cheese or at least the offer of same. It was a first for me with Fajitas to have corn tortillas in stead of flour but I like corn tortillas.  Wife had a Beef Burrito and didn't like anything about it. I get they are trying to be high in and it is all but the food, beautiful restaurant and Bar.

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: They are still working out this links regarding service but the food and design/feel of the place are top notch.  It is a great little lunch spot on this side if town.

reviews.name: Kc K.
reviews.review: Great service but the food need a make over...the quality of food was defiantly not worth what we paid

reviews.name: Kevin K.
reviews.review: Decided to try out la parrilla for lunch today.  The restaurant was very clean and looked nice.  As for the food it was average and a little expensive for lunch.  Probably the first and last visit.

reviews.name: Philip G.
reviews.review: Cold stale chips and bland salsa. Portions are small and beef tortilla was mostly beans and rice. Overpriced and not very tasty. Fancy presentation could not make up for poor quality of the food. Service was good. We wont be back.

reviews.name: Libby C.
reviews.review: I work on Elm Hill Pike and it is understood that every restaurant around here gets a lunch rush. Yes, this is the old Casa Fiesta that has been completely redone. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt because they just opened, but this place was horrible. 3 adults & 1 child arrived there at 11:20 for lunch, was immediately seated, and then it all went down hill from there. I ordered unsweet tea which I asked for sweet and low packets. I asked 4 times from 2 different people and finally got them 25 mins later. By the time I got the packets, we all needed a refill, never got them. We were offered more chips and salsa (the salsa was really good, cold, and fresh actually) and only received more cold chips. Never got a drink refill. The kids plain cheese quesadilla took over 20 mins to come to the table. As for the 3 adult entrees we ordered?...we left after waiting an hour for them. The waitresses there were frantically running around and it was clear to see that we weren't the only table frustrated with the poor service. When we finally got to speak to the manager (i asked twice to talk to him), which was in the middle of us walking out the door, he apologized. Thanks for the apology, but this is just the tip of the ice burg: the acoustics are horrible; very loud, not a big menu, the La Parrilla that you find online to look at their menu is not this restaurant.....even though their sign and their font and colors resemble it???? I could go on and on, but I'm going to bank on "opening week" kinks that simply haven't been worked out yet. I really wanted to like this place.

reviews.name: Rena S.
reviews.review: So I came in at lunch around 1:45.  I am the only customer.  I check in through yelp and notify the waiter that I have received a 10% off coupon for checking in.  He states, the manager no longer accepts those coupons.  I order the Gui de Roma.  It is shrimp, sausage, and chicken on Pena pasta with a Cajun Alfredo sauce.  The pasta was cooked well, the sauce was great, chicken and shrimp tasted good.  The sausage did not taste good to me but I'm particular about sausage.  My meal came with three bread sticks and a house salad.  I also ordered a sweet tea.  My total was $11.39.  My waiter brought my check to the table and it was $13 and something.  I inquired about the amount because the menu stated that my meal would be $8 plus my drink.  He stated he guessed it was right.  I asked him to please make sure.Long story short, the food was good.  The service was less than desirable. Probably will not go back.

reviews.name: Katie B.
reviews.review: Still checking out the local grub since we moved to Donelson a couple of monthsago. We stopped in Taste of Italy around 6pm on a Tuesday and no one else was there... that always bothers me. We were there for almost an hour, and the entire time only one other couple came in. That said, the atmosphere and decor is really nice, and the food was good too. I had the cannelloni which came with bread sticks and salad - bread sticks great, salad boring.Here's the two biggest issues for me:1. The prices were $2-3 more per entree than the prices on their online menu.2. They do not serve alcohol (it is BYOB & there is a liquor store next door); their soft drink selection is cans/bottles. There's definitely room for improvement here, and I hope they'll make some because the food was good enough to return. Maybe next time I'll get it to-go.

reviews.name: Julie K.
reviews.review: We've never been to this location usually go downtown. We were the only people here for a nice while. I got the anitpasta salad and it was huge. For entrees we got baked ziti it's delicious. I got the spaghetti and meatballs so good. Server was prompt and kept our cokes full. I have a to go bag or two so a whole lot of food not much money.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I'll openly admit that as I'm writing this I'm a bit annoyed. Last Sunday the boyfriend and I were too lazy to get out so we decided to try Taste of Italy since they delivered and had something to offer other than pizza. I went with the Italian club sandwich (minus hot peppers) with fries and he got the mild buffalo wings and fries. We were quoted a 20-30 min delivery time but it actually took almost an hour. My sandwich was really good! It was on yummy homemade bread and had a good amount of ham and turkey, lots of melted provolone, fresh tomatoes, and romain lettuce. (NOT shredded lettuce! Yay!) The bacon could be crispier. The fries were good but almost too salty to eat. My boyfriend liked his wings and also agreed that the fries were too salty. Here's where my annoyance sets in.... So tonight I stop by because even though It's only been 4 days, I'm already craving another Italian club sub! After I place my order I show the waitress my Yelp check in offer and she has to go "ask her boss because she doesn't know about that." She comes back and proceeds to tell me they don't "do that" and the only discount they have is for senior citizens. I told her that her boss needs to contact Yelp so people won't be led to believe that they offer a discount if in fact they don't. I SHOULD have asked to speak to the manager to clarify the issue but after the day I had I simply wasn't in the mood to argue or debate over something that I shouldn't have to argue or debate over. The manager SHOULD have came out and explained their policy to me him(her)self. Anyway, while I was seated at a table waiting for my order I noticed a little card on the table encouraging people to check in and review them on Yelp. (See pic) Seriously, any other day I would have addressed this with the manager but sometimes you just know yourself well enough to know that it's probably best to let it go for now. After reading other reviews I now see that this happened to someone else a month ago. Management responded and blamed it on a new waitress and has allegedly fixed the issue. Apparently not. I'll likely give this place another try but if they still don't honor the Yelp discount I will definitely be addressing it with the manager. It's not the 10% off that's a big deal, it's the principle.

reviews.name: Anthony R.
reviews.review: I was placing my order and the guy on the phone wouldn't answer me when I keep repeating on mushrooms, artichokes and extra piccata sauce. After repeating myself four times I ask the gentleman to please respond to me, his response was I doing something else. I travel for a living, and that has to be the rudest response I have ever received while placing an order for delivery. The driver showed up with my water and it was incorrect. I called to make a complaint with the manager and the guy said he was the one that took my order and he made it correctly, I thought ask for a refund and told the gentleman I would send the food back with the driver and I was told sorry there will be no refund because he made it correctly.

reviews.name: Arthur M.
reviews.review: This is a small little place but with GREAT food. I've gotten steak and pizza here and let me tell you. The steak is super good. It's juicy and nearly fork cut. They cook on an open flame which is amazingTheir pizza is fabulous for someone who grew up in Boston. Just amazing.Give it a try, you'll be glad you did.

reviews.name: Grant C.
reviews.review: Atmosphere - ok. Air conditioning ducts are uncovered and above booths. Result is it the condensation drips on guests, food, and drink.Service - we arrived at 12:22. They were crowded, but unsure if they were busy. We arrived after typical lunch rush. Service was slow. Waitress was friendly and nice though.Food - excellent flavor, large portions, and hot food was hot/cold was cold.This is a BYOB restaurant. Yeah!We were in a hurry so this really didn't fit the bill for me. I need to go again when I have time to relax and I'm not rushed.Though I only gave them a 2, I will try it again. I think they were over whelmed by the lunch rush. The friendliness of the waitress and quality of the food leads me to believe it's a good restaurant, but maybe I caught them at a bad time. If you go here to eat, just don't be in a rush.

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: Simply lackluster. There is nothing that I ate that screamed Italian. I've studied and lived in Italia for 6 months.  The salad tasted like there was a ton of canned vegetables and iceberg lettuce. The only things that I liked to eat were the crust of the pizza and the tiramisu dessert that I took home with me. My service was descent and the waitress was really nice. That is all.

reviews.name: Food M.
reviews.review: HORRIBLE! RUN! Manger said F*** you to me multiple times over a mistake I made in the order. The food was terrible, like soggy vomit in a box. There is NOTHING good about this place.

reviews.name: Greg M.
reviews.review: Not impressed. Americanized dumbed down fast food style Italian. Pizza was ok. Pasta....not so much. If you think your Mom's spaghetti was great, you may like this place. If you've been to Italy, you won't be happy here. In their defense, the fare here is what passes for Italian in Middle Tennessee.

reviews.name: Stryker M.
reviews.review: Great service and even better food! Arrived with a party of 16 people (12 adults/4children) the staff didn't seemed worried by our large size at all, which was nice since several other places were definitely intimidated by our size. The staff quickly made us a large table and got our drink order started. The waitress checked on the other parties at the time and then came back to get our food orders. After we order it did take a bit to get our food but that was completely expected with a group our size. Once the food arrived everyone dug in and our rowdy group fell silent due to the amazing food. Our group ordered just about everything on the menu and we ate every last bite! I want to give a special thank you to Kaithlyn our waitress who handled our large group the whole time with a smile on her face. She never once seemed flustered or overwhelmed by us which is amazing considering we have a couple of kids who think they're grown and like to ask a bunch of questions. Wish we had more time in Nashville so we could go again!!!

reviews.name: Jordan B.
reviews.review: Went as a group. Manicotti, spaghetti w meat sauce. 2 lasagna, 2 pizzas. All excellent. Recommend this place to anyone. Great atmosphere, great chef.

reviews.name: Shannon M.
reviews.review: Just ordered Chicken Parmesan, had it delivered, came half an hour early, & was very pleased!!! I highly recommend this place!

reviews.name: Kristina L.
reviews.review: It was just okay.  Nothing flashy, nothing outstanding, merely ok-ish.  The decor is the typical Italian joint type of set up and painted the color of the Italian flag.  The music was atypical as well - Sinatra and the like.  So for that I ding them.  Come on, people!  Let's be a little creative here and try setting up a whole different ambience!Hubby ordered the tropical pizza (thin crust) topped with ham and pineapple.  While he said the toppings were tasty, his big complaint was that they kept sliding off.  Oh, and the pizza only comes in one size....  It basically fits on a dinner plate.  And it is cut into squares, not the typical pie wedges.  That made it drop down as well since hubby likes each piece to have crust.I ordered the chicken piccata.  At $14, it came with a house salad and bread sticks.  The salad was just the bland iceberg lettuce variety with some tomato, canned black olives, red onion and a sprinkle of cheddar cheese.  The dressing was obviously bottled.  My entree was alright.  Nothing special.  It could have used more lemon in the sauce.  The biggest problem with it as well was that I had to put salt on it a few times.  I am not one of those that usually adds salt to my cooked meal as I think it should have been properly seasoned during the actual cooking process.The biggest highlight to our lunch was that we discovered that you can bring your own bottle of wine and there is not a fee for corkage.  However, that really doesn't matter since we will not be returning.

reviews.name: Blake R.
reviews.review: The pizza is pretty good but the service is horrible. There's really no ambience to the place. It's extremely quiet inside. Almost like sitting in a dark empty small room. Both times we've been over the past 2 months, there have been roughly 3-4 tables full and it has taken us up to 20 min a time just to get our server. Upon ordering 30 min after arriving, we never see our servers until it's time to leave. This time, it wasn't until after we paid and were getting ready to walk out did the server ever come back and ask if we wanted a refill on our drinks. Not only that, the employees always seem like they are off in a different world. Won't be going back again and I recommend, unless you love slow service and have no where to be soon, that you don't visit either.

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: We just tried this place for the first time.  Got a salad and pizza.  The prices seemed pretty high and the food wasn't that good.  I had the pizza and the dough was every tough....almost like eating calamari.  My wife had a salad which was decent but nothing special.  Service was good but that can't fix sub-mediocre food.  We'll stick with Sals.

reviews.name: Miranda F.
reviews.review: First experience with Taste of Italy..... It was a larger order so understandably it was going to take some time. I was quoted approximately an hour, but the food did not arrive until 1hr 35/ 1hr 40 from the time of the order. This would have been okay, had the food not arrived cold. Every entree was cold and had to be microwaved. I was very disappointed.

reviews.name: Cynthia H.
reviews.review: When I first moved nearby "Taste of Italy", we ordered Stromboli & small Greek pizza. I picked up the order and it looked like maybe they hadn't been open a long time, interior was just slightly set up & painted red, green & white. Received my order, got it bk home and it was all delicious!! Starting getting delivery of our orders & everything was very tasty & the delivery people very nice! Imagine my delighted surprise, when I called in an order for carry out 2wks ago, got there to pick it up & thought I was at the wrong place. Lol They have completely renovated "Taste of Italy" & it isn't a huge restaurant but they have made a very nice, enticing dining area and it's decorated very nice!! Green, red & white is gone! The lighting is dimmed later in evening & it is great for families and or dates!! Yes, it's in a strip mall but you will think you've gone to a nice restaurant once you arrive! Give it a try! I love all the food we've gotten, my fav Manicotti, Greek pizza and their delicious Tiramisu

reviews.name: Abby N.
reviews.review: I just wanted to update my last review as it has been a couple years.  I have been back many times over the years and am NEVER disappointed.  The owner always makes time to come talk to our table and he is always a delight.  The service is fantastic and I must say, I really love the update Sean did to the decor... it is a warm and inviting interior that is quite conducive to great conversation!  It is a quaint little place to take family and friends for a fantastic Italian meal.  My mother is from New York and she says it is the best Chicken Piccata she has ever tasted.  I also highly recommend the Caprese... it just gets better and better!  And as always, it is byob and the wine shop is right next door... you can't beat that!

reviews.name: Hip T.
reviews.review: My third time here, trying spinach calzone. It was very good! BTW the eggplant parm is the only one I actually like of all the ones I've tried. However the management gave me a hard time when I tried to use the Yelp check-in discount, so one star minused...too bad

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: Had caprese salad, very fresh and delicious. Also tried the eggplant, Valentine pizza which both were very satisfying. The calamari was good but not as great as the rest. I certainly recommend this place as a casual dine.

reviews.name: Mitch J.
reviews.review: We've been eating here for years, and the food has always been outstanding. Traditional Italian dishes and great pizza. The decor changed over the years, though, and it had started to get a little tacky inside. Well, they completely renovated, and now it's very classy inside!  Nice soft lighting with nice wood booths and tables. The tackiness is gone and it's a classy little Italian restaurant with terrific food. Tonight, I had the lasagne and my wife had the Eggplant Parmesan. Both were served hot out of the oven with salad and terrific little garlic bread sticks. This is a nice place for a family dinner or a date night for two. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.name: Marcia P.
reviews.review: This review is going to reflect the person who we talked to for a delivery order tonight.  We've eaten here and had their delivery before, and the food is good.  Tonight we called for a delivery and the person on the phone was rude like no one else we've encountered there.  My husband asked for the manager, who (of course) was not available.  So when he asked for the name of the person to whom he was speaking, he refused to give his name.  When you treat customers on the phone like they're idiots, you can expect someone to ask to speak to your boss.  March 1, 2014 Saturday

reviews.name: Mala H.
reviews.review: Went for lunch.Servers are very friendly.The atmosphere is extremely tacky. Red/White/Green everywhere and very DARK..Looks like it's not sure if it wants to be a pizza place or a formal restaurant. I would go 2 Stars because the actual experience dining in is so bad, but the food redeems it.The appetizers were surprisingly good. Recommend the stuffed mushrooms and bruschetta. Very tasty and fresh.BYOB

reviews.name: R R.
reviews.review: The food is delicious, but this place has gotten a bit pricey for a suburban restaurant. It's not an amazing first-class Italian place. The food was obviously cooked fresh so naturally it took awhile to get out, but our server hardly paid any attention to us, and we were the only ones there. We even had to flag them down to pay lol. It's in an unfortunate location...I feel like if it was in a better place and had a bigger space it could do much better.

reviews.name: Anthony P.
reviews.review: I've been several times for lunch and dinner. Food is always excellent. The stromboli is one of my favorites. Decor? When this place first opened they were going for classy and quasi formal. They must have figured out rather quickly "that dog wouldn't hunt" in Donelson. It's now casual with remnants of its former self still evident. Go for the food.

reviews.name: Cara P.
reviews.review: It's Italian food...made by people who don't really know what Italian food is.  My veal marsala was nearly tasteless; but the veal was tender.  The side salad had chunks of lettuce so large they required a knife, and the salad was not tossed; dressing should be on the side only if you request that.  The dressing was, however, clearly not bottled; vinegary with plenty of oregano which I liked.  Oddly enough, my husband's antipasto salad had no dressing at all.Cheesy bread is garlic bread with mozzarella melted over it; but this was like a cheese pizza with no sauce.  But the cheese was properly melted & browned, the way I like it.The waitress was a nice girl--but my husband had to point out the antipasto salad on the menu because she didn't know what it was, and couldn't manage the word "antipasto".  And, ok, I realize it was the middle of a Sunday afternoon, not exactly peak hours, but....really? you're going to hang out with your friends either outside having a cigarette or in a corner table?I really wanted to like Taste of Italy.  But the "antipasto" episode sort of sums up the whole experience: they are trying, but they just don't really understand what they're trying to do.

reviews.name: Mallory M.
reviews.review: Small is right! It was good, but not outstanding. However on a night when you just want some pasta and don't wanna cook, this is the place you wanna hit.

reviews.name: Beth P.
reviews.review: Sadly, the food can be good, especially the antipasto salad. Unfortunately, the wait staff is rude, the decor is tacky, and the delivery time is never right, which means my pizza was always cold. Rather discouraging.

reviews.name: Brent D.
reviews.review: Little hole in the wall of the interstate.  The food was very good.  We ordered Chicken Marsala, peperoni pizza, and garlic knots.  The only complaint was that the bread sticks that came with the Marsala were cold and kind of hard.  The servers were very friendly.  The restaurant is tiny.  This is where the star comes off.  The servers would have to rub along the back of my chair to get between tables as there was no other way around.  Give this place a try

reviews.name: Amy N.
reviews.review: Came in from out of town and wanted pizza delivered around 10:30 PM (our hotel has their brochures, etc). Called to order and a person who spoke rather poor English answered to take my order. As I spoke and let him know I had a coupon, he continued to talk over me as I explained my toppings because he needed to "enter the coupon code in". After being interrupted at least 3 times, he must have put the phone over his shoulder and talked to his coworker although I could hear ever rude word he spoke. Once he came back on, he said, "is that all?". I said, "can you please repeat that back to me?". He put the phone down again and I could again, hear all words, as he said "now she wants me to repeat her order." At that point, I was so fed up because he could not understand a word I was saying, nor did he seem to want to take the business as it was after 10 pm on a Wednesday. We took our business to Dominos and I will be complaining to our hotel about having them as a preferred vendor.

reviews.name: Taurus C.
reviews.review: Usually pretty good food but today we order a thin crust pizza and get regular crust . I called back and received another pizza in about an hour. It was COLD! Maybe just a bad day but not during the game

reviews.name: Amber S.
reviews.review: The food proportions may be plentiful and delicious... But have you ever wonder what goes on in the back?? How is your food really being made?? I've seen this with my own eyes and will eat only certain dishes... They drop food all the time and instead of tossing it.. They just put it back or put it in the pan..

reviews.name: Clint W.
reviews.review: I was out on a bike ride when a good smoothie sounded delicious. Found this place and I was impressed.Great service. He asked where I was riding to and I told him it was a pretty long day for me.I asked for a banana chocolate smoothie and he asked if that was it, I said yes and he made it. Tasted the smoothie, it was amazing, and then I paid with card with a $1 tip. He deserves more. Trust me.Great smoothies, great service and an overall great experience.Go try this place. You won't regret it.BTW, I saw they have a gym next door. They also have clif bars and what not as well to sell in the smoothie place. Go now!!! :D

reviews.name: Robin P.
reviews.review: Me and my coworker were on the road for work and we were craving a smoothie. So like Any normal person we Yelped to find a smoothie place off the highway. First off this place is NOT called Trendy Blends it's called Boom Fit with a smoothie bar inside the fitness center. Then while we were waiting for our smoothies one of the guys (I'm assuming was the owner) was openly yelling at his poor 10yr old child. Ok back to the smoothies, I ordered a PB, banana, chocolate and my coworker ordered the almond joy. Mine was AAAMAZING but his was...well, not as good as mine. The ice was not chopped up enough and was very chunky. It's lacking in flavor and the protein powder is over powering. I understand that it is now a fitness smoothing joint, but we were just looking for a good smoothie...well, I'm happy with mine but my oh poor coworker.

reviews.name: Mikey K.
reviews.review: NOT open on Sunday. Was bummed but we found a coffee & smoothie place down the road which was swingin.

reviews.name: Eric Y.
reviews.review: The smoothies are wonderful. Healthy and tasty using all natural ingredients!

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Once in a while a place surprised you with its great courtesy, service, and sense of humor: I enjoyed the place for all these characteristics.When I came in, the lady behind the counter was finishing up and order with another guy, and she wasn't done with him for even a minute when she started chatting me up with her enthusiasm for her product.  She must have noticed my apparent... um ... rotundity, and very quickly offered a sample of their soft serve, which is oh so graciously accepted.  Her "sample" was the size of a small in some places, and was among the best soft serve I've ever had.Once I had finished that, her husband offered a completely frozen version of their chocolate soft serve.  It was tasty, but hard.  I finally settled on a strawberry smoothie and a hot dog.  They were both excellent.I am full of praise of the place, but the only small criticism is that they were a little slow.  Once I ordered, it took ten minutes to get my hot dog and smoothie, even though I was the only customer there.Beyond that, I really like the place: a hidden gem in the Hermitage area.  If you're in Hermitage and need a quick, cheap, and tasty lunch, Trendy Blends is a place you've got to try.

reviews.name: Steven Z.
reviews.review: Trendy Blends is a great local business! It is kind of hard to find, but it is worth the search! I haven't tried the food, but their smoothies are worth the trip alone! They have great soft serve ice cream which they use as a base for a lot of their smoothies. Support local business and you wont be disappointed!

reviews.name: Kab E.
reviews.review: Whether you like fast food or hate it, you gotta admit there are a lot of people eating it.  And when I find a good one I have to talk about it.Never would have thought I'd come across a good fast food chicken place inside of a Shell station. Krispy Krunchy Chicken is located inside the Daily's Shell station on Hermitage Ave in the downtown area. I stopped in for gas but the smell of fresh hot Cajun fried chicken made me buy more than a tankful.If you're a fan of Popeye's Chicken, Krispy Krunchy Chicken is every bit as good. Honestly, when I took my first bite of Krispy's Chicken I thought about Popeye's.  I even had to go to the Krispy Krunchy web site to find out if they were owned by Popeye's. If you like a Cajun type recipe with the spices that are added to that style of fried chicken, you'll like Krispy Krunchy.I ordered a three piece with one side and a biscuit. The price was comparable to Popeye's.  The side I had, red beans and rice, unfortunately was not as flavorful as Popeye's red beans and rice but I'll try the rice and beans again, maybe I came through on a bad day. However, Krispy Krunchy biscuits are nothing short of crack biscuits.  Those of you that have tried Knock Out Wing's biscuits (on Jefferson Street) know what crack biscuits are.  Knock Out's biscuits don't have anything on Krispy Krunchy biscuits!  I'll be going back for more.Fast food places aren't known for the best service and Krispy Krunchy is no different but the food is pretty good and cheap... so... what can you do.

reviews.name: Eric E.
reviews.review: Its inside the shell station with hardly any visibility from the outside, but once you in you'll spot It right away. I usually come here for lunch, and Its usually a hit or miss. If you go around 12-1 chicken is hot and fresh, but after 130 its starts to get dry and rubbery. For the price you get so much more than you pay for, and the biscuit your meal comes with is just as good if not better than churchs. Yoy can never go wronf with their biscuits. They bread the chicken in the back before they deep fry it, and they usually have a dish specific to a day. Their catfish on fridays is outstanding, and their salisbury steak on mondays is wayyyyyy better than copper kettles next door. (I have tried them both) If you are looking for a good cheap place to eat, then I'd say this is the spot for you. Sorry for having read such a long review.

reviews.name: Katie D.
reviews.review: With any chain restaurant, it seems a bit redundant to review the food and such, but I will say though that the food was delicious, especially considering we came in at an off time. The service and everything can be incredibly hit or miss coming in when it's totally dead like that, but they did not disappoint.We had Sara, who was incredibly friendly and provided awesome service. The food was hot and fresh, and everything came out pretty quickly. She was also great in checking back just enough, but didn't hover or bug us. Awesome.

reviews.name: Alexander M.
reviews.review: Came here on Thursday for the bones less wings special! Yum yum! $.65 a wing and they charge another $.65 for any kind of dipping sauce lol I always think this is completely ridiculous because how in the hell are you suppose to eat your wings? Plain? But anyways the durning experience was pretty good we had a really nice server and she was able to suggest some of the corona strawberry drinks and it was really good! I'd say for the most part you can't expect anything spectacular from a sports bar type of environment but long as the service is great that's all that matters! Cost effective is always a plus because $13 for 6 boneless wings and premium alcoholic beverage is a bargain in my opinion!

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Not sure how often we go. Sometimes once a month sometimes every 2 weeks or more. It is consistent and good. Service at front good and service for food is also very good. And they are also accommodating in wing sauce. Trivia is fun and sitting at bar is easy and seamless. Nice touch on having local school jerseys. Parking is in lot or across the street. Always clean. Since it is a wing place we get the wings but the tacos are really good too.

reviews.name: Zoran J.
reviews.review: On a Saturday night also ufc fight night they were out of like 6-7 beers and out of JACK DANIELS WTF very bad management

reviews.name: Corey G.
reviews.review: Buffalo Wild Wings is one of those places that you always know what to expect.  A loud and bright atmosphere will OK service and unhealthy processed food.  That being said, I can't help but like the wings at the BWW, they offer an awesome variety sauces and dry rubs both bone in or boneless.  It is a good atmosphere to catch a game but not an ideal location if you're looking for a quiet, relaxed night out.  They have an alright beer selection with prices you'd expect from a place this.  Overall BWW is just okay, it lacks the amazing customer service and food quality to earn 4-5 stars.

reviews.name: Sarah T.
reviews.review: It's Buffalo Wild Wings. Over priced wings. Decent Beer. Better service at this Buffalo Wild Wings, then others..but that's not saying much. Sam the bartender was nice, played a little trivia.. But nothing to write home about.

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: I go to Buffalo Wild Wings mainly for the access to television sporting events, rather than the food.  The atmosphere is a typical bar/restaurant setting but there are tv's everywhere which is nice if you want to watch a sporting event.  I really like that they offer the big pay-per-view boxing matches and UFC fights for free.  I usually get the wings but they are not the best wings I've ever had.  I feel like the food is mediocre but I will continue to go back for the atmosphere.

reviews.name: James C.
reviews.review: Went here to watch the football game, MNF means BWW and beers right? Wrong.We arrive and see that they are pretty busy, makes sense because it's Monday night. We wait by the hostess stand to be seated...and wait...and wait...until about 10 minutes go by I walk over to the "to-go" waitress and ask her if we seat ourselves.She says "oh, we have a private event so seating is only available at the bar". Sounds good, we make our way through a crowd that looks like they're having a private event and go to find a table. Every table, high top, etc. at the bar either has people at it or has trash all over it, waiting to be cleaned. So we end up picking a table that has least amount of garbage still on it and clean the table of ourselves.Fast forward to the meals. We had to remind our waitress about our appetizer, had to go retrieve our own silverware, and still had to wait for our food to come out.l way too long.  My grilled chicken sandwich comes out and you think it's going to be, I don't know, edible..right? Nope. The chicken breast was still raw. It takes is a solid 10 minutes to get the waitresses attention and she apologizes, I'm calm about it and not the screaming guy in the restaurant, not her fault-she didn't cook it. Everyone else I was with ends up finishing their meal as they go back to "fix this issue" which consists of seeing the manager taking the sandwich from her and going into the kitchen. 20 mins later our waitress comes back with the sandwich after she already came up and goes "is your sandwich out yet?".  No sign of the manager. The sandwich came out done this time, with the wrong sides on it, and a hand written "SORRY!" on the wax paper that lines the plate. Only the waitress had the decency to apologize for a raw chicken sandwich face to face. They did take the meal off of the total bill but what would it take to get the manager to talk to a concerned customer that already ate a bite of raw chicken? Me lose my mind and shout at people who's fault it was? Or was it the fact that they were so understaffed and poorly managed that they were doomed to have a bad night? (I heard another lady requesting the manager while I was waiting for my meal, looks like that person was spending all their time cleaning up the incompetency of other staff).   I even had another staff member come over offering free samples with a name tag talking about a "customer services expert" or something. I don't want free samples, I just want to eat my sandwich I without the fear of getting salmonella. This review would have more stars if the manager would have came over and talked but I think that this place looks like inmates running the asylum. Needless to say, I don't think we will be back. I'll try to remember to update this if I get food poisoning.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: Typical Buffalo Wild Wings. Waitresses are nice and the wings are good. Great place for sports, beer and heartburn lol.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: The beer flows rather fair priced.  The food is what I call "sustenance" but not ever going to blow your balls off.I mean it's a great place to go and fight over which TV you want YOUR TEAM to be on with other random (usually rednecks) but I digress.  It's still one of the few places you can go and watch NFL in the Fall and get every game in full on sensory overload without being covered in cigarette smoke and baseball or hockey or probably even women's gymnastics (just don't be the creepy guy in the corner watching it by himself).I recommend if in dire need of food and a beer and maybe some people watching.

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Marginal service and food was cold...SMH, one of my favorite restaurants sliding into the crapper - sigh.

reviews.name: Desiree S.
reviews.review: This was my first experience at a Buffalo Wild Wings. My pregnant friend really wanted Buffalo Wings for dinner, and how do you tell a pregnant lady "No"?I didn't like the prices and didn't feel like you got what you paid for. I was really excited that they let us sample different sauces though. I decided to order just the plain buffalo wings because you really can't go wrong with that, or at least shouldn't be able to. We waited a little while for our food, which was ok because the first college football game of the season was on and they were busy.When our food finally came out, it was cold. The sauce wasn't even warm and the fries were stale. None of us wanted to complain because we just wanted to eat. Our server wasn't that attentive to us. We actually had to flag her down and ask for water, which I think is wrong since we were not sitting very far from the Soda Fountain.I probably won't be going here again.

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: First of all I love wings. B-Ws is one of my favorite places for wings but this location isn't. Service is bad. Servers could care less, look awful (crazy dyed hair and tats galore) and can usually hear loud cursing from the kitchen. Guess it bothers us parents but then again this IS a bar... Great for watching some sports but so loud and crazy you'll be ready to leave. Food is inconsistent. But again, service is poor here!!!!

reviews.name: Shafi K.
reviews.review: I guess it depends a lot on who your server was for a place like this one. I come here regularly to watch baseball/football games since I'm from California and miss watching our home teams play live. My boyfriend and I will come by and get some grub and some beer to relax. Obviously their service is a little hasty because there's so many people who come by. Usually, our servers and the kitchen have delivered food on time and without delay. They are a little slower on the drinks, especially when the bar's busy looking from far, but that's again not something unexpected. Overall, I will continue to come here to enjoy that college-style sports bar feel and amazing wings!

reviews.name: Jerry C.
reviews.review: Had a craving for wings. Arrived to find BWW half empty which was strange. Then no one at the front seating. Asked for a table outside and were seated by a very pleasant trainee. Then no one came. No waiter even though the table next to us had food delivered. 15 minutes. Gave up. Now I know why it was empty.

reviews.name: Cheryl H.
reviews.review: Came in for a quick meal a couple of nights ago ...NEVER AGAIN.   My husband and I walked into the bar area and sat at a table and waited and waited and waited to be waited on. They weren't even that busy, but we saw so many employees walking around including the manager.  Once we finally had someone take our order, the wings arrived cold. On our second round of drinks the waitress rudely yanked my beer away right before I took a drink saying the bartender poured the wrong beer.  We have never had such poor service at a buffalo wild wings before and will definitely not be coming back to this one.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: The Nashville West Buffalo Wild Wings is finally open, but its pretty obvious the new staff has a few kinks left to work out.  The place was very busy (I asked the Hostess if she was getting a lot of business now that they were open, "More than when we were closed", she responded.) which resulted in some slower service.  Only one of the TVs was playing Trivia, and it wasn't immediately obvious where the restrooms where.All in all though the location seems nice and the Wings were about what you'd expect.  If you like B-Dub, you'll be getting about what you'd expect.

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: Good for a quick high calorie lunch. The place is nice for watching sports. Not too loud and great service. We will return.

reviews.name: Jasmin S.
reviews.review: Just to be fair, I must confess, I would probably strangle a cute little kitten with my own hands for a good buffalo wing. With that in mind, and the fact that I ate at Murfreesboro location 2 times a Month for 4 years in college, this place is pretty terrible. I know its a chain and one should not expect too much, but I have one simple request, please use good chicken. The chicken tasted old and was fried to death. The sauces are the same at every location, but this one apparently was running low the night I showed up, because my wings were pretty much dry. NO BUENO! I won't go too much into the sauces, mostly because I am a buffalo loyalist, but also because this chicken is so terrible I just won't bother with the rest. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is the fact that they have cold beer and good televisions. So if watching a game and having a few beers is your sort of thing, In that part of town, I don't really know of a better choice. Unless you want to visit one of those meth and lortab dens, they call bars scattered all over Charlotte.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: Men, rejoice.  This is your place. Women - run like hell.  This places sucks it big time.  I'm all in for the sports bar vibe when needed, and hey, I was stoked to see some Olympics, but the food is so far past bad you will want your money back as well as the money you spent on gas getting there.  Wings SWIMMING in sauce.  Bizarre over flavored flat bread dripping in grease and so not worth the calories.  It is just bad, bad, bad. But the crappy ambiance and deafening noise do help to dull your sense of taste enough that you may not gag.  Don't count on it though.

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: My experience overall good. We went there after 12 on a Saturday, watched some b-ball on the tvs and the service was great. Perhaps some of those with bad reviews aren't sports fans and aren't used to the noise levels in sports bars. I had a great experience, but of course, my boys have been told that we were too loud in other establishments in the past, so maybe we are part of the problem! Our server kept our drinks filled and checked up on us pretty regularly. And yes, we had wings and they were tasty and cooked correctly.

reviews.name: Steve P.
reviews.review: Great for watching sports.  To be fair I only sampled the boneless chicken wings, and they were fine.  Nothing outstanding, but the sauces were good and I have no complaints.  Good beer selection, attentive staff, and they put the Pats game on the big screen with the sound on, so I was a fan.

reviews.name: Erik B.
reviews.review: Great environment to eat + drink+ watch the game. Bartenders friendly and knowledgeable. Staff courteous. Food items were delicious. Great variety in terms of drinks.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I wandered in here after a grueling visit to Costco recently and here's the low down for those of you who don't know the schtick (cuz I didn't).  It's a sports bar/restaurant as any self respecting wing place ought to be with large screen TV's, lots o' beer, bar food and on screen trivia that you can play from your table for those of us with a head full of completely useless knowledge.Someone else mentioned the service and I have to admit that ours was pretty slow.  The beer selection was pretty good and they did have it out quickly so because I'm easily amused with beer and trivia, I got past the service.   My kids got a bit fidgety but the atmosphere is certainly fine for kids if they don't mind waiting a while for their food.Now the reason I really can't give them huge props is because I thought the wings were pretty boring.  They have a whole bunch of sauces you can pick from and we had a few different ones at our table.  Just left me kind of wanting more tangy wingy flavor where there wasn't.   I also think they are high for what they offer.  We also tried the ribs and fries but again, I've had better.  The place has it's merits for hanging out watching some sports, table side amusements and no smoking is a plus too but just don't expect a culinary trip to heaven.

reviews.name: Andrew T.
reviews.review: We have ordered BWW two weeks in a row and when we got it home, it was wrong. Both times we called, both times it was immediately rectified. We obviously would prefer it to be right the first time, but mistakes are made and when they are corrected immediately, it's a good spot. I would definitely recommend this one.

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: I've been here a couple of times & my visit usually follows either a trip to Costco or Strike & Spare (two main reasons I drive all the way to Nashville West!).The last time we went was a Saturday night, and it was CRAZY INSANE.  I have to stress all caps because the wait was 2 hours!  There were people lined up everywhere, even all over the parking lot, waiting to get a table.  Insanity I tell you.  We asked the hostess if the bar was open seating, and she said yes.  On to the bar we went!We found 2 seats at the bar, but since we had 4 in our party, we continued scoping other potential tables.  I spotted a party of 4 getting up so we immediately swooped in & grabbed the table.  This was after maybe 5 minutes.  A lot of work for a table, but it was much better than waiting 2 hours!!Ok so the food - we ordered wings, fried pickles, a burger, and a chicken tender basket.  The fried pickles & wings were pretty good - we got the "Wild" sauce which was good but not that hot.  The chicken tenders tasted like they had been fried long ago, so that was very disappointing.  The onion rings weren't that great either.  My husband ordered a burger, and after waiting a good while we got most of our food except for his burger - they delivered the wrong entree.  Poor thing had to wait another  good while for the burger to get there, and when it did, it was so sad that he didn't even eat it.  He said it tasted very charred & burned, and he just couldn't take more than a couple of bites.  After waiting so long we just were ready to get out of there.  We ate some snacks at home.Let me say that this isn't the worst place ever.  The wine was priced alright (I am just not a beer drinker), and the beer prices were good too.  I just won't be in too big of a hurry to come back.  The experience just isn't good enough to justify being a table vulture!

reviews.name: Theresa W.
reviews.review: I can't really comment on the quality of the food because the service was so horrible! It seems that our "server" Alex had better things to do sitting out on the patio with a group of boys.  At 7:00-8:00 on a Saturday night you would think they would be worried about taking care of the customers, but this wasn't the case. The one time she came in and stopped by our table it was a good thing we were already done eating because the smell of cigarette smoke was enough to turn my stomach. She attempted to be sociable when she did come by the table, but this was outweighed by the fact that we had to go to the bar to get drinks because she was sitting at the table outside. I never saw anyone that looked like a manager. Whoever the manager was, sure wasn't keeping an eye on what was going on with the staff.
