reviews.name: April D.
reviews.review: I love Bdubz. Yummy wings, go on Tuesdays & Thursdays for their deals. And if you're feeling cocky & think you can do the blazin challenge, don't. If you have a steel tummy go for it, just be sure to invite me. I wanna watch you cry.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: All B-Dubs are the same; cold beer, good wings and tons of TV's. If you are looking for a spot to watch some sporting events, this is the place. There are TV's everywhere, and I mean everywhere. I've counted more than 40 before. Wings are tasty and beer is cold!

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: Went to BWW for fight night and had a very good time.  The food is pretty underwhelming, but it is not offensive.  There are a ton of flat screens and the service was competent.  I don't think I will be back too often, but for a fight and a bite it fits the bill.

reviews.name: Jessie G.
reviews.review: loud but a bunch of games to enjoy

reviews.name: Marc C.
reviews.review: Nice surprise given the reviews. Note the Gunness pie is off the menu. I had the Ploughman's Platter which was a nice rich sampler of sausage and cheese.   The high quality was a surprise in a corporate hotel resort If you are over the trendy stuff in the rest of this Gaylord Resort try Findleys.

reviews.name: ThomasE L.
reviews.review: Jet lagged, tired and hungry my co-workers and I ended up here after we checked at the hotel.  As it one of the few things still open.The good:Excellent beer list, very good Guinness cake, good if slow service.The bad:The price.  Hello captive audience pricing. I paid less than this for 2 trips to the local for better fish and chips and a pint when traveling in England.  $33+ for greasy fish and chips and a pint is a bit much.The hours.  We went back after getting back from downtown the last night we were there (my co-workers wanted the cake, I wanted a Guinness) but they closed at 10pm.  We got there at 10:02. Who closes a pub at 10pm?Oh well, live and learn.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: Findleys Irish pub is your typical Irish themed place to get a beer. I went to this location for lunch 2 times and both times they were closed. When I checked online they said they were open. The third day I finally got to eat here. In my opinion It's not bad food but it's not omg this is great food ether. When we sat down I asked the waiter what he would recommend he said the burger was good. My friend asked how the Guinness pie was. The waiter said "I wouldn't order the Guinness pie" he said he didn't  like it. In my mind and experience when the waiter said that. I thought of 2 things. Ether the food isn't fresh and there re heating it from a few days ago or the waiter has seen something back in the kitchen that he knows is messed up. After all the waiter does go back in the kitchen and knows how the food is prepped and handled. I do appreciate the waiter being honest. But it did make me weary of eating here. Anyways the waiter said you can't go wrong with the burger so we ordered THE BUrGER the food was good. Not great. It hit the spot. The burger came with truffle fries which were the best part of the meal. They have other items like pork belly, fish and chips and a cured meat platter. Overall. This place wasn't the best it wasn't the worst. The waiter said stay away from the Guinness pie, so stay away from it!!. Make sure you call findleys before you show up to make sure they are open. PROS:- good spot for beer - honest waiterCONS:- said they were open 2 times but when i arrived they were closed. -waiter said do not get the Guinness pie

reviews.name: Liz M.
reviews.review: Great food I had corn beef and cabbage. The chocolate pecan cobbler was amazing! Fun friendly staff!

reviews.name: Sanjay R.
reviews.review: The Chicken and Dumplings was good, but the real star of the show was the brussel sprouts with bacon. It was a side dish (that came with the meal) that was incredible!

reviews.name: Dennis S.
reviews.review: Big fan.  Really the only down side is, like everything at Gaylord Opryland, it's ridiculously expensive.  Burgers are awesome, really good.  If you want a lighter snack, the BLT sliders are quite nice.The highland gaelic ale on draft is great.Several nights there were very good bands playing.  Such a pleasant pub it became home away from home during a long stay.  Good service, they seemed to really care that you got good food and service.Look forward to my next burger and ale there.

reviews.name: Naomi S.
reviews.review: We went to Findley's Irish Pub for dinner. Our. Server was Ginger. Ginger was very pleasant but was more concerned having conversations with two of the four tables she had.  There were men at the other tables and maybe she thought two women wouldn't tip as well, but she was wrong. It took 30 minutes for our food to arrive. The chef did accommodate us with mashed potatoes and a side salad. The Rueben sandwich didn't have any sauerkraut or cole slaw on the sandwich .  The other meal was corn beef and cabbage. The meat was tender but average and there was hardly any cabbage with the meal.

reviews.name: David L.
reviews.review: Had the Reuben, was quite tasty.  Service was good.  Tried the beet salad, that was tasty.Also had one of the duck sliders, it was good, but not as good as wild duck.Ploughmans plate was good too

reviews.name: Kenneth R.
reviews.review: Tried four times to go here and every time they were closed. Why have a lighted menu and advertised hours if your not going to be open. Three days in a row....

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: Food is "good" but overpriced for what you get- but you are surrounded by a fishbowl economy here at the hotel. My wife liked her iceberg wedge salad but my blt sliders were super small, and the fries are just normal. I wouldn't eat here again, it was just meh and the server was attentive but not engaged with us.

reviews.name: Timothy L.
reviews.review: For a pub within a high-end hotel, Findley's offers the very best beer selection in the entire Gaylord. The food is also nothing to sneeze at. I had a couple of offerings, and I can't complain. They seemed to lack any form of a hostess, when I visited. This made things a bit confusing for seating, but it didn't impact the level of service, which was great. Make this your casual choice when staying at the Gaylord.

reviews.name: Heather P.
reviews.review: I would've only given one star but the waiter allowed my daughter to order potato soup even though it wasn't on the menu. He explained that the kitchen is shared with the place beside of it.I ordered an order of the cheese fries, I requested it to be without the gravy that the menu mentions. They were $9 and was brought out at least thirty minutes after my daughter's soup. They were burnt and were horribly greasy. I think that this place specializes in beer and if you're wanting a 5 star food experience, skip this place.

reviews.name: Ian S.
reviews.review: If you're eating here, you're probably staying at the convention center and are therefore a captive audience.  Remember that fact because they do.I was here for a convention and the center doesn't have enough capacity in their restaurants to handle convention crowds at dinner.  Nor do they have the ability to take reservations.  We had a party of 11, so granted it was a big group.  We ended up splitting the group in two.  When my part of the group finally got a table, our waiter was good and accommodating (more on this in a second).Our waiter then explained that they had just started opening for lunch that day but the management hadn't really told anyone that they were opening for lunch now.  And the kitchen wasn't ready for it because a few items on the menu were sold out from lunch.We had two kids with us who wanted milk (none of the dinner places here at the Gaylord seem to be very kid friendly as far as kid menus or kid type drinks).  Findley's does not have milk available.  So, our waiter was nice enough to go to one of the other restaurants to get milk.  How does a bar not have milk to mix into drinks?  They have a drink menu, so they make mixed drinks...Back to the kids.  There is no kid's menu.  The waiter again offered to go across the hall to another restaurant to get something for the kids.On the whole, the food was okay.  But every place here seems to have some problem with service or food.  You're a captive audience, so it seems like they've learned they don't have to try to get your business.  Where else are you going to go?

reviews.name: Martin S.
reviews.review: Sloooooow service. Almost room temp beer that was not very tasty. The beer was 8 dollars and it was a 16 oz. I thought the old Irish pubs were for working class Joes to come and have libations after a hard days work. I understand paying for it being in Gaylor Opryland but wow. At least have a better selections of beer and make sure they are cold.

reviews.name: Ronnie C.
reviews.review: In the Gaylord Resort. Pretty laid back. The reason for my review is because if you prefer a decent beer they have a good selection of craft beers. You can also order food if you like which I haven't yet.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: They had live music last night and it was so it was a fun place to stop in.

reviews.name: Shannon B.
reviews.review: I would not recommend this restaurant. Out of three meals only one was marginally good and that was an iceberg lettuce salad. The people at the table next to is were not happy with their meals either.  The service was also extremely poor. We were there for two hours.On a positive note, the Brussel sprouts were fantastic and the beer selection was decent.

reviews.name: Laura F.
reviews.review: Went here with a few friends and ordered the duck sliders. They were overpriced (around $15) and very small. The flavor was pretty good but the meat and bread could have been of higher quality. The service was fine. I would not go back.

reviews.name: Anonymous ..
reviews.review: Excellent food.  Much better than what you would excited from a hotel restaurant.   Tiny tables.  Awesome fish and chips. Great steak and guiness pie.

reviews.name: Shannon F.
reviews.review: It's an ok little pub. I came here twice, once to meet with a coworker to enjoy a beer and another time to get some food to go.The interior atmosphere is nice, carrying that typical slightly dark, yet comforting hearty pub feel. it almost reminded me of some pubs I went to in New York, which I found very appealing.We sat at the bar the first time. The bartenders were extremely friendly and let me try a few samples of several different delicious beers. I ended up having one I can't recall though it was superb!2nd time here, I picked up some food to take to my room. I got an appetizer of some deviled eggs which had a blend of some cheeses and spices and I cant recall the exact name for it. I also ordered a cup of heirloom tomato basil soup with bacon. The eggs were ok, different flavor with a kick though, nothing special. The tomato soup was very rich creamy and delicious, though a little too heavy for me to finish.Overall, fun, classic pub atmosphere, sincere, friendly service and from the few items I had,  it appears they have decent food.

reviews.name: Natalie R.
reviews.review: So, this place would've gotten much higher reviews had the hostess been better trained... I'll give her the benefit of the doubt & say she was new bc she was polite- but when a conference is in town, & all other restaurants are closed for "private parties"- you need to hustle to sit your open tables... I think they were understaffed too. But told 30 min wait, at least 4 open tables with dirty dishes, people waiting for tables... I asked if I bussed my own table, could we sit?? Hahaha-she did not find me amusing...after about 45 min, I happened to check back in with her- she had scratched us off the list (she took phone numbers) & said she tried to call & got no answer... Needless to say, after that, we were seated immediately... Once seated, our waitress was great! The food and beer was delicious! I wish it had come a little faster, but again, I think they were understaffed (not sure why nobody at convention center knows how to plan for large conventions, but it is a running theme with ALL restaurants in Gaylord property). If not for the highly shaky start, definitely would've gotten much higher rating- & there wasn't even any live music that night!!!!

reviews.name: Lauren J.
reviews.review: Had the fish and chips and grilled veggies- fish and veggies were great, fries needed some crunch. Service was excellent once it got started. Thought this was just as good as the BBQ place across from it, but I'm not much of a beef eater and I don't eat pork. Menu is definitely Irish!

reviews.name: Mandy C.
reviews.review: Surprisingly, after reading all the reviews, I loved it here. Great atmosphere, friendly service and both our entrees were prepared wonderfully with unique combinations. I was in Nashville shopping and stopped by the Opryland Hotel; since it was St. Patricks day we decided to take our chances and eat at the Irish pub in the hotel.  It was an adventure finding the restaurant...all the way over on the side of the resort near the convention rooms. Once we found it, we were seated quickly and immediately greeted by our server.   After perusing over the menu of strange listings, I ordered the burger cooked to medium; it was served on an english muffin, with Irish cheese and a fried egg and a freshly made tomato paste and replaced the fries with a side salad.   It came out cooked exactly medium and was much larger and flavorful than I expected. My friend ordered the grilled cheese entree which is made with tillamook sharp cheddar and served on griddled sourdough bread with fries and a tomato cream soup.  We were both happy with our choices and content at the end of the meal. Price was definitely above normal but it was expected at Opryland. Total for the two sandwiches totaled $29 before tip. I will go back and try other menu items next time I visit this hotel!

reviews.name: L L.
reviews.review: When the live music started to play, I was already a bit tipsy from all the drinks that I had.   Forgotten that I was in an Irish pub but vaguely remembered that I was in Nashville - I thought the country music that they played sounded Irish.  I tried to follow the music but neither my 2 steps nor my River dance moves were working.   That was the point when I realized that the music was Irish and I got too much to drink - and I should not have danced like a madman in a restaurant.   It was a good thing that I only have to stagger 15 minutes to my room in Opryland to collapse in bed.  And yes, it was my room and my bed!

reviews.name: Rick W.
reviews.review: Been here twice. Guinness on tap. The fried fish was good. The fresh beef jerky was fabulous not to mention fresh fried potato chips. I will be back.

reviews.name: eric w.
reviews.review: I am here for a conference. The place has a nice look to it. And, it smells good while I wait for my lunch. My waitress has been very friendly so far.The steak and Guinness pie was a lot of food. It was too salty and light on Guinness flavor.This was much better than the other place I went within the opryland hotel.I'd eat here again - the scotch eggs sounded good.

reviews.name: Chris J.
reviews.review: Really enjoyed my experience here. The waittress went to the restaurant across the way to get me fried pickles because I really wanted Southern food. Great service.

reviews.name: Sal P.
reviews.review: So I'm giving 2 stars because of the service. The food was great even at their prices. So after a long day of traveling we walked in and thought it would be a good place to start. We stood up front for about 3 minutes. Several employees walked by us without so much as a hello. They were at about 30% seating capacity. We finally just asked somebody if it was self seating. The server said "Well it seems to right now" so we grabbed a booth. We sat for 10 minutes without so much as a hello. My wife finally flagged somebody down. We ordered our drinks and scanned the menu. We both had a bacon cheeseburger, fries, and a diet coke. The bill was about $42. I will say that the burgers were worth the price. The fries were great as well. We did however have to flag somebody both times for drink refills. There were clusters of servers standing around chit chatting so no excuse here. So overall...... Great food but terrible service.

reviews.name: Rachel E.
reviews.review: This place has AMAZING food! Their Chicken Noodle Soup is like nothing I've ever had before - it's even better than my Grandma's soup and that is saying a lot. The ambience is nice and the beer is great (how can you go wrong with a Guinness?). Stop in if you are in the area.

reviews.name: Nick G.
reviews.review: I ate at Findley's my first night at the Gaylord and I have to say, "meh" is about right for me. The server was nice, and the atmosphere was really cool, but the food was hard for me to figure out. It was a really ambitious fish with capers dish, but somehow they made the fish mushy and it was huge!!! It must have been four pounds of fish without exaggeration. Not sure if the size of the fish made the problem seem bigger than it was, but it was basically inedible to me.I have a feeling if I was a drinkin' man, this place would have been better, but I don't drink which meant this place held little for me. Three stars is for the service and the atmosphere, the food was one or two stars at best.

reviews.name: Luci L.
reviews.review: After reading the lukewarm reviews from fellow Yelpers, I was determined to prove everyone wrong with a rave review! ahem. I shall commence to slouch off sheepishly. We came at 10:45pm on a Wednesday. Had devilled eggs and soup of the day - white bean and ham. Both were just okay - eggs were seriously bland for how they were described. Soup was pretty good with chunks of ham. All in all, a thought mediocre experience. Sorry for my prior presumption! I now believe what my all-wise fellow Yelpers were trying to tell me.

reviews.name: Scott C.
reviews.review: The story you are about to read is true. This is Music City, Nashville, Tennessee. My name is Skacey, I carry a bitter chill from the January cold.8:40 pm. Thursday. I'm in the Gaylord Opry setting up a tradeshow and looking for a proper Guinness. The Gaylord Hotel has a few in-house pubs and restaurants that I feel obligated to try. Findley's is the Irish pub and is situated directly across from the sport's bar.This is a night for American Football, the padded up grid iron combat which dominates most drinking establishments. Tonight is no different - If you are wanting to watch the game, come on in. If you are wanting to escape the sports bar, this isn't it. As I sit at the bar, the Irish band sits flaccidly plucking their instruments, pining for a chance to roust the crowd. No luck tonight boys, the Red Tide is on the plasma and the bar is packed with old men reflecting on a youth long since past.Ah, now for the Guinness. The pour is a good try, with a 3/4 glass and then a pause. The challenge is that the 'tender is pouring with one eye over his shoulder spotting the score. The final may be closer to what you would find in Football Season in Dublin (that's soccer for the western crowd) - the final product is passable, but not passionate.If you need to stay within the resort area, this is decent. If you've got your own vehicle, I'd suggest a more adventurous selection.guinness was Meh, tasted off. go here if you have to 6.95

reviews.name: Pete B.
reviews.review: Mussels and fries...so good. Ask for bread to dunk. Great live music as well.

reviews.name: Carmen C.
reviews.review: We had dinner here due to a conference.  Our server was fantastic!  The fries were good, especially with the fish and chips. They had broccoli for the side vegetable the night we were there and it was fresh, cooked just right, and tasted wonderful (that is if you like broccoli).  The music was pretty good too!  So if you are ever at the Gaylord for a conference try Findley's Pub, food is A-OK!

reviews.name: Crissy H.
reviews.review: We came here for only one round of drinks - so all I can say is.... Great beer and a great selection.

reviews.name: sean l.
reviews.review: i get the feeling that the average customer is a captive audience staying here for a convention. in other words, i am guessing that not too many locals venture out to try Findley's -- i know i would probably never come here if i lived here. i am pretty certain of that.starting off, it really has a cheap pub feel to it. i felt like i could easily be walking into something closer to McDonald's than to Applebee's . . . and that's a scale that is far less than impressive. well, since i was dinning alone i decided to take a spot at the bar -- near the Guinness. i should point out that the Guinness was absolutely fine and I would probably have no reservations about stopping in for another Guinness during my stay; just not the food.speaking of food . . . the menu is pretty simple. they have maybe 6 appetizers and 8 main dishes. once i saw the prices, i knew i'd be skipping the appetizers and just going with the main dish. the prime rib is $22 for the 8 ounce and $30 for the 12 ounce, fwiw. i decided to try the prime rib sandwich. my final bill was about $23 for a sandwich and 1 Guinness. for $23, I want ambiance and good food. my sandwich came with fries that were overcooked -- too brittle and very little potato left in them. there was a piece of green lettuce on my sandwich, which lacked the crunch and wilted with sogginess. i had my prime rib sandwich blackened and it was okay. if the sandwich had been $8 then i'd chalk it up to an experience that wasn't memorable; however, the sandwich was twice that price and there is no way to justify paying $16 for a meh sandwich.this is not the place to be if you're on a budget for dinner. maybe the lunch menu has better pricing???

reviews.name: Kenny A.
reviews.review: came here for convention stay.  This place is the best near the convention hall.  There are healthy dinners on their menu.  The staff are very friendly and I recommend this place if your on a budget.

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: So I officially started my vacation today (yay!), but had to spend the first afternoon of it at the dentist (boo). I figured to treat myself as compensation I would go have a long lunch a couple beers on a patio. I found myself at Joe's Place for the first time, and am very glad I did.The service was excellent, even with just the bartender running the whole place. My $5 lunch special pizza was far from gourmet, but it was large enough for two and there were lots of topping options. The side salad was enormous, and more than just a pile of iceberg.  The patio was completely shaded, and off the street - ideal for a too sunny afternoon. The part that put it over the top was the customer service and welcoming atmosphere. Besides the bartender/server I mentioned, the guy at the smoker (Bill?) when he found out I was spending the first hour at my vacation at Joe's, bought me my next beer. How surprisingly nice!All in all, a great experience, and I will definitely be back. I recommend you bring a friend, split lunch and a side or app, and both of you can get out of the place with a filling meal and even with a beer and tip for under $10 a piece!Oh, I almost forgot, the music selection was a major plus: old blues and and country. Loved it!

reviews.name: jaime h.
reviews.review: My friends and I have been here quite a few times for karaoke and have had a good time. We had let slide, the bartender being rude to us a few times cause we had fun while we were here but it's gotten out of hand. Last night, the bartender actually told my friend that "if he didn't tip her, she wasn't going to serve him", but this was when he went and ordered his first drink. She eventually started telling everyone at the bar that we weren't tipping her(even though I had already left her a dollar for each beer I had). I went up to pay my last tab and heard everyone around me talking about one of the guys I was with, talking about he wasn't going to get any more beer. He wasn't even drunk. Next thing I knew, we were being recorded on someone's phone while he called us "non tipping mother fu*kers". I went and said something to them and the girl got up and was arguing with me. Then the guy who works there, threw me in a choke hold(keep in mind I'm 5'2). I ended up punching a guy who told me "I was a dead motherfu*cker", then I was grabbed by the throat, again, by the guy who works there and escorted out. Needless to say, My friends and I will never be back to this bar. I don't know how they are able to have such rude service.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: DING DING DING DING!  We have a winner as a dive (or divey at least) bar in Green Hills and it is Joe's Place.I won't go about calling out the others that have written reviews here.  Suffice to say it seems they are all pretty old and perhaps had some beef with this place or just don't like dive bars.  I do like dive bars and I'm here to tell you what was good about this place.First off, large bar to your left as soon as you walk in.  Huge U shape so more corners and space to sit around it.  The lady behind the bar was on top of it - she had our drinks coming without having to ask.  And spotted us some cash for the ciggy machine as long as we tipped it back to her on our tip.  Nice!Yes you can smoke 'em if you got 'em.  So if you don't like that I suggest you not even think about coming here.  Apparently they have food but we had already eaten at Nero's and were too full to consider that.  There's darts in the back and a patio in the very back.  There are TVs throughout so you can watch the game.  There's also a stage and when I walked in I saw it, the best thing I've seen in a while.  Yes, it was a lady sitting beside the stage with a computer.  And two microphones and a monitor on stage.  KARAOKE!  Finally, a dive with karaoke!  And do not be scared to sing whatever song you want, curse words and all, because they do not care.  Thank goodness too since Fuck Her Gently is the BF's fave karaoke jam.  The patrons were of all ages - group of frat boy looking types playing darts and getting rowdy, groups of older people listening to karaoke and getting rowdy.  So you will fit in no matter who you are.So others can hate but give Joe's a chance.  Definitely more divey than other places in Green Hills, so come here when you are not feeling the see and be seen places and get down and dirty to some karaoke, some liquor, and some cigarette smoke!

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: As a fan of dive bars I've been to my fair share of questionable establishments. Joe's, unfortunately, leaves a lot to be desired. Coming through on a Friday night with some friends, we had a pretty good time but I was surprised to see the place pretty slow even into the late night hours. The drink prices were normal but you expect a little bit more value at a place that has such little overhead costs. Karaoke was to be expected and there was plenty to laugh at while we were there. The space itself is pretty small and uncomfortable to move around in. Fixture planning obviously wasn't in the strategic plan for the owners.In general, this bar is simply OK. You would be better off walking down the road to the Crowe's Nest or finding a dive bar downtown with a little more spirit. What hurts this bar the most is its location in Green Hills where - it would be safe to say - most people don't go to dive bars for their kicks.

reviews.name: Jessica C.
reviews.review: Joe's place is OUR place! It rocks. WE love it and have made it our place to go with our group of friends. They have awesome Karaoke! We used to come on Saturday nights and sing all night long! It's spacious...they always have sports on the tv's, and it's a great atmosphere to just hang out, sing, and drink! Not pretentious at all! Like some places in Green Hills can be... We LOVE Joe's Place!!

reviews.name: Nathan L.
reviews.review: Smallish place, decent beer specials, haven't tried the food.  You can smoke here, and there is a patio out back.  Bartenders are very friendly and often adorable. Wifi is fantastic.  Free, and I got 18MB down, and 5MB up. ++Sprint's 4G service is great here too (with MiFi unit on window ledge). I measured the highest rates I have anywhere in Nashville so far, 11MB down, and 1MB up. ++Great place to grab a beer and finish up some work.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: The Health Department requires you to be 21 or over to enter, since this bar allows smoking. Plenty of TVs to watch races, baseball, football and basketball, but you may have to wash your hair if you don't want your healthy friends to run off. Sometimes musicians not worried about the smoke perform here although many singers prefer the safety of the nearby Bluebird. The owners are not ashamed of being in the dive bar genre, like the old smoky Springwater. Best Dive.

reviews.name: Wes H.
reviews.review: Joe's Place makes their living on being the red-headed stepchild of Greenhouse and Crow's Nest. Monday night trivia is tolerable/fun with the right people in the place. The staff there is fine; not awful but certainly could be more attentive at times. Smokers paradise for sure. Plastic dart machine makes for some fun if it isn't packed. All-in-all, it's a fine place to go for drinks when you just want to hang out and not go to Lime or the Standard or somewhere similar.

reviews.name: Ivy W.
reviews.review: As a fellow service industry employee, I enjoy heading out for a drink after a  long night of servicing others.  I was excited to see new places open up in the Green Hills area considering I work in the vicinity.  I had been frequenting Joe's until recently when 100% of the staff were fired and replaced with sloth like, unattentive women.  At first dealing with the loud covers and the obnoxiously loud juke box was something i could do without; now a good bartender is in order in this place.  There is also a young gentleman that seems to either be a barback or manager who has the worst attitude and most unfriendly disposition ever.  Very sad to no longer be enjoying Joe's.

reviews.name: Tamara G.
reviews.review: To quote my friend "you know a meal is good when you're sad that it's almost ending."We were very pleased. The salsa was wonderful. The guacamole was lacking a little flavor but mixed with the salsa it was good. I had the tostada combination, 1 beef, 1 chicken and 1 al pastor. All were delicious.As for drinks I enjoyed the Queen of the Night beer. My husband had a Dos Piratas beer cocktail which he also loved.

reviews.name: Deb P.
reviews.review: Dinner inside the Gaylord Opry Hotel. The service is awesome. There was no wait and our waitress so far has be wonderful. Drinks and appetizers were brought out shortly after ordering. The restaurant is well decorated, clean, and the food is amazing!!! It's fun, up beat vibe and relaxed for tired travelers. I ordered Maui Fish Tacos and they are so good. There were some pepper so it had a kick to them. The drinks are definitely worth the price. They have more alcohol than I've ever had in a restaurant.The restaurant manager is quite a humorous guy!!! He walked around and greeted all his customers. He joked around with us, teasing my friend about her location in FL. Our nicknames are now WIFI!!  :). It was a pleasure to have dined here.

reviews.name: Mikey B.
reviews.review: Would not recommend. Waited an hour, then found out there were 10 unoccupied tables inside. The manager would not say if they were reserved or not. Finally sat ordered. Waitress was rude in her demeanor. No condiments on table. Food sub par. Limited menu, should be listed as a BAR. Their emphasis is on selling alcohol. Providing meals does not appearTo be a priority.

reviews.name: Shehla M.
reviews.review: Here are the pros.The service was very good. All hosts and servers were well aquatinted with the menu and were quite friendly.Next pro- the salsa bar, need I say more?Last pro/slash/ first con- the chicken tortilla soup which I ordered had fat in it. Yes, I mean chicken skin. I know for some this may be quite "normal" but in all honesty I cannot stand fat in ANY of my food. It simply makes me feel sick to my stomach.The pro to this con, yep that's such an odd thing to say, is that the staff and their management quickly took this off of my bill.Last con- the food lacked flavor and essence of Mexican food. I caught myself adding salt to everything. That's a no go. Shouldn't the chef taste their sauces to ensure proper prep? All in all a mediocre experience. I would have given this restaurant a 2 star rating had the management not handled my tortilla soup,fat situation as well as they did.Here's to better finds!
reviews.location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

reviews.name: Yuna D.
reviews.review: The ambiance here is romantic enough for a dinner date, and the food is great (once you get it). Unlimited chips & salsa, which is also a plus. I got the green chile However, wow at the service. The guy who took our order completely got my order wrong, and then another server had the balls to ask whether I was sure that I had ordered something else, even when my boyfriend and his mother both heard me. That's just plain rude. The original server who took the order was pleasant despite the mistake and made the switch for me, no questions asked. However, he then charged us for a single plate & a coke, which was very confusing. We pointed out our mistake, but service just seemed very chaotic and unorganized. There wasn't a wait, even during the dinner rush, which was good I guess. Is there a reason for it? I don't know. I'd try this place one more time if I stayed here longer.tl;dr chaotic service, but pretty decent food.

reviews.name: Andrea S.
reviews.review: Very limited menu and they charge for everything. Even chips and salsa are extra.  Chips were cold but the salsa was good. The staff on the other hand were great. Too bad the food was mediocre.

reviews.name: Jennifer H.
reviews.review: 1) The strawberry jalapeño margarita: amazing. 2) The chips and salsa - mind blowing.  HOWEVER our table of five asked for a few refills of salsa.  Naturally, when the first two rounds that our server brought out were one halfway-filled cup for us to share, we are going to go through that pretty quickly.  We were soon notified by our server that if we asked for any more salsa she would have to charge us.  It was actually pretty awkward.  Yes it was a paltry amount ($2.00), but I have never been charged for salsa at a restaurant like that.  It's not like we weren't spending $$$ to eat and drink - we spent over $50 per person.  That was definitely off-putting, to say the least.  Sure enough when we got our receipts we had the dreaded "too much salsa" upcharge.  The queso dip was quite good, the meals themselves were raved about (I had the veggie tacos, which came with some very tasty black beans).  The ambiance is quite nice.  But come on with that salsa deal.  If people are ordering food and drinks give them some salsa!!

reviews.name: Kevin S.
reviews.review: Not a very big menu at all.  Queso was nothing but melted velveta that was already cold by the time it made it to the table.  Main dishes were cold and undercooked.  If your looking for good mexican, don't come here.  Now for the good...atmosphere is awesome and the wait and management staff are superb.

reviews.name: Eric J.
reviews.review: I've had better tasting mexican food from a food truck.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: I love this restaurant. We ate here last February when we were in town for a convention, and it was so good we wanted to return this year. I read some reviews that talk about lack of flavor. I don't see that, and neither did any of my friends. But then again we don't like super hot spicy food, just a touch of pepper for us. And this fits that bill. The salsa is the best I've had anywhere. Not super hot, but full of great flavor. Guacamole is right up there tied with the best 2 or 3, and you get a huge portion. Chips are not thin like I usually like them, but these chips are crunchy and fresh with a nice corn flavor, so I liked them. You only get a small bowl of salsa each (maybe 2 oz), and if you want more, you can buy three types plus chips. We did that last year, and I remember all 3 flavors were excellent. Ambiance was great; salsa music while sitting on the patio in the Opryland rain forest. Our server (forgot to ask her name) was a middle aged white lady with reddish hair, and she was very attentive, did a perfect job. (Manager, are you listening?) Food was out very promptly, but they weren't busy. Last year they were swamped, and we did wait a while. I got the green chili pork enchilada again, and my friend got the beef burrito. Both very good. Beans and rice were pretty good, but not the best I've eaten. We each had a classic margarita, which were very good, too. Maybe not the strongest I've ever had, but definitely not virgin like one reviewer surmised - I could feel my single drink when I got up to leave. Kinda expensive, like you'd expect from a resort: two big margaritas, a coke, two entrees, and guacamole plus the complementary salsa - $73 for two people, before the tip.They don't take reservations, so it's first come, first served. They opened at 4PM.We will definitely eat here again. If we had a Solario in Memphis, I'd eat there all the time!

reviews.name: David F.
reviews.review: I sure now better not to get Tex-Mex food in Nashville.    :)  The guacamole lacked flavor.  Come on, it's not that difficult to make this stuff.  Chicken enchiladas were good, but the margarita I ordered was way too sweet.  I couldn't taste the alcohol.  Back to Texas for the real stuff.

reviews.name: Lori L.
reviews.review: Very noisy! We found out when they were seating us that they were only offering a buffet that night. So when we were seated we didn't get menus. The restaurant was less than half full but we sat for over 7 mins before a waitress came over. She wasn't very happy when I asked her for a drink menu but I like to check out the cocktail selection before ordering. We headed to the buffet and when we came back we had a new waitress, Jessica. She was the only good thing about having dinner there. She was friendly and attentive. Other than that the white sangria was gross and the food was bland. The salad was hidden with the desserts so we missed that until the end. This is the first restaurant we've gone to at this hotel. Hopefully the other ones are better.

reviews.name: Jen P.
reviews.review: The atmosphere is amazing. The menu is very unique -- wooden & contemporary. The staff is quite friendly.The variety on the menu leaves a lot to be desired. Tacos. Quesadillas. Burritos. That's about it. I was hoping for fajitas, but they don't offer them.The plated good is very pretty.Our waiter (Bo) was very friendly & brought some free guacamole for us to try. He also brought me a free flight of sangrias. The food was tasty. The drinks were good, but the red sangria was much better than the white. The pink was kind of gross.

reviews.name: Kenneth R.
reviews.review: Where do I start with this place. Wonderful ambiance  with the open seating in the atrium. There is a big negative with copper tables in an atrium though. They have a tenancy to leach and leave green stains on your clothes and arms (definitely a bad idea for an outside table). It took twenty minutes to get two drinks and an order of cheese dip. The waitress acted like she was doing a big favor by giving me free salsa (normal charge is 3 dollars). Yet she forgets to give us the chips. That took another five minutes (they were undercooked and therefore they were greasy and chewy). The cheesedip itself had good flavors and had a nice tone of cilantro but the salsa was nothing special. We both ordered fajitas (all three meats). It wasn't anything to write about and it came out right after the chips we finally got so we didn't get to enjoy the dip. The waitress while nice felt she was very busy handling the four tables she was working and stayed behind. By it was all done with we spent 80 dollars on two people for a meal I can get at any Mexican joint for thirty. The last straw was it took twenty minutes to get the check and cash out. If you are staying at the opryland and are looking for something to eat either walk to the mall for chuys or get a cab and go to taco bell. You can eat here if you want but chances are they won't be open during their advertised times anyway.

reviews.name: Erica J.
reviews.review: Yumo! It was a Mexican gem! I wish we lived in Nashville so I could go there on a regular basis! First of all the service was great! Our waitress was attentive and bright us everything we needed.We started with a carafe of margaritas because we were thirsty (it's meant for 4 but my husband and I always get 2 each) what a great decision! I never had an empty glass waiting for another! We started with the spicy guac, I'm telling you the portion was huge! They must have used 4 avocados to make this bad boy! It was spectacular we barely dented it!We asked the server what she recommended and we went with both. My husband got the pulled pork enchilada and I got the steak taco salad. Wow! Not your traditional taco bowl shell, this was more like a giant taco filled with scrumptious salad! It was a beautiful presentation. My husband and I promised to split each other's but we were too busy enjoying our own we never did that. I did get to sample his enchilada and let me tell you that pork was so incredibly tender and the sauce it swam in brought out all the amazing flavors of this dish it's no wonder why he was able to finish the whole thing! Do yourself a favor. Spend the extra money and stay at the opryland hotel and despite what people to tell you about eating at cascades, if you had one choice it should be here. You can thank me later.

reviews.name: Emily Y.
reviews.review: This was a consolation prize for us. The weather was crappy and Nashville was packed with convention-goers, so we took a mulligan and decided to avoid both the rain and the crowds and stay in the hotel for margaritas. 2 $42 pitchers later, we are still waiting for our tequila buzz. Menu is very limited (and liberally features goat cheese, which I hate). We tried both the queso and the guac, but the complimentary salsa was a show stopper - it was some of the best I've ever had anywhere. Food is OK and our server was attentive. Too bad the plusses couldn't outweigh the giant minus of our seemingly virgin margaritas.

reviews.name: Seema P.
reviews.review: We came down from our room to explore the wonderful hotel and our bellies were asking us to pause the adventure to refuel.  It was the night of our one year anniversary so we were happy to just enjoy each other's company since life recently got so chaotic.  Solario helped make the night very memorable with its delicious food.  My husband is not a fan of Mexican cuisine, sad to say, but he loved this place.  The hook: salsa.  By far the best salsa I've had in a long time!  And I am very, very, VERY picky about my salsa.  I wanted to eat it by itself the next day for lunch.The line: guacamole; pepper'd style.  This was our normal run of the mill guacamole with an added mix of habanero, serrano, and jhelepino peppers.  It was nice and nose running spicy.  We enjoyed every bite!The sinker: service and ambience.  It doesn't get any better sitting on the "patio" looking on the inside of the beautiful Gaylord hotel where you feel like you went to paradise without leaving the mainland and with outstanding customer service being delivered to you by a knowledgeable and friendly staff.2 days after our visit to Solario, we were back in Dallas and we were missing the food so much so that I went to the Grapevine Gaylord to see if there was a Solario here we could visit but sadly there isn't.  I guess hubs and I will have to really consider coming back to Nashville for our favorite salsa soon.

reviews.name: Bobby W.
reviews.review: I second the previously stated reviews describing a non-impressive experience. Unfair?.... This is a Mexican restaurant that resides within the GAYLORD Opryland. High expectations are why tourists and business people lodge in resorts such as the Gaylord hotels. Ambiance is very nice, great for an intimate setting, however food leaves much to be desired. If you're looking for a spot to get good guac and 'Rita's, youll be in good shape.

reviews.name: Janna E.
reviews.review: It was okay.  Food was kind of bland.  Hostess staff unfriendly.  Everyone seemed to be bothered by us being there.  Slow service.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: I was staying at the Gaylord and ate here. WOW so good and great service. The Guacamole was tasty and yummy. I could of ate more, but didn't. My dinner was just as i ordered it. I for sure will be back to this place. You have to stop in. I hope you like it as much as I did

reviews.name: Katie C.
reviews.review: This place was horrible. HORRIBLE. To start off, we were seated and it took 10 minutes for our waiter to come over. He was busy cleaning tables. They brought us 3 waters and chips and salsa. 10 minutes later he came to take our order. Never asked what drinks we wanted. We had to ask for them. He didn't even know what sodas they offered. We ordered our food, ordered mixed drinks, and asked for more salsa. Never got the salsa. Our food came before our mixed drinks, they sat over at the bar for 10 minutes while we ate our food. We ordered the kids menu cheese quesadilla, chicken enchiladas, and beef tacos. The tacos were bland. No flavor. There was more fat than meat there. The beans and rice were bland. The enchiladas were just ok. We only got one refill the whole time, so we sat there with empty glasses the majority of the time. When it came time to pay, he brought us our bill and went and cleaned off a few more tables so we sat there for a bit waiting to pay. I will say this, we only to pay for the drinks it was so bad. $30 for two margaritas. Cucumber lime, which had no taste of cucumber in it at all, and strawberry jalapeño, which was all jalapeño and no strawberry. The worst part is we waited an hour to get in there and by the time we did, there were only 4-5 out of the 15 tables in our area with people at them. So they weren't that busy. I wouldn't recommend this place even if it was the only place open in there.

reviews.name: Lennae P.
reviews.review: As others have mentioned, the atmosphere is very nice - although at times it was difficult to converse over the level background music.  There was a large group of us, so we ordered a variety of appetizers. The guacamole was fresh and wasn't overly spicy.  It appealed to a wide variety of taste preferences in our group.  The chorizo queso'd was outstanding for anyone who likes bold flavor.  The fish tacos received mixed reviews.  One person thought they were the amazing, but another thought they were under seasoned and a bit dry. For children, or someone who prefers a milder flavor, Solario also offers cheese or chicken quesadillas.  They aren't on the menu, but were available upon request. The beef in the Solario Burritio was flavorful and moist and perfectly complemented by the sauce.  It was easily the favorite dish at our table.

reviews.name: Tom T.
reviews.review: Terrible. My wife's fish tacos were deeply fried. They were some kind of frozen fish from a cheap store. My beef  taco was OK but very chewy. The rice side dish seemed like it was out of a box. The guacamole was not as described on the menu. I have eaten at a few of the restaurants in the Gaylord Opryland, not great. They need to get with the updated demands and provide some healthy options, like farm to table.

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: As a resident of Nashville, my go-to places are not typically in resort areas, but this place was just added to my roster.My boyfriend and I went to the restaurant, located inside the Opryland Resort, for a fun night out and felt like we were on vacation. The atmosphere was fun, colorful, classy yet not stuffy, and our waitress (I wish I remembered her name because she was wonderful!) was helpful and friendly.We started with the strawberry jalapeño margarita (myself) and the cucumber mint margarita (Matt), and like them so much we ordered another round of the exact same ones, which is rare coming from a couple that likes to sample everything on the menu.The chili relleno appetizer, peppers filled with goat cheese and wrapped in bacon, was the perfect size and absolutely delicious.The tortilla soup was a generous portion and combined with the appetizer and chips and salsa was plenty enough for my average-sized appetite. Matt went with the pork enchiladas and cleaned his plate easily.We loved this place and will definitely be back again. If you're on vacation, it's a great spot in the Opryland area, and if you live here, it's the perfect night out for a stay-cation.I'd recommend it to anyone!

reviews.name: Shannon F.
reviews.review: This place was a huge disappointment. After  a long day of working our company's event, we were all quite starving and in need of some good satisfying food. One of our fellow co workers picked this place out ( out of the 9 I believe, additional restaurants at the hotel) and we all agreed it sounded and looked like a fantastic place...NOT!So the atmosphere is quite mesmerizing with its Spanish rustic appeal nestled in the middle of the beautiful opryland rain forest, however, the food turned out to be quite the opposite.For starters, we ordered a bowl of chips with guacamole and a cheese queze like appetizer.I ordered the steak taco salad that came with a guacamole dressing and everyone else ordered ( supposed street taco's ) and I believe someone got an enchilada.Our appetizers arrived with in a reasonable amount of time looking decent. The cheese appetizer was actually quite good and ended up being the only good thing but then again how can you mess up melted cheese with mexican seasoning and tomato's. Our main meals on the other hand, took FOREVER TO RECEIVE.  I am guessing a good 45 min after we ordered and finally when they arrived nothing looked appealing.My salad was in quadruple sized taco shell with slices of steak all presented quite sloppy. My steak was semi warm as if it had been sitting out for quite some time and the guacamole dressing? If they want to call it that tasted like guacamole mixed with vinegar ehh...  I ended up just asking our server ( who barely served us) to get thousand Island dressing which he had to search to see if we had, which he later brought to me and still unfortunately could not save my bleek salad.As for everyone else, they were all disappointed with the tacos and found them to be nothing identical mexican food and there portions were all quite small as well considering the price.Overall, food sucked along with it being way overpriced, the service was vacant all I can say, is the ambiance is the only thing this place has going for it. Neeless to say, I wont be back.

reviews.name: Angie K.
reviews.review: Mexican place inside the Opryland resort. This is one of the better dining options in the resort. The food is a little overpriced, but it is pretty good. One tip when dining here - they serve you chips and salsa so if you just order an appetizer along with it, it's still filling enough. I had the pork carnitas, which come with bean dip, and while it was $10 which is a little much for an appetizer, the quality was good. One bonus to being inside the resort is that you can order a margarita (or pitcher) to take back to your room with you. It's pricey but they are pretty good.

reviews.name: sameer a.
reviews.review: Went in just like most other people who are visiting opryland. The food though was horrible, much less than 3 stars. The only good thing was the salsa in the beginning.. Go to some other tourist trap..

reviews.name: Elizabeth U.
reviews.review: After a long day of meetings at the Gaylord, we wanted to have a quick bite to eat and a glass of wine.  The restaurant was completely full, but Ed found a table for us and waited on us as well.  He went out of his way to make sure we didn't  walk away to another restaurant and made sure our dining experience was fantastic. 5 stars to Ed and the Solario!

reviews.name: Marisa M.
reviews.review: Grabbed a quick bite while waiting for the room to be ready. The scenario is beautiful, as the restaurant overlooks the Garden Conservatory of the Gaylord Opryland Hotel. The chips and salsa were awesome. Ordered the cheese dip too. It came with a few flour tortillas, wish there had been more they were so good. Got the dessert chips and salsa which were fantastic. I hadn't had fruit salsa before and it was delicious. The wait staff was friendly and attentive.  Only issue was the cheese was burnt once you got past the top layer. They promptly noticed it and took care of it.  Didn't have an entree this time, but I plan to be back!

reviews.name: Lily M.
reviews.review: I came here for my last night at the Gaylord hoping to get a really good meal.  I wish I hadn't chosen this restaurant because it didn't meet my expectations.  I ordered the chicken fajitas and was so surprised when the waitress brought out the dish.  There was so much chicken on the platter, it could have easily fed 3 people.  I think that the chef should focus more on the taste of the chicken and less on the quantity.  There was hardly any flavor at all on the meat.  Thankfully, I was able to add my own flavor with the small cup of salsa it came with.I also had a side of beans and rice.  The rice looked like mexican rice, but it tasted like white rice straight from being boiled before any seasoning is added to it.  The beans were the best part of the whole meal.The best part about eating here is the amazing surroundings of it from the garden.I would not recommend this restaurant for anyone that really knows good mexican food; however, if you aren't that familiar with mexican cuisine, you can give it a try.  Be prepared to spend some moolah at this place because it isn't cheap.

reviews.name: Eric H.
reviews.review: I was extremely impressed with Solario.  The food was great and the service was wonderful.  Our server was very helpful and attentive as well as personable and friendly.  He made one very minor mistake, but fixed it immediately and did more than necessary to make up for the mistake. I ordered the fajitas and they were delicious.Probably the best meal I had while in Nashville.

reviews.name: Albert W.
reviews.review: Reasonable prices for at place inside the resort.   Gauc was fresh.   Food was alright.   As you can imagine, I love in California and there are much, much better place.   I think of eating here like eating in Disneyland.   You really don't have choices, it's going to be pricey but there is a lot of convenience.   If you want something better, walk 10 minute to Chuy's across the street from the resort.

reviews.name: leslie k.
reviews.review: Mexican food in the south is usually terrible for a So Cal native.  This place turned out to be really good.  I got the shredded beef salad, which was delicious.  The salsa bar was excellent.  The cocktails are made with fresh citrus and agave.  Servers were very nice too.

reviews.name: Sara G.
reviews.review: This is hands down the BEST Mexican food my husband and I have ever had! We  have lived in San Diego, where mexican food is readily fresh and delicious, but Solario beats any of those places by a landslide! I had to write a review because very rarely are we super impressed, but WOW!My husband and I came to the Gaylord Resort for a few days for our 1 year wedding anniversary, and on the first night (Friday) luckily decided to eat at Solario.  There was no wait for a table, it was 7pm, and it was busy, but we were sat immediately.  Our waitress, Michelle, was as sweet as can be, friendly and knowledgeable.  The chips and salsa were brought out first and they were amazing! Chips were served warm, the salsa had just enough kick to it, the guacamole (a HUGE portion) was beyond delicious, and the queso (although we were warned it is not your typical 'melted' cheese queso) was melt-in-your-mouth delicious! My husband got the chicken tacos which he scarfed down, and I got the chicken fajitas which were super tasty.  The chicken was so tender, and so flavorful. We loved the atmosphere and food so much we knew we had to come back.We went to Solario again on our last night (Sunday) at the Gaylord, and it was even BETTER this time.  Our waiter this time was Nicholas, who was also very friendly, funny and upbeat.  He knew the menu better than the back of his hand, and made sure to let us know that the salsa would be a different flavor than on Friday night when we were there last.  We both looked at each other wondering how he knew we were there Friday night ... then, the Manager (I believe his name is Ed) came over to our table to thank us for joining them for dinner again. He had remembered us from the first time we were there and told our waiter! Wow, how awesome!We got the chips salsa guac and queso again, and we both got the chicken fajitas, and again, it was just beyond words delicious!  Because we had mentioned to Nicholas it was our anniversary, he had told the chef and she made a special dessert for us and spelled out in melted chocolate on the plate was "Happy Anniversary."  It was so very sweet.Needless to say I have nothing bad to say about this place (except that there is only one Solario, I wish they were all over the place!).  The staff is super friendly and the food is down right the best! Thank you Solario for helping to make our first anniversary a fabulous one :)Sara and Gary Gerhardt

reviews.name: Jen F.
reviews.review: Solario is your average tasting Mexican cuisine with higher prices and nicer presentation.Chips are not complimentary- you have to pay for them.  The salsa plate includes three shallow plates of different salsas.  They were all tasty but my table probably could've used another three.The tortilla soup was excellent.  I highly recommend getting a bowl.  The soft tacos were very bland.  I was not impressed.  The servers were nice.  You also get parking validated- score!

reviews.name: Patricia M.
reviews.review: Just had dinner here after making a drive over to the Gaylord hotel to see what it was all about. This restaurant was pretty yummy and I'm usually really picky about Mexican food because it's so easily available in California and Nevada where I'm from. But this place surprised me. We ordered the guacamole for two and the fajitas for two. The guacamole was extremely tasty and they gave you a decent amount of it BUT it did cost $10.....the fajitas came with beans and rice and plenty of tortillas. The steak was tender and they gave you lots of onions and peppers as well. They too were a little on the pricey side $30.....but if you had to pay the $18 for parking they will validate so you will no longer have to fork out that outrageous parking fee.The restaurant is really beautiful and staff was very friendly and attentive. I would give it more stars but it's expensive for not really any good reason other than they are located in this hotel.

reviews.name: Ebonye B.
reviews.review: It looks good, but it isn't. The guacamole has huge numerous onion chunks. Eew. I ordered the burrito. The braised beef tasted like pot roast. I know I'm in Nashville, not Mexico. I've never had such a weird and untasty burrito. My friend ordered the house-made chorizo, but it wasn't tasty either. The beans were good. The salsa was good.  Do not eat here. I know it's right downstairs if you're staying in the Gaylord Opryland resort, but put some shoes on and go get some delicious Mexican fare for half the price at Las Maracas on Gallatin Road.

reviews.name: Jeannette W.
reviews.review: I was tired of eating heavy foods and wanted a little change so I ended up at Solario despite the fact that it hadn't any yelp review for me to base my decision on.  If you are looking for a good tortilla soup, this is the place for you.  The soup is a rich tangy red broth that comes with strips of chicken, avocado, a little cheese and fresh crunchy tortilla strips.  Since I was missing home, I also ordered for the fresh guacamole that is made to order at your tableside.  I had never had so much fun eating by myself before.  The staff is here is very nice and friendly and I would recommend giving this restaurant a try if you are staying at the resort.

reviews.name: Paul I.
reviews.review: I'm convinced that hotel restaurants will always be hotel restaurants, expensive and not too good.  This one is better than some hotel restaurants but not by much.  I'm sure the waitress was disappointed when she saw me sit down alone and even more so when I ordered no alcoholic beverages (not a very good tip opportunity), but service was still fine, maybe a bit slow.  For dinner I had the taco salad.  The vegetables and toppings were very tasty and fresh.  The steak was room temperature, not hot of the grill.  I saw this in other reviews so it may be that they do not want to wilt the lettuce, but I would have preferred if it were served hot.  The steak had good flavor otherwise.  The salsa served with the chips was very good.  I ate it like soup when I did not want any more chips.  Overall it was not a bad meal.  If you are bound to the confines of the Gaylord, it may be a reasonably priced option considering the other options in the hotel.

reviews.name: Katherine B.
reviews.review: This place is a bit pricey but worth it at times. As long as you know what you are eating and enjoying then you won't have any issues. The service and staff are all very friendly and we were very impressed.We had the chorizo and queso for an appetizers. The chorizo and cheese were tasty but the tortillas were a bit cold. It might have just been for the appetizer because the tacos my husband ordered were warm enough. The chips and salsa were fresh and flavor. I had the Mexican paella. I took one bite out of the chorizo on top and was immediately assaulted with spice and heat. It was overly spicey and unfortunately still speaking to me now. Everything else on the dish was just fine.But the lemonade was delicious. I think I can safely say I had 3 glasses full. we didn't stay for dessert.

reviews.name: chris k.
reviews.review: Surprisingly good.  I'd read bad things about this place but I came for lunch and was pleased.  The oxacan empanadas were small but tasty with a nice pork filling and a tasty green sauce drizzled on them.  The green chile braised pork burrito was excellent with lots of flavor.  It's not cheap but I have to give it four stars.  Good service as well.  Chris

reviews.name: Lynn C.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed my meal at Solario.  The chips were warm, salty, and perfectly crisp and the salsa had great seasoning in it.  I ordered the chicken fajitas and they were so yummy as well!!  The server was very polite and did a great job.  Like all the restaurants in the Opryland complex, prices seem higher than usual, but I think it was worth it.  Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Seth B.
reviews.review: My meal was not bad, it is just not Mexican food. There is a big difference between adding ingredients and knowing why they are there. All the components are there, rice, beans, cheese, tortillas (maybe not all the ingredients I doubt they have ever seen a jalapeno) but is comes off as a strange pseudo BBQ/Italian/Sunday dinner conglomerate. The food fits perfectly into the strange imitation loving environment of Opryland.  A perfect example: Queso is cheese right? Not exactly, there is more too it then that. Kind of like Sprite has more to it then Lemon and Lime. Well if you order the Queso you get... cheese... mozzarella it appears (i don't know for sure I just could not bring myself to sample this bizarre dish) The completely wrong preparation, is obvious to anyone familiar with a kitchen. It was heated under the salamander and congealed into a great big block. Topped with diced tomatoes(?) and onions that look as though they belong in the French Onion. But wait there's more! Order now and you too can indulge in the layer of straight creme under your giant block of white goo. That's right straight cream topped with mozzarella! Yummy! Not.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: Amazing infused cucumber margarita!  Best tacos I've ever eaten.  I love Solario!

reviews.name: megan s.
reviews.review: Solario is another needlessly way overpriced restaurant with a lousy menu at Opryland right next to another way overpriced restaurant with a lousy menu, Ravello.  They must be run by the same awful management.  Ravello used to be Volarie and it was a nice place with a decent menu/prices, no more though once it became Ravello.  We ate at Solario and had just as negative experience as Ravello, first the the shocking needlessly high prices, again nothing upscale about these restaurants or food, food is actually pretty bland and tasteless.  My wife did not want anything spicey so they said they could give her some shrimp that were not spicey, they were not spicey and not very good either and we were shocked when her meal came to $40 with just the bland lousy small amount of shirmp and a drink.  My meal was not good either, no better then what you get at Rosie's or same medium priced Mexican place for $16, except it cost $30 at Soario with no salad or side.  Opryland is nice to visit but their restaurants are way overpriced for very mediocre food and little selection, very disappointing.

reviews.name: Daniel L.
reviews.review: If you are looking for a nice Mexican breakfast or any sort of Mexican breakfast, then do not go here. Although billed as a Mexican restaurant, there was nothing mexican about the breakfast. The breakfast consisted of a limited standard American breakfast buffet: eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, gravy, potatoes, limited pastries, limited fruit, no cereal. The drinks were served, and they were slow at that. All this for a price of 25 dollars plus tax. Too much for too little.

reviews.name: Andrea W.
reviews.review: My party of 8 business travelers had an excellent experience at Solario. The food, service, and presentation were outstanding. Prices were reasonable, especially given the location in the Opryland Hotel (which itself was worth the visit, particularly at Christmastime). I had the paella, which they make without saffron. It was rich and flavorful, with plenty of shellfish and chorizo. The house Spanish red was smooth and fruity, a sweet start with a dry finish. For dessert, the goat cheese cheesecake was a nice twist on an old favorite, balanced rather than ultrasweet, and the slice was plenty big enough to share. The waitress was friendly and knowledgeable, enhancing the fun of the evening. The chef came out at the end of the meal, and we couldn't praise her highly enough. This establishment is not what I had in mind when I heard "Mexican restaurant." Despite the size of our party, they didn't add an automatic gratuity, as most restaurants do. They even validate your valet parking! If you're ever lucky enough to be in Nashville, don't miss Solario.

reviews.name: Ross P.
reviews.review: Had lunch at Solario one Sunday. It was really good, especially the tortilla soup. The food was expertly prepared, and the service pleasant. Nice atmosphere. On the expensive side, though.

reviews.name: CT L.
reviews.review: One of our favorite  places in Nashville to eat or just for lunch. My husband comes here when he goes to work & I just happen to come here when I am making arrons around town. Always clean, staff is always happy, & food is always fresh.

reviews.name: Marie L.
reviews.review: This was seriously some of the worst Chinese food I have ever tasted.  The service was fast and friendly but the food was scarcely edible at best.  I was able to choke down most of the sweet and sour chicken but the lo mien was a slimy mess of inedible goop.  The chicken fried rice was dry, hard and conspicuously missing anything that could be identified as chicken.  The egg rolls were the most passable part of the meal, and they were just that: passable.Due to the convenience, friendly staff, and relatively large selection, I REALLY wanted to like, if not love Panda House.

reviews.name: Nick R.
reviews.review: Kinda dingy inside, not a lot going on in here. Food was pretty good, had the Mongolian beef and it tasted like they actually grilled the beef. It won't be a regular stop, but was ok for a meal.

reviews.name: J S.
reviews.review: It is not a good quality. I'm not a food snob, but this was really just subpar. The fried rice was odd yellow colored rice. The beef and chicken were both very chewy and taste was bland. Unless you want to see if they've improved, I'd pass.

reviews.name: Tara S.
reviews.review: I have no complaints here. I was a bit hesitant to come try it out at first for 2 reasons. The 1st is location. It's in a small plaza next to a laundry mat, a convenience store and a Subway off Briley Parkway. The 2nd reason is I can't always trust my husband's palate as he enjoys water chestnuts and brussel sprouts sooo yeah.The restaurant was very clean and had a score of 98. I'm told by others that frequent here that the score is pretty consistant. We ate in and all the tables were clean and it was well swept. The food was very good and made fresh to order. I'm very picky about eating Chinese food because a lot of places will add msg and they will tell you otherwise. I can tell the difference at about 30 minutes after eating my meal because I'll get an excruciating migraine. The people at Panda House told me they do not use msg and I had no headache after I ate so I'd say that was a win for me! They also have lunch specials that come with rice and soup for $5.75. Fantastic deal! The people behind the counter were very helpful. I told them I was new and they were open for questions and were able to also offer up some suggestions. While one person was on the phone, another person came out to greet us and speak with us until the guy on the phone was done. I really appreciate that because a lot of people will not even acknowledge you until they're done. This will definitely be my go-to place for good Chinese in Nashville.

reviews.name: Christina P.
reviews.review: My favorite Chinese place! Eat here many a bit too often. Never had a thing I didn't like. The chicken with garlic sauce and lo mein lunch special is the best. Usually turns into 2 meals for me. Also love the general tsos and honey chicken. Service is fast and super friendly!

reviews.name: Jerry C.
reviews.review: Great take out place!  Food is fresh and tastes great. Don't judge to food by the worn out dining room.

reviews.name: Bristol D.
reviews.review: Good portions for the prices paid.  Always plenty of leftovers for me.  The flavors are good and not greasy. I'll be glad to order again from them!

reviews.name: Jim M.
reviews.review: Seriously the best cheap/affordable Chinese place in town. I wish they delivered but it's worth the drive.

reviews.name: Toni M.
reviews.review: This is the only Chinese place I will eat from. Everything they make is good and fresh. There has only been about 3 times when the food wasn't fresh and we eat there about 1-2 times per week. The owners are a cute family and will custom make the food with or without vegetables,  spicy or not. Give them a try.

reviews.name: April F.
reviews.review: My husband and I make this our go to place at least twice a month.  The service and food quality are consistently great!!! We love how quickly they make our orders fresh. The food is above average for this area.

reviews.name: Jenny H.
reviews.review: I stop here for take-away on the way home from work all the time.  The General Tso's is tasty and not so hot as to be unenjoyable.  Frequently have Spring Rolls and Crab Rangoon, fried rice, and everything is always good and fresh.  Staff are very friendly as well, and I feel like I get a good value for my money.

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: This place had probably some of the worst tasting chinese food that I have had the displeasure of eating. The menu was a joke and the selection was not very wide. I will definitely not be returning to Panda House.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: When we lived at Glastonbury, this is where I ran for some quick Chinese food I could bring back to the house. Because of Subway, I honestly can't say how the place has stayed in business, there's always next to no line. My husband and I used to joke we were the reason keeping them open, although judging from the tip jar, that was far from the case. They had the traditional fare, and when you got your meals to go they came in plastic containers that I began to reuse at home. You can't NOT like a place that pretty much gives you free dishes, now can you? The eggrolls are really good and don't taste super cabbage-y and the sweet and sour chicken puts some places I've tried in town to complete shame.

reviews.name: JC C.
reviews.review: I heard that this place was decent from some co-workers in my office. I went yesterday and just had two egg rolls (I had already eaten lunch). Probably the worst egg roll I've ever eaten....actually it's the first egg roll that I've eaten that I didn't like. It had that ubiquitous pink pork that always makes my stomach turn, and the cabbage tasted old (for lack of a better term).  I was thinking that I may try this place again, since I love me some General Tso's Chicken....but but as I put my trash in the garbage, I caught a fleeting glimse of a roach running along the floor.  Tap. Tap. I'm out!

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: I am definitely a fan of the margaritas, which are pretty great and cheap even off-special. Plus, sipping a Dos Equis or Corona on their outdoor patio in the sun and shade of the umbrellas is quite pleasant. At night, their patio is lit with hanging lights that make the restaurant feel cozy. Even though the restaurant is located next to a sometimes busy road, there is a hill and wall that blocks your view, and it is quiet enough to hold a conversation. I highly recommend it for low-key dates or group gatherings.The inside is also great for group gatherings as they have huge tables and live music. The waitstaff is INCREDIBLY friendly and very good-humored! Their little quick quips and funny wit really makes dining a fun experience.The portion sizes are huge, and the price is excellent for the quality.Because this is a family-oriented Mexican restaurant, the atmosphere is a little kitschy, but for this place, it just makes sense.

reviews.name: Jasmine M.
reviews.review: There are 2 items I get from here: the carnitas and the chicken tortilla soup. Everything else is mediocre and bland. The carnitas are seasoned just right and are not dry whatsoever. The soup is sooo yummy and has all these wonderful things in it, like pico, cheese, avocado, and a bunch of chicken. It's great for the buck!Service is ok if you have certain waitstaff. Some are rude and some are nice. Expect rudeness so that you won't be disappointed :)

reviews.name: Mickey D.
reviews.review: 5 star, 10 times over!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Have never ever found any better Mexican food in Nashville. Have been goimg for 15 years! The wait staff is incredible.

reviews.name: James S.
reviews.review: It's very bland and just OK. I had a combination plate, and the beef enchilada was filled with dry ground beef that tasted like air. The taco had the same tasteless beef plus bland cheese. You can get a much more flavorful taco and enchilada at Taco Bell. The chalupa was OK, with beans, tomato, and a blob of guac. The only thing that stood out was the chips and salsa. Chips were crisp, and the salsa was plain but had a nice flavor of fresh cilantro.The server took my order fairly promptly, but completely ignored me after my food arrived. Entree, soda, tax, and a small tip totaled $13.

reviews.name: Jessie W.
reviews.review: We love La Ha so much we come here once a week. For taco Tuesday. Best Mexican around.

reviews.name: Kiel G.
reviews.review: I called to find out when they close at night.  I was told 10pm. I had just arrived at a nearby hotel which I stay at frequently.  So I left my hotel and ran over because I was famished. I attempted to open the door at 947 and the manager had already locked the door and stood there looking at me as if to say "sorry chump, better luck next time". If a place advertises that they close at 10, then lock the door at 10. I have better things to do than to waste my time attempting to give business to an establishment that doesn't want it.

reviews.name: Kaleena 'Kala' H.
reviews.review: Went here with my friends for lunch and "mid-day margaritas". It wasn't that busy so we were able to get a table pretty quickly. Didn't care much for the decor...it just seemed like a typical Mexican restaurant. I ordered a chicken quesadilla, an order of cheese dip for the chips, and a small watermelon margarita. The food was good, but nothing special. The margarita was pretty strong for a small amount...I had to keep sipping my water to get the strong taste out of my mouth.I'll probably come back mainly just because my husband wants to try the food here.

reviews.name: Judy S.
reviews.review: Slow service.  Food was OK...somewhat bland.  ..salsa was basically tomato sauce.  My margarita was too sour so I watered it down with Sprite.  The chairs are too large for the tables.

reviews.name: Colleen T.
reviews.review: The Service was Excellent ..  Unfortunately the Food Didn't match !! I ordered a Combo Plate and the Beef was not Seasoned AT ALL .. and the sauce on the plate tasted like a sauce out of a RAGU or other Spaghetti Sauce Jar !!  SO DISAPPOINTED in the food !!

reviews.name: Marissa J.
reviews.review: Food was fine, service was good! Free refills on chips and salsa, and they refilled it before we even ran out.  More chips and salsa is almost always a positive!

reviews.name: Becky O.
reviews.review: This restaurant was close to our hotel and because we were traveling with a dog we decided to get takeout.  We both got taco salad,  and we were given a very generous portion of chips and 2 types of salsa.  The salad was very fresh and delicious.  We enjoyed the food and it was a very easy convenient experience.

reviews.name: Erin M.
reviews.review: Friendly staff, good food, great prices

reviews.name: Robert G.
reviews.review: Whenever we visit Nashville we come here. Friendly staff make us feel at home. Better than average food at great prices.  Very good value. Nice outdoor dining area as well.

reviews.name: Jordan C.
reviews.review: first let me say, patio is great! needs a bit of an update but perfect for sippin margaritas and enjoying friends! food is the regular food you see at every Mexican spot and I always wonder how it comes out in less then 5mins haha but this place will always be our 'spot' especially because of a certain Juan!... he is pretty much the best!!!!!

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Food is not that good..service was sub par. There are way better Mexican restaurant around.  I would go to them.

reviews.name: Mala H.
