reviews.review: Super bland, and very poor quality mexican food, but it is Nashville.Go for the giant drinks only, those are interesting. They can also accommodate large groups.

reviews.name: Bradley S.
reviews.review: I'm not sure how this place is still in business to be completely honest with you. This place has been down the street from my house for most of my life and it's been consistently terrible for the past few years. Nothing on the menu is tasty it's just food for the sake of food. The fajita nachos are a favorite of mine at most Mexican restaurants and there's is just not desirable. It's put together very sloppy, and it just taste blah. My most recent visit was welcome with absolutely terrible service from a server who I feel like is either new or nobody has taught him how to properly serve a group. There seems to be no cycle of service through out the restaurant. Just a disappointing experience with family who just arrived back in the country and had a hankering for Mexican. There are great Mexican restaurants in the area, go to them.

reviews.name: Joanne R.
reviews.review: I was looking for a place to blow off some steam that was not too far from work and my friend recommended this restaurant.  I did not have high hopes when we pulled up to the restaurant but I was pleasantly surprised once we were seated.  It was midday so it was crowded but we were seated quickly. The chips were fresh and warm, but the salsa was a little bland for my taste. The queso dip was the perfect consistency and very tasty.  The star of the meal was my margarita. It was delicious.  Strong enough and flavorful even though it was frozen. The next visit will be just for that.  My entree was arroz con pollo and while the portion was generous,it was a little salty. Overall it was a decent dining experience.

reviews.name: Charlie S.
reviews.review: Both times we have gone the food came out cold and bland.  Add to that the poor atmosphere and you get a 1 star.  We'll drive further for better Mex.

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: I live close to this restaurant & I've tried it a few times because I want to like it. The service is nice & fast. All the food tastes the same. Most of the ingredients just taste bland. The chicken tastes like it's boiled in water & then thrown on a taco. The chips are usually room temperature. The margaritas are good. I'd go for a margarita. I wouldn't go for the food.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I've been here a handful of times over the years since its right down the street from me. I've never been overly impressed. Everything is on the low end of the "average" scale. My last encounter was with a to-go order of chicken fajitas. The chicken had no taste. None. Service is fine and they have an outdoor patio but that's still probably not enough to lure me back in. Cinco De Mayo is one exit up and a hundred times better.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Eww, eww, eww...   This was a bad dream.Waitstaff was beyond hope.It was impossible to get our waiter to come to our table.When we got salsa and chips, salsa was weak and watery - no flavor and chips were stale.Friend ordered a combination plate of two enchiladas and rice and beans.minuscule amount of stuffing in enchiladas and then overwhelmed with sauce.Beans and rice were bland.How do they stay open?

reviews.name: Mary A.
reviews.review: The food is very average, the only good thing were the chips & salsa. I ordered  the carne asada soft tacos and they was loaded with onions, not much taste.  My husband's chili colorado was so hot, he could't even eat it. Our food came out about 5 minutes after we ordered it, so I don't know how fresh it was. We have had much better food elsewhere, would not go back.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: La Hacienda must translate to The House because they always make me feel at home here.The menu is pretty extensive and everything I've tried was Great, the Chile Relleno and the Pescado are fantastico !  ( Pescado, Fish served with the head on, if you cant handle having your dinner looking at you, pass on this dish ) One of the server's grows his own peppers to share with the guests, I Love Those Home Grown Hot Peppers.They offer a lunch menu, served quickly and very reasonably priced.Oh, be sure to ask for the Salsa Verde and the Hot Salsa, Muy Bien, Gracias!

reviews.name: Howard B.
reviews.review: Went yesterday and the food is always good but yesterday the waitress was not very good. She spent more time sitting inside instead oh waiting on the customers .So the service needs to improve. Any the staff needs to waiting on the customers needs.

reviews.name: B J.
reviews.review: FIRST REVIEW EVER ON THE INTERNET.   I am a normal guy that uses technology, however I have never done a review on a product, a restaurant or place because I have never had a reason I guess. I ate here last night and it was the worst food I've ever had in my life. I decided to review, just to help you not make the same mistake. Service: Bad, Saw the waiter 1 time for water and deliver food once. Atmosphere: Very loud. Fan under the spotlights could cause seizures, but definitely sent me home with a major headache.Food: Barely edible. Burrito, enchilada, chicken quesadilla, rice and beans all had no flavor, no spice nothing. Tasted like overcooked browned ground beef.Chips: OK. Nothing special. Only got 1 basket because no 1 would come back to us. Left with a sick stomach, spending too much money on bad food and bad service. This was hardley a restaurant and barely food. Please don't ruin your night by going to this restaurant. Stay away. Doesn't even deserve 1 star.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: Typical Mexican restaurant with the menu-by-the numbers. Pretty nice and clean atmosphere, but the food was just okay. Also, for some reason we had to track our server down for the check, which she did not leave us after two post-meal delivery trips to our table. I have had better food at the Las Palmas chains in the area. There is some nice outdoor seating at this location as well.As far as the girl a couple below who keeps mysteriously getting "food poisoning" on every restaurant she reviews: I'd suggest a gastroenterologist. Either that or your version of food poisoning is vastly different than mine.

reviews.name: Yolanda T.
reviews.review: Excellent meal. I had the burrito fajado(?) and it was spectacular. It was do much I didn't think I was going to finish but it was so good I couldn't stop eating it! This place is a hidden gem.

reviews.name: Catherine K.
reviews.review: This place is hit or miss.  Love their chips and salsa.  Love their margaritas.  Nothing is that special....just your average Mexican food.  But, I always come back!

reviews.name: Shane M.
reviews.review: Not very impressed. Portions aren't that large, service leaves something to be desired, and the food is so so. The best thing about this place is the new bar, and the outdoor patio. (Which gets super hot during the day).

reviews.name: Anthony P.
reviews.review: Good, maybe even very good, for the Nashville area. I grew up in New Mexico, so I'm not easy to please. Sadly I can't afford to fly to Santa Fe just to enjoy a great meal. So in the meantime Laha will do just fine.

reviews.name: Ryan H.
reviews.review: I should have trusted my fellow Yelpers on this one, but the concierge at the hotel I was staying at offered rave reviews, so we decided to give it a shot.I'll cut right to the chase here, because this place just isn't worth writing an extensive review.1.  The margaritas were watered down and weak.  2.  The food was unbelievably salty.  So much so that nobody in my party finished their meals.  This joint could easily pass for a one-star affair, but I will give up that extra star because the chips and salsa were good.  All in all, a complete downer that we were still complaining about a week later.

reviews.name: Marie T.
reviews.review: I had the nachos supremos and it was awful. Description reads, "Cheese nachos with assorted toppings of beef, chicken & beans. All covered with lettuce, tomatoes and sour cream." I ordered vegetarian with no meat and just beans. Lettuce is the worst quality possible - very wilted and pale ice berg. And there was only 1 measly slice of a tomato. The beans were terrible, seemed like poor quality canned bean paste. Very dissatisfied and felt totally jibbed that they charged me $9.5

reviews.name: Sara K.
reviews.review: I'd give it a zero and plan on calling the heath services after i do this Yelp.Disgusting. Horrible. Offensive. Gross. = La Hacienda on Bell Rd. Poop Smelling. Flies. Dirty tables. Horrible Waiters. Disgusting Food. No Service. (Just in case you're one of those people that look at the first couple lines of a Yelp)When we first walked in it smelled like someone had literally taken a crap at the door way. As a joke - i asked the guy in front of me if he crapped his pants but it was horrible. Still we tried to keep a good face and look (or smell) past the gross first impression. We got seating right away in the corner and the decor looked like everything that a Hacienda should have but then when i looked slowly at the windows and table there was dirty and at least two flies at our table trying to escape. That's what i did for the 10 min it took to get chips - catch flies. When the chips were put on the table the guy that seated us just dropped them off and didn't take our drinks or anything. We had to literally go up and tell them to give us something to drink after 6 mins of waiting. The waiter came over (the one that seated us, who had a horrible high and tight) and asked us for our order and when he brought it back they were the wrong drinks. We waited another 10 mins and had to go up to the counter again to ask if we could so kindly be asked for our meal order. It was ridiculous. The waiter then came over and tried to make a joke of the horrible service when we asked for hot sauce and more chips he said "no...just kidding!" Needless to say, he got horrible looks from the four of us. I'm gonna skip ahead and just mention why the next 30 mins were a waste of my life. 1. No chips or hot sauce/guacamole as requested for 15 min. 2. 20 min wait for food. 3. Different waiter switch with no warning then he disappeared and had to go up the counter agin. 4. All of us got different things which all were horrible tasting and tasted old. Carmones Rancheros (disgusting shrimp and bland spanish rice - no tortilla till we were done with our meal so i didn't even get to eat the meal with it), Chicken Burrito with Chicken Fajita meat - old chicken that tasted raw, Quesdilla was not memorable, Enchilada Supremo - hot sauce was just pure spice with no taste and road kill chicken5. No mid meal check in from the unknown disappearing waiters.6. No refills on drinks till we asked. 7. Gross sweet tea/ice tea8. Check never came so we had to ask yet again from another random waiter9. Unenthusiastic waiters who don't give a crap. Period. 10. When we told the counter about the horrible service, food and disgusting atmosphere he responded with "..ok"The ONLY GOOD THING that came out of going to that Hacienda was the cheap $3.36 gas down the street. DONT EVER GO THERE.By the way, pretty sure i got food poisoning also.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Popped by here for some much needed carbs post a day full of mischief and debauchery at Percy Priest Lake. There were only 3 things on my mind after a day full cocktails and the sun beating down on me. Oddly enough, it didn't consist of margaritas which I have heard are great here.Diet Coke + bean burritos (no cheese) + trough of tortilla chips with salsa = survivalThe food certainly got the job done but was unremarkable. Could it be because I wasn't exactly ordering the most exciting things on the menu too?However, the service was good and the bill was only a whopping $7 for a massive plate of 2 bean burritos and an unlimited amount of chips and soda. Can't really complain about that, can I?This location is not in an area that I frequent so I doubt that I will make my way back unless I make another pit-stop at the lake soon.

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: This restaurant has a pleasant ambience but yelp ratings are for the food. I am left with no choice but 1  star. This restaurant is the  worst of the worst. There is nothing mexican about the food here. The tacos are so bad.They are all cheese, cheese and cheese. Absolutely Rubbish.Thought mexican food was supposed to be fun, spicy but this food is as bland as mashed potatoes.

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: Barely mediocre!  Mediocre is almost too good to call this place.  Nothing was very fresh.  Nothing was very flavorful.  It was just a pile of food arranged uncreatively on my plate.  Everything seemed cheap, from the tables and chairs to the service, which left much to be desired.My son's food, the "Mexican Hamburger" (whatever that is), looked extremely stale.Overall, it's just a place I won't be going back to.The chips and salsa were decent; so they have that going for them, which is nice.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: I've only been to this La Hacienda because I was dragged in by friends and during none of those times was I wowed by their food. It is your typical Mexican restaurant, but there are plenty of other better ones in town.

reviews.name: Ben H.
reviews.review: So this is my buddy and I's 2nd visit. The only reason we r coming back is because of the Pizza Quesadilla plain and simple (: it is PHENOMENAL! Salsa is pretty good as well. The first time we came the waiter was horrible... Visited out table maybe twice... Took forever to get our food. Didnt even bring chips and salsa until we asked, maybe 10 mins later... So service was sub-par. This 2nd time we came at lunch time instead. we had a waitress and although she was way better and more responsive, the waiter that brought us out our salsa and chips, we asked for a bowl of hot as well.. Never came back. Food came out much faster this time though. So service not as good here but pizza Ques- the bomb!!! Perfect amount of food for a man. So if u decide to eat here stay on the wait staff and pray you get a good one! ~Enjoy

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: I always notice this place is ALWAYS packed especially at night no matter what day of the week. I had to stop in and see what all of the fuss was about. The food was ok I might add! I had the chile relleno (a stuff with cheese chile pablano) with a side of rice and beans. The salsa and cheese dip for the nacho was good. I'm still shopping around for good mexican food so I'm on the prawl! I'd go back again though.

reviews.name: Theresa V.
reviews.review: I just need to say something about whoever said the salsa was out of a jar. You're an idiot. The salsa tastes different almost every day. It is made there. Just sayin.Other than that, it isn't the best Mexican food I've ever had, but it's good. We live close by and we tend to get their takeout.I also noticed all these comments talk about the girl who waited on them. There's only like 2 female waitresses there. I've been waited on by guys almost every time I've been there.I like a lot of things there.

reviews.name: Jessie G.
reviews.review: Delicious as always. Had a strawberry daquari for the first time...I'm buzzed and haven't even finished half.

reviews.name: Patrick M.
reviews.review: Didn't get to try the food. I waited at the front counter while staffers kept walking by me without making eye contact or any acknowledgement that I was there. Waited about 5 minutes and walked out.

reviews.name: Megha M.
reviews.review: I've been there multiple times ... Not because I like this place but because it's the only Mexican place close to work !!! Everytime I go there I am disappointed ... The food is just ordinary ... Definitely nothing to talk about!!

reviews.name: Jen A.
reviews.review: Food was good, service was great. Nice atmosphere.

reviews.name: greg p.
reviews.review: OK, first off the food here in past visits was not great. About 3 months ago, we decided to give it another try. We were pleasantly surprised! The food is much better. I have always liked their drink specials and now that the food is up to par, we have been going back again and again. The must have gotten a new cook!

reviews.name: Scott W.
reviews.review: Food was okay, service left a lot to be desired.  Our waiter disappeared during service.  A waitress showed up later, but was disinterested.  Took 15 minutes to get our check.   Restaurant was was mostly empty.  Still looking for that good Nashville mexican restaurant

reviews.name: John F.
reviews.review: Goof food and lightning fast service. Love the chees duip and fajitas.

reviews.name: Ron V.
reviews.review: Not too bad. I asked for ranch dressing and they gave me an empty bottle. Salad was good though.

reviews.name: Melinda P.
reviews.review: We tried this because it is close to a new home we purchased.  The waitress was not very attentive and our drinks ran out and we kept trying to get her attention and we were ignored. My husband said his food was bland. I ordered a steak fajita quesadilla, it was ok but I've had better. We decided to give it another try when we were moving and ordered take out. We ordered food for 3 people. We got 1 small container of salsa and chips. I ordered steak fajita's, the steak was tough and full of gristle. The food and service at Palmas Verdes on Old Hickory Blvd is much better. We will not return to La Hacienda.

reviews.name: Jourden V.
reviews.review: We asked for to-go boxes, and our waitress took our almost-full basket of chips away. Very scared she dumped it into some communal chip vat to be re-served to oblivious customers after our hands had been all over them. Muy repulsivo! You'll find better luck (and fresh chips) at Cinco de Mayo on OHB.

reviews.name: Connie P.
reviews.review: After reading the reviews, I was expecting the worst. However I was pleasantly surprised. The margs were great as were the fajitias. Tacos were good. Only disappointment was the enchiladas..

reviews.name: Erik P.
reviews.review: First off, I understand I went to a Mexican restaurant on Cinco De Mayo, and I understand that there will be a wait longer than usual. I also have heard from other people that have come in on non-holidays that they experienced poor service and food. With that, thinking it may have been a fluke and was an off-day for the restaurant, we came in with the intent to have a good time. With it taking 15 minutes to place our drink order (and we placed the food order at the same time) we were still ready to enjoy a great Mexican meal. When we received our drinks, we didn't see our waiter for another 45 minutes. No refills, no water, no more chips. He helped multiple tables around the restaurant, but not once stopped by to see if we were alright. As we were about to pay for the first round of drinks and leave our food came to the table. Mediocre at best, we had to call our waiter back as he was walking away to get more beverages. Waiter was rude as we placed drink orders for 2 of the 3 of us, then he began to walk away. We had to call him back again to place the third order, which he then brought the wrong thing. Again, I don't blame the waiter 100%, him having 10 tables scattered between the inside and patio didn't help, but my experience with the service and the food quality on this "festive" day will have me not coming back. We should have gone to Taco Bell for better food at a better price with nicer staff.

reviews.name: Nate H.
reviews.review: Walking in you see nothin more then another just another Mexican restaurant in a ran down strip mall just along side Nashville's string of Chinese restaurants and liquire stores.DON'T let this fool you! Expect a wait, the regulars of the area are not regular due to availability, but because of awesome food, great atmosphere, the friendliest staff, and not to mention top notch-top shelf margaritas! Food is awesome, and expect dinner to run u around $6-$10!!!! Fresh avocados, home made guacamole, and pico de giao puts la Hacienda above other mexican restaurants. Great for families, friends, and even a date.You'll find me on the patio enjoying my dinner, pull up a chair, grab a drink, and relax.

reviews.name: James R.
reviews.review: Wow.  Walking into La Hacienda can be a bit daunting at first.  Bright colors, loud music, lots of noise - definitely a cacophony of sounds and sights.  This must be similar to walking into a street market in Tijuana.But keep steady, my friend.  For if you can make it to a table, you have made.  From margaritas to fajitas, this place has flavor in spades.  The cheese dip?  Delicioso!  The tacos?  Fantstico!  Oh, and the fajitas...now you're talking.An odd but semi-important detail none-the-less.  The chairs here are round wicker oddities, and not the most pleasant place to rest your bones.  However, during the more mild months, try to get a seat on the patio.  The atmosphere is fun, and the seating is much more appealing to your derriere.And if you can make it, check this place out for lunch.  They've got tons of great lunch specials under $7-$8, so your leave with your stomach and your wallet full.

reviews.name: Rick B.
reviews.review: DO NOT CONFUSE THIS PLACE WITH LA HACIENDA ON NOLENSVILLE ROAD! The food here is not good!

reviews.name: Bruce H.
reviews.review: I'm from CA, and as a whole Mexican food out here in Nashville leaves a lot to be desired. However La Hacienda has good fresh guacamole and decent food. But the reason I'll be going back is the Margaritas!At most restaurants they bring out a pitcher and as many empty glasses as people at the table. Here they brought out full glasses for each of us as well as an over flowing pitcher. And even though they bring out a lot, they sure don't water them down. I would definitely recommend going here!

reviews.name: Mary G.
reviews.review: Great authentic Mexican restaurant where you definitely get your money's worth. If you want to try several different items, I would suggest ordering the special dinner. I go there every time I'm in Nashville. It's seems very cheesy when you first walk in, but I really enjoy the food and drinks there.

reviews.name: Jesse Q.
reviews.review: Good food always fresh my mom didn't like it one time as they were closing but I've always liked it the staff here are cool and I enjoy the relaxed feel of the restaurant I'm sure it's a hard job trying to please everyone

reviews.name: Julie K.
reviews.review: Avoid this location period. I was seated and the previous tip was still on the table. After a long time finally ironically before we got up to leave a server finally came!!!We ordered I ordered a salad the spouse ordered roast beef. The roast beef came before my salad and the waitress "Debbie" was happy to sling it down before huffing & puffing  ,  and walked away then my salad came. Most of the staff is super rude at this location we had at least 5 servers pass our table and never even acknowledge us.Like not even moving out of customer was but making the customer move. We heard the staff calling someone a b@&&@ unprofessional!!!These folks need to go to Charlotte Pike and train also so manners and respect would go a long way!! If you're hating your job get s new one I personally don't care just do your damn job people!!! I've actually had an issue well it was food poison & Cracker Barrel didn't care so I know this will also be of little concern, however avoid this location. The male servers seemed to be the only nice ones here.

reviews.name: Charles S.
reviews.review: It's a Cracker Barrel; if you've used the interstate highway system in much of this country, you've driven by them hundreds of times. They all do Southern homestyle cooking, and there's a 'general store' where you can buy old-fashioned candies, gifts, and other knick-knacks.The food is always better-than-average, especially for a chain (and especially at breakfast), and the service is usually prompt and friendly.  Unless you go Sunday right after church, this particular location is pretty good about getting you seated quickly -- I've never waited more than 5 minutes for a table.

reviews.name: Miss C.
reviews.review: This was my second or third time here. It's been a while, and it will be much longer before I return. Service was slightly less than "meh". And the restaurant must have been having an off day. Everyone loves the hashbrown casserole. Mine was HORRIBLE. It was old and dry and flavorless. Pancakes were rubbery. Did I mention the hashbrown casserole sucked?And to top it off, a waitress spilled a bottle of hot sauce and it splattered on my face and my new blue leggings. She said "Oh did it get you?" I confirmed. She picked the bottle up and walked away. Didn't even offer to bring me a napkin or wet wipe. She just walked away.In summary: BOOOOOOO! If this restaurant's performance was on a stage, I've have a bucket of tomatoes ready to throw.

reviews.name: Sidney M.
reviews.review: When you think of the good ole southern cookin, you better be thinking about Cracker Barrel. Even as a child the Cracker Barrel always felt like home, and even now as an adult it still does. With great food, great prices, and excellent Southern Hospitality service I say this with PRIDE, "There's NO PLACE like home". "Until next time America", this is Big Sid out.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: Cracker barrel is awesome. It's cheap and it's good southern food. It's one of the only chain restaurants I genuinely like.

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: I went here with a group of friends on Tuesday. The restaurant was busy as usual but they got us in quickly. I had the Grandpa's (biscuits, grits, fried steak, hard fried eggs, and apples) and a sweet tea. Pros: - Sweet tea. Very yummy and I can actually taste the tea flavor, unlike other restaurants.- Hard fried eggs. Trust me, some restaurant can mess this up. - Good for big groups.- Manager came and talk to you- Waiters were very attentive Cons:- Biscuits and gravy. Sorry but White Castle has better biscuits and it's a fast food restaurant.- Grits....well it's grits. Flavorless. - Fried steak with gravy. Frozen steak then fried? There was no seasoning or anything. - Apples. Very very sweet. I drank my sweet tea after eating the apples, the sweet tea tasted like unsweetened tea because the apples were wayyy too sweet! May be I ordered the wrong meal. If I ever come back here, I'll make sure I'll just get breakfast items like bacon, eggs, sausages, or pancakes (which were a hit among my friends). Parking wasn't a problem and they have chairs outside to enjoy the beautiful summer view.2013/#23

reviews.name: Justin M.
reviews.review: Who doesn't enjoy a Cracker Carrel? Usually very consistent and good service. This place takes their jobs wayyyy too seriously though. My family met me here when traveling through. Just to get the food out of the way it was the same as any other Cracker Barrel. Southern, salty, decent sized portions. It came out hot, quick and tasty. I was full and ate everything.Trying to get seated was a pain though. We had a party of 9 but 6 of us  got there about 40 minutes before everyone else. We waited till the 2 of the last 3 were pulling in to tell them we were ready. They refused to seat us even though we told them my grandparents were pulling in. Then... I had a friend coming from work to meet us (I had their order already). They didn't want to seat us till this person arrived even though we told them we were in a hurry. I mean really? You have 8 of 9 and one is in a hurry. Finally she gave in and seated us.I might come back because it is close to my house but not without looking at other options.

reviews.name: Benjamin O.
reviews.review: No food....apparently my server feels salad can't be had at breakfast...so Im.just going to sit here & watch my friend eat. (This, despite the fact Ive had salad at this very location several times).

reviews.name: Mitch R.
reviews.review: The food here is reasonably priced and the service is pretty good considering how busy they are.  Breakfast is probably your best bet and really cheap. It seems like on dinner and lunch the quality of the food has went down they run a lot of lunch and dinner specials so I think the cheaper prices have something to do with it. Also if you have kids figure in the cost of a toy when you come in my daughter never leaves without some stuffed animal. Their always busy but I never had to wait very long for my food.

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: I was in a fairly large group, but they seated us pretty quickly.  Our server did a great job of keeping our orders and our bills straight.  I had my favorite breakfast, the Smokehouse, and I've learned to ask for my eggs over medium with the whites completely done and my bacon extra crispy.  I got exactly what I asked for and really enjoyed it.

reviews.name: Sameer D.
reviews.review: NEVER AGAIN! I ordered lunch today from cracker barrel, just a cheeseburger and fries. Picked it up, paid, TIPPED...I came back to my office and my cheeseburger had bacon on it. If I was not allergic, this would be fine...I called back and the manager said he would make another, sure no problem.  I get it, I checked this time and it was a cheeseburger. I get to my office, Starving at this point, Took a big bite and it was dripping BLOOD. Pretty sure I have E.Coli now. I attached a picture so you could see on the yelp page. I can handle medium rare, not raw. Thats not the bad part. I called back and the Dick-head manager acts like its my fault.  I am pretty sure we have not discovered a way to UNCOOK FOOD...but hey maybe Dick knows something I don't! I really hate to leave bad reviews, but I didn't do anything but order, pay (with TIP), AND get E. Coli...is it wrong to be respected as a paying patron? Guess Cracker Barrel is stuck in the past.

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: This location is near our home and I love going here. I am not much a breakfast eater, but I like it because I can get exactly what I like One  Egg over easy, with bacon and toast and HOT Tea..I love the hot tea here..Tony varies, but it is good because when he wants eggs ..he can get his egg beaters here. I love the restaurant for the awesome store and all the lovely country decorations...especially at Christmas time. We ate a quick breakfast here on November 1, 2012, and it was less than $20 with taxes and tips..can't beat it..highly recommend to all..

reviews.name: Lanitia C.
reviews.review: I go to this cracker barrel frequently and have yet to be dissatisfied. The food is alwaysfresh and hot, the wait persons are always prompt, courteous and friendly. And they always seem to try to be as helpful as they can be.

reviews.name: Luke K.
reviews.review: The food was good but the service was amazing. We had Kathy, the best server ever, who helped us out with advice on what to see in Nashville, was always making sure we had what we wanted, and made sure we really enjoyed our time there.

reviews.name: Martí M.
reviews.review: Throughout the years I've had great experiences and poor experiences with this location; far too many to recount in a review. Hence, meet somewhere in the middle. It says two stars because I can't give two-point-five.I haven't been in awhile, and it was nice to see the To-Go process a bit more streamlined today. A server actually brought me my order, and asked if there was anything else she could get for me, all with a huge smile on her face. Upon my request for more ketchup, she gladly ran to retrieve some for me and promptly returned.Why oh why is the "To-Go order taking phone" located in the kitchen? I brace myself every time I call knowing I will have to yell so the person taking my order can hear me.An insert was placed in the bag today stating CB offers designated parking for To-Go folks at SOME of their locations. As far as I can tell, this isn't the case (perhaps, yet) at this location. Now why would Corporate instruct a store to insert this flyer knowing that location is not yet participating?As far as getting your vehicle into and out of this lot, good luck. Once in the lot, finding a spot to park it can be equally as challenging. Then ultimately stand in line with the rest of the diners in a very cramped check out area. Thank goodness their veggie soup and hash brown casserole are so darn good!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: When you've had enough of going to Pancake Pantry for breakfast, this Cracker Barrel is an excellent place to try. Its especially nice because just up the street is also a Waffle House.  If you find that this Cracker Barrel is too busy for breakfast, you can just cruise up the street to Waffle House.Keep in mind this location, like most Cracker Barrel's gets very busy, especially weekends and in the morning.

reviews.name: George B.
reviews.review: Cracker Barrel is more like a barrel of shit. Obviously these mobo idiots only care about profit and nothing less. A 73 year old man gives away a couple items to some needy people and you fire him, you'll need to start  changing your  policies.

reviews.name: Sara S.
reviews.review: I thoroughly enjoy Cracker Barrel.  I tend to hit this one up for breakfast, and am always pleased with my experience.  The only thing that is somewhat inconsistent is the service.  The food is always GREAT, but the service can be hit or miss.  I don't know if they have a lot of turnover or what, but I guess what I'm saying is- I've had better.  But hey, for now I'm the Duchess so obviously it doesn't keep me from going back!!

reviews.name: Rob A.
reviews.review: Excellent service, fast and  friendly. Much better then my last visit. Would come again.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: I scoff at Cracker Barrel when suggested.  Under-seasoned food for the masses?  Pass.  However, I forgot about one meal that most places don't F up and that's BREAKFAST.Forget the rest of the menu - it isn't going to be as good as your Granny's.  But the breakfast.  Seriously.  Maybe it was because I was super hungover and had been dieting all week or maybe it was really that good.  I don't know but whatever, I had a lovely breakfast here.We started with some pancakes with blackberry syrup as an "appetizer" for the table.  Yes, that's some extreme piggyness right there.  They were great but then what isn't when doused in liberal doses of syrup and butter?   Next she brought out everyone's food but my food was taking longer because they accidentally made country fried steak instead of chicken for my meat...I told them I'd eat the steak but they really wanted me to have the chicken.  But in the meantime she had put biscuits out with a big bowl of gravy beside it.  So I did what any person would do...dipped a biscuit in gravy while waiting for my food.  What, other people have shame?  Not me, no shame at ALL.  Then I got my country fried chicken with hashbrowns and two eggs over easy.  The chicken (in TX we call that chicken fried chicken) was decent - it was fried after all.  The hashbrowns were perfectly crunchy, eggs perfectly runny.  Overall I was stuffed and pleased with the entire thing.This particular Cracker Barrel is mobbed though so just know you are going to wait on the porch for a while.  They also make you have the entire party there before you are seated, but if your party is running just a small bit behind tell the lady seating you they are in the bathroom.  Works.  Also, it was interesting that apparently our waitress was fired in the middle of our meal for something.  Very strange.  But both waitresses were nice to us so I didn't have a problem.I am not usually going to think of Cracker Barrel first on my list, but I might schedule an entire cheat meal around breakfast here when I don't feel like going somewhere farther away (like Loveless).

reviews.name: Howard L.
reviews.review: I think it's odd that so many of the reviews for this particular location are general cracker barrel reviews. Yeah, it's great that you stopped at a Cracker Barrel during your weekend visit to the "south", but they aren't all the same. My review is specific to this location and how loathsome it is. Poor cooking and poor service. If you want a decent Cracker Barrel, try the one in Goodlettsville or the one on the east side of Murfreesboro. They've always treated me right, which is unfortunate because this Cracker Barrel is the closest to me.Had the fried fish last Friday. Steak fries are definitely frozen and not well cooked, fish was dry and poorly fried. When a place can't fry anything correctly, it really is time to move on. This was the first time I'd gone since my last review and I think it'll be another couple of years before I try again. Gross.

reviews.name: John J.
reviews.review: It's 11:00 am on a Wednesday. There's a 20 minute wait. This was a last resort after seeing the line at pancake pantry and a 45 minute wait at pfunky griddle. Didn't want to take a chance on sky blue. So, someone please give us another breakfast choice in Nashville.Please don't say loveless.

reviews.name: Doug F.
reviews.review: Always a favorite with my teenage daughter, we caught an early dinner at this Cracker Barrel on a Thursday afternoon around 4:30, no line, no waiting. Service was excellent and food was very good. The ribeye was just right and the country fried steak was very good. Breakfast available anytime.

reviews.name: Robert S.
reviews.review: What a terrible CB experience.  Started with the host who was incredibly rude. Waitress was a little better in the personality department but disappeared for 15 minutes.  never got our "starter biscuits", food came out cold, and when they brought it back warm they forgot the grits and gravy.  Said they would bring it out, never did.  Had to ask for coffee twice, only got it once.  It gets two stars because the front end employees in the store were great.  Won't be coming back to this horrible Cracker Barrel. If I can convince my wife to go back, we will be going to cool springs where we haven't had anything but good service.

reviews.name: Charles C.
reviews.review: You can't go wrong with Cracker Barrel and this location is close to everything.

reviews.name: Jasper T.
reviews.review: I was having a rather busy day in the office, didn't have time to grab anything for breakfast and I looked up and it was lunch time so I was craving some great breakfast food.  And to the Cracker Barrel I went!  This location never disappoints.  They always keep my tea glass full and make me feel so fat I don't think I'm going to be able to fit out the door.  Exactly what I needed this day!

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Just reminded of good service and southern food yet again.  Generally good times at the C-Barrel.BTW, the new pork dish w/ cinnamon apples is pretty decent IMHO.  It was kinda roast beef-esque.

reviews.name: David F.
reviews.review: Stopped by this place on my way out of Nashville. We had the sweetest waitress who guided me through the menu. I ordered the Sunday special (fried chicken) with sides of fried okra, freid apples, and chicken dumplins. The fried chicken was great as was the fried okra. The fried apples were great but are more of a dessert than a side. I wasn't too fond of the dumplins. I finished up with a multi-berry dessert with ice cream that was amazing. It sat on a berry cobbler pie, which was nice and warm.The trippy thing about this place is that the front of the restaurant is a convenience store. Oh, and they had a sign on the way in saying that they serve all races lol.

reviews.name: Joseph R.
reviews.review: Climate was great. Dianne was our server and done a wonderful job. I ordered the Sunrise Sampler, which is always too much food. Everything was cooked perfectly and served hot. Coffee good. Seating and service were good, and the place was packed. Good experience.

reviews.name: Phillip S.
reviews.review: This is another formerly good place to eat, which I guess, due to the increasing cost of food, has changed their menu.  I ate there a few days ago and had the meatloaf.  It was more like "filler" loaf, since I can't say for sure there was any actual meat in it.  I also had a salad and the pinto beans, which were okay, but nothing special.  Maybe it was just this location and I will give it one more chance, but that's all.The service was slow, even though the place wasn't that crowded.  Not sure if it was under-trained or over worked waitstaff, but it was not good.

reviews.name: Hope D.
reviews.review: I never get tired of this place. I also never order anything other than my usual Grilled Chicken Tenderloin plate with Mac'n Cheese and Dumplings with a side of grilled Sourdough Toast!!! Sweet Tea of course. I would never put any of the country bumpkin items sold at the store in my house, but somehow I find myself infatuated with all the retro toys!

reviews.name: Nathan M.
reviews.review: Actually ate dinner (usually do breakfast for dinner here). They didn't light our lantern. Docked em a star for it, lol.

reviews.name: Evermore B.
reviews.review: I really don't see what the appeal is. Many people seem to like it.  It's too crowded and the wait is always long.  The food that comes out is mediocre. We had breakfast..it was meh.  The worst was the gravy. It tasted like a bowl of lard..weird, chemically thing.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: This is food that is not good for your heart, but is good for your soul!  Be ready to wait for a table on a Sunday morning - but at other times it's pretty speedy.  A roadtrip through the South is not a roadtrip without "the Crack"!

reviews.name: Andy A.
reviews.review: We eat at Cracker Barrels whenever we can find one when we travel.  Absolutely consistent, reasonable prices, clean restrooms.  Some of them - the ones in high traffic corridors like I-95 - can be crowded around normal mealtimes.

reviews.name: Katrina W.
reviews.review: I had to choose one location of Cracker Barrel to review, but I love Cracker Barrel no matter where it's located.  This is guilty eating at its best.  My favorites include the chicken and dumplings, hashbrown casserole, cinnamon apples, and country fried chicken.  I also love the store located right next to it and all the rocking chairs out front because I'm sappy and kitschy that way.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Part of a chain of southern style restaurants headquartered in the same "neck of the woods" in Lebanon, Tennessee.  It's an old fashioned throwback to the past.  Relics of the past on the walls of this south nashville place are items like old Coca Cola signs and handheld washboards.  The waitresses are nice and polite.  You may well be called "honey" or "sweetheart."  Visiting yankees might think they're flirting, bless their hearts. The food is good and affordable.

reviews.name: Virginia M.
reviews.review: home style happy food.
